begynneth firſt volum ſir johan froyſſart cronycles englande fraunce spayne portyngale scotlande bretayne flaū ders place adioynynge trāſlated frenche maternall englyſſhe tonge johan bourchier knight lorde berners cōmaundement oure mooſt highe redouted ſouerayne lorde kyng henry viii kyng englande fraunce highe defender chriſten faythe c hec rosa virtutis de celo missa sereno eternum florēs regia sceptra feret royal tudor blazon ¶ preface johan bourchier knyght lorde berners tranſlatour preſent cronycle condygne grace thankes ought men gyue writer hiſtoryes great labour haue done ſo moche profyte humayne lyfe ſhewe open manifeſt declare reder example olde antyquite ſhulde enquere deſyre folowe alſo ſhulde eſchewe auoyde vtterly flye whan beynge vnexpert chaūces ſe beholde rede auncyent actes geſtes dedes home labour daūgers paryls geſted done right greatly admoneſt enſigne teche v howe maye lede forthe lyues farther hath perfyte knowledge others ioye welthe higher proſperite alſo trouble ſorowe great aduerſyte hath xpert doctryne parylles albeit mortall folke marueylouſly ſeparated bothe lande water right wōderouſly ſytuate yet actes done ꝑaduenture ſpace thouſande yere cōpact togyder thiſtographier dedes one ſelfe cyte one mānes lyfe wherfore ſay hiſtorie may well called diuyne prouydence celeſtyall bodyes aboue complecte euery tyme vniuerſall worlde creature therin cōteyned dedes ſemblably ſo dothe hiſtory nat right noble thynge v fautes errours amede erect lyfe better ſhuld nat ſeke acquyre dyd thyng moſt beſt moſt laudable worthely done ſhulde putte eye folowe nat ſage counſayles two thre olde father cyte towne coū tre long age hath made wyſe dyſcrete prudent farre prayſed lauded derely loued yongemenne howe moche ought ſtories cōmended prayſed loued encluded ſo many ſage counſayls great reaſons hygh wiſedoms ſo innumerable ꝑſons ſondry nacyons euery age ſo long ſpace four fyue hundred yere moſt profytable thyng worlde inſtytucion humayne lyfe hyſtorie due contynuall redyng therof maketh yonge men equall prudence olde men olde father ſtryken age mynyſtreth experyence thynges yeldeth priuate perſons worthy dignyte rule gouernaunce compelleth themperours hygh ruler gouernours noble dedꝭ thende may optayne immortall glory exciteth moueth ſtereth ſtrong hardy warriours great laude haue ben deed promptly go hande great harde parels defence countre prohibyteth reprouable perſons miſcheuous dedes feare infamy ſhame thus monumentes writynge whiche teſtymony vnto vertue many men haue ben moued byldecytes ſome deuyſe eſtabliſſhe lawes tight profitable neceſſarie behouefull humayne lyfe fynde newe artes craftes ſciences requiſyte vſe mākynde aboue thynges wherby man welthe ryſeth ſpeciall laude cauſe ought gyuen hiſtorie keper ſuche thinges haue ben vertuouſly done wytneſſe yuell dedes benefite hyſtorie noble highe vertuous actes immortall moued ſtrong ferſe hercules enterpriſe lyfe ſo many great incō perable labour pyls certaynly noughtels y• merytꝭ immortalyte mought gyuen hym folke ſēblable wyſe dyd imytator noble duke theſe u many innumerable worthy price famouſe men whoſe vertues ben redemed ſro oblyuion ſhyne hiſtorie monumentes proceſſe tyme varyable chaunces confuſed loſt vertue hiſtory dyffuſed ſpredde throughe vuyuerſall worlde hathe cuſtos kepat ſay tyme whiche cōſumeth writynges albeit thoſe menne right worthy great laude prayſe writynges ſhewe lede v waye vertue yet neuertheleſſe poem lawes artes foūde deuyſed writ ben mixed ſome domage ſōtyme trueth enſigne man lye onelye hyſtorie truely wordes repreſentyng actes geſtes dedes done complecteth profyte moueth ſtereth compelleth honeſtie deteſteth erketh aborteth vice extolleth enhaunceth lyfteth vp ſuche ben noble vertuous depreſſeth poyſtereth thruſteth downe ſuch ben wicked yuell reprouable knowlege ſhulde haue auncyent thynges paſt hiſtorie nat whiche teſtymony therof lyght trouthe mayſtres lyfe humayne preſydent remembraūce meſſanger antiquyte moued ſtered phaleryus kynge ptholome oft dilygently rede bokes forſothe none cauſe thoſe thynges founde writen bokes frēdes dare nat ſhewe price moche wolde fayne write incomparable profyte hyſtorie feare ſhulde ſore tourment reder preface alſo doute nat great vtilyte therof better knowen coulde declare wherfore ſhall breuely come apoynt thus whan aduertyſed remembred many folde comodyties hyſtorie howe benefyciall mortall folke eke howe laudable merytoryous dede write hyſtories fixed mynde ſome thyng therin euer whā ymaginacyon came volued tourned redde many volume bokes conteyning famouſe hiſtories amonge redde dilygently four volume bokes ſir johan froyſſart countrey heynaulte written frenche tonge whiche iudged comodyous neceſſarie profytable hadde englyſſhe ſithe treat fomous actes done party ſay englande fraūce spaygne portyngale scotlāde bretayne flaū ders place adioyning ſpecially redounde honoure englyſſhemen pleaſure ſhall noble gē tylmen englande ſe beholde rede highe enterpriſes famous actes glorious dedes done atchyued valyant aū ceytours forſothe god hath moued highe cōmaundement mooſt redouted ſouerayne lorde kynge henry viii kyng englande fraunce highe defender chriſten faythe c gracyous ſupportacyon deuoyre tranſlate frenche maternall englyſſhe tonge ſayd volume ſir johan froyſſart whiche cronycle begynneth raygne mooſt noble valyant kynge edwarde thyrde yere lorde thouſande thre hundred ſixtene contynucth begynning reigne king henry fourth yere lorde god thouſande foure hundred ſpace twene threſcore fourtene yeres requyrynge reders herers therof take rude tranſlacion gre haue nat folowed myne authour worde worde yet truſt haue enſewed true reporte ſentence mater true namyng maner perſonages countreis cyties townes ryuers teldes coude nat name properly aptely englyſſhe haue written acordynge founde frenche thoughe haue nat gyuen euery lorde knyght ſquyer true addycion yet truſt haue natſwarued fro true ſentēce mater haue named dyſtaunce bytwene place myles leages muſt vnderſtande acordyng cuſtome coūtreis named ſome place lengar ſome englande leage myle well knowen fraūce leage two myles ſome place thre coūtreis leſſe euery nacion hath ſondrie cuſtomes faute rude tranſlacyon remyt correctyon therof thē diſcretely ſhall fynde reaſonable deraute ſo doynge ſhall pray god ſende thē blyſſe heuen amen thus endeth preface ſir john̄ bourchier knight lorde berners trā ſlatour preſent cronycle herafter foloweth table chapiter ſtande boke order one four hūdred fyftie northūberlande erle notyngham thēglyſſhmen made iourney scotlāde ambaſſadours fraunce ſent scotlande notifye truſe taken bytwene englande fraunce cap cccc xliiii ¶ howe baron knightes scotlande lancaſtre ſent erle heynalt maryage chyldren heynalt burgoyne cap cccc l ¶ howe ye duke berry enſured doughter ſonne erle bloys howe erle marche duke burbone made ſomons entre lymoſyn cap cccc li ¶ finis ¶here begymeth prologe ſyr john̄ froiſſart cronicles frā ce inglande place abioynynge ¶he firſt chaptre thentent honorable noble au • tures offeatis armes done achyued y• warres frā ce ingland ſhuld notably inregiſterd put perpetuall memory wherby prewe hardy may haue enſample courage theyr well doyng ſyr john̄ froiſſart wyll treat recorde hyſtory great louage preyſe begyn require ſauyour worlde nothyng created al thynges wyll gyue ſuche grace vnderſtandyng may cō tinue ꝑ euer ſuche wyſe ſo proces redeth hereth may take paſtaūce pleaſure enſample ſayd trouth al buyldynges maſoned wroughte dyuerſe ſtones great tyuers gurged aſſembled diuers ſurges ſprynges water lyke wyſe ſciences extraught cōpiled diuerſe clerkes one wryteth another parauenture ignorant famous wrytyng auncient auctours thyngis ben knowen one place attaygne mater haue entrepriſed wyll begyn fyrſt grace god bleſſed virgyn ourlady ſaynt mary comfort conſolation procedeth wyll take foundation ye true cronicles ſomtyme cōpyled right reuerend diſcrete ſage maiſter john̄ la bele ſomtyme chanon ſaint lābartis liege good herte due diligence dyd true deuoure wrytyng noble cronicle dyd contynue lyf dayes folowyng trouth nere myght great charge coſte ſekyng haue perfight knowledge therof alſo lyf dayes welbeloued ſecret counſayle lorde sir john̄ haynaulte often remembred reaſon requyreth boke many fayre noble auentures chief cauſer whoſe meanes ye ſayd ser john̄ la bele myght well knowe many dyuers noble dedes whiche ſhalbe declared trouth haue entrepriſed boke ordeyne pleaſure paſtaunce whiche alwayes haue ben inclyned intent haue folowed frequented company dyuerſe noble great lordes aſ well fraunce juglande scotland diuerſe country haue knowledge alwayes power iuſtly haue inquired trouth dedis warre auentures haue fallen ſpecially ſyth great batell poyters noble kynge john̄ france takyn priſoner tyme yonge age vnderſtandyng ho toke aſſoone came ſcole wryte recite ſayd boke bare ye ſame compyled ingland preſented volume therof lady philypp heynaulte noble quene ingland right amyably receyued great profite auaūcemēt may ſo ſame boke nat yet eramyned corrected ſo iuſtely ſuche caſe requyreth featis armes derely bought achyued honour therof ought gyuen truly deuided promes hard trauayle haue deſerued therfore acquyte bihalf folowyng trouth nere john̄ froiſſart haue entrepryſed hyſtory ye forſaid ordynaūce true fundacion inſtaūce requeſt dere lord myn ser robert namure knyght lord bewfort entierly owe loue obeyſyunce god graunt thyng may pleaſure amen ¶here ſpekethe auctour ſuche moſt valiant knyghtis made mencion boke ¶ap ii noble hertis encorage ſhewe enſample mater honour ser john̄ froiſſart begynne ſpeke true report relation maſter john̄ la bele ſomtyme chanon ſaynt lambertis liege af • ermyng thus howe many noble ꝑſons haue oft tymes ſpoke warres france ingland ꝑauenture knewe nat iuſlely trouth therof true occaſions fyrſt mouyngis ſuche warres howe warre length contynued truſt ye ſhall reported true foūdation cauſe thentent wyll nat forget myuyſſhe abrydge ye hyſtory • thyng defaute lāgage rather wyll multiply encreaſe ner folowynge trouth poynt poynt ſpekyng wyng auētures ſith natiuite noble kyng edward ye iii reigned kyng england achyued many perilous auentures dyuers great batelles addreſſed featis armes great prowes ſyth yere oure lorde god ccc xxvi noble kyng crowned ingland generally ſuche hym batels happy fortunate auentures peple abſence ought ryght well takyn reputed valiant worthy renowne though great plenty ſondrye parſonages ought prayſed reputed ſoueraignes yet among pryncipally ought renowmed noble propre ꝑſone ye forſaid gentyll kyng alſo prynce walys ſon duke lancaſtre ser reignold lorde cobham ſyr gualtier manny heynaulte knyght ſyr john̄ chandos ſyr fulque harle dyuers made mencion hereafter preſent boke bicauſe theyr valyant prowes batels moſt cōmonly euer renowne land ſe accordyng trouth theyr dedis ſo valyant ought reputed ſoueraignes chyualry yet ſuche theyr companye ought nat ye leſſe value leſſe ſet alſo fraūce y• tyme foūde many good knyghtis ſtronge well expert featis armes realme fraunce nat ſo diſcomfited alwayes ther people ſufficient fyght withall kyng philyppe uaioyes ryght hardy valiant knyght alſo kyng john̄ ſōne charles ye kyng behaigne erle alāſon erle foyz ſyr sa •• tre ſyr arnold dangle lordes beamon father ſonne dyuerſe ye whiche cā nat theyr name hereafter ryght well ſhall made mencion tyme place cōuenient ſay trouth maynteigne ſame ſuche cruel batels haue ben ſeen abydyng diſcomfeture ſufficiently doyng theyr deuour may wel reputed valyant hardy ſoeuer theyr aduenture ¶ mater ſpeketh ſome predeceſſours kyng edwarde ingland cap iii firſt better entre mater honorable pleaſaūt hyſtory noble edward kyng ingland crowued londō yere lorde god ccc xxvi chriſtmas day lyuȳg kyng father quene mother certayne opinyon ingliſſhmen moſt comonly often tymes ſeen ingland tyme kyng thure howe betwene two valyant kynges ingland ther moſt comōly one bitwene leſſe ſufficiauncy wytte prowes ryght well aparant ye ſame kyng edward thyrde graundfather called good kyng edward fyrſte ryght valyant ſage wyſe hardy auenturous fortunate al featis warre moche agaynſt ſcottis conquered iii iiii tymes ſcottꝭ coude neuer haue victory idure agaynſt hym diſſeaſe ſōne firſt wyfe father ſayd good kyng edward thyrde crowned kyng called edward ii reſembled nothyng father wyt prowes gouerned kept realme ryght wyldly ruled hym ſelfe ſynyſter counſell certayne parſons wherby length profytte norlaude ye ſhall anone crowned robert bruſe kyng scotlande often gyuen moche ſayd good kyng edward fyrſt conquered agayne scotland brent waſted great parte realme england iiii v dayes iourney within realme two tymes diſcomfyted kyng baron ingland place scotland called eſtaruelyn batel arengyd day ſaynt john̄ baptyſt vii yere ye reigne ſame kyng edward yere lorde ccc xiiii chaſe diſcōfeture endured ii dayes two nyghtys kyng ingland wēt wt ſmall company london mydlentſonday yere lorde ccc xvi ſcottis wan agayne cite berwyk treaſon bicauſe part mater wyll leue ſpekyng therof ¶ myn auctour maketh mencion parentꝭ good kyng edward iii cap iiii kyng edward ii father noble kyng edward iii ii brethern̄ one called marſhall ryght wyld diuers condicions called ſir aymon erle cane right wyſe miable gētle welbeloued alpeople kyng edward ii maried iſabell y• doughter philyp la beaw kyng fraūce one feyreſt ladyes ye worlde kyng ii ſōnes ii doughters fyrſte ſon noble hardy kyng edward y• iii hyſtory begon ii named john̄ dyed yong firſt ye doughters called iſabel maried yōg kyng dauid ſcotlād ſon kyng robert de bruſe maried tēder yongth thaccord realmes ingland scotland make 〈◊〉 fight pear doughter maried erle reynold called duke guerles ii ſōnes reynold edward reygned ī great puiſſaūce herafter begynneth occaſiō wher warr moued bitwene kyngis fraūce ingland cap v ſheweth hyſtory philyp la beaw kyng fraūce iii ſōnes feyre doughter named iſabel maried ingland kyng edward ii theſe iii ſōnes theldeſt named lewes kyng nauerr father day called kyng lewys hotin ii name philyp great long ye iii called charles iii kyngis fraūce theyr father diſceaſe ryght ſucceſſion eche aff without hauyng iſſue male theyr body laufully begoten deth charlis laſt kyng iii xii pier barōs fraūce wold nat gyue realme iſabell ſuſter quene inglād cauſe ſayd maynteyned yet realme fraūce ſo noble ought nat go womā ſo cō ſequētly iſabel kyng inglande eldeſt ſonne determyned ſonne womā haue ryght ſucceſſion mother ſyn declared ye mother haue ryght ſo theſe reaſons xii pier barōs fraūce theyr comon acord dyd gyue realme fraūce lord philyp ualois nephew ſomtyme philyp la beawe kyng fraūce ſo put quene ingland ſonne next heire male ſōne ſuſter charles laſt kyng fraunce thus went realme fraunce ye ryght lynage ſemed many folkꝭ wherby great warres hath moued fallen great diſtructiōs people coūtres realme fraūce place ye may right foūdation hyſtory recount great entrepriſes great featis armes y• haue fortuned fallen ſyth tyme good charlemaigne kyng fraunce ther neuer fell ſo great aduentures ¶ erle thomas lancaſtre xxii great lordis knyghtis inglande beheeddyd cap vi forſaid kyng edward ii father ye noble kyng edward ye iii mater foūded ſayd kyng gouerned right diuerſly realme ye exortaciō ser hewe spēcer ben noriſſhed hym ſyth begynnyng yongth whiche ser hewe ſo enticed kyng father ye greatteſt maiſters realme enuy thought ſurmoūt baron ingland wherby great diſcōfeture ſcottꝭ made eſtermelyn great murmoryng ther aroſe ingland bitwene • noble barōs ye kyngꝭ coūſell namely ageynſt ser hewe spē cer put hym counſell diſcomfeted fauorable kyng ſcottꝭ poynt harōs diuers tymes comunicatiō gether aduiſed myght wherof thomas erle lā 〈…〉 vncle ye kyng chief anon whan ser hewe spencer eſpied purueyd remedy ſo great kyng ſo nere hym y• beloued kyng world day came ye kyng ſayd ſir certayn lordes realme haue made aliaunce gether agaynſt without ye take hede therto tymes purpoſe put realme ſo malicioꝰ meanes cauſed kyng made ſayd lordes takyn theyr heedis ſtrikē without delay without knowlege anſwere cauſe fyrſt ser thomas erle lancaſtre noble wyſe holy knyght hath done ſyth many fayre myracles 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 pomfret wher beheedded ye whiche dede ſayd ſir hewe spencer achyued great hate realme ſpecially quene erle cane brother ye kyng whan parceyued dyſpleaſure quene ſubtile wytte ſet great diſcorde bitwene kyng quene ſo ye kyng wold nat ſe quene come company whiche diſcord endured long ſpace ſhewed quene ſecretly erle cane withoute toke good hede ſelfe lykely diſtroyed ſir hewe spēcer purchace moch trouble theym quene ſecretly dyd puruey go fraūce toke way pylgrymage ſaynt thomas canturbury ſo wynchelſey nyght went ſhyp redy yong ſōne edward erle cane ſir roger mortymer nother ſhip put theyr purueyaūce wynde wyll next mornyng arryued hauyn bolayn ¶ howe quene ingland went complayned kyng fraunce brother ſyr hewe spencer cap vii whan quene iſabell arryued bolayn ſonne erle cane capytayns abbot ye towne came agaynſt ioyouſly receued company abbey ther ſhe aboode ii dayes ſhe departed de ſo long iourneys ſhe arryued paris thā kyng charles brother enfourmed comyng ſent mete dyuers greatteſt lordes realme lorde ſyr robert de artoys lorde crucy lorde sully lorde roy dyuers honorably dyd receue brought cite paris kyng brother whan kyng ſawe ſuſter nat ſene long ſhe ſhuld haue entred chambre mette toke armes kyſt ſayd ye welcome feyre ſuſter feyre nephewe ſonne toke handis led forth quene great ioy harte ſhe ſo nere kyng brother ſhe wold haue kneled downe ii iii tymes foot kyng kyng wold nat ſuffre held ſtyl right hande demaunding right ſwetely aſtate beſyneſſe ſhe anſwered hym ryght ſagely lamentably recounted hym felonyes iniuries done ſyr hewe spencer requyred hym ayde cōfort whan noble kyng charles fraū ce harde ſuſters lamentation wepyngly ſhewed hym nede beſyneſſe ſayd fayre ſuſter appeaſe ſelfe faith owe god ſaynt denyce ſhall right well puruey ſome remedy quene kneled downed whether kyng wold nat ſayd ryght dere lord fayre brother pray god reward kyng toke armes led chambre whiche apparayled yong edwarde ſōne ſo departed fro cauſed coſtis chargis thyng delyuered behouefull ſōne nat long occaſion charles kyng fraunce aſſembled together many great lordes baron realme fraunce haue theyr coūſell good aduiſe howe ſhuld ordeyne nede beſynes ſuſter quene ingland coūſailed kyng ſhuld let quene ſuſter purchas ſelfe frendis ſhe wold realme fraunce place hym ſelfe fayne nat knowen therof ſayd moue warre kyng ingland bryng owne realme hatred nothyng apertenaunt profitable hym realme cōcluded conueniently mgiht ayde golde ſyluer metall wherby loue attaygned gētylemen pore ſouldiours counſell aduyce accorded kynge cauſed ſhewed quene priuely ſir robert dartoys one greatteſte lordis fraunce ¶ howe ſyr hewe spencer purchaſed quene iſabell banyſſhed fraunce cap viii nowe let v ſpeke ſomewhat ſir hewe spencer whan ſawe hadde drawen kyng inglād ſo moche wyll coud deſire nothyng hym graunted cauſed many noble men put deth without iuſtice lawe bicauſe held ſuſpect ageynſt hym pride dyd ſo many marueylles barous left alyue land coude nat beare ſu 〈…〉 e lenger beſought requyred eche among ſelfe peaſable accorde cauſed ſecretly knowen quene theyr lady hadde ben parys ſpace iii yere certifiyng wryttyng ſhe coulde fynd meanes haue companye men armes nombre bryng ſon heyre inglande wolde drawe abeye ſonne edward bounde duety theſe letter thus ſent ſecretly ingland ſhe ſhewed kyng charles brother anſwered ſayde fayre ſuſter god ayde beſyueſſe ſhall auayle moche better take men ſubiectis nombre frendes haue wrytten conſent wel voyage ſhall cauſe delyuered vnto golde ſyluer moche ſhall ſuſfyce mater quene done ſo moche prayer gyftes promyſſes many great lordis yong knyght accorde bryng great ſtrength agayne inglande quene ſecretly ſhe coulde ſhe ordeyned voyage made puruey aunce ſhe coude nat ſo ſecretly ſir hewe spencer knowledge therof thought wynne withdrawe kyng fraunce fro great gyftes ſo ſent ſecret meſſangers fraunce great plentye golde ſyluer ryche jewelles ſpecially kyng priue counſell dyd ſo moche ſhorte ſpace kyng fraūce pryue counſelle colde helpe quene voyage great deſyre dohit kynge brake voyage defended euery parſone realme payne banyſſhyng ſame none ſhuld ſo hardy go quene brynge agayne ingland yet ſayd ser hew spencer aduyſed hym malyce bethought hym howe myght gette agayne quene inglande vnder kyngis daunger cauſed kyng wrytte holy father pope effectuouſly deſyryng hym wolde ſende wrytte kyng fraunce ſhulde ſende quene wyfe agayne inglande wyll acquyte hymſelfe god worlde nat faute ſhe departed fro hym wolde nothyng loue good faith ſuche ought holde mariage alſo ther lyke letter wrytten cardynals dyuyſed many ſubtile wayes whiche maye nat wrytten alſo ſent golde ſyluer great plenty dyuerſe cardynalles prelate ſuche mooſt nereſte ſecretteſt pope ryght ſage able ambaſſadours ſente meſſage ladde pope ſuche wyſe theyr gyftes ſubtyle wayes wrote kynge fraunce peyne curſyng ſhulde ſende ſuſter iſabell ingland kyng houſbande theſe letter brought kyng frā ce buſſhopp • ainctes pope ſent legation whan kyng redde letter cauſed ſhewed quene ſuſter nat ſeen long ſpace commaundyng haſtely auoyde realme orels wolde cauſe auoyde ſhame ¶ howe quene iſabell departed fro fraunce entred empyre cap ix whan quene hard thys tidyngis ſhe knewe nat ſay aduyce take baron realme fraūce withdrawen frō cōmaundement kyng fraū ce ſo ſhe comfort ſuccoure onely dere coſyn ser robert de artoys ſecretly dyd counſaile comfort moche myght wyſe durſt nat kyng hadde defended hym knew well quene chaſed ingland alſo fraunce euyll wyll enuy whiche greued hym greatly thus ſyr robert de artoyes quenes commaun dement durſte nat ſpeke knowen therof hard kyng ſay ſwere ſo euer ſpake hym quene ſuſter ſhulde leeſe landis banyſſhed realme knewe ſecretly howe ye kyng mynde make ſuſter taken edward ſonne erle cane ſyr roger mortymer put theym handis kyng ſyr newe spencer wherfore came nyght declared quene aduyſed parell ſhe ye quene greatly abaſſhed required hym pyng good counſaile ſayd madame counſaile ye depart go empire ther many great lordes may ryght well ayde ſpecially erle guillyam heynault ſyr john heynaulte brother theſe two great lordes wiſe men true drad redoubted ennemies quene cauſed made redy purueyaunce payd euery thyng ſecretly ſhe myght ſo ſhe ſonne erle cane company departed paris rode warde heynaulte ſo long ſhe rode ſhe came cambreſys whan ſhe knewe ſhe empyre better aſſured ſhe ſo paſſed cambreſys entred oſtrenaunt heynaulte lodged ambreticourt knight houſe called ſyr dambrycourte receyued ryght ioyously beſt maner power ſo moche afterwarde quene inglande ſonne hadde ingland euer knyght wyfe child auaunced dyuers maners comyng thus y• quene inglāde ſonne heyre coū trey heynaulte anon well knowen howſe ye good erle heynault ualenciennes ſyr john̄ heynault certified tyme whan quene arryued place ſyr dambrecourte whiche ſyr john̄ brother ſayde erle guillam yong luſty deſiryng honoure mounted horſe departed ſmall company fro ualēciennes came ſame nyght ambreticourt dyd quene honour reuerence coulde deuyſe quene ryght ſorowfull beganne declare complaynyng hym ryght pyteouſly dolour wherof ſayd ſyr john̄ great pitie ſo water daſhte yen ſayd certaynly fayre lady beholde owne knyght ſhall nat fayle dye quarell ſhall ye beſt power conducte lorde ſonne helpe brynge aſtatis inglande grace god helpe frendis party ſuche deſyre ſhall put lyues goodes aduēture ſake ſhall gette men warre ſufficient god pleaſed without daūger kyng frā ce brother quene wold haue kneled downe great ioye ſhe ye good wyll offred noble knyght toke vppe quyckly armes ſayde grace god noble quene inglād ſhall nat knele dame recomforte yourſelfe company ſhall kepe faithfull promyſe ye ſhall go ſe erle brother counteſſe wyfe theyr fayre chyldren ſhall receyue great ioye ſo harde theym reporte wold queneſayd ſyr fynde loue comforte worlde ye ſay affirme thāke thouſande tymes yf ye wyll ye haue promiſed courteſy honoure ſonne ſhall euer bounde wyll put realme inglād abandon right ſo ſhuld theſe wordes whan accorded syr john̄ heynaulte toke leue quene uyght went douaing laye abbeye mornynge maſſe lepte horſe came agayn quene receyued hym great joye tyme ſhe dynedde redy mounte horſe departe hym ſo quene departed caſtell dambrety courte toke leue knyght lady thanked theyr good hadde made ſayd ſhe truſted oones ſe tyme ſhe ſonne ſhulde well remembre theyr courteſye thus departed quene company ye ſayd ſyr john̄ lorde beamont ryght ioyouſly dyd conducte ualencyenues agaynſt came many burgeſſes towne receyued right humbly thus ſhe brought erle guyllaume heynaulte receyued great ioye lyke wyſe ſo dyd coūteſſe wyfe feaſted ryght nobly erle hadde foure layre doughters margaret philypp jane iſabell amonge whome yong edwarde ſette mo 〈…〉 hi • loue company phylypp alſo yong lady al honour conuerſ •• nt hym ſuſters thus quene iſabell abode ualencyennes ye ſpace viii day good erle coūteſſe jane ualoys meane tyme quene aparailed needis beſyneſſe ſaid ſyr john̄ wrote letter ryght effectuouſly vnto knyghtis ſuche companyans truſted beſt heynaulte brabant behaigne prayed amyties bitwene theym wolde god 〈◊〉 hym entrepriſe inglande ſo great plentye one countrey content go hym loue ſayd ſyr john̄ heynaulte greatly reproued counſailed contrarye bothe erle brother chief counſaile countrey bycauſe ſemed theym entrepriſe ryght hygh parillouſe ſeynge great diſcordis great hate bytwene barones inglande amonge ſelfe alſo conſyderyng theſe 〈…〉 hemen moſt commonly haue euer great enuy ſtraungers therfore doubted ſayd ſyr john̄ heynaulte company ſhulde nat retourne agayne honour howeſo euer blamed coūſailed hym gētle knyght wolde neuer chaunge purpoſe layd hadde one dethe dye whiche wyll god alſo ſayd knyghtꝭ ought ayd theyr power ladyes da mozels chaſed theyr owne countreys beyng without counſaile comfort ¶howe quene iſabell arryued inglande ſyr john̄ heynaulte company cap x thys ſyr john̄ heynaulte moued courage made aſſembly prayed ye 〈◊〉 redy hale • y• 〈◊〉 bredas hollander • uchryghte daye lymytted quene juglande tooke leue erle heynault coūteſſe thanked theym greatly honour ſea • good chere hadde made kyſſynge theym departynge thus lady departed herſonne company ſyr john̄ heynaulte great peyne gatte leue brother sayng hym lorde brother yong thynke god hath pourueyed entrepryſe myn aduancemēt beleue thynke verely wrōgfully ſynfully lady hath chaſed inglande alſo ſōne hit almes glory god worlde comforte helpe comfort 〈…〉 ſpecyally ſo hyghe ſo noble lady doughter kyng desceudyd royall kyng bloodde ſhe oures hadde rather renounce forſake haue go ſerue god ouer ſee neuer retourne countrey rather good lady ſhulde haue departed v withowte comforte helpe therfore dere brother ſuffre go yor good wyll wherin ye ſhall nobly ſhall hū bly thanke therof better therby ſhall accomplyſſhe voyage whan good erle heynaulte hadde 〈◊〉 harde brother parceued great deſyre hadde entrepryſe ſawe 〈◊〉 hy • myght tourne hym heyres great honoure sayd hym fayre brother god forbyd good purpoſe ſhulde broken lerte therfore name god gyue leue kyſte hym 〈…〉 ynge hym hande inſygne great loue thus departed roode ſame nyghte mounce heynnaulte quene inglande ſhulde make long proceſſe dyd ſo moche theyre journey came durdryght holande wher theyr ſpecyall aſſembly made purueyed ſhyppys great ſmall ſuche coulde get ſhypped horſes harneys purueyaunce ſo com 〈…〉 ded ſelfe kepyng god toke theyr paſſage ſee cōpany knyghtis lordis fyrſt ſyr john̄ heynaulte lord beamond ſyr henry da • • g ſyr michell de ligne lorde gōmeg 〈…〉 ſyr parceualde semeries ser robert de 〈◊〉 ſyr saures de bouſſoit lorde 〈◊〉 ye lord pocelles ye lord uillers ye lord heyn lorde sars lorde boy 〈…〉 lorde dābretycourte lorde 〈◊〉 ſyr oulpharte guſtelle diuers knyghtis ſquyers great deſyre ſerue theyr maiſter whan departed fro hauyn durdryght fayre flete quantite well ordred ſeaſon fayre clere ryght temperate theyr departynge fyrſteflodde came dignes holande next day drewe vppe theyr ſayles toke theyr waye coſtynge zelande theyr ententis haue taken land dongport coulde nat tempeſte toke ſee put ſo farre theyr courſe wiſt nat two dayes wher wer whiche god dyd great grace takyn lande porte thought ben loſte fallen hand theyre ennemyes knew well theyr commyng aboode haue putte theym dethe hit ende two dayes tempeſt ſeaſed maryners parceyued lande inglande drewe parte right ioyouſly toke lande ſandes withoute ryght hauyn orporte harwiche inglyſſhe cronicle ſayth xxiiii daye septembre yere lorde ccc xxvi ſo aboode ſandes thre dayes lytle puruey aunce vitaylle vnſhypped theyr horſes harneys wiſt nat parte inglande power theyr frendis power theyr ennemies iiii day toke forth theyr way aduenture god ſaynt george ſuche people hadde ſuffred great diſeaſe colde nyght hunger great feare whereof nat clene ryd ſo rode forth hylles dale ye done ſyde tyll laſte founde vyllages great abbeye blacke monkes whiche called ſaint hamō wher iii dayes refreſſhed themſelfe ¶ howe quene inglande beſeged kyng huſbande towne briſto cap xi tidyng ſpred ye realme ſo moche ye laſt came knowledge ye lordes quene called agayn ingland apparailed haſt come edward herſon wold haue theyr ſoueraigne lorde fyrſte came gaue mooſt comforte henry erle lancaſtre wrye necke called torte colle brother thomas erle lancaſtre beheeddyd ye haue harde good knyght greatly recōmended ye ſhall hyſtorye thys erle henry came quene great companye men warre hym came one parte erles barones knyghtys ſquiers ſo moche people thought clene parelles alwayes encreaſed theyr power went forewarde toke counſell among ſhulde ryde ſtreyght towne bryſtowe kyng hym spencer whiche good towne ſtronge well cloſed ſtandyng good port ſee ſtronge caſtell ſee bettyng rounde therin kyng ser hewe spencer elder xc age ſyr hewe spencer ſonne chieffe gouernour kyng counſayled hym euyll dedis alſo erle arundell wedded doughter ſyr hewe spēcer diuerſe knyghtis ſquiers repayryng kyng courte quene companye lordes heynaulte erles baron ingliſſhemen toke right way ye ſaid towne briſtowe euery towne entred receyued great feaſt honour alwayes theyr people encreaſed ſo longe rodeby theyr iourneys arryued bryſtowe beſygedde towne rounde nere myght kyng ſyr hewe spencer yonger helde theym caſtelle olde ſyre hewe spencer erle arundell helde towne whan people towne ſawe greate power quene mooſt inglande accorde parceued parell daunger euydentely toke counſell amonge theymſelfe determyned wolde yelde vppe towne quene theyre lyues gooddys myghte ſauyd ſoo ſende treate quene counſell mattyer quene counſelle wolde nat agree therto without ſhe myght wt ſyr hewe spencer erle arundell pleaſed whan people towne ſawe coulde haue peace otherwiſe ſaue towne theyr gooddes theyr lyues diſtreſſe accorded quene opened gate ſo quene ser john̄ heynaulte barous knyghtis ſquyers entred towne toke theyr lodgyngys within many myght reſide without ſir hewe spencer erle • rundel taken brought quene pleaſure brought quene owne chyldren john̄ herſonne two doughters whiche foūd ther ye kepyng ye ſayd ſyr hewe spencer wherof quene great ioye ſhe nat ſeue theym longe kyng myght haue great ſorowe ſir hewe spencer yonger faſt incloſed ſtronge caſtell mooſt part realme turned quenes parte edward eldeſt ſonne ¶ howe yt ſyr hewe spēcer erle arundell iudged dethe cap xii whan quene baron company lodged theyr eaſe beſeged caſtell nere myght quene cauſed ſyr hewe spē cer elder therle arūdell brought forth edward ſonne baron preſent ſayde howe ſhe ſonne ſhulbe take ryght lawe accordyng theyr deſertis ſyr hewe spencer ſayd dame god good iudge gyue good iudgement nat haue world praye god maye haue hit another ſtepte forth ſyr thomas wage good knyght marſhall hoſte ther openly recoū ted dedis wrytynge tourned hym another auncient knyght entent ſhuld bryng hym caſe fanty declare ſhuld done ſuche parſones judgement ſhulde haue ſuche cauſes ſayd knyght counſailed baron knyghtis ſo reported theyr opynions whiche well deſerued deth dyuers horryble dedis whiche haue commyſed treſpas reherſed iuſtifie trouth wherfore haue deſerued dyuerſyties theyr treſpaces haue iudgement iii dyuers maners fyrſt drawen heedded hanged jebet lyke wyſe iubged ſo done executed caſtell bryſtowe ſyght kyng ſyr hewe spencer yonger iudgement doone yere lorde ccc xxvi ſaynt denys day october execution kyng yong spē cer ſeyng theym ſelfe thus beſeged myſchief knewe comfort myght come mornyng betymes two ſmalle company entred lytle veſſell behynde caſtell thynkyng haue fledde countrey walys xi dayes ſhyppe enforced ſaile moche myghte ſo euer dydde wynde euery daye ſo contrary wyll god euery daye oones twyſe euer brought agayn within quartter myle ſame caſtell laſt fortuned ſyr henry beamond ſon vicount beamond ingland entred barge certayne company hym ſpyed veſſell rowed hym ſo long ſhyp wherin kyng coulde nat flee faſt fynally ouer takyn ſo brought agayn towne briſtow delyuered quene ſon priſoners thus befel high hardy entrepryſe ſyr john̄ heynault companye whan departed entred theyr ſhyppes durdright iii c mē armes thus theyr help lordes inglande quene iſabell conquered agayne aſtate dignyte put vnto execucion ennemyes wher mooſt parte realme right joyouſe withoute fewe parſones ſuche fauourable ſyr hewe spencer parte whan kyng ſir hew spencer mere brought briſtowe ſaid ſir henry beamond kyng ſent coūſell baron knyghtis ſtrong caſtell barkeley put vnder good kepyng honeſt ther ordeined people aſtate aboute hym ſuche knewe ryght well ought doo ſtraytly commaunded ſhulde wyſe ſuffre hym paſſe ye caſtell ser hewe spē cer deliuerd ser thomas wage marſhall 〈◊〉 hoſt yt quene departed al hoſt ward london whiche chief cite ingland ſo ryd forth theyr iourneis ser thomas wage cauſed ser hewe spēcer faſt boūd ye beſt leuieſt horſ al ye hoſt cauſed hym tabarte ſuche traytours theues wont thus led ſcorue quenes rout townes paſſed trumpes canayres hym greatter diſpyte tyll laſte came cite herford wher quene honorably receyued great ſolempnyte cōpany ther ſhe kept feaſt ſayntis wt great royalte loue ſon ſtraūgers yt ther ¶ howe ſyr hewe spencer put iudgement cap xiii whan feaſt done ſyr hewe spencer nothyng beloued brought forth quene lordes knyghtꝭ ther hym wrytyng reherſed dedis ageynſt whiche wold gyue maner anſwere ſo iudged playn ſentence fyrſt drawen hyrdell trumpes trumpettis cite herford brought market place people aſſembled tyed hygh vpon ladder euery mā myght ſe hym ſame place ther made great fier ther pryuy membres cut hym bycauſe reputed hym herety 〈…〉 ſo demed ſo brent fyre face hart drawen body caſt fyre bycauſe falſe traytour hart yt hys traytours coūſell extorciō yt kyng ſhamed realme brought great myſchief cauſed behedded greatteſt lordes realme y• realme ought haue ben ſuſteyned defended ſo enduced kyng wolde nat ſe quene wyfe edwarde eldeſt ſon cauſed hym chare realme fere theyr lyues heed ſtryken ſent lōdon accordyng iudgement executed quene lordes toke theyr way toward london dyd ſo moche theyr iourneys arryued cite london cite great company mette dyd quene ſonne great reuerence al theyr company thought beſt beſtowed whan ben thus receyued feaſted ſpace xv dayes knyghtis ſtraūgers namely ſyr john̄ heynaulte great deſyre retourne agayn theyr owne countres thought well done theyr deuour achyued greathonour ſo toke theyr leue quene lordes realme quene lordes requyred tary longer lytle ſpace ſe ſhuld done kyng pryſon ſtraungers ſo great deſyre retourne theyr owne countreys praye theym contrarye auayled nat whan quene coūſell ſaw yet deſyred ſyr john̄ heynaulte tary tyll paſt chriſtmas retaygne hym ſuche company pleaſed hym beſt gentle knyght wold nat leue parfourme ſeruice courteſly graunted quene tary long pleaſed cauſed tary ſuche company coud get fewe remnaunt wold wyſe tary wherof diſpleaſed whan quene counſell ſawe wold nat abyde prayer made great chere feaſtis quene made gyuen plenty golde ſyluer theyr coſtis ſeruicis dyd gyue great jewelles eche accordyng theyr degree ſo helde ſelfe ryght well content ouer ſyluer theyr horſes ſuche wolde leue behynde theym theyre owne eſtymation without grudgyng thus ſyr john̄ heynaulte aboode ſtyll ſmalle company among engliſſhemen always dydde hym moche honoure coude ymagyn company lyke wyſe ſo dyd ladyes damozelles countre great plentye counteſſes great ladyes gentle pucels come thither acompany quene ſemed well y• knyght ser john̄ heynaulte well deſerued y• chere feaſt made hym ¶ coronacion kyng edwarth thyrde cap xiiii moſt part company heynault departed ser john̄ heynaulte lorde beamond taryed quene gaue leue people parte ſauynge certayne noble knyghtis whiche ſhe kept ſtyl ſōne counſell commaunded departed london next chriſtmas ſhe determyned kepe open court promyſed ſo whan chriſtmas come ſhe helde great court thyther came duke erles harous knyghtis noble realme prelate burgeſſes good townes aſſemble abuysed ye realme coud nat long endure without h 〈…〉 chief lord put wrytynge dediss kyng priſon hadde done euyll counſell vſagess euyll behauyngis euyll gouerned realme whiche wa • edd openly playn audience thentent noble ſagis realme might take therof good aduyce 〈◊〉 fall acorde realme ſhuld gouerned thenſforth whan caſess dedis kyng done cōſented behauyng vſagis red wel vndeſt harone knyghtis al y• coūſels realme drew aparte coū ſell moſt part accorded namely great lordes noble burgeſſes y• good townes accordyng hard ſay knew ſelfe moſt parte dedis wherfore cōcluded ſuche man nat worthy kyng bere crowne roy haue name kyng accorded edward eldeſte ſon ther preſent ryghful heyre ſhuld crowned kyng ſtede father ſo wold take good counſell ſage true hym ſo realme thenſforth myght better gouerned olde kyng father ſhuld well honeſtly kept long lyued accordyng aſtate thus agreed noble ſo accomplyſſhed crowned crowne roy palaice weſtm̄ beſide london yong kyng edward iii bayes rightfortunate happy armes coronacion wa yere lorde ccc xxvi chriſtymas day yong kyng age xvi held feſt tyl cōuercion ſayut paule folo wyng mean tyme greatly feſted ſir john̄ heynaulte princis noble coū tre gyuen hym company many ryche jewel ſo company great feaſt ſolas lordis ladyes taried tyll xii day ser john̄ heynault hard tydyngis 〈◊〉 kyng bayghan erle heynault brother great plenty lordis fraūce ordeyned conde great feaſt turney cryed wold ſir john̄ heynaulte longer abyde prayer ſo great deſire ſaid tourney ſe erle brother lordis hys countrey ſpecially ryght noble kyng large gentyll charles kyng bayghan whā ye yong kyng edward quene mother barōs ſaw yt wold longer tary theyr requeſt coude nat auaile gaue hym leue ſore agaynſt theyr wyls kyng coūſell quene mother dyd gyue hym cccc markis ſte • lyng 〈◊〉 heritable hold hym fee payed euery yere towne bruges alſo dyd gyue philyp chaſtaulre chief eſquyer ſoueraigne counſellour c marke rent yerely payed ſayd place alſo delyuered hym moche money pay therwith coſtis hym company tyl come 〈◊〉 owne countre cauſed hym conducted many noble knyghtis douer ther delyuered hym paſſage free ladyes come ingland quene namely counteſſe garrēnes ſuſter erle hare dyuerſe ladyes damozel ther gyuen many feyre ryche iewels theyr departyng whan ser john̄ heynaulte departed fro ye yong kyng edward company wer come douer entred encontynēt theyr ſhippes paſſe ſee entent come tymes ſayd tourney ther wēt hym xv yong luſty knyghtꝭ ingland go tourney hym acqueynt ſtraunge lordis knyghtꝭ ſhuld ther great honour company turneyd tyme conde ¶ howe kyng robert de breux scotland defyed kyng edward cap xv ſyr john heynault departed fro kyng edward y• quene mother gouerned realme counſelle erle kent vncle kyng counſell ſyr roger mortymer great lādes ingland ſūme vu c li rent yerely • aniſſhed chaſed inglād 〈◊〉 quene ye haue hard alſo vſed moche ye coūſell ser thomas wage aduyſe reputed moſt ſageſt realme ther ſome hadd enuy therat whiche neuer dyed ingland alſo reigneth wyl reigne dyuers countres thus paſſed • orth wynter lent ſeaſon tyll eaſter kyng quene realme good peace ſeaſon • fortuned kyng robert scotland ben rygh hardy ſuffered moche trauaile agaynſt ingliſſhmen oftē tymes ben chaſed diſcom • eted tyme kyng edward fyrſt graūdfather yong kyng edward iii become olde auncient ſicke ſayd great euyll malady whan knewe thadu • tures fallen ingland howe olde kyng edwarde ii taken depoſed downe fro regalley crowne certayne coūſellours behedded put diſtruction ye haue hard bethought hy yt wolde defye yonge kyng edward iii bicauſe yong baron realme nat one accorde ſaid therfore better ſpede purpoſe conquere part ingland ſo eaſter yere lorde ccc xxvii ſent defyaūce yong kyng edward iii realme ſendyng worde howe wolde entre realme ingland brenne hym done tyme ſuche ſeſon diſcomfeture caſtell eſtermelin ingliſſhmen receyued great dāmage whan kyng ingland counſell perceyued defyed cauſed knowē ouer realme commaūded noble ſhuld redy appareled euery mā eſtate ſhulde aſcen •• day next towne yorke ſtandyng northward kyng ſent moche people kepe fronters agaynſt scotland ſent great ambaſſade ſir john̄ heynault praying hym right effectuouſly y• wold helpe ſocour kepe company hym voiage agaynſt scottis wold hym aſcēcion day nexte yorke ſuche company myght gette men warre thoſe party whan ser john̄ heynaulte lorde beamonde hard y• kyngis deſyre ſent ſtreyght letter meſſengers euery place thought recouer attaigne haue company men warre inflaunders heynaulte brabant place deſyryng yt theyr beſt apparell warre wolde mete hym wyſant go ouer ſee hym ingland ſuche ſent vnto came hym glad chere dyuerſe hard therof truſt attaigne moche honour hym ingland voiage tyme y• ſayd lorde beamond come wyſant ther redy ſhyppes hym company brought ingland ſo toke ſhyppyng paſſed ouer ſee arryued douer ſo ſeaſed nat ryde tyll came within iii dayes penthecoſte towne yorke wher kyng quene mother lordis great hoſt taryeng comynge ofſir john̄ heynaulte ſent many theyr men armes archer comen people good townes villagꝭ people reſorted cauſed loged ii iii leges alabout countre day thyther came ſir john̄ heynaulte company ryght welcome well receyued kyng quene mother barōs delyuered ſub barbes cite lodge ſir john̄ heynaulte delyuered abbey whyte monkes hym howſold ther came hym heynaulte ye lorde angiew called ſyr gualtier ſir henry lorde dantoing lord saignoles ſit faſtres de rae ſir robert de batlleul ſir guilliam de bailleul brother lorde hauereth chaſteleyne mon ser allard de bryſnell ser mychell de ligne ser john̄ de mē tigni yonger brother ſir sawſe de bouſſat lorde gōmegines ſyr percyual de seuernes lorde byaurien lorde floien alſo countre flaūders ther ser hector uilais ſir de rodes ser umſlart de guiſtell lorde trace ſir guyſſuyn de la muele dyuerſe came thither countrey brahant lorde dufle ſyr tyrry uaucourt ſyr raſſe de gres ſyr john̄ de caſſebegne ſyr john̄ pyleſtre ſyr guyllaum de courterelless iii bretherne de harlebeque ſyr gualtier de hault bergue dyuers behaignons ther ſyr john̄ de libeaur ſir henry brother ſir henry de la chapell ſyr hewe de hay ſyr john̄ de limies ſyr lambert de dres ſir guilbert de cā breſis artoys ther come certayn knyghtꝭ theyr owne good wylles auaūce theyr bodyes ſo ſir john̄ heynaulte well company v c men armes well apparailed richely mounted feaſt penthecoſt came thyther ſyr guyllaume de juliers duke juliers y• diſſeaſe father ſir henry tyrry branberque erle los ryghtfayre row •• kepe companye gentle knyght ſir john̄ heynaulte lorde beamont ¶ diſcencion bitwene archer inglande themof heynaulte cap xvi gentle kyng inglād better feſt theſe ſtraūge lordes company helde great courte trynite ſonday ye frier wher queue mother lodged kepynge theyr houſe eche apart feaſt kyng hadde well v c knyghtis xv newe made quene well courte lx ladyes damozelles redy make feaſt chere ſir john̄ heynaulte companye myght haue ſeen great noble plēty maner ſtraūge vitaile ladyes damozelless fre ſhly apparayled redy haue daunced myght haue leue incontynent dyuer began great fraye bitwene ſome gromes page ſtraūgers archer inglande lodged among ſaid ſubbarbis anon archer aſſēbled gether bowes droue ſtraungers home theyr lodgyngꝭ moſt part knyghtis maiſters kyng courte ſoone harde tydyngꝭ fray eche drewe theyr owne lodgyng great haſt ſuche myght entre ſuche coulde nat get great parell archer nombre iii ſhotte faſte theyr arowes nat ſparyng maiſters varlettis thought ſuppoſed ſraye begonne ſome frendis y• spencer erle arundels put deth • de counſell ſir john̄ heynaulte ye haue harde parauenture thought ſom reueged ſet diſcorde hooſt ſo inglyſſhemen hoſtes theſe ſtraū gers ſhoot faſt doores wyndowes wolde nat ſuffre theym entre theyr lodgyngis howbeit ſome gate backe ſyde quickly armed durſt nat iſſue ſtrete feare arowes ſtraūgers brake backe ſide brake downe pale hedge garden drewe certeyne playne place aboode company tyll laſt c aboue men armes many vnharneſt ſuche coulde nat get theyr lodgyugꝭ whan aſſēbled gether haſted go ſuccoure theyr compaignyons defended theyr lodgyngis y• great ſtrete went forth paſſed ye lodgyng lorde denghyen wher great gatis behynd openyng great ſtrete archer ingland ſhot ferſly howſe ther many henaus hurte good knyght auſtre de rue ſyr john̄ parceuall de meries ſyr sanſe de bouſſac theſe iii coulde nat entre theyr lodgyngis arme dyd valiantly though ben armed great leuers handis whiche founde carpenter yarde whiche gaue ſuche ſtrokis men burſt nat aproche iii bette downe day ſuche company mo lx great myghty knyghtꝭ fynally archer fraye diſcomfetted put chaſe deed place well nombre ccc ſaid y• buſſhopprike lyncoln̄ itrowe god dyd neuer gyue grace fortune people dyd gentle knyght ſyr john̄ heynaulte companye theſe inghſſhe archer intended none thyng murder robbe come ſerue kyng beſyneſſe theſe ſtraūgers neuer ſo great parell ſeaſon lay northey 〈1 page missing〉 euery man takyn place lodge ther al nyght lordes drewe aparte take counſaile howe myght fyght ſcottis conſideryng countrey farre coulde vnderſtande ſcottis went euer foreward burnyng waſtyng countrey parceyued well howe coulde nat wyſe feyght among theſe mountaignes without great parell daunger ſawe well alſo coulde nat ouertake thought ſcottis muſt n • dis paſſe agayne y• riuer tyne home warde therfore determined great aduyce counſaile oſte ſhulde remoue mydnyght make haſte mornyng entent ſtoppe paſſage ryuer scottis wherby ſhulde aduyſed force eyther fyght orels abyde ſtyll inglande theyr great daunger loſſe concluſion oſte accorded ſo ſupped lodged well myght nyght euery man warned redy fyrſt ſoundyng trumpette ſecunde blaſte euery man arme hym without delaye iii euery man quyckely moūte theyr horſes drawe vnder owne ſtā dard baner euery man take hym one loſte breede truſte behynde hym horſe alſo determined ſhulde leaue behynde theym theyr looſe harneys maner cariagis purueyaunces thought ſurely feyght ſcottis next daye ſo euer daunger thynkyng ieo • de eyther wyn leeſe thus ordeyned ſo accōplyſſhed mydnyght euery man redy apparailed fewe ſlepte lytle yet ſore traualed daye great haſte made well raunged batell day began appere auaūced forward al haſt moūtaignes valeys rokkes many euyll paſſages without playn countrey hyeſt theſe hylles playn theſe valeys meruaylouſe great marſhes daungerous paſſages great meruaile moche people hadde nat ben loſt roode euer ſtyll forward neuer taried one another ſo euer fel 〈◊〉 theſe marſhes moche peyne could gette ayde helpe theym agayne dyuerſe place many loſt ſpecially horſe cariagꝭ often tymes day cryed alarum ſaid euer formoſt company oſte wer fyghtyng ennemies ſo hynder moſt went ben true wherfore haſted theym ouer rokkis ſtones mountaygnes helme ſheld redy apparailed fyght ſpere ſwerde redy hand wt tariyng father brother companyon whan thus ron forth often tymes day ſpace halfe myle gyther towarde crye wenyng theyr ennemyes deceyued crye euer aroſe reyſyng hartis hyndis ſauage beaſtis ſeen y• forewarde whiche beaſtis made ſuche ſhowtyng criyng came went ben fyghtyng theyr ennemies thus rode forth daye yonge kyng inglande moūtaignes destis without fyndyng hygh way towne village whā ageynſt nyght came ryuer tyne ſame place ſcottis hadde paſſed ouer inglande wenyng muſte nedis repaſſe agayne ſame waye kyng inglande oſte paſſed ouer ſame riuer ſuche gydis had▪ moche peyne trauaile y• paſſage full great ſtones whan ouer lodged theym nyght ryuer ſyde tyme son goon reſte fewe among axe hoke inſtrument cutte downe woodde make lodgyng withall many loſte owne company wiſt nat footemē farre behynde wyſt nat well way take ſuche knewe beſte countrey ſayd playnly hadde rydden ſame daye xxiiii englyſſhe myles roode faſte might without reſt ſuche paſſages coulde nat cheſe nyght laye ryuer ſyde ſtyll theyr harneys holdynge theyr horſes theyr raynes theyr handts wyſt nat wherunto tye thus theyr horſes dyd eate meate nyght day nother ootes forage people oſte ſuſtenaūce day nyght euery man loffe hadde caryed hynde hym whiche ſore wette ſwette horſes dranke none drynke water ryuer withowte ſome lordis caryed botels wt fyer lyght nothyng make lyght withall without ſome y• lordes torch brought great trouble daūger paſſed nyght armour ſtill backis horſes redy ſadled whan day began appere▪ whiche greatly de sired y• hole oſte truſted ſynd ſome redreſſe ſelfe horſes orels fyght theyr ennemies whiche greatly deſyred thentene deliuered y• great trauaile peyne endured day rayned faſte ryuer paſſage waxen great ryſen ſo high y• noone ther myght none paſſe paſſages agayn wherfore could nat ſēde know haue forage lytter theyr horſes brede drynke owne ſuſtinaūcis ſo y• nyght fayne faſt theyr horſes nothyng leues tree herbes • cut downe bowes tree wt theyr ſwerdꝭ tye withall horſes make themſelfe lodge noone ſome poore folkꝭ y• countrey founde ſaid howe xiiii myle newcaſtell vpon tyne xi myle frō carlyle towne nerer wheri might fynde thyng theym eaſe withall whan ſhewed y• kyng lordꝭ coūſell incontinent ſent thither horſes ſompters fetche then ſome p • ueyāce crye kyngis name made y• towne newcaſtell y• ſo euer wolde bryng brede wyne vitaile ſhulde payd therfore incontinent good price ſhulde conducted oſte ſaue garde publiſſhed openly y• kyng oſte wolde nat departe place y• tyll ſome tydyng • ennemies become next day noone ſuche benſent vitaile returned agayne oſte ſuche purueyaūcis coulde gette nat ouer moche came folkis coūtrey lytle nagges charged brede euyll bakyn panyers ſmalle pere wyne barels vitaile ſel oſte wherby great part oſte well refreſſhed eaſed thus cōtinued day day ſpace viii dayes abidyng eueryday y• retournyng agayn y• ſcott • knew y• engliſſh oſtelay thā knewe wer ſo eche ignorāt thus iii dayes iii nyghtis maner withowte brede wyne candel lyght • oder forage maner purueyaūce othe • horſe • ſpace iiii dayes lotte brede ſolde vi whiche worthe • gallon wyne vi grootis worth vi yet ſuche rage famin eche toke vitailes others handis wherby roſe diuers batels ſtryffes bitwene ſondry companyōs yet beſide theſe miſchieffis neuer ſeaſed rayne hoole weeke wherby theyre ſaddels pannels countreſyngles rottyn brokē moſt part horſes hurt backꝭ nat wherwith ſhoo vnſhodde nothyng couer ſelfe withall fro y• rayne colde grene buſſhes armour thyng make fyre withal grene bowes y• whiche wolde nat burne bicauof rayne great miſchief weeke without heryng worde ſcottis vpon truſt ſhuld repaſſe agayn theyr owne countreis ſame way uere ther wherby great noyſe murmour began ryſe oſte ſome ſaid layd others charge theyr counſaile kyng brought daū ger done betraye y• kyng ooſte wherfore ordeyned kyng counſaile nexte mornyng ſhulde remoue ooſte repaſſe agayne ryuer vii myle then wher myght paſſe eaſe cried oſte euery mā ſhulde redy apparailed remoue nexte day tymes alſo crye made ſo euer coulde bryng kyng certayne knowledge ſcottꝭ y• brought fyrſt tydyng therof ſhuld haue labour c li lande hym heires euer made knyght kyngis hande whan crye made oſte diuers engliſſhe knyghtis ſquiers nombre • xv xvi couetyſe wynnyng promyſe paſſed ryuer great parell rode forth throughe mountaignes departed eche one takyng aduē ture next mornyng oſte diſlodged rode fayre eaſely daye euyll apparailed dyd ſo moche yt repaſſed agayn ryuer moche payn trauaile water depe bicauſe rayn fallen wherfore many dyd ſwym ſome drowned whan alouer lodged oſte ther founde ſome forage medowes feldis lytle village whiche ſcott • brēt wh • 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 paſt way nerte daye departed frothens paſte ouer hyls dale day tyll noone founde ſome village brent ſcottis ſome champyon countrey corne medowes ſo nyght oſt lodged ther agayn iii day rode forth ſo moſt parte oſte wiſt nat whiche way knewe nat countrey coulde tydyng ſcottis agayn 〈◊〉 day rode forth ilyke maner tyl houre iii came ſquyer faſt tydyng toward kyng ſaid like grace haue brought parfit tydyngꝭ ſcottꝭ ennemies ſurely within iii myle lodged great moūtaine abidyng ther ther haue ben viii dayes knewe tidyngis ye dyd ser y• ſhew trouth aproched ſo nere takyn priſoner brought y• lordes oſte ſhewed tydyngis ye ſeke • ent haue batell lordis dyd quyt raūſom priſon whan ſhewed howe grace promiſed c li ſterlyng rent hym y• brought fyrſt tydyng made promiſe yt ſhuld nat reſt tyll ſhewed thys tydyngys ſayde great deſyre fyght ye theym ther ſhall ye fynde without faulte ſoone kyng harde tidynges aſſembled ooſte fayre medowe paſture theyr horſes beſidis ther lytle abbey y• whiche brent called y• dayes kyng arthur le blanche land ther kyng confeſſed hym euery man made hym redy kyng cauſed many maſſes ſong howſell ſuche deuotion therto incontyuent aſſigned c li ſterlyng rent ſquier brought hym tidyng ſcottis accordyng pmyſe made hym knyght owne handis oſte whan well reſted takyn repaſte • compet ſounded horſe euery man moū ted baners ſtanders folowed thys new made knyght euery batell itſelfe ī good order moūtaignes dale raynged well myght euer redy apparailed fyght roode made ſuche haſt noone ſo nere ſcottys eche theym myghte clerely ſe ſoone scottis ſawe theym iſſued owte theyre lodge foote ordeyned iii great batelles auaylynge hyll foote thys mountaygne ranne great ryuer full great rockes ſtones ſo none myght paſſe ouer withowte greate daunger ieopardye though engliſſhmen hadde paſſed ouer ryuer yet place rowme bytwene hylle ryuer ſette batayle good order scottis hadde ſtablyſſhed two fyrſte batelles two corner mountaigne ioynyng rockes none myght well mounte vpon hyll aſſayle theym ſcottis euer redy beate ſtones aſſaylantis paſſed ryuer whan lordes inglande ſawe behauyng maner ſcottis made people lyght foote put theyr ſpurris araynged iii great batelles hadde done made many newe knyghtis whan theyr batelles ſette good order ſome lordes inglande brought theyr yong kyng horſe backe batelles oſte entent gyue therby courage people whiche kyng full goodly maner prayed requyred theym ryght graciouſly euery man wolde peyne theym theyr beſte ſaue honour common weale realme cōmaūded vpō peyne deth none ſhulde go marſhas baners breke theyr arraye without commaunded kyng cōmaunded ſhulde aduaunce towarde ennemyes fayre eaſely ſo dyd euery batell went forth good array order great ſpace groūde diſcendyng mountaygne ſcottis engliſſhe oſte dyd thentent ſe ennemies wolde breke felde nat ſe wolde could nat parceyue remoue ī wiſe wer ſo nere guyther myght knowe eche others armes oſte ſtode ſtyll take counſell ſome oſte mounted good horſes rode forth ſkrymyſſhe theym beholde paſſage ryuer ſe countynaunce theyre ennemyes nerer harauldis armes ſent scottis gyuyng knowledge wolde come paſſe y• ryuer fight playn felde wolde drawe backe fro ryuer gyue theym ſufficient place araynge theyr batelles eyther ſame day orels next wold choſe ſelfe orels lette lyke wyſe wolde come ouer whan ſcottis harde toke counſell among theymſelfe anon anſwerd harauldꝭ mold nother ouenor ſayd ſyrs yor kyng lordisſe well realme haue br • nt waſted y• countrey haue paſſed diſpleaſed ther lette amend whan wyll wyll abyde long ſhall pleaſe v ſoone kyng ingland hard anſwere hit incontynent cryed oſte ſhuld lodge y• nyght without reculyug backe ſo oſte lodged nyght moche peyne hard ground ſtones alwayes ſtyll armed ſtakꝭ roddis tye withall horſes forage huſſhe make withall tyre whan thus lodged ſcottis cauſed ſome theyre people kepe ſtyll felde ordeyned batelles y• remnant went lodgyngꝭ made ſuche fyers merueile beholde bitwene day nyght made amerueilus great brute wt blowyng horne one ſemed proprely deuelles hell ben thus theſe two oſtis lodged nyght whiche ſaynte peter nyght begynnyng auguſte yere oure lorde ccc xxvii nexte mornynge lordes inglande harde maſſe rayngen agayne theyre batelles hadde done daye scottis lyke myſe ordred ther • batelles thus ottis ſtoode ſtyll batell tyll noone scottis made neuer ſemblaunt come englyſſhe oſte fyght theym lyke wyſe engliſſhe men coulde nat aproche g • ther withowte great dammage dyuerſe compaignyons horſe backe paſſed ryuer ſome foote ſkrymyſſ • e scottis like wyſe ſome scottꝭ brake oute ſkrymyſſhed dyuerſe bothe partyes ſlayne wounded takyn pryſoners noone paſte lordes juglande commaunded euery man drawe theyr lodgyng ſawe well scottis wolde nat fyght theym like maner thus dyd iii dayes gyther ſcottis lyke caſe kepte ſtyll theyr mountaygnes howe ſkrymyſſhynge bothe partyes dyuerſe ſlayne pryſoners takyn euery nyght scottis made great fyres great brute ſhowttyng blowyng horne entencion englylſhe men holde ſcottis mauer beſeged coulde nat fyghte theym thynkyng haue famyſſhed theym englyſſhe men knewe well ſuche pryſoners hadde takyn y• scottis hadde nother bredde wyne norſalte purueyaunce ſaue beaſtis great plentye whyche hadde takyn countrey myght eate pleaſure without bredde whiche euyll dyette lacked oten meale make cake withall ſayde whyche dyet ſome engliſſhe men vſed whan haddenede ſpecially borderer whan make rodes scotlande y• mornyng iiii day englyſſh men loked moūtaigne wher scottis coulde ſe creature ſcottis depted mydnyght ſent men horſe backe afoote ouer ryuer knowe become noone founde theym lodged another mountaigne ſtronger ſame ryuer ſyde great wodde one ſyde goo come ſecretly whan lyſt incontynent englyſſhe oſte diſlodged brewe parte batelled good order lo •• ed theym another hyll ageynſt ſcottis raynged theyr batelles made ſemblant haue come scottis iſſued lodge ſet theyr batels along y• ryuerſyde ageynſt wold neuer come toward engliſſhe oſte y• engliſſhmen could nat go wout wold haue ben ſlayn take auaūtage thus lodged eche •• cuſt y• ſpace xviii day often tymes y• kyng inglād ſent harauldis armes offeryng yt wolde ſome fyght hym wolde gyue place ſufficient playn groūde pytche theyr felde elles lette theym gyue hym rowme place aſſured theym wolde come ouer ryuer fyght wt theym ſcottis wolde neuer agree thus ooſtis ſuffered moche payne trauayle ſpace laye ſo nere gyther fyrſt nyght engliſſhe •• thus lodged ſecund moūtaigne lorde willyam duglas toke hym aboute cc men armes paſt ryuer farre fro oſte ſo nat parceyued ſodē ly brake englyſſhe ooſte mydnyght criyng duglas duglas ye ſhall dpe theues juglande ſlewe seaſſ •• ccc men ſome beddis ſome ſkant redy ſtrake horſe ſpurres came kyngis owne tent alwayes criyng duglas ſtrake ſundre ii iii cordis kyngꝭ tent ſo departed y• retret loſt ſome men returned agayn y• ſcottꝭ ſo done euery nyght engliſſhe oſte made good ſure watche doubted makyng ſkryes euer moſt part oſte laye harneys euery day ther ſkrymyſſhes made men ſlayne party concluſion y• laſt daye xxiiii ther ſcottiſſhe knyght taky • ageynſt wyll ſhewed lordes ingland ſtate condition ſcottꝭ ſo ſore examyned feare lyfe ſhewed howe y• lordes scotlād accorded among ſelfe ſame nyght euery man ſhuld redy armed folowe baners lorde wyllyam duglas euery mā kepe hym ſecrete y• knyght could nat ſhewe entended lordis ingland drewe coū ſaile ther thought amōg ſcottis myght nyght tyme come aſſaile oſte ſydes aduenture themſelfe lyue dye coulde endure longer famyne among theym englyſſhe lordes ordeyned iii 〈…〉 batels ſo ſtode iii party without lodgyngis made great fyers therby ſe better cauſed page kepe theyr lodgyngis horſes thus ſtode ſtyll yt nyght armed euery man vnder owne ſtā dard baner brekyng daye • ii trompettis scotland mette engliſſhe ſcout watche toke trompettis brought kyng ingland conſaile ſaid openly sir ye watche ye leſe tyme ieopardye heedis ſcottis gone departed mydnyght y• leſt tyme iii iiii myle theyr way left v ii behynd thentent ſhulde ſhewe engliſſhe lordes ſaid foly folowe ſcottis ſawe well coulde nat ouer take theym yet doubte diſceyuyng kept ſtyll two trompettis pryuely cauſed batailes ſtande ſtyll araynged tyll nere prime ¶ whan ſawe trouth ſcottis departed euery man leaue retraye lodgyng lordes toke counſaile determyn ſhulde beſt meane tyme dyuerſe ingliſſhe oſte mounted horſes paſſed ouer ryuer came mountaigne ſcottis ben ther founde mo v c great beſtis redy ſlayne bicauſe ſcottis coulde nat dryue theyr ooſte bicauſe engliſſhe men ſhulde haue ſmall profit alſo ther found ccc caudrons made beſtꝭ ſkynnes heare ſtyll ſtrayned ſtakes ouer fyre full water full offleſſhe ſodden mo ſpyttꝭ full fleſſhe roſted mo x olde ſhoos made rawe lether heare ſtyll whiche ſcottis left behynd also founde v poore englyſſhemen priſoners bounde faſte certayne tree ſome legges broken thā loſed let go returned agayn tyme al oſte diſlodged ordeyned kyng aduyce counſaile hole oſte ſhulde folowe marſhals baners drawe homeward ingland ſo dyd y• laſt came fayre medow foūd forage ſufficient horſes cariagis wherof great nede nigh ſo feble ſhulde haue ben great peyne haue goon forther engliſſhe cronicle ſayth ſcottis ben fought ſyr roger mortymer lorde inglande nat betraied kyng toke mede money ſcottis thentent myght departe pryuely nyght vnfoughte hit maye ſeen playnely engliſſhe cronycle diuers mater whiche paſſe ouer tyme folowe myn auctour ſo nexte day oſte diſlodged agayne went forth abowte noone came great abbey two myle fro cite durham kyng lodged oſte feldis founde forage ſufficient theym ſelfe theyr horſes nexte day oſte lay ſtyll kyng went cite durham ſe churche offered ī cite euery man founde owne cariagis whyche hadde lefte xxxii dayes wodde mydnyght whan folowed ſcottis ſyrſt hath benſhewed burgeſſes people durham founde broughte theym theyr towne theyre owne coſtis chargis theſe cariagꝭ ſette voyde grange barnes ſaue garde euery mannes cariage owne cogniſaūce armes wherby euery mā myght knowe owne lordes genty lmē gladde whan thus founde cariages thus abonde two dayes cite durham oſte rounde coulde nat lodge within cite theyr horſes newe ſhoode toke theyr way cite yorke ſo iii dayes came thither ther y• kyng foūde quene mother receyued hym great ioye ſo dyd ladyes damozelles burgeſſes c •• mon citie kyng gaue lycence maner people euery man drawe home • arde theyr owne countreys kyng thanked greatly erles barones knyghtꝭ theyr good coū ſaile done hym hys io • ney retayned ſtyll hym ser john̄ heynaulte company greatly feaſted y• quene ladyes knyghtis ſtraūgers hys company made byll horſes ſuche ſtuffe loſt iourney delyuered kyngis counſaile euery man itſelfe truſte kyngis promyſe ser john̄ heynaulte lorde beamont boūde hymſelfe company ſhulde content euery thyng cōprised theyr owne bils within ſhortſpace kyng counſaile coulde nar ſo ſoone recouer golde ſyluer content deſyres delyuered ſufficient reaſon pay ſmall charge bryng home withal theyr owne countreis anon within y• ſame yere payd euery thyng could deſyre heynnaulte bought lytle • agges ryde theyr caſe theyr lackettꝭ pagis harneys baggage water ii ſhippes deliuered whiche ſhyppes theyr 〈◊〉 arryued sluce flaundders ſyr john̄ heynnaulte companye toke theyr leue kyng olde quene erle kent y• erle lancaſtre barones greatly dyd honour theym kyng cauſed xii knightis c▪c men armes cōpany doubt archer inglād whome nat well aſſured muſte needis paſſe buſſhopryke lincoln̄ thus departed ſi • john̄ heynaulte rowte conduct theſe knyghtis rode ſo long ī theyr iourney came douer ther entred ſee iſhippis veſſels founde redy ther apparayled • adliſt knyghtis veparted fro then retourned owne houſes henous arriued wyſant ther ſoiourned ii bayes makyng redy theyr horſes harneys y• mean tyme ser john̄ heynault ſome company rode pylgrimage lady bollayn returned heynaulte depted eche fro owne howſes countres ser john̄ heynaulte rode therle brother ualenciennes receyued hym ioyouſly greatly loued hym recounted tydyng ye haue hard ¶ howe kyng edward maryed lady philyp heynaulte cap xix hit nat long kyng y• quene mother therle kent vncle therle lancaſtre ſir roger mortymer barones inglande aduyce kyngis counſaile ſent buſſhop ii knyghtis banerettis ii notable clerkꝭ ser john̄ heynault pray enghym mean theyr lord y• yong kyng ingland myght haue mariage one eric • ▪ boughts heynault brother named phylyp kyng noble realme rather haue lady loue hym ser john̄ heynault lord beamont feaſted honored greatly theſe ambaſſadours brough ualenciēnes therle brother honorably receued made ſuche chere yt ouer long reherse whan ſhewed content theyr meſſage therle ſaid sir thāke greatly y• kyng prince quene mother lordes ingland ſyth haue ſent ſuche ſufficient ꝑſonages ye ſuche honor treat mariage whiche requeſt well agreed holy father pope wyll cōſent therto y• whiche answer theſe ambaſſadours right well cōtēt thā ſent ii knyghtꝭ ii clerkꝭ incōtinent pope auygnon purchaſe diſpēſation mariage without y• pope licere might nat marie ye linage frāce ſo nere kyn y• iii degree ii mother coſyn jermayns iſſued ii brethern̄ whan theſe ambaſadors cōe pope requeſtꝭ conſideratiōs well hard holy father pope hole colledge conſentyd mariage ſo feaſted departed came agayne ualenciennes buls mariage concluded affirmed bothe party deuyſed purueied theyr apparaile thyngꝭ honorable belonged ſuche lady ſhuld quene inglande princeſſe maryed ſufficient procuration brought fro kyng inglande al feaſt triumphes done thys yonge quene entred ſee wyſant arryued cōpany douer john̄ heynaulte lorde beamont vncle dyd cō duct cite london made great feaſt many noble ingland quene crowned alſo great iuſtes tourney daunſyng carolyng great feaſtis euery day whiche enduced ſpace iii weekis engliſſhe cronicle ſaith mariage coronation quene done yorke moche honour ſunday euyn cōuerſion ſaynt paule ye yere lorde ccc xxvii whiche cronicle ſhewyd many thynges rulynge realme deth kyng edwarde carnaruan dyuerſe debate within y• realme ſame cronicle playnly hit appereth whiche auctor boke ſpeketh worde b • cauſe • auenture knew nat hard ſtrāger knowe thyngis accordyng wrytyng yong quene philyp aboode ſtyll inglande ••• company • ſones owne coū tre • ſauyng one named wandelet manny aboode ſtyll quene karuer dyd ſo many great proweſſes dyuerſe place harde make mencion ¶ howe kyng robert scotland dyed cap xx whan ſcottis departed nyght mountaigne kyng ingland hadde beſeged theym ye haue harde went xxii myle throughe ſauage countrey without reſtyng paſſed riuer • yne right nere carlyle ye next day went theyr owne lande ſo departed euery man owne manſion▪ within space af • peace purchaſed bitwene kyngis ingland scotland englyſſhe cronicle ſayth done ſpeciall counſell olde quene ser roger mortymer theyr meanes plyament holden north hampton ye whiche kyng within age graūted ſcottis releaſe feaulties homage ought haue done crowne inglande charter enſ • aled alſo delyuered ſcottis endenture whiche called ragmon wherin co • teyned homage feaulties y• kyng ſcottis prelatis erles barones scotlande ought haue done crowne inglande ſealed ſealis rightis ſondry barones knyghtis ought haue hadde realme scotlan • alſo delyuered agayn blacke croſſe scotland▪ whiche good kyng edwarde conquered brought abbey scoue whiche precious relique rightis entereſſes euery baron scotlande clene forgyuen many thyngis done parlyament great hurt preiudice realme ingland maner ageynſt wyls noble realme ſaue onely iſabell olde quene buſſhop ely lord mortymer ruled realme ſuche wyſe euery man myſcontent yt erle henry lancaſtre ſyr thomas brotherton erle marſhall ſyr edmund wodſtocke kyngꝭ vncles dyuerſe lordes cōmons agreed gether amende theſe faultes myght meane tyme y• quene iſabell ſyr roger mortym̄ cauſed nother parliament holden salyſbury whiche parliament roger mortymer made erle marche ageynſt ye barōs wyls inglād preiudice ye kyng realme ſir john̄ eltham ye kyngis brother made erle cornewal whiche • liamēt henry lācaſtre wold • come wherfore kynge broughte beleue wold haue diſtroyed parſon whiche aſſembled great hoſte went ward bedforde erle henry companye erle marſhall therle kent kyngis brother made peace bitwene kyng ye erle lācaſtre whoſe part henry lorde beamont ſyr fowke fitzwayn thomas rocellin ser williā truſſell syr thomas wyther abowte c knyghtis exyled inglande counſaile quene iſabell erle mortym̄ ſo couetous yt thought haue moſt part landis owne handis playnly ſhewen ye ingliſſhe cronicle▪ whiche paſſe ouer folowe myn auctour forsaid peace whiche purchaſed bitwene ingland scotlād endure iii yere meane tyme fortuned kyng robert scotland right ſore aged feble▪ greatly charged great ſickenes ſo ther way hym deth whan felte ende drew nere ſent ſuche barones lordis realme truſted best ſhewed remedy hym muſt nedis leue transetory lyfe cōmaū dyng faith trouth yt owed hym truly kepe realme ayde ye yong prince dauid ſonne whan wer age ſhulde obey hym crowne hym kyng mary hym ī ſuche place cōuenient aſtate called hym gentle knyght ſir william duglas ſayde lordes sir william dere frēd ye knowe well haue moche dayes vphold susteyne ryght realme whā moſt made ſolemne vow whiche yet haue nat accomplyſſhed wherof right sory whiche myght acheue make ende al warres ſo myght one haue brought realme reſt peace promyſed mynd haue gone warred chriſtis ennemies aduerſaries holy chriſten faith purpoſe myn hart hath euer eatē ded lorde wolde nat co • ſent therto haue ſo muche dayes nowe laſt entrepriſe haue takyn ſuche malady nat eſcape ſyth ſo yt body nat go acheue yt hart desireth wyll ſende hart inſtede body accomplyhſſmyn auowe bycauſe knowe nat realme knyght valyaunt ye body ſo well furnyſſhed accōplyſſhemyn avowe ſtede ſelfe therfore qui myn owne dere aſpeciall frēde ye wyll take voiage loue acquite ſoule agaynſt lord god truſt ſo moche noblenes trouth ye wyll take doubte nat ye ſhall achyue ſhall dye eaſe quiete ſo done ſuche maner ſhall declare vnto woll yt ſoone trepaſſed worlde ye take harte owte body enbawme take treaſoure ye ſhall thynke ſufficient entrepriſe yor ſelfe ſuche company ye wyll take preſent hart holy • pulchre lorde laye seyng body nat come take ſuche company purueyaunce ſhalbe aparteyuyng aſtate ſo euer ye come let knowen howe ye cary harte kyng robert scotland inſtaūce deſire p̄ſented holy ſepulchre thā lordes harde theſe wordes wept pitie whan knyght ſyr william duglas myght ſpeke wepyng ſayd gentle noble kyng c tymes thanke grace great honour ye sith ſo noble great treaſure ye gyue charge ſyr ſhall glad harte ye haue cōmaūded beſt true power howe nat worthy ſufficient achyue ſuche noble entrepriſe kyng ſayd gētle knyght thāke ſo ye wyl promyſe syr ſayd knyght ſhall vndoubtedly faythe owe god ordre knyghthodde thanke ſayd kyng nowe ſhall dy • eaſe mynde ſith knowe yt moſt worthy ſufficient knyght realme ſhall achyue whiche coulde neuer atteyne vnto thus ſoone thys noble robert de bruſe kyng scotland •• paſſed vncertayne worlde hys hart taken body enbaumed honorably entred abbey donfremlyn yere lord god ccc xxvii vii day moneth nouembre whan ſpryngyng tyme began ser william duglas purueied hym whiche aparteyned entrepriſe toke ſhip port morais scotlande ſailed flanders shluce tydyngꝭ knowe noble man coūtrey wolde go jeruſalem thētent haue cōpany lay ſtyll sluce ye ſpace xii day departed wold neuer come alande kept ſtyll ſhyp kept alwaies port behauour great tryumphe trumpettis clarion though ben kyng ſcottꝭ hym ſelfe companye knyght baneret vii knyghtis realme scotland xxvi yong ſquiers gentylmē er ue hym▪ veſſell golde ſiluer pottꝭ baſons ewer dyſſhes flagon barels cuppes thyngis ſuche wolde come ſe hym well ſerued▪ two maner wynes dyuerſe maner ſpices maner people accordyng degres whan thus taryed ſpace xii dayes hard reported yt alphons kyng spaigne made warre ageynſt ſarazyn kyng granade thā thought draw partie thynkyng ſuerely could nat beſtowe tyme nobly thā warre ayenſt goddis ennemies entrepriſe done thā thought go forth jeruſalē acheue charged ſo departed toke ſe ward spaigne arryued ye port ualen • great 〈◊〉 ſtreight kyng spaigne helde hoſte ageynſt kyng granade ſarazyn nere gether fronters lande within knyght ſyr williā duglas come ye kyng spaigne day kyng iſſued felde aproche nere ennemies ye kyng granade iſſued like wyſe part ſo eche kyng myght ſe wt al baners diſplayed arenged batels eche ageynſt 〈◊〉 william duglas drewe one ſyde company entent ſhewe prowes better whan ſaw theſe batels thus ranged party ſawe ye bataile ye kyng spaigne began ſomewhat aduaunce towarde ennemies thought verelye ſhulde ſoone aſſēble gether fyght hande ſtrokes thought rather formeſt hyndemooſt ſtrake horſe ſpurres al company alſo daſhte batelle kyng granade criynge duglas duglas wenyng hym kyng spaigne hoſt folowed dyd nat wherfore diſceyued spaignyſſ hoſt ſtode ſtyll ſo gentle knyght encloſed company ſarazyns dyd meruelles armes fynally coulde nat endure ſo company ſlayne whiche great dāmage ye ſpaynyardis wolde nat reſcue ¶ alſo ſeaſon certayn lordes treated peace bitwene inglād scotlande laſt mariage made ſolempniſed bitwene yong kyng scotland dame johan towre ſuſter kyng edward ingland berwyke ingliſſhe cronicle ſaith mary maud ly • day yere lord iii c xxviii agaynſt aſſente many noble realme quene iſabell kyng mother erle mortymer made mariage ye whiche myn auctor ſaith great feaſt made bothe party ¶ howe phylypp̄ ualoys crowned kyng fraunce cap xxi kyng charles fraunce ſōne fayre kyng phylyp iii tymes maried yet dyed without iſſue male firſt wyues one moſt fayreſt ladyes world ſhe doughter erle artoys howe ſhe kept euyll ſacramēt matrimony brake wedloke wherfore ſhe kept long ſpace pryſon caſtell gaylarde huſband made kyng whan realme frā ce fallen hym crowned aſſent xii dowſepiers fraunce thā bicauſe wold nat realme frāce ſhulde belong without heyre male aduyſed counſell kyng ſhulde remaryed agayne ſo doughter emperour henry lucenbourg ſuſter gentle kyng bayhaigne wherby firſt mariage kyng fordoone bytwene hym wyfe priſon licēce declaracyon ye pope ii wyfe ryght humble noble wyſe lady kyng ſōne dyed yong age quene alſo iſſodnii berrey dyed ſuſpeciouſly wherfore dyuers parſones put blame priuely ſame kyng charles maried agayn iii tyme doughter vncle ye lorde loyes erle dewreux ſhe ſuſter kyng nauerre named quene johan ſo tyme ſpace lady childe meane tyme kyng charles huſband fell ſycke lay downe dethe bedde whan ſawe waye hym deth deuiſed fortuned quene delyuered ſonne wolde lorde phylyp ualoys ſhulde gouernour regent hys realme tyll ſonne come ſuche age myght crowned kyng fortune ye quene haue doughter wold xii pier fraunce ſhulde take aduyſe counſell forther ordering realme ſhuld gyue realme regally hym mooſt ryght therto ſo within whyle ye kynge charles dyed eſter yere lorde ccc xxviii within ſhort ſpace quene delyuerd doughter peres fraunce aſſē bled counſell togyder parys ſhortly might conueniently gaue ye realme cōmen acorde ſir phylippe ualoys put clene quene iſabell englande kynge edwarde ſonne ſhe ſuſter germayne king charles laſt deed opynion noble fraunce ſayed maynteyned realme fraunce ſo great noble ought nat ſucceſſyon fall woman hande ſo thus crowned kyng france philypp̄ ualoys raygnes trinyte ſonday next anone ſomoned barownes men war • went withall power towne caſſell layd •• eg therto makyng war • agaynſt •• emmynges rebelledde agaynſt owne lorde namely bruges ippre franke wolde nat obey therle flaū ders chaſed hym owne countrey ſo might nat abyde partie therof onely gaunt ſcantly ther theſe flēmynges xvi thouſande capytayne called colen • ānequyn hardy man couragious made grayſon caſſell y• wage dyuerſe townes flaunders thentent kepe fronters ye ſhall howe flemmynges dyſconfeted owne outrage ¶ batell caſſell flaū ders cap xxii day garyſon caſſell departed thentent haue dyſconfyted ye kyng hooſt came priuely without noyſe thre batels well ordred wherof firſt batayle toke way kynges tentes fayre grace kynge natben taken ſouper company thought nothyng batayle toke ſtreyght way tentes kynge behaygne maner founde hym lyke caſe thirde batayle went tentes therle heynault likrwyſe nere take hym theſe hooſtes cāe ſo peaſably tentes moch payne thooſt coude arme wherby lordes people ben ſlayne grace god nat ben maner myracle god theſe lordes dyſconfyted iii batayls eche batayle ſelfe one hour ſuch wyſe • vi thouſande flemmynges ther aſcaped neuer perſon captayns ſlayne kyng lordes frāce knewe nat one hadde done tyll finyſſ edd atchyued lay thre ſondrie party one fro flēmynges nat one left lyue lay deed hepes one vpon ſayed thre ſondrie place done ſaynt bartylmewes day yere lorde ccc xxviii french men entred towne caſſell ſet vp baners fraūce towne yelded thē kyng alſo towne pyepigne ipre caſtlayne bergues receyued therle loys lorde ſware hym faythe loyaltie foreuer kynge people departed went parys moche honoured prayſed enterpriſe ayd done coſyn lois erle flaūders thus kyng great proſperite euery day encreſed ryall eſtat ſayd ther neuer kyng fraūce helde like eſtat dyd kyng philyp ualoys ¶ howe erle kent erle mortymer englande put deth cap xxiii yong kyng edwarde englande gouerned great ſpace ye haue harde coūſell quene mother edmonde wodſtoke erle kēt vncle ſir roger mortymer erle march ye laſt enuy began growe bytwene therle kent therle mortym̄ ſo moch yt erle mortim̄ enformed ſo yong kyng cōſentyng tholde quene iſabell mother beryng ye kyng hande therle kent wolde haue enpoyſoned hym thentent kynge hymſelfe nexte heyre apparaunt crowne kynges yonger brother called john̄ gaunt newly deed kyng gaue lyght credence theym cauſedde vncle erle kent taken openly beheeded without maner excuſe harde wherwith many y• noble realme wer ſore troubled bare gruge hertes towarde erle mortymer accordyng thenglyſſhe cronycle therle ſuffred dethe atte wyncheſter tenth day octobre y• thirde yere kynges raygne lyeth buryed frier wincheſtre myne auctour ſayeth within whyle reported quene isabell kyng • mother wt chylde therle mortymer wherof ye kyng enfourmed ſayd mortym̄ cauſed put deth therle kent vncle without good reaſon cauſe realme reputed hym noble man thanne kynges commaundement erle mortymer taken̄e brought london byfore great lordes noble realme recyted open declaratyon ye dedes ſayd mortymer kynge demaunded counſell ſhuld done hym lordes commen aſſent gaue iudgement ſayed ſyr hath deſerued dye ſa 〈…〉 ethe ſir hewe spenſer dyed iudgement delacyon ſufferaunce mercy incōtynent drawen throughout london ſet ſcaffolde membres cut hym caſt fyre hert alſo bycauſe ymagined treaſon thanne quartered quarter ſent foure beſt cyties realme heed remayned ſtyll london within lytle ſpace kyng commaunded thaduyce counſell yt quene mother ſhulde kept cloſe caſtell ſo dōe ſhe ladyes damoſels knyghtes ſquiers ſerue acordyng eſtat certayne lādes aſſigned mētayne ther noble eſtat dayes lyfe wyſe ſhe ſhulde nat deꝑt caſtell wt toſe ſuche ſportes ſomtyme ſhewed byfore caſtell gate recreatyon thus lady ledde forth lyfe ther mekely one twyſe yere kyng ſon wolde cōe ſe thenglyſſhe cronycle ſheweth dyuerſe conſyderations therle mortym̄
