ſuffred deth ſaynt andrewes euyn yere lorde thouſande thre hundred xxix whiche paſſe ouer folowe myne authoure ¶ thomage kyng edwarde englande dydde kynge fraunce duchye guyen cap xxiiii king dōe theſe two execucyōs toke newe counſelours mooſt nobleſt ſageſt ꝑſons realme ſo yere yt phylip ualoys crowned kyng france barones noble realme made homage fealty except yong king england nat done homage duchy guyen alſo nat ſomoned therto ye king france thaduiſe counſell ſent ouer englande lorde auycenis lorde beauſalt two table clerkes maiſters parlyament parys named maiſter peter orlyaunce maiſter peter maſieres theſe iiii deꝑted fro paris dyd ſomoch iourneis yt cāe wyſant ther toke ſee aryued douer ther taryed day abyde vnſhypping horſes bagages thā rode forth ſo long cāe wynſore kyng yong quene england lay theſe foure cauſed knowen kynge occaſyon commyng kyng englande honoure french kyng coſyn cauſed cōe preſence receyued houourably publyſſhed meſſage ye kyng anſwered noble realme counſell nat hym deſyred drawe lōdon ther ſhulde anſwered ſuch wyſe reaſon ſhulde content ſo dyned kynges chambre departed lay ſame nyght colbroke yt next day london nat long kynge came palace weſtmynſter counſell cōmaunded ther certayne day lymited whan aſſembled frenche embaſſadours ſent declared thoccaſyon cōmynge delyuered letter fro maiſter thanne kynge went parte counſell take aduyſe beſt hym thanne aduyſed counſell ſhulde anſwered thordynaunce ſtyle predeceſſours byſſhopp̄ london ſo frēchmen wer called counſell chambre byſſhop london ſayd lordes aſſē bled kyng fraunce kyng grace ſoueraygne lorde hath harde wordes redde tenour letter syrs ſay vnto woll counſell kyng ſoueraygne lorde preſent go fraunce ſe kynge maiſter dere coſyn right amyably hath ſent hym touchyng faith anohomage ſhall deuour euery thynge ought ryght ſyrs ye may ſhewe ye kyng yor maiſter within ſhort ſpace kyng englande maiſter ſhall arryue france reaſon ſhall requyre thā theſe meſſangers feaſted kynge rewarded many great gyftes iuelles toke leaue dyd ſomoche laſt came parys wher found kyng phylyppe whome recounted newes wherof king right ioyouſe ſpecially ſe kyng englande coſyn hadde neuer ſene hym whan theſe tidynges ſpredde abrode y• realm fraunce duke erles lordes aparelled beſt maner kyng fraūce wrot letter kyng charles behaygne coſyn kynge nauarre certifyeng theym day tyme whan kyng england ſhuld hym deſyringe hym ſame day ſo came thyder gret array counſelled kynge fraunce ſhulde receyue kyng englande cyte amyas make prouyſion commyng chamber halle hoſte ries lodgynges made redy apparelled receyue company alſo duke burgoyne duke burbon duke lurren ſyr john̄ artoyes purueyaunce thouſande horſe ſixe hundred horſe ſhulde come kyng englande yonge kyng englande forgate nat voyage fraunce ſo aparelled hym company well ſufficiently departed englande cō pany two byſſhoppes beſyde byſſhoppe london foure erles lorde henry erle derby coſyngermayne ſonne ser thomas erle lancaſtre wrie necke erle saliſ bury therle warwyke erle hereforde vt barownes lorde raynolde cobham lorde thomas wage marſhall englande lorde perſy y• lorde māny lorde mowbray mo xl knyghtes ſo kyng cō pany thouſand horſe y• kyng two dayes paſſing bytwene douer wyſant kyng company rod bullayne taryed one day myddes auguſt yere lorde god thouſande thre hundred xxix none tidynges came kyng phylip fraunce howe kynge englande bullayne kynge fraunce ſent conſtable great plentie knyghtes kynge englande thanne monſternell ſeeſyde ther gret token loue good chere made bothe party than̄e kynge englande rodde forth withall rowt company conſtable fraunce rodde ſo long came cytie amyas wher kyng phylippe kynge behaygne kynge mayllorgues kynge nauarre redy aparelled receyue kynge englande many duke erles great barownes xii peres fraunce redy feaſt make chere kynge englande peaſably bere wytneſſe kynge englandes homage ther kyng englande nobly receyued thus theſe kynges prince taryed amyas ſpace xv dayes meane tyme many wordes ordynaunces deuyſed farr coude knowe kyng edwarde englād made homage kynge fraunce onely worde nat puttyng hādes bytwene kynge fraunce handes none prince prelate lymitted hym kynge englande wolde nat procede farther doyng concernyng homage rather detmyned returne agayne englande redde openly priuyleges auncyent tyme graunted declared maner kynge ſhulde homage howe wyſe ſhulde ſeruyce kynge fraunce kynge fraunce ſayd coſyn woll nat diſceyue ye haue done pleaſeth v rightwell preſent tyme tyll ſuch tyme ye returned agayne realme ye haue ſene vnder ſeales predeceſſoures howe wyſe ye ſhulde ſo thus kynge englande tooke leaue departed fro kynge fraunce ryght amyably prince retourned agayne englande laboured ſo longe came wyndeſor quene receyued hym right ioyouſly demaunded tidynges kynge phylippe vncle linage fraūce kyng ſhewed knewe gret chere honour ſayd mynde realme coude compared ye realme fraunce within ſpace kyng fraunce ſent englande ſpecyall counſell byſſhoppe chartres byſſhoppe beannays lorde loys cleremont duke burbon therle harcourt therle tankermylle dyuers knyghtes clerkes ye counſell englande holden london parfourmaunce kyng englandes homage ye haue harde alſo kyng england counſell well ouerſene maner fourme auncyent predeceſſours done homage duchy acquitayne many englande y• murmured ſayd kyng lorde nerer true ſucceſſion herytage crowne fraunce phylippe ualoys kyng fraunce kyng coūſell wolde nat knowe ſpeke therof tyme thus ther great aſſemble moch homage ſhulde parfourmed theſe embaſſadours taryed ſtyll england wynter tyll moneth may folowyng aunſwere dyffinatyue finally kynge englande aduyce counſell ſyght priuyleges vnto gaue great fayth determyned write letter maner patentes ſealed great ſeale knowle gyng therin homage ought kyng fraunce tenour report letter patentes foloweth edward grace god kyng england lorde ireland duke acquitayne y• theſe preſent letter ſhall ſe ſend gretyng wold knowen made homage amyas ye right excellent prince right dere coſyn phylyppe kyng fraunce requyred hym ſhuld knowledge ſayd homage make hym expreſly promyſinge bere hym fayth trouth y• dyd nat cauſe nat enfourmed trouth made hym homage generall wordes ſayeng entred homage lyke maner predeceſſours duke guyen tymes paſt entred thomage kyng fraūce tyme beyng ſyth tyme haue ben well enfourmed trouth therfore knowlege theſe preſentes ſuch homage haue made y• cyte amyas kyng fraunce generall wordes ought vnderſtande worde lyege man hym owe bere faith trouth duke acquitayne pere fraunce erle poyters mutterell thentent tyme cōmynge yt ſhulde neuer dyſcorde cauſe promyſe v ſucceſſours duk • acquitayne homage made maner folowyng kyng englande duke acquitayne holdeth handes bytwene handes kyng fraūce ſhall addreſſe theſe wordes kynge englande duke acquitayne ſhall ſpeke kyng fraunce maner yeſhall become lyege man kynge lorde preſent duke guyen pere fraunce hym promyſe bere faythe trouthe ſay ye kyng englande duke guyen ſucceſſours ſayth ye kyng fraūce receyueth kyng englande duke guyen ſayd homage lyege man wt faythe trouth ſpoken mouth ſauyng ryght furthermore whan ſayd kyng entreth homage kyng fraūce therldome poyters muttrell ſhall put handes bytwene handes kyng fraunce ſayd erldome ſhall ſpeke kynge fraunce ſhall addreſſe wordes kynge erle ſay thus ye ſhall become liege man kyng fraūce lorde preſent erle poyters muttrell hym ꝓmyſe bere fayth trouth ſay ye kyng erle poyters ſayth ye kyng fraūce receyueth kyng erle ſayd homage fayth mouth ſauyng ryght maner ſhalbe done renewed often homage ſhulde done ſhall delyuer ſucceſſours duke guyen theſe ſayd homage made letter patentes ſealed great ſeale kynge fraūce requyre beſyde promyſe good faythe holde kepe effectuouſly peace cō corde made bytwene kynges fraūce kynges englande duke guyen c theſe letter lordes fraunce brought kyng lorde kyng cauſed kept chauncery ¶ howe lorde syr • ubert artoyſe chaſed realme fraunce cap xxv man world moſt ayded kyng philyppe attayne crowne fraunce syr robert erle artoyſe done moſt ſagelt great teſte lordes fraunce hygh lynage extraughte fro blodde royall hadde wyfe ſuller iermayn ſayd kyng phylyp allwayes chief ſpeciall compaignyon louer hys aſtatis ſpace iii yere done realme fraunce done aduyce withoute hym nothyng done fortuned kyng philyppe tooke meruailouſe great hiſ pleaſure hatred ageynſt noble man ſyr robert artoyſe plee •• ed hym wherof erle artoyſe cauſe wolde haue wonne entent vertue letter layd forth whiche nat true ſayde wherfore kyng ſuche diſpleaſure yf hadde takyn hym ire ſurely hadde coſte hym lyfe without remedye ſyr robert fayne boyde realme fraunce went namure erle john̄ nephewe kyng toke erles wyfe two ſonnes owne nephewes john̄e charles dyd put priſon kept ſtraytly ye kyng ſware ſhuld neuer come priſon long lyued kyng mynde wolde nat turned maner meanes kyng furye ſente haſtely buſſhopp laoul liege 〈…〉 deſired hym inſtaūce wolde befye make warre agaynſt erle namure without wolde put countrey 〈◊〉 roberte erle artoyſe ¶ buſſhoppe greatly loued kynge fraunce lytle loued neyghbours dyda 〈…〉 y• kyng deſired hym erle namure ſore ageynſt wyll cauſed erle artoyſe auoyde lande erle 〈◊〉 robert went duke brabant coſyn right ioyouſly receyued hym dyd hym great cōforte ſoone kyng fraūce knew ſent worde ye duke wold ſuſteyue maynteyn ſuſ • erle artoyſe co • trey ſhulde haue greatter ennemy wold hym wolde make warre ageynſt hym al beſt power realme fraunce duke ſent erle artoyſe pryuely arge • tuel tent ſe kyng wold forther caſe anon kyng knew ſpyes euery corner kyng great diſpyte duke ſhuld ſo dele hym within brief ſpace kyng pourchaſed ſo reaſon golde ſyluer kyng behaigne coſin iermayn y• duke brabant buſſhop liege arche byſſhop coleyn duke guerles ye matques julyers erle bare ye lord los lorde fawkmount diuers lordes alied guyther al ayenſt duke brabant defyed hym entred great oſte countrey eſbayng ſo 〈◊〉 hanut brent twyſe ouer coūtrey pleaſed kyng fraūce ſent therle ewe conſtable great oſte men armes 〈◊〉 〈…〉 liā heynaulte ſent wy 〈…〉 〈◊〉 kyng brother 〈◊〉 john̄ 〈◊◊〉 〈…〉 de beamont fraunce 〈…〉 peace ſufferaūce warr bitwene kyng duke brabant laſt kyng frāce wiſ • moche warke conſented therto vpon condition duke ſhulde put hym ſelfe vtterly abyde ordynaunce kyng fraūce counſaile euery mater kyng 〈◊〉 ſuche befyed hym ageynſt hym alſo wt certayn day lymitted auoyde coūtrey erle artoyſe make ſhorte al duke dyd ſore ayenſt wyll ¶ howe kyng edwarde ingland toke towne berwyke ageynſt scottis cap xxvi ye haue harde recited truce bitwene inglande scotland ſpace iii yere ſo ſpace •• ue yere kept well peace ſo ccc yere nat ſo good peace kept beit kyng edward ingland enformed yong kyng dauid scotland wedded ſuſter sea • ed towne berwyke whtche ought apperteyn realme ingland kyng edward firſt graunfather poſſeſſion peaſably alſo ye kyng e 〈…〉 〈◊〉 realme scotlande ſhulde holde chief crowne inglande yong kyng ſcottis nat done thā homage wherfore kyng ingland ſent ambaſſad kyng ſcottis deſyryng hym leue handis towne berwyke parteyned heritage kyngis inglande predeceſſours haue ben poſſeſſion therof alſo ſomoned kyng scottis come kyng ingland homage realme scotland kyng scottis toke counſaile howe anſwere thys mater finally kyng anſwerde engli •• ambaſſadours ſayd syrs noble realme meruaile greatly ye haue requyred v fynd nat auncientely realme scotlande ſhulde thyng bounde ſubgiet realme ingland nother homage wayes kyng noble memorye father wolde neuer homage kyngꝭ ingland warre made vnto hym 〈◊〉 like wyſe wyll alſo kyng robert father conquered towne berwyke force armes agaynſt kyng edwarde father kyng maiſter nowe ſo father helde dayes lyfe good heritage ſo lyke maner thynke beſt power howe lordes require meanes kyng maſter whoſe ſuſter haue maryed wyll ſuffre v peaſeably enioye fraūches ryghtis auncetours haue done lette v enioye father hath woune kept peaſeably lyfe dayes deſyre kyng maiſter wold nat beleue euyll counſaile gyuen hym y• contrary ther prince wolde v wrong ſhuld aide ſuccour defende v loue ſuſter haue maryed theſe ambaſſadours anſwerd ſaid syr haue well vnderſtand anſwere ſhall ſhewe kyng lorde lyke maner ye haue ſaid ſo toke theyr leaue returned inglande kyng whiche anſwere kyng ingland nothyng content ſomoned parliament holden weſtm̄ noble wyſe men realme aſſembled determine ſhuld beſt done mater meane tyme ser robert erle artoys came inglande dyſguyſed lyke marchaunt kyng rereyued hym right ioyouſly reteyned hym one counſaile hym aſſigned erledom rychemount whan daye parliament aproched noble lande aſſembled londō thā kyng cauſed ſhewed meſſage howe wrytten kyng ſcottis anſwere ſame kyng wherfore kyng deſyred noble realme yt wolde gyue hym ſuche counſaile ſhulde aꝑteyne ſauyng honour ryght whan aſſembled counſaile thought yt kyng myght lenger bear honour iniuryes wronges kyng scottꝭ dyd hym dayly ſo reported aduiſe kyng exortyng hym prouyde force ſtrength men warre atteyne therby towne berwike entre realme scotland ſuche wyſe ſhulde conſtrayne kyng scottis ioyfull come homage hym ſo noble cōmons realme ingland ſayd wold gladly willyngly go hym iourney theyr good wyls kyng thāked greatly deſired redy aꝑailed daye aſſigned aſſēble gyther new caſtell vpon tyne euery man went home p̄ pared iourney kyng ſent agayn ambaſſadours kyng ſcottꝭ brother lawe ſufficiently ſōmon hym wolde nat wyſe aduyſed kyng gaue full auctorite defie hym ſo day aſſembly kyngꝭ oſte aproched y• whiche day kyng inglāde oſt aryued new caſtell vpō tyne taried iii dayes reſidue oſte comyng fourth day departed al oſte toward scotland paſſed landes lord perſy lorde neuell two great lordes northumberland marched ſcottis like wyſe ſo dyd lorde roſſe lorde ligy lorde mombray kynge oſte drew toward cite berwyke y• kyng scotland made anſwere theſe ii meſſengers dyd fyrſt wherfore opēly defied ſomoned ſo kyng ingland oſte entred scotlād coūſailed ſhuld nat tary ſiege berwike ryde forth burne countrey graund father dyd ſo dyd whiche iourney waſted diſtroyed playn countrey scotland exiled diuerſe townes cloſed dykꝭ pale toke ſtrong cattell enyagburth ſette therin g 〈…〉 paſſed ſecund 〈◊〉 scotlād 〈…〉 lyn ran ouer countrey abowte scone diſtroyed good towne douf fremlyn dyd euyll abbey kyng ingland cōmaunded hurte ſhuld done therto ſo kyng cōquered countrey dondieu • oubreten ſtrong caſtell ſtādyng march ayenſt wylde ſcottis kyng scottꝭ quene wyfe withdrawen vnto ſuretie ſcottis y• wolde appere afore engliſſhe men drawen forelf ged worth whiche wer inhabitable ſpecially y• knew nat countrey wherin ſcottis wer theyr gooddis ſo ſet lytle rēuant maruaile thoughe thus dryuen kyng lorde xv yere age erle morrey yong nephew willyam duglas ſlayne spayn alſo ſame age y• tyme realme scotland diſpurueyed good capiteyns whan kyng ingland ronouer playne countrey scotlande taried ther ſpace vi monethes ſawe none wold come agaynſt hym garnyſſhed diuers caſtels wonne thought make warre withdrew fayre eaſely toward berwike returnyng wan caſtell alueſt parteynyng heritage erle duglas v leagis fro edēburge ther kyng ſet good capitayus rode ſmall iourneis tyll came berwike whiche entre scotlande kyng layd rounde ſiege ſayd wolde neuer depart then tyll wonne orels kyng scottis come reyſe ſiege parforee within towne good men warre ſet kyng scottis cite ther many aſſaultis ſore ſkrymyſſhes • ygh euery daye cite wolde nat yelde vp ſymply alwaies thought reſeued ſuccour appered ſcottꝭ mornyng nyghtis made many ſ • rye trouble oſte lytle hurte dyd englyſſhe oſte ſo well kept ſcottis coulde nat entre theyr dammage often tymes loſte theyr men ¶ whan berwike ſawe comfort ayde came fro part theyr vitayles began fayle howe encloſed water lande began fall treate kyng ingland deſired truee indure moneth within moneth kyng dauid theyr lorde ſome hym come nat force reyſe ſiege thā rendre vp cite lyues gooddis ſaued ſoudiers within myght ſafly go theyr countrey without dammage treaty nat lightly graūted kyng ingland wolde haue yelded ſymply haue pleaſure ſome bicauſe hold ſo lōg ayenſt hym finally content counſaile lordꝭ alſo ser robert artoys dyd put therto payne ben iourneye y• kyng ſhewed hym alwayes home uert enheriter crowne fraun •• wolde gladly kyng ſhuld haue made warre fraūce left warres scotland wordes others inclined greatly kyng cōdiſcend treaty berwike truee treaty 〈…〉 graūted within cite ſent worde kyng caſe ſtode coulde fynde remedy reyſe ſiege cite delyuered vp thende moneth alſo caſtell marſhals oſ • toke poſſeſſion kyng ingland burgeſſes cite came dyd theyr feaute homage kyng ſware hold hym kyng entred great ſolempuite taryed xii dayes made capitayn ther called ſyr edward bailleul whan kyng departed lefte ſayde knyght certayne yong knyghtis ſquiers helpe kepe landis conquered ſcottis fronters therof kyng people returned london euery man theyre owne countres kyng went wyndeſore ser robert artoys wt hym neuer ceaſſed daye nyght ſhewyng kyng ryght crowne fraunce kyng harkened gladly wordis thus ſeaſon kyng ingland wanne moſt parte realme scotland many expert knyghtꝭ hym among ſir wylliam mō tague ſyr walter manny hardy knyghtis dyd many dedis armes ageynſt ſcottis better haue entre scotland fortified baſfyde roſebourge made ſtrong caſtel ser wylliam montague dyd ſo well entrepriſes kyng made hymerle erle sa 〈1 page missing〉 surely ſayd therle cannat deuyſe puiſſant prince ayde hym duke brabant coſyn germayne alſo byſſ hoppe liege duke guerles hath ſuſter wyfe archbyſſhop colayne marque jullers ſyr arnolde de baquehen lorde faulquemount theſe lordes thei may make mooſt men warr inſhort ſpace knowe arre good men warre may well make • x thouſande men war • ſo haue wage therafter arre people wolde gladly wynne aduauntage yf ſo kyng ſonne maiſter might gette theſe lordes part ſo come theſe party might well go ouer water dyſſe ſeke kyng phylippe fyght hym anſwere theſe embaſſadours retourned england kyng reported done wherof kyng great ioy well cōforted theſe tidyngꝭ came fraunce multiplyed lytle lytle ſo kyng phylippes enterpriſe ye ſayd croyſey beganne aſſwage ware colde coūtermaūded offycers ſeaſe makyng farther puiſion tyll knewe kyng edward wolde kyng edward ordayned x banerettes xl knyghtes ſent ouer ſee ualencēnes byſſhoppe lyncolne theym thentent treat lordes thempyre ſuche therle heynalt named whanne come ualencennes eche kept great eſtate port ſpared nothynge yf kynge englande bene proper perſone wherby dyd gette great reuo wine prayſe thē yonge bachelars eche one eyen cloſed • peace ſylke ſayd made vowe among ladyes contrey wolde natſe wt one eye tyll done ſome dedes armes fraūce beit woldnat knowen therof whan thei ben well feeſted ualencēnes byſſhoppe lyncolne part cōpany went duke brabant feaſted greatly agreed promyſed ſuſayne ye kyng englande cōpany contrey might go come armed vnarmed pleaſure gyue beſt counſell coude alſo yf kynge englande wolde defy frenche kyng wolde ſame entre countrey fraunce men warre ſo wage might borne nombre thouſande mē armes thus lordes retourned agayne ualencennes dyd ſomoch meſſangers ꝓmyſe golde ſyluer duke guerles kynges brother lawe ye marque jullers archebyſſhoppe colayne waleran brother lorde faulquemount came ualencēnes ſpeke theſe lordes englande byfore erle haynalt lorde john brother meanes great ſomme florēs eche ſhulde haue themſelfe men made pmyſe defy yt frenche kyng go kyng england whā pleaſed hym certayne men warre promyſing alſo gette lordes take part wage ſuch beyonde ryuer ryne able bringe good nombres men warre lordes almayne toke leaue retourned ther owne contreis thenglyſſhmen taryed ſtyll therle heynalt ſent certayne meſſangers byſſhoppe lyege wolde gladly haue hadde hym partie wolde neuer agaynſt french kyng become man entred feaultie kyng charles behaygne nat deſyred knewe well ſo fermely ioyned frenche kyng reaſon maryage john̄ duke normandy wyfe kyngꝭ doughter wherby knewe well wold nothyng agaynſt y• frēch kyng ¶how jaques dartuell gouerned flaunders cap xxix ſeaſon great dyſcorde bytwene erle flaūders flē mynges wolde nat obey durſt nat byde flaunders gret parell y• towne gaunt man maker hony called jaques dartuell entred ſuch fortune grace people thynge done dydde might commaunde wolde flaunders ther non though neuer ſo great yt durſt diſobey commaundement alwayes goyng hym vp downe gaunt lx • ourſ kore varlettes armed amonge thre foure knewe ye ſecretues mynde mette ꝑſone hated hym ſuſpectyon incontynent ſlayne commaunded ſecret varlettes whanne ſoeuer mette perſone made ſuche aſygae theym incōtynent ſhulde ſlee hym whatſoeuer without wordes reſouynge yt meanes made many ſlayne wherby ſo doughted none durſt ſpeke agaynſt thynge wolde haue done ſo euery man gladde make hym good chere theſe varletꝭ whan thei brought hym home houſe ſhulde go dyner lyſt dyner returne agayne ſtrete lodgyng abyde tyll come 〈◊〉 wayt hym tyll ſouper tyme theſe ſouldyours eche foure grotes flemmyſſhe day truely payd wekely thus euery towne ſouldyers ſeruauntess wage redy commaundement eſpy ther perſon wolde rebell agaynſt mynde enfourme hym therof aſſone knewe ſuche wolde neuer ceaſe tyll banyſſhed ſlayne without reſpyte ſuch great men knyghtes ſquires burgeſes good townes thought fauourable therle maner banyſſhed flaunders wolde leuey moyte landes owne vſe thother halfe wyuess chyldren ſuch banyſſhed whome great nōbre abode atſaynt diner ſpeke properly neuer flaunders none contrey prince duke ruled countrey ſo peſably ſo long jaques dartuell dyd rule flaunderss leuyed rente wynages rightes pertayned therle flanders spē ded pleaſure without acompt makyng whāhe wold ſay ye lacked money byleued hym ſo behoued none durſt ſay agaynſt hym whan wold borowe thynge burgeſſe none durſt ſay hym nay theſe englyſſh embaſſadours kept honourable eſtate towne ualencennes thought ſhulde agreat comforte kynge lorde yf might gette flymmynges take part toke counſell therle mater anſwered truely ſhulde one gretteſt aydes coude haue ſayd thought labour yt behalfe coude nat preuayle without gette firſt goodwyll jaques dartuell ſaid wolde aſſay coude ſo thervpon departed fro ualenceunes went flaunders departed thre foure cō panies went bruges ſome ipre ſome gaūt kept ſuch port made ſo large dyſpēce ſemed ſyluer golde fell hādes made many great promyſes offer ſpake mater byſſhopp̄ certayne hym wēt gaunt dyd ſomuch fayre wordꝭ otherwyſe gate thacorde jaques dartuell dyd gette great grace towne ſpecially olde knyght dwelt gauut ther right well beloued called lorde courciſyen knight baneret reputed hardy knight alwayes ſerued truely lordes knyght dyd moche honour thenglyſſhemen valyant knyght ought ſtrāgers accuſed french kyng incontynent ſent ſtrayt commaundement therle flaunders ſhulde ſend ſayd knyght aſſone hym ſtrike hed therle durſt nat breke kynges cōmanndemēt dyd ſomoch knyght came hym ſendyng thought non yuell incontynēt taken heed ſtryken wherof many folkes ſorie ſore dyſpleſed therle welbeloued lordes contrey theſe englyſſhe lordes dyd ſomoche jaques dartuell dyuerſe tymes togyder counſelles good townes ſpeke beſynes theſe lordes englande deſyred fraūchyſes amyties offred kyng englā de byhalfe often ſpake mater fynally agreed kynge englande myght come go flaunders pleaſure howe beit ſayd ſo ſore bouude french kyng myght nat entre realme fraunce make warre without ſhulde forfayt great ſomme florens ſo deſyred wold cōtent anſwere yt tyme thenglyſſhe lordes retourned agayne ualencennes great ioy often tymes ſent worde ye kyng englande ſpedde euer ſent theym golde ſyluer ber • charge gyue lordes almaygne deſyred nothyng el ſeaſon noble erle heynalt dyed vi day june yere lorde ccc xxxvii buryed frier ualencennes byſſhoppe cābrayſang maſſe ther many duke erles barownes welbeloued honoured people lyfe dayes dyſceaſe ye lorde wyllyam ſonne entred counteis heynalt hollande zelande wyfe dougther duke john̄ brabāt name jahane endowed lande bynche right fayre heritage profitable lady jahan mother went fontnels leſcault ther vſed reſydue lyfe great deuotion thabbey ther dyd many good dedes ¶ certayne noble flaūders kept yle cagaunt agaynſt thenglyſſhemen cap xxx theſe ordynaunces confortes kyng england get ſyde ſee kyng phylipp̄ fraunce well enformed mater wolde gladly haue flemmyngꝭ part jaques dartuell ſo ſurmounted maner people flaūders none durſt ſay agaynſt opynion ye erle hym ſelfe durſt nat well abyde countrey ſent counteſſe wyfe loys ſonne fraunce dout flē mynges ſeaſon ther yle cagant certayne knyghtes ſquyers flā ders garyſon ſir dutres de haluyn ſyr john̄ de radays ſonnes leſtriefe kept paſſage agaynſt thēglyſſhmen made couert warre wherof thenglyſſhe lordes beyng heynalt well enformed went way homewarde england ſhulde met withall dyſpleaſure wherfore nat well aſſured howbeit rode went ye countrey pleaſure confort jaques dartuell ſupported honoured moche might theſe lordes went doudrech holande ther toke ſhypping eſchue paſſage cagaunt wher gariſon layd commaundement frenche kyng ſo theſe engliſſhe lordes cāe agayne england priuely coude came kyng right ioyouſe commyng whan harde garyſon cagaunt ſayd wolde prouyde ſhortly anone ordayned therie derby ser water manny dyuerſe knyghtes ſquiers fyue hundred men armes two thouſande archer toke ſhippyng london ryuer tames firſt tyde went graueſende next day margate thyrde tyde toke ſee ſayled flaūders aparelled ſelfe came nere cagaunt ¶ batell cagaūt bytwene thenglyſſhmen frenchman cap xxxi whan thenglyſſhmen ſawe towne cagaunt thē made thē redy wynd tyde ſerue ſo name god ſaint george approched blewe vp trumpettes ſet archer ſayled warde towne cagaunt ſawe well great ſhypp̄ aproche knewe well englyſſhmen araynged dyke ſandes baners made xvi newe knyghtes fyue thouſande mē warr good knyghtes ſquiers ther ſir guy flā ders good ſure knyght baſtarde deſyred cōpany well deuoyre alſo ther ſir dutres de hauyn ſyr john̄ de roodes ſir gyles de leſtriefe ſir symon ſyr john̄ bonquedēt made knyghtes peter anglemonſter many knyghtes ſquiers expert men armes thenglyſſhmen deſyrous aſſayle flēmynges defende thenglyſſhe atchers began ſhout cryed cryes ſo ſuche kepte paſſage fayne perforce recule backe firſt aſſaute dyuerſe ſore hurte englyſſhmen toke lande came fought hande hande flēmynges fought valyantly defende paſſage thēglyſſhmen aſſauted chyualrouſly erle derby day good knyght firſt aſſaut ſo forwarde ſtryken erth lorde manny dyd hym great confort pur feat armes releued hym vp agayne brought hym pyll cryed lancaſtre erle derby approched euery part many hurt mo ye flemmynges englyſſhmen archer ſhot ſo holly togyder dyd flemmynges moche damage thus hauyn cagant ther ſore batell flēmynges good men warre choſen erle flaunders defende paſſage agaynſt thenglyſſhemen englande erle derby ſonne erle henry lancaſtre ye wry necke therle suffolke ſyr robert cobham ſir lewes byauchampe ſir wyllyam ſonne therle warwyke lorde bourcher ſyr water māny dyuers ſore batayle well foughten hande hande finally flēmynges put chaſe ſlayne mo thre thouſande y• hauyn ſtretes houſes syr guy baſtarde flaūders taken ſir dutres de haluyn ſir john̄ de rodes wer ſlayne two bretherne bonquedent ſyr gyles de leſtrief mo xxvi knyghtes ſquyers towne taken pylled goodꝭ priſoners put ſhippes towne brent ſo thus englyſſhemen retourned englande without damage kyng cauſed ſir guy baſtarde flā ders ſwere bynde hymſelfe priſoner ſame yere became englyſſhe dyd fayth homage kyng englande ¶ kyng edwarde england made great alyaunces empyre cap xxxii dyſconfeture cagaunt tidynges therof ſpredde abrode coū trey flaunders ſayd yt without reaſon agaynſt wylles therle flāders layd yt garyſon jaques dartuell wolde nat ben otherwyſe contynent ſent meſſangers kynge edwarde recommendyng hym grace withall hert counſellyng hym come thyder paſſe ſee certyfyenge hym flemmynges greatly deſyred ſe hym thus kyng englande made great purueyancꝭ whan wynter paſſed toke ſee well acompanyed duke erles barownes dyuers knyghtes aryued towne andewarpe thā pertayninge duke brabant thyther came people partes ſe hym great eſtate kept ſent coſyn duke brabant duke guerles y• marque jullers lorde john̄ heynalt ſuch truſted haue conforte sayeng howe wolde gladly ſpeke theym came andewarpe bytwene whytſontyde feeſt ſaynte john̄ whan kyng well feaſted th • deſyred knowe myndes whaūe wolde b • gynne promyſed requirynge dyſpatche mater breuely intēt ſayd come thyder men redy howe ſhulde great damage hym defarre ye mater long theſe lordes longe counſell among fynally ſayd syr commynge hyther nowe ſe thynge el nat nowe purueyed gyue full anſwere lycence ſhall retourne people come agayne pleaſure thaūe gyue ſo playne anſwere mater ſhall nat reſt v toke day come agayn thre wekes feeſt ſaynt john̄ kynge ſhewed thē charge ſo longe abyding thynkinge whan came thyther ben full purueyd haue made hym playne anſwere ſayng howe wolde nat returne england tyll full anſwere thus theſe lordes departed kynge taryed abbay ſaynt bernarde ſome englyſſhe lordes taryed ſtyll andewarpe kepe kynge company ſome rode countrey great dyſpence duke brabant went louane taryed long tyme often tymes ſent frenche kyng deſyring hym haue ſuſpecyous hym nat byleue yuell informacion made hym wyll ſayd wold make none alyance couenant agaynſt hym sayrng alſo kynge englande coſyn germayne wherfore might nat deny hym come countrey day cāe kyng englande loked haue anſwere theſe lordꝭ excuſed ſayd howe redy men duke brabant wolde redy part ſayeng yt nere aſſone might knowe redy wolde nat behynde begynnyng mater aſſone kyng dyd ſo moche ſpake agayne ye duke ſhewed anſwere lordes deſyring amyte lynage faut founde hym ſayeng parceyued well cold mater without wer quicker dyd otherwyſe douted ſhulde leſe therby ayde lordes amayne defaulte duke ſayd wolde take counſayle matter whan longe debated mater ſayd howe ſhulde redy firſte ſayd wolde ſpeke agayne lordes dyde ſende thē deſyring come hym wher pleaſed beſt yt day apoynted myddes auguſt counſell hale bycauſe yong erle heynalt ſhulde alſo ther hym ſir john̄ heynalt vncle whan̄e theſe lordes come parlyament hale longe counſayle togyder finally ſayd kyng englande syr weſe cauſe ſhulde make defyance frenche kyng thynges conſydred without ye gette thagrement themperour wolde commaunde v ſo name emperour may well thus long tyme paſt couenant ſworne ſealed kyng fraūce ought take thyng parteyning thēpyre kynge philyppe hath taken caſtell creuecure cambreyſis caſtell alues pailleull cytie cambray wherfore themperour hath good cauſe defye hym v therfore ſir ye get acord honour ſhalbe kyng ſayd wolde folo counſayle ordayned marque jullers ſhulde go themperour certayne knyghtes clerkes kynges ſome counſell duke gwerles duke brabant wold ſende none fro hym lende caſtell louayne kynge englande lye marque cōpany foūde emperour florebetche ſhewed hym cauſe commyng lady margarete heynault dydde payne forthe matter ſir lewes banyer emperour wedded ther marque jullers made erle ye duke guelders byfore erle made duke themperour gaue commyſſion foure knyghtꝭ two doctours counſell make kyng edwarde englande bycarre generall throughout empyre therof theſe ſayd lordes hadde inſtrumentes publyke confyrmed ſealed ſuffyciently emperour ¶howe kyng dauyd scotlande made alyaunce kyng phylypp̄ fraūce ca xxxiii ſeaſon yonge kyng dauyd scotlande loſt beſt part lande coulde natte recouer holde thēglyſſhmend eparted priuely ſmall company quene wyfe hym toke ſhippyng arryued bolayne ſo rodde pares kyng philyppe gretly dyd feaſt hym offred hym caſtels abyde goodes dyſpende condycion ſhulde make peace kynge englande without counſell agremēt kyng philyppe knewe well howe kynge englande apparelled greatly make hym warre thus kyng ther retayned kyng dauyd quene long ſeaſon neded coſte charge scotlande came lytell ſubſtāce mayntayne withall eſtates french king ſent certayne meſſangers scotlāde lordes ther ſuch kept warr agaynſt thēgliſſh men offryng great ayde confort ſo y• wolde take peace tru • e ye kyng englande without agrement thaccorde owne kyng likewyſe promyſed ſworne lordꝭ scotlande coūſelled togyder ioyouſly accorded requeſt ſo ſealed ſware kyng lorde thus alyance made bytwene scotlande france endured long ſeaſon ye frenche kyng ſent men warre scotland kepe warr agaynſt thenglyſſhmen ser arnolde dandregien alter marſchall fraunce lorde garencieres dyuerſe knyghtes ſquyers frenche kyng thought yt ſcottes ſhulue gyue ſomoch realme england yt thēglyſſhmen ſhulde nat come ouer ſee anoy hym ¶how kyng edwarde england made bycare generall thēpyre almaygne cap xxxiiii whan kyng england lordes hym alyed wer departed fro parlyament hale kyng wēt louan made redy caſtell byding ſent quene come thyder pleaſed ſent worde wolde nat come then hole yere ſent home certayne knyghtes kepe lande fro ſcottes lordꝭ knyghtes ſtyll kynge rode aboute realme flanders henalt makyng grete dyſpence gyueng great rewardes iuels lordes ladyes damoſelles countrey get good wylles dyd ſomoche greatly prayſed ſpecially common people bycauſe port ſtate kept feeſt ſayntes marque jullers cō pany ſent worde kyng ſped kyng ſent hym ſhulde hym feeſt ſaynt martyne alſo heſent duke brabāt knowe mynde wher wolde plyament ſhulde beholde anſwered arques y• countie loz nere countrey kyng ſent alyes ſhulde ſo hall towne apparelled hanged though ben kynges chamber kyng ſatte crowned wt golde 〈◊〉 fote hygher op • nly redde letter thēperour kyng made bycare generall liefrenaunt emperour power gyue • hym make lawes myniſtre juſtyce euery perſon thempours name make money golde ſyluer emperour alſo commaunded letter perſons empyre ſubgiettes ſhulde obey kyng england vycare hymſelfe hym homage contynent ther clayme anſwere made bytwene party emperour right iudgement gyuen alſo renued iudgement ſtatute affermed made emperours courte ſoeuer wolde hurt ſhuld make defyance thredayes byfore dede dyde otherwyſe ſhulde reputed euyll doet lan dede whan done lordes departed toke day ſhulde appere cambray thre wekes ye feeſt ſaynte john̄ whiche towne become frenche thus departed euery man went owne kynge edwarde bycare thempyre went louayne quene newely come thyder englande great nobleneſſe well accōpanyed ladyes damoſels englande kynge quene kepte houſe ryght honorably wynter caused money golde ſyluer made andewarpe great plentie yet duke brabant lefte nat great dyligence ſent often meſſangers kyng philyppe lorde loys • rauehen chefe counſellour dyuers euer excuſe hym ye whiche cauſe knight often tymes ſent laſte abode ſtyll frenche court kyng thentent alwayes excuſe hym agaynſt informacions myght made hym knyght dyd detroyre behalfe ¶howe kynge edwarde alyes dyd defye frenche kyng cap xxxv thus wynter paſſed ſomer came ye feeſt ſaynt john̄ baptyſt aproched lordꝭ englande almayne apa relled themſelfe acōplyſſh enterpriſe frenche kyng wrought aſmoch coude cō trary knewe moch intentꝭ kyng edwarde made prouiſyon englande men warr redy paſſe ye ſee incōtynent feeſt ſaynt john̄ ſo dyde kynge went uyllenort made cōpany lodged many myght towne without long ryuerſyde tentes pauylyons ther taryed fro maudelyn tyde tyll lady day septembre abyding wekely lordꝭ thempyre ſpecially duke brabant whoſe cōmynge abode whan kyng englande ſawe howe came nat ſent great meſſangers eche ſommonyng come promyſed mete hym machlyn ſaynt gyles day ſhewe hym taryed ſo long thus kynge edwarde lay uyllenort kepte dayly coſt charge well nombre xvi hundred men armes •• e fro thother ſyde ſee x archer beſyde ꝓ uyſious matueylous great charge beſyde great rewardes gyuen lordes beſyde great armyes ſee frenche kynge part ſet genowayes normayns breton pycardes ſpanyardes redy ſee entre england aſſone ye warr opened theſe lordes almayne kyng englande ſomons came machlyn moche beſyneſſe finally acorded kyng englande might well ſette forwarde within xv dayes thentent warr ſhuld ye laudable thei agreed ſend defyancꝭ french kyng firſt kyng england duke guerles marque jullers ſir robert dartoyſe ſir john̄ heynalt marque muſſe ye marque blanquebourc lorde faulquemont ſir arnold baquchen archbyſ ſhop colayne ſir galea brother al lordes thempyre theſe defyancꝭ written ſealed lordes except duke brabāt ſayd wold dede hymſelfe tyme conuenyent bere theſe defyances fraunce charged byſſhop lyncolne bare thē parys dyd meſſage ſuche maner yt coude nat reproched blamed ſo ſafe cō duct retourne agayne kyng machlyne ¶how ſir water manny defyances declared made firſt iourney frāce ca xxxvi firſte weke frenche kyng thus defyed ſir water manny aſſone knewe gate hym xl ſperes rode brabant nyght day tyll came heynalt entred wode blaton nat knowig ſhulde ſhewed ſome mooſt priuyeſt aboute hym howe promyſed ladyes damoſelles came englande wolde firſt ſhulde entre fraunce gete towne caſtell ſome dedes armes entēt ryde mortaigne gete might partayned than̄e realme fraunce ſoo rode paſſed wode blaton came mornynge ſonne riſyng mortaygne aduenture founde wycket gate opynne alyghtedde company entred dyd ſette certayne company kepe gate ſo went hygh ſtrete penon hym came great towre gate wycket faſt cloſed whan ye watch caſtell harde brunt ſawe blewe horne cryed treaſon treaſon euery man woke made redy kept ſelfe ſtyll within caſtell ſir water manny went backe agayne dyd ſet fyre ſtrete ioyninge caſtell ſo threſcore houſes brent ye people ſore frayed wende haue taken ſir water company rode backe ſtreight conde ther paſſed ryuer hayne rode way ualencennes cooſted ryght hande came deuayne ſo went abbay ſoo paſſed forth towarde bouhaigne dyd ſomoche captayne dyd let paſſe thorough ryuer thei came aſtrong caſtell parteyning byſſhopp̄ cambray called caſtell thyne ye ſodēly toke captayne wyfe win lorde manny made good garyſon ſet therm brother called ſir gyles mā ny afterwarde dyd moche trouble cytie cābray caſtell within leage towne ſir water manny retourned brabant kynge ſoueraygne lorde founde machlyne ther ſhewed hym done ¶how ſay • defyances made frenchman entred england cap xxxvii ſone kynge phylyppe knewe vefyed kyng england alyes reteyned men warre euery ſyde ſent lord galoys de • bauſyne good knyght sauoy cyte cambray made hym captayne ther hym ſir thybalt de marneyle lorde roy sauoy fraūce ii hundred ſperes kynge philyppe ſent ſeaſed handes countie pontyeu kyng englande reaſon mother alſo ſēt dyuers lordes thempyre therle heynalt neue duke lorrayne therle bar byſſhop metz byſſhop liege deſy ryng wolde make yuell purchaſe agaynſt hym realme mooſt part theſe lordes anſwered howe wolde nothyng ſhuld agaynſt hym erle heynalt wrote vnto hym right courteſſy wolde redy alwayes ayd hym realme agaynſt men ſeyng kyng england maketh warre bycare lyeutenaunt thempyre wherfore ſaid might nat refuſe hym coūtrey confort bycauſe helde part countrey thempour aſſone ſir • e nuyriell ſir peter bahuchet barbe noyre lay kept ſtreightes bytwene england fraunce great nauy knewe ye warre opyn came ſonday fore noone hauyu hampton whyle people maſſe normayns pycardes ſpanyerdes entred towne robbed pylled towne ſlewe dyuers defowled maydens enforced wyues charged veſſels ye pyllage ſo entred agayne ſhyppes whan tyde came dyſancred ſayled normandy came depe departed deuyded boty pyllages ¶how kyng edwarde beſieged cyte cambray cap xxxviii kyng england departed fro machelyne went bruſſels people paſt ye towne came kynge xx almaynes kynge ſent demaūded duke brabāt entenſy go cambray el leaue duke anſwered ſayed ſone knewe beſieged cābray wolde come thyder xii hundred ſperes good men warre kyng went nyuell lay one nyght nexte day mon heynalt founde yong erle heynalt receyued ioyouſly euer ſir robert dartoyſe kyng one priue counſell xvi xx great lordes knightes englande euer kyng honoure eſtate counſell hym dedes alſo hym ye byſſhop lyncolne greatly renomed iourney wyſdome ī prowes thus thenglyſſhmen paſſed forth lodged abrode countrey founde prouyſion ynough money howbeit ſome • ayed truly ſome nat whan kyng taryed two dayes mon heynalt than̄e went ualencennes xii hym entred towne mo perſons thyder come therle heynalt ser john̄ vncle lorde faguyuelles ye lorde uerchyn lorde haureth dyuers therle lorde ye kyng therle went hand hande ye great hall redy aparelled receyue went vp ſteares hall byſſhoppe lyncolne preſent ſpake loude ſayd wyllyam byſſhopp̄ cambray admonyſſhe procurer kyng england vycare thēpyre rōe ye opyn gate cyte cambray ye nat ye ſhall forfayt landes woll entre byforce ther none anſwered mater byſſhop nat preſent byſſhop lyncolne ſayd agayne erle heynault admonyſſhe name thempour ye come ſerue ye kyng england vycare cyte cambray ſuche nombre ye ought therle ther preſēt ſayd right good wyll redy thus entred hall therle ledde ye kyng chābre anon ſupꝑ redy ye next day king deꝑted went aſpre ther taryed ii dayes ſuffred men paſſe forth ſo went cābray loged wy beſieged cyte cambray roūde dayly power encreaſed thyder came yong erle heynalt great atray ſyr john vncle lodged nere ye kyng duke guerles company marque muſſe therle mon erle sauynes lorde falquemōt ſir arnolde bouquehen withall thother lordes thempyre ſuche alyed kyng englande ſixt day ſiege layd thyder cāe duke brabant ix hundred ſperes beſyde lodged toward oſtrenan ryuer leſcaut made bridge ouer water thentent go fro ye one hooſt aſſone come ſent defye frenche kyng compyengne wherof loys traneheu alwayes excuſed duke ſo confuſed wold returne agayne brabant dyed ſorowe fraūce ſege durynge ther many ſkirmyſſhes ſir john heynalt lorde falquemont rod euer lightly togyder brent waſted ſore countrey cambreſys day theſe lordes nombre v c ſperes men warr came caſtell doiſy cambreſys pertayning lord coucy made ther great aſſaut within dyd defende ſo valyantly thei damage ſo ſayd lordes retourned lodgynges therle heynalt company ſaturday came gate towarde ſaynt quyntines made ther gret aſſaut ther john̄ chandos thā ſquier whoſe prowes boke ſpeketh moch caſt hymſelfe bytwene barrers gate fought valyantly ſquyer uermandoys called johanne ſaynt dager ther goodly featꝭ armes done bytwene ſo heynows cōquered force baylles ther entred therle heynalt marſhals ſir gararde uerchyne ser henry dantoyng aduentured valyantly aduaunce honour gate called ye gate robert y• lord beamonde lorde falquemont lorde danghyen ſir wyllyam manny company made ther aſore harde aſſaut cambray y• ſoudyers ſet french kyng defended themſelfe cyte ſo valyantly thaſſauters wan nothyng ſo retourned right wery well beaten logynges yong erle namure cāe thyder ſerue ye yong erle heynalt deſyre ſayd wolde part long thēpyre aſſone entred realme fraunce ſayd wolde forſake go ſerue french kyng retayned hym likewyſe ſo thentent therle heynalt cōmaunded men payne dethe none ſhulde thyng within realme fraūce ſeaſon whyle ye kyng england lay ſiege byfore cambray xl men armes greatly conſtrayned thē aſſautes kyng philyp made ſomons peron uarmādoys kyng england counſelled ſir robert dartoys whome great affyance demaūdyng hym whyther better hym entre ye realm fraunce encounter aduerſary el abyde ſtyll byfore cābray tyll biforce lordꝭ england ſuch coūſell ſawe well cyte ſtrōg well furnyſſhed men warr vytels artylary ſhuld long abyde ther tyll wonne cytie wherof certētie alſo ſawe well wynter aproched nere yet done maner entpriſe lay gret erpēce counſelled kynge ſet forwarde y• realme wher might fynde plentie forage counſell taken lordes ordayned dyſlodge truſſed tentꝭ pauylions maner harnes ſo departed rode towarde mnūt ſaynt martyn thentre fraūce thus rode good oroce euery lorde amōg owne men marſhals thenglyſſhe hooſt therle northāpton glocetter therle suffolke conſtable englande therle warwyke ſo paſſed ther ryuer leſcault eaſe whan therle heynalt acōpanyed kyng vnto deptyng thēpyre ſhuld paſſe ryuer entre realme fraunce toke leaue kyng ſayd howe wolde ryde farther hym tyme kyng philypp̄ vncle ſent hym wolde nat haue yuell wyll wold go ſerue hym fraunce ſerued y• kyng england thempyre thus therle henalt therle namure cōpanyes rode backe queſnoy therle heynalt gaue mooſt part company leaue part deſyringe redy whan ſende ſayd ſhortly wolde go kyng philyppe vncle ¶how kyng edward made ſir henry flaunders knyght cap xxxix asſone kyng edward paſſed ryuer leſcaute entred ye realme fraunce called hym ſir henry flāders thā yong ſquier made hym knyght gaue hym yerely cc 〈◊〉 ſterlyng ſufficiently aſſigned hym england ye kyng went lodged thabbey moūt ſaint martyn ther taryed two dayes people abrode contrey duke brabāt lodged thabbey uancellez whan french kyng beyng cōpiengne harde theſe tydynges enformed ſomones ſent ye erle ewe gynes cōſtable ſaynt quyntines kepe towne frōters ther agaynſt ennemies ſent ye lorde coucy owne contrey lorde hen ſent many men armes guyſe rybemont behayne fortreſſes ioynyng thentre realme ſo went hymſelfe ward peron ye meane ſeaſon yt kyng edward lay thabbey moūt ſaynt martyn men ran abrode contrey bapau • nere peron ſaynt quyntines founde contrey piētyfull ther ben warr long ſeaſon ſo fortuned ser henry flauders auance body eucreaſe honour day knyghts wherof ſir john̄ heynalt chefe hym lorde faulquemōt lorde bergues lorde uaudreſen lorde lens dyuers nōbre v c auyſed towne therby called hōnecourt wher moch peple wer gadered truſt ye fortreſſes therin cōueyed goodꝭ ther ben ser arnolde baquehen ſyr wyllm̄ dunor cōpany tayned nothyng ther ther hōnycourt abbot great wyſdome hardynes cauſed made without towne barrers ouerthwart ſtrete lyke grate nat paſt half fote wyde euery grate made great puiſyons ſtones quicke lyme men redy defende place theſe lordꝭ whan came thyder lighted fote entred barrers gleuys handes ther began ſore aſſaut within valyātly defended thēſelfe ther thabbot hymſelfe receyued gaue many great ſtrokes ferſe aſſaut win caſt downe ſtones peces tymbre potts full chalke dyd moche hurt thaſſaylers ser henry flāders helde glayue handes gaue ther great ſtrokes laſt thabbot toke gleue handꝭ drewe ſo hym y• laſt ſet hand ser henres arme drewe ſo ſore pulled arme barrers ſhulder heldehym great auauntage y• barrers ben wyd ynough drawen hym ser henry wolde nat let wepen go ſauyng honour thother knyghts ſtrake thabbot reſcue felowe ſo wraſtlyng endured longe ſpace fynally knyght reſcued gleaue abode thabbot day whan wrot boke paſt ſhewed gleue monkes ther yt kept treaſur ſayd day hōnycourt ſore aſſaylled ye indured tyll nyght dyuerſe wer ſlayne ſore hurt syr johān heynault loſt kynght hollande called ſir herment whan flemyngꝭ heynowes englyſſh men almaygnes ſame fierſe wylles within ſawe howe coulde gette nothynge withdrewe ſelfe agaynſt nyght ye next day mornyng y• kyng depted fro mount ſaynt martyn cōmaūdynge perſon ſhulde hurt abbey cōmaundemēt kept ſo entred hermandoys toke y• day lodgyng tymes y• mount ſaynt • ui tyne good order batayle ſaynt • uyntines myght well ſe deſyre yſſue towne fore ryders came rynnynge barrers ſkyrmyſſhyng hooſt taryed ſtyll y• moūt iyll next day lordes toke counſell way ſhulde drawe thaduyce duke brabant toke y• way thyeraſſe way prouiſyon came dayly thē determyned kyng • hy lyppe dyd folowe thē ſuppoſed wolde wolde abyde hym y• playne felde gyue hym batayle thus went forthe thre great batayls marſhalles almaygnes firſt kynge englande myddle warde duke brabant rerewarde thus rodde forthe brennynge pyllynge countrey thre foure leages day euer toke logynge tymes company englyſſhmen almaygnes paſſed ryuer somme abbey • ermans waſted countrey al company wherof ſit johān heynalt lorde faulquemōt ſir arnold barquehen chefe rode drigny ſaynt benoyſte good towne eaſely cloſed incontynent taken aſſaut robbed abbey ladyes vyolated towne brent departed rode towarde guy rybemont kynge englande lodged • ehories ther taryed day men ranne abrode dyſtroyed countrey kynge toke way flammengerie come leſche thyeraſſe marſhals byſſhopp̄ lpncolne fyue hunderd ſperes paſſed ryuer tryſague entred laonnoys towarde lande lorde cou • bret ſaynt gouuen towne matle nyght lodgedde valey beſyde laon nerte day drewe agayne hooſt knewe ſome priſoners frenche kyng come ſaynt • uyntines c thouſand men paſſe ryuer somme theſe lordes retournynge brent good towne called crecy dyuerſe townes hamelettes ther ¶ let v ſpeke ser john̄ heynalt company fyue hundred ſperes came guy brent towne bete downe mylles wt fortreſſes lady jane owne doughter wyfe therle bloys called lewes ſhe deſyred father ſpare therytage erle ſon lawe ſit john̄ henalt wolde nat ſpare enterpriſe ſo retourned agayne kyng lodged thabbey sarnaques euer peple r 〈…〉 ouer countrey lorde falquemont c ſperes came lonnion thyeraſſe great towne men towne fled great wood goodes fortifyed wood fellyng tymbre thē almayns rode thyder mette sir arnolde baquehen company ſo ther aſſayled wood defēdyd thē aſwell might finally cōquered put flight ther wer ſlayne ſore hurt mo xl loſt thus contrey ouer ryden dyd lyſt ¶ howe kyng englande french kyng toke day iourney fight togyder cap x • kyng englande depted fro sarnaques went muttrell ther loged nyght next day went flamēgery made mē loge nere hym wherof mo xl thouſande coūſelled avyde kyng 〈…〉 lyp fyght wt hym french kyng depted fro ſaynt duyntines dayly men came hym fro partes ſo cāe uyrōfoſſe kyng taryed ſayd howe wold nat go then tyll fought wt kynge englande alyes ſeyng within two leages toguyther whā therle heynalt du • lnoy redy purueyed men warr knewe y• frenche kyng uyronfoſſe thynkyng gyue batayle thenglyſſhmen rode forthe tyll cāe french hooſt v c ſperes preſēted hymſelf kyng vncle made hym ſmall cher vycauſe ven wt aduerſary cambray howe erle excuſed hymſelfe ſo ſagely kynge counſayle well cōtent ordayned marſhals ſay marſhall bertrame y• marſhall try erle ſhulde lodged next englyſſhe hooſt thus theſe two kynges lodged bytwene • yrōfoſſe flamēgery playne feldes without aduauntage thynke ther neuer ſene ſo goodly aſſemble noble men togyder whanne kynge england beyng chapell thyeraſſe knewe king ph •• ypp̄ wt two leages called lordes host togyder demaūded ſhuld • honour ſaued ſayd enten cyon gyue batayle lordes behelde eche deſyr • dde duke brabāt ſhewe firſt entent duke ſaid accorde ſhulde gyue batayle otherwyſe ſayd coude nat depart ſauyng honour wherfore counſayled y• ſhulde ſende harauloes frenche kyng demaunde day batayle haraulde duke guerles coude well langage offrenche enformed ſhulde ſay ſo herode tyll came y• frenche hooſt drewe hym kynge philyppe counſayle ſayd ser kynge englande felde deſyreth haue batell power agaynſt power whiche thyng kyng philyppe graunted toke day friday nextafter thā weduiſday ſo haraude • ourned well rewarded wt good • urred gownes gyuen hym french kyng lordes bycauſe tidynges brought thus iourney agreed knowledge made therof lordes bothe hooſtes ſo euery man made hym redy matter thurſday mornyng two knyghtes ther • e heynaultes lorde sanguinelles lorde tupeney mounted horſes two onely depted fro frenche hooſt rode viewe y• englyſſh hooſt ro • e co •• yng hooſt fortuned lorde sanguynelles horſe toke bridell tethe ſuche wyſe •• ter coud nat rule hym ſo ther wolde nat horſe brought hym thenglyſſhe hooſt fell handes 〈…〉 maynes perceyued well none company ſet hym toke hym horſe ſo priſoner fyue orſixe gentylmen 〈…〉 mayne none ſet hym raunſome whan vnderſtode • aynome • demaunded hym knewe ser joh • hepnalt anſwered yes deſyred loue god bring hym preſens knewe well wolde quyte hym raū ſome therof almaygns ioyous ſo brought hym lorde beaumounde incontynent dyde pledge hym fro maiſters handes lorde sanguynelles retourned agayne therle heyualt horſe agayne delyuered hym requeſt lorde beamond thus paſſed day • one thynge done ought remembred ¶ theſe kynges ordayned batayls • yronfoſſe cap x •• whan friday came mornyng hooſtes aparelled thē ſelfe redy euery lorde harde maſſe among owne cōpa • yes dyuers wer ſhr • uen firſt woll ſpeke thorder thenglyſſhmen drewe thē forwarde feld • made iii▪ batels fote dyd put horſes bagages lytell wood behynde tefyed firſt batell ledde duke guerles marque nuſſe marque blaquebour • ſir john̄ heynalt therle • ōs therle sauynes lorde faulquemont ſit guyllam du fort ſir arnolde baquche • almayns amonge them▪ was▪ xxii▪ banner lx penons hale viii • men ſeconde batayle duke brabant lordes knyghtes countrey firſt lorde • u • ſe lorde bergues lorde bredangh lorde 〈◊〉 lorde • aucelare lorde borguynall lorde stōneuort lorde wyten lorde elka lorde caſſebegne y• lorde duffle ser thyrre • alcourt ser raſſe grez ser john̄ caſſebegne ser john̄ filyfe ser gyles coterebe ser water • otebergue thre bretherne harlebecque ser henry flaiū ders dyuerſe barownes knyghtꝭ flanders vnder y• duke 〈◊〉 baner y• lorde hallayne y• lorde 〈◊〉 ſir hector • yllains ſit john̄ rodes ser 〈◊〉 ſtart gupſtell ser wyllin̄ strat • ser 〈◊〉 de la mule many duke brabāt xxiiii baners lxxx penons vii men iii bataile gretteſt ha • kyng englande hym coſyn therle derby byſſhopp̄ lyncolne byſſhopp̄ durame therle salyſbury erle northamton glocetter therle suffolke ſir robert dartoyſe called erle rychmont lorde raynolde cobhm̄ lorde perſy lorde rooſe lord montbray ſir lewes ſir john̄ beauchampe ye lorde dalawarr lorde laucome ye lorde baſſet lorde fitz water ſir water manny ſir newe haſtyngs ſir john̄ lyle dyuers nat name among ser john̄ chandos moche honour ſpoken boke kyng wt hym xxviii baners lxxxx penons batayle vi men armes vi archer ſet batell wyng wherof therle warwyke therle penbroke ye lorde barkley lorde multon dyuerſe cheyfe wer horſbacke thus whan̄e euery lorde vnder banner cōmaunded marſhals kynge england mounted palfray acōpanyed onely ſir robert dartoyſe ſir raynolde cobham ser water manny rode long batels right ſwetely deſyred lordes wolde day ayde defende honoure ꝓmyſed hym ſo returned owne batell ſet euery thing good order cōmaūded non ſhuld go ye marſhals banerꝭ ¶ nowe let v ſpeke lordes fraunce dyd xi ſcore baners iiii kynges vi duke xxvi erles mo iiii knyghtes cōmons fraunce mo lx kyngs ther kyng philyppe ualoys kyng behayne kyng nauerr king dauyd scotland duke normandy duke bretayne duke burbon duke lorrayne duke athene erles therle alanſon brother kyng erle flaunders therle heynalt erle bloys therle bare therle foreſtes therle foyz therle armynacke erle dophyn auuergne therle lōguyle therle stā pe therle uandoſme therle harrecourt therle ſaynt pol therle guynes therle bowlougne therle rouſſy therle dampmartyn therle ualentynois therle aucer therle sancerre therle genue erle dreux gaſcongne languedoc many erles vycuntes long reherſe great beauty beholde baners ſtanderdes wauyng wynde horſes barded knyghtes ſquyers richely armed frechemen ordayned thre great batayls eche fyftene thouſand men armes xx men fote ¶ howe theſe two kynges departed fro uironfoſſe without batayle cap xlii might well marueyledde howe ſo goodly ſight men warr ſo nere togyder ſhulde depart without batayle french men nat one acorde dyuers opynyons ſayed great ſhame fought nat ſeyng ennemys ſo nere thē owne countre raynged felde alſo promyſed fyght thē ſome ſayd ſhulde great folly fyght harde knowe euery mannes mynde ieoꝑdy treaſon ſayd fortune cōtrary kyng leſe ſelde ſhuld put hole realme ieopardy loſt though dyd dyſconfet ennemes yet ſhuld neuer nerer realme englande ſuch landes parteynyng thoſe lordes hym alyed thus ſtriuyng dyuers opynions ye day paſt tyll paſt noone ſodenly ther ſtarted hare among frenchman ſuche ſawe cryed made gret brūt wherby ſuche behynde thought ben fightynge ſo put helmes toke ſperes handes ſo ther made dyuers newe knyghtes ſpecially therle heynalt made xiiii wer euer called knyghts hare thus batell ſtode ſtyll friday beſyde ſtryfe bytwene counſellours france ther brought letter hooſt recōmendacion frenche kyng counſell fro kyng robert cicyle kyng ſayd great aſtronomyer full great ſcience often tymes ſought bokꝭ theſtate kyngs england frāce founde aſtrology thēfluens ye heuēs yt french kyng euer fought kyng edwarde england ſhuld diſcōfited wherfore lyke king gret wyſdōe douted peryll frenche kyng coſyn ſent often tymes letter king philyppe counſayle wyſe ſhulde make batayle agaynſt thenglyſſ men kyng edwarde perſonally preſent dout ſuch writyng fro kyng cecyle dyuers great lordes fraunce ſore baſſhed alſo kynge philyppe enfourmed therof beit yet great wyll gyue batayle ſo counſelled cōtrary day paſſed without batell euery man withdrue lodgynges whan erle heynalt ſame ſhulde nat fight departed withall hole company went backe ſame nyght queſnoy kyng englande duke brabant lordes retourned truſſed bagagis went ſame nyght daueſnes heynalt next day toke leaue eche almayns brabances departed kynge went brabant duke coſyn ſame friday batell ſhulde haue ben french kynge whan came lodgyng ſore dyſpleaſed bycauſe departed without batayle counſayle ſayd howe right nobly borne hymſelfe halyantly purſued ennemies done ſomoche put thē realme kyng englande ſhuld make many ſuch vyages conquered realme fraūce next day kyng philypp̄ gaue lycēce maner men dept thanked right courteſly gret lordes ayde ſocour thus ended great iourney euery mā went owne frenche kynge went ſaynt omers ſent men warre garyſons ſpecially tourney lyſſe doway townes marchyng thēpyre ſent tourney ſyr godmart dufay made hym captayne regent coūtrey ther ſent ſyr edwarde beaugewe mortayne whan ordred ꝑt beſynes drewe towarde parys ¶ kyng edwarde toke hym bere armes fraunce name called kyng therof ca xliii whan kynge edward departed fro flamengery came brabāt went ſtreight bruſſels duke guerles duke jullers marque blanqueboure erle mon ſyr john̄ haynalt lorde faulquemōt lordes thempyre ſuche ben iournay brought hym thyder take aduyce counſell ſhulde done mater gone haue expedycion cauſe ordayned parlyamēt beholden ye towne bruſſels thyder come deſyred jaques dartuell gaūt came thyder great company al counſels good townes flaunders ther king england ſore deſyred alyes thempyre ſhulde requyre thē flanders ayde mentayne warr defy french kyng go wher wolde haue ſo doyng promyſe thē recouer iſle doway bethayne requeſt well hard ſlemynges therupon deſyred take counſell among themſelfe ſo toke coūſell good leaſer ſayd kyng syr tyme ye haue made v requeſt behalfe ſyr myght well doo ſauyng honour ſaue ourſelfe wolde gladly ſyr bounde faith othe ſomme two lyon floreyns pope chaumbre may make moue warre agaynſt kynge fraunce ſoeuer payne leſe ſayd ſomme beſyde ryn ſentēce curſyng ſyr ye wyll take armes fraūce quarter armes englande call yourſelfe kyng fraunce ye ought ryght woll take rightfull kyng fraūce de maūde quytāce bondes ſo ye gyue v ꝑdon therof king frāce meanes ſhalbe aſſured dyſpēſed wt ſo thā wyll go whyder ſoeuer ye wyll haue v kyng toke coūſell thought ſore mat take hym ye armes france name thā cōquered nothing therof coud nat tell ſhuld fall therof whyder ſhuld cōquere nat thother ſyde loth refuſe confort ayde ſtemynges myght hym ayde thā ye kyng toke counſell lord thēpyre lorde robert dartoyſe ſpecyall frendes ſo finally good yuell wayed anſwered flemmynges wolde ſwere ſeale accorde promyſe mentayne warre howe wolde good wyll promyſed gette agayne lyle way bethayn anſwered howe content day aſſigned mete gaunt day kynge mooſt part ſayd lordes counſayls generally flaūders ſo ſayd mater reherſed ſworne ſealed king quartred armes fraūce englande thenſ forthe toke hym name kynge fraunce ſo contynued tyll lefte agayne compoſicyo • ye ſhall boke ſo counſayle determyned next ſomer wold make great warre fraunce promyſing beſiege cytie tourney wherof flemmyngꝭ ioyfull thei thought ſtrōg ynough gete one goten leued ſhortly wynne agayne lyſſe way bethayne thappurtenaūces 〈◊〉 tayning holden therle flaūders thus euery man departed went home kynge englande went warpe quene abode ſtyll gaunt often tymes vyſited jaques dartuell lordes ladyes damoſels gaunt kyng left flaunders therle salyſbury therle suffolke went ipre ther kept great garyſon made ſore warre agaynſt lyſſe whan kynges ſhyppes redy toke ſee ſo ſayled englande came london feeſt ſaynt andrewe honourably receyued ther cōplayn te made hym dyſtruction hampton ſayd truſted yere lenger ſhulde well reuenged ¶ frenchman brent lā de ſyr john̄ heynault cap xliiii nowe lette v ſpeke kyng philyppe greatly fortifyed nauy hadde ſee wherof ſyr kiry bahuchet barbe noyre captayns thei vnder great retynu • genowayes normayns breton pycardes dyd wynter great damage realme englande ſomtyme came douer ſandwyche wynchelſe haſtynges rye dyd moche ſorowe thenglyſſhe men great nombre xl men ther none coude yſſue en glande robbed taken ſlayne ſo wan great pyllage ſpecially wan great ſhyppe called chriſtofer laden wolles ſhe goyng flaunders ſhyppe cooſt kynge englande moch money taken ſhyppe ſlayne drowned conqueſt frenchman ryght ioyeouſe frenche kyng ſent wrote lorde beamont y• lorde breme uidame chalon lorde john̄ de la boue lorde john̄ gararde loyre ſhulde make army ryde land ſyr john̄ heynalt burne dyſtroy aſmoche might obeyd gathered togyder nombre v c ſperes ſo mornynge came towne simay gathered gyder gret pray countrey thought frenchman wolde nat cōe ſo farre haue paſſed wode thyrach frēchmen burnt ſubarbes simay dyuerſe vyllages nygh lande simay except fortreſſes went aubēton thyerach ther deuyded boty ſame ſeaſon ſoudyours cā bray came lytell ſtrong houſe without cā bray called relenques pertayning ſyr john̄ haynalt baſtarde ſonne kept y• houſe xv ſoudyours hym ſo aſſayled hole day togyder ye dyke wer ſo froſen man might well come walles ſo within truſſed mydnight departed ſet fyre themſelfe houſe next day whan cambray came thyder agayne ſawehowe brent dyd bete downe ſtode capitayne houſe company went ualencennes ye haue well harde fore howe ſir gualter manny toke y• caſtell thyne ſet therm brother called gyles manny made many skirmyſſhes cābray dyd moch trouble ſo hapened day went fro garyſon ſixſcore men armes came barrers cambray brunt ſo great many armed within cyte came ye gate wher skirmyſſh wher ſir gyles put backe cambray yſſued among cambreſes ther yong ſquyer gaſcoyne called wyllyam marchant went felde well horſed ſhelde necke ſpere hande whan ser gyles māny ſawe hym rode f • er • ly hym ther ser gyles ſtrykē harnes ye hert ſo y• ſpere went clene body ſo fell erth ther • yers ſkirmyſſhe many ſtryken downe bothe partes finally cambray obtayned place drewe way ennemies toke ſir gyles manny hurt ſo brought hym cambray wt great toye incontynent dyſarmed hym 〈◊〉 dyd gette ſurgions dreſſe wound wold gladly might eſcaped dyed next day thei •• myned ſend body two bretherne john̄ tyrrey garyſon bouhayne oſtrenant though countrey heinalt tyme warr yet frō ters warde fraūce euer good awayt ordayned horſe lytter right honorably put body therin cauſed ii freres conuey bretherne receyued hym great ſorowe bare hym freres ualencennes buryed two bretherne mā ny came caſtell thynel made ſore warre agaynſt cambray incounteruengyng dethe brother ¶ ſeaſon captayne turney turneyſes ſir godmarde fay fortreſſes lorde beauye • within mortayn ryuer leſcaute ſtuarde carcaſſonne towne ſaynt amande ser amery poyters • ouay lorde galoisde la baulme lorde uyllars marſhall 〈…〉 lorde marneyl cyte cambray theſe knyghtes ſquyers ſoudyers france deſyred none thyng ye myght entre heynault robbe • yll countrey alſo byſſhoppe cambray parys kyng cōplayned howe heynowes done hym domage brēt ouer ron contrey men kyng gaue lycence ſoudiers cābreſys make rode heynalt th •• garyſous made iourney nombre vi c men armes ſaturday mornyng departed fro cā bray alſo la male mayſon rode forth ſame day mette togyder went towne aſpre ye good towne great without walles peo 〈…〉 ther dout knewe warr towardes thē ſo frenchman entred founde men woman houſes toke robbed towne pleaſur tha ſette fyre towne brent ſo clene nothynge remayned walles within towne ther priory blacke monkꝭ great byldinges beſyde church helde ſaynt waſt arras frenchman alſo robbed place brent yerth pyllage retourned cābray theſe tidynges anone came knowledge therle heynault bedde •• epe lodgyng called ſale ſodenly roſe armed hym called vp ſuch knyghtes hym loged ſo abrode nat ſo ſonne redy therle without taryeng ꝑſon came market place ualencēnes cauſed belle ſouned alaram euery man roſe armed folowed therle lord ryden ye towne great haſt toke way towarde aſpre tyme ryden aleage tidyng • came hym howe frenchman depted rode thabbey fountnels lady mother ſhe moche repayſe hym dyſpleaſure ſayd playnly dyſtruction aſpre shuld derely reuenged realme fraunce good lady mother dyd aſmoche ſhe coude ſwage yre excuſe kynge dede whā therle ben ther certayne ſpace toke leaue retourned ualencēnes incōtynent wrote letter prelate knyghtꝭ contrey haue aduyce counſayle behalfe whan ſir john̄ heynalt knewe toke horſe came therle nephue ſone erle ſawe hym ſayd fayre vncle abſence hath ſette frenchman pride ſir ꝙ trouble anoyance ſore dyſpleaſed howe beit maner glad therof nowe ye well rewarded ſeruyce loue ye haue borne y• frenchman nowe behoueth make iourney fraunce agaynſt frenchman vncle ꝙ therle loke quart ye thynke beſt ſhalbe ſhortly done thus day parlyamēt aſſigned mon came thyder reſoried counſayle countrey alſo nolande zelande ther di • iers opynyons wolde certayne ſufficyent ꝑ ſons ſhulde ſent french kyng knowe cōſentyng hurt done henalt tytle ſhulde make warre erles lande without defiaunce ſome wold therle ſhulde reuenged lyke maner frenchman begon beit finally reaſons debated thought therle coude otherwyſe make warr fraunce ordayned therle ſhulde make defyaunce frenche kyng entre byforce realme frā ce bere theſe defyāces ordayned thabbot thybalt ſaynt criſpyne thā letter defyance written ſealed therle ye noble cōtrey therle thā ked lordes good confort promyſe ayde reuēge agaynſt frenchman thabbot ſaynt criſpyne came fraunce brought theſe de fyances kyng philypp̄ made light therof ſayd nephue outraous folc howe marchāt haue cōtrey brēt thabbot returned therle counſayle ſhewed howe ſped therle prepared men warre cō trey brabant flanders ſo 〈◊〉 great nombre togyder ſo ſet forwarde towarde lande symay therlles intent go brenne landes y• lorde bremus alſo aubenton thyerache ¶ howe therle heynault toke diſtroyed aubenton thyerach ca xlv aubenton douted greatly therle heynalt ſir john̄ vncle ſo ſent ſome ayde great bayly uermādoys ſent thē vydam chalons lorde beaumont lorde de la bone lorde lore dyuers nombre ccc men armes ſo repayred ye towne certayne place determyned abyde heynowes defende towne gret towne full drapery heynowes cam friday lodged nere aubenton aduyſed towne ſe quarter mooſt beſt taken mornyng aproched thre wardes baners thē right ordynatly alſo croſbowes erle heynalt ledde firſt batayle hym great nombre knyghtes ſquiers countrey vncle ſir john heynalt ſeconde batayle wher plenty men warr thyrde lorde faulquemont good nōbre almaynes ſo thus euery lorde vnder owne baner began̄e ſore aſſaut bowes began ſhote within without wherby dyuers ſore hurt therle company came gate ther great aſſaut ſore ſkirmyſſhe ther uydame calons dyd marueyles made gate thre ſonnes knyghtes finally therle company cōquered baylies byforce made ennemies withdrawe yt gate alſo gate towarde symay ſir john̄ de la bone ſir john̄ beamōt ther alſo cruell aſſaut within wer fayne withdrawe gate leaue barrers heynowes wan y• brige alſo ther ſore aſſaut ſuche fledde entred within went vp gate caſt downe barres yron ſtones pottꝭ full quycke lyme wherby many ſore hurt ſquyer henalt receyued ſuche ſtroke ſtone targe clouyn clene ſonder ſtroke arme broken ſo long hole ſaturday mornyng ther great aſſaut within dyd deuer defende themſelfe finally towne wonne byforce pale defence broken firſt entred towne ſir john̄ heynalt baner great cryeng ſhowtyng yu uydame chalons withdrewe hym company place mynſter made ſemblant defende hymſelfe lōg myght endure lorde bremus departed without order knewe well ſir john̄ heynalt lore dyſpleaſed ſo thought ben taken yt raūſome ſhulde haue ſaued lyfe whan ſir john̄ heynalt knewe departed done ſomoche dyſpleaſure lande symay purſued hym lorde bremus ſledde falt founde gate towne opyn ſo entred ser johanne heynault purſued hym iuſte gate ſwerde hande whan̄e ſawe eſcaped retourned agayne aubenton men mette certayne y• lorde bremus men folowed maiſter ther ſtayne without mercy erle company ſought ſore thē mynſter ther uydam chalons dyd marueyls armes ſo dyd two ſonnes finally wer ſtayn ſcaped none ſuche fledde lorde bremus ſlayne taken ii men towne town robbed pylled goodes ſent symay towne brent y• butnyng aubenton heynowes wēt mauber fountaynes incontynent wan robbed brent towne alſo towne daube • ueyll segny great segny lytell hamelettes ther mo xl erle went mouns gaue leaue men warr depart thanked ſuch wyſe well content anone therle went make aſure alyance kyng england ſtrōger warre agaynſt frēchmen firſt made vncle ſir john̄ heynalt chefe maiſter gouernour holande zelande ſir john̄ lay ſtyll mon prouyded contrey ſent ualencēnes confort ayde thē lorde autoyng lorde uerguy y• lord gomegynes ſir henry huſpharyce ſtewarde heynault hundred ſpeares towne landrechyes bouhayne thre brethern almayns called courtars • ſcaudyme • ſir gararde saſſes gynes towne daueſnes ye lord faulquemount thus dyde euery fortreſſe fronters fraunce ¶ howe tourney made courney flaunders cap xlvi whan frenche kyng knewe howe heynowes brent contrey thyerache taken ſtayne knyghtes diſtroyed good towne aubenton commaunded duke normandy ſonne yt ſhulde make iourney heynalt bring countrey caſe ſhuld neuer bere couerd agayne alſo ye kyng ordayned therle layll gaſtone kyng parys yt ſhulde make voyage gaſcoyne lyeutenant make warre burdeux bordeloys fortreſſes helde kyng englande alſo frenche kynge enforced great nauy ſee commaunded kepe bondes flanders nat ſuffre kyng englande paſſe ouer ſee flanders payne lyues whan ye frenche kyng vnderſtode flemynges made homage kynge englande ſent vnto prelate vnder colour pope shewyng yſ wolde retourne knowledge themſelfe holde hym crowne fraunce forſake kyng englande enchaunted ſayd wolde ꝑdon treſpaces wolde quyte thē gret sōme money wer bound vnto hym oblygacion olde tyme alſo gyue thē many fayre franchyſes ye ſlemmynges anſwered howe thought thēſelfe right well aſſoyled quyted thynge yt boūde kyng fraunce frenche kyng complayned pope clement vi whervpon pope dyd caſt ſuche ſentence curſyng preeſt durſt ſyng ſay ther diuyne ſeruyce wherof ſlemmynges ſent great cōplaynt vnto kyng englande apeaſe ſent worde yt whan came ouer ſee wolde bring preeſtes contrey ſyng maſſes whyther pope wolde nat ſayd priuylege ſo ſo meanes flēmynges ſomwhat apeaſed whan frenche kyng ſawe coude nat tourne slē mynges fro opynion cōmaunded garyſons tourney lyſle 〈◊〉 ▪ make warre flem 〈…〉 ouer ronne contrey ſo 〈◊〉 • ohn̄ du roy ser mathue de trye marſhall fraunce ſir godmar du fay dyuers lordes made army men armes ccc croſbowes turney lylle doway ſo euenyng ther departed fro turney y• day mornyng ▪ courtray 〈◊〉 •• yme ſon vp gathered togyther catall ther ſome thē ran gatꝭ ſlewe hurt dyuers founde without than̄e retourned without domage droue al prayes ſo whā came turney mo thā x ſhepe many ſwyne beates kyen wherof flemynges ſore troubled jaques dartuell ſware y• ſhulde derely reuenged incōtynent cōmaunded good townes flanders men warr ſhulde wt hym turney day aſſigned wrote therle salyſbury therle suffolke wer ipre ſhulde ther y• ſame ſo agaynſt day lymitted wēt gaūt came place bytwene warpe turney called le pount de sere lodged taryed therles england franke bruges ſayd two erles thought honour enterpriſe ſhulde nat delayed ſo ſent jaques dartuell promyſing hym nat fayle day apoynted ſo day departed ipre l ſpeares fortie croſbowes▪ went towarde place jaques dartuell abode thē paſſed towne lyle ꝑceyued towne yſſued xv c men fote horſbacke went iii partes thentent therles ſhuld nat ſcape thē theſe two erles rode forth gyding ſir u 〈…〉 art de la crox ▪ kept lōg warr̄ agaynſt lyle knewe y• wayes contrey ipre ſo came forthe theſe erles gyde well gyded lyle nuely made great dyke wher neuer none whan ſir uauflart hadde brought thyder ſawe howe way nuely ſtopped ſayd therles englande ſirs ſe well nat paſſe without danger lyſle wherfore counſell let v turne agayne take ſome way lordes ſayde nay ſir uauflart ſhall neuer ſayd woll go way feare lyſle therfore ryde byfore haue promyſed jaques dartuell wt hym day ſo thenglyſſhmen rode forth feare ſir uauflart ſayd ſirs ye haue taken vyage gyde haue ben wynter ī ipre wherof moch boūde lyle yſſue vpon v haue truſt wyll abyde wyll ſaue ſelfe aſſone wer taken ſhulde coſt lyfe loue better thā cōpany lordes dyd laugh hym ſayd well yf ſo holde well excuſed ymagined ſo fell ▪ wer ware danger frenche buſſhement cryed ſtoppe ſirs ye ſhall nat paſſe way without lycence ſo began ſhote ronne englyſſhmen aſſone ſyr uauflart ſawe maner lyſt ryde farther retourned aſſone myght gate hymſelfe preace • erles fell handes ennemies lyke fyſſhes nette cloſed rounde narowe ſtrayet paſſage among hedgꝭ buſſhes dyke ſo coude ſcape maner way forwarde backewarde whan ſawe wer ſo hardly beſtad lyghted fote defended themſelfe well might dyd hurt dyuers thē lyſle finally defence coude nat auayle euer newe freſſhe men warre came ther wer taken byforce yong ſquyer lymoſyne nephue pope clement called remon yelded priſoner ſlayne couetyſe fayre harnes freſſhe apareyle theſe two erles set priſon hall lyſle ſent frenche kynge promyſed lyſle great rewarde good ſeruyce done hym whan̄e jaques dartuell pont de ferre knewe thoſe tidyngꝭ ſore dyſpleaſed ſo ſeaſed enterpriſe tyme retourned agayne gaunt ¶ iourney duke john̄ normandy made heynault cap xlvii duke john̄ normā dy eldyſt ſonne french kyng made aſſemble ſaynt quyntines hym duke athene therle flaunders erle aucerr erle ewe conſtable fraunce therle porcyen therle rouſſy therle breſne therle de graūt pre lorde couey lorde craon dyuers noble normandy lowe march whan aſſembled anone eaſter yere lorde ccc xl conſtables two marſhals nombred company vi thouſand men armes viii folowynge hooſt ſo went forthe feldes went towarde y• caſtell cā bre ser paſſed bohayn rode tyll paſſed ſayd caſtell cambre lodged towne montays ryuer sels ſir rycharde uerchyne ſtewarde henalt knewe ſpyes duke normandy moutays deſyred certayne knightes ſquyers ſuche wer nere hym go hym thyder wolde bringe graunted hym ſo ſo departed fro houſe uerchyn hym l • ſpeares rode forthe fro ſonne ſettyng tyll came foreſt yſſuyng heynalt lytell leage fro montays y• tyme night reſted hym felde ſayde company howe wolde go wake duke montays wherof right ioyouſe ſayd howe wolde aduenture hym lyue dye thanked hym ser jaques de sart ſir hēry phalyſe ſir olpharte du guyſtelles ſir john̄ du chaſtellet ſir bertrande ſquyers 〈…〉 gyles thyerty sommayne baudwyn beaufort colebrier brule moreau leſcuyer sawdart de stramen johān roberſat bridoull de thyaulx dyuerſe rode priuely came mōtays entred y• towne frēchmen made watche ſo ſtewarde company alyghted fayre great lodgyng wenyng theym duke lodged ther houſe loged ii great lordes normandy lorde baylleull lorde beaulte quickely aſſayled gate broken • pynne whan hard cry heynalt baſſhed defēded thēſelfe aſ well might ther lorde baylleull ſlayne lorde beautie taken fayne promyſe ſeneſhall fayth trouth yelde hymſelfe priſoner wt thre dayes ualē cens frenchman began ſtirr towne came logynges 〈◊〉 fiers lighted vp torch candels eche thē rayſed vp woke duke roſe armed hym haſt diſplayed baner logyng euery man drue thyder heynoues withdrue backe ſagely horſes mounted whan wer gyder x xii good priſoners ſo returned without damage wer nat purſued ſo darke ſo came day queſnoy reſted rode ualencens mornyng duke cōmaunded dyſloge entre heynalt bren contrey wt mercy fore ryders went forthe ii c ſpeares captayns thē ſir thybalt marncyle galoys y• baume lorde myrpois lorde rayuenall lorde sempy y• lorde john̄ landas lorde hangeſt lorde tramels rode two marſhals fyue c ſperes duke lordꝭ knyghtes ſo fore ryders burnt foreſt bertran bertynguinell eſcarmayne uēdegres 〈◊〉 y• wod uēdegres y• ſandes vpon y• ryuer cynell next day went forwarde brent oſmelnall uyllers gōmegynes marchepoys peſtell • aufroy pyepreux freſnoy obeys good towne bānoy cō trey ryuer hōmell y• ſame ſecond day marſhals company made gret aſſaut ſkirmyſſhe caſtell uerchy • e▪ wan nothyng ther ſo well defended went lodged ryuer selz bytwene auſey sanſoy ſir ualeron lorde falquemont captayne y• towne maubenge hym c ſpeares almayns heynowes whan̄e knewe frenchman rode brent contrey ſawe howe poore peple wept armed hym company left towne kepyng lorde beau reuoyr lord montigny ſayd wolde gladly fynde frenchman ſo rode day cooſtyng y• foreſt moriuall agaynſt nyght harde howe duke normandy loged y• ryuer sels ſayd wolde go wake ſo rode forthe mydnight paſſed ryuer gyde whan ouer made hym company redy ſo rode fayre eaſely tyll came duke logyng whan nere ſpurred horſes daſſhed thooſt cryed falquemont cut downe tentes pauilyons ſlewe dyuers men dyd great hurt hooſt began ſterre armed drewe part noyſe lorde falquemont whan ſawe tyme drue backe frēchmen ther ſlayne lorde pyquegny taken priſoners vycont queſnes borgne rouuory ſore hurt ſir antony condune whan ye lorde falquemont thought beſt departed cōpany paſſed ryuer sels without damage wer nat folowed ſo ſonne riſyng came queſnoy ſir thyerrie uallecourt opyned gate next day dede duke normādy cauſed trumpettes blowen ſo paſſed tyuer sels entred heynalt ſuche rode ye marſhall mitpoys lord noyſiers galoys baulme ſir thybalt marneyle iiii c ſpeares beſyde brigantes came queſnoy bariers made ſemblant gyue aſſaut within ſo well prouyded good men warre artyllery ſhulde haue loſt payne beit made lytell ſkirmyſſh bayles laſt fayne wtdrawe queſnoy dyſcharged certayne peces artyllery ſhotte great quarels wherof frēchmen frayd ſleyng horſes ſo withdrue backe goyng brent uergyn great uergyn lytell frelanes sa •• uers artes semeries artuell saryten turgies eſtynen aulnoy dyuers ſo yt ſmoke came ualencēnes frenchman ordayned batels moūt caſters nere ualencēnes certayne lorde craon lorde mauluryer lorde mathelon lorde dauoyr two c ſpeares rode towarde mayng came aſſayled great wre parteyninge john uernyer ualēcens afterwarde ꝑteyning john̄ neuell ther great fierſe aſſaut endurynge nygh day ſo frenchman departed ſlayne v vi within defēded themſelfe ſo well yt toke damage ſome frenchman went try wenyng firſt cōmynge haue paſt water wne broken bridge defended paſſage ſo frenchman coude neuer haue way than̄e ther ſome among knewe paſſages contrey ſo brought two c men fote paſſed plankes ponny ſone ouer came thē try ſmall nombre coude nat endure agaynſt ſo fledde dyuers ſlayne hurt ſame day ſe neſhall heynalt departed ualencens c men armes ſocour trye lytell fro ſaynt waſt met rrv currours frenchman lorde boucyqualt marſhall frāce lorde surgeres ſir wyllyam blādeau captayns paſſed bridge ualencēnes called bridge de la tourell whan ſeneſhall heynalt ſawe ranne bare downe ſpeare lorde boucyquault toke hym priſoner ſent hym ualencens lorde surgeres ſcaped ser wyllyam blandeau taken ſir henry duſphalyſe wer taken ſlayne fewe ſcaped ſo ſeneſhal went towarde try came late frenchemen wonne came beatyng downe mylles lytell caſtell ther whan ſeneſhall came leaſer wer put backe ſlay ne put flight chaſed ſo nere many lept ryuer leſcalt ſome drowned thus towne try delyuerd ſeneſhall went paſſed ye ryuer leſcalt deuayng cōpany rode caſtell uerchyn entred kepe defēde yf nede ſeaſon duke normandy moūt caſters nygh day thinkynge euer yt ualencennes wolde haue yſſued haue fought hym ſo wolde fayne haue done ſir henry dantoynge rule towne nat ben wolde ſuffre man yſſue gate cambreſen moch kepe peple wt ye prouoſt towne fayre wordes great reaſons peaſed peple whan ye duke ſawe wolde nat yſſue gyue hym
