calays wherby kyng enfourmed ſtate realme kyng ſende incōtynent johan coplande ſhulde come ouer ſee hym ſiege calays ſame johan dyd putte priſoner ſaue kepynge ſtronge caſtell ſo rode england tyll cāe douer toke ſee arryued calays whan kyng englande ſawe ſquyer toke hym hande ſayd welcome ſquyer valyantneſſe hath taken myne aduerſary kyng scottes ſquyer kneled downe ſayde ſir yf god grace haue ſuffred take ye king ſcottes true conqueſt armes ſir thynke man ought haue enuy aſwell god may ſende grace ſuche fortune fall poore ſquyer great lorde 〈◊〉 requyre grace nat myſcontent though dyde nat delyuer kynge scottes cōmaundement quene sir holde myne othe nat good maner kyng ſayd johan good ſeruyce ye haue done valyantneſſe ſomoche worthe hit muſt counteruayle treſpaſſe taken excuſe ſhame haue bere yuell wyll therfore ye ſhall retourne agayne home houſe tha •• e pleaſure ye delyuer priſoner ye quene wyfe rewarde aſſigne nere houſe ye thynke beſt yourſelfe tyue hundred pounde ſterlyng yerely rent heyres euer make ſquyer body than̄e thyrde day departed retourned agayne englande whan came home owne houſe aſſembled guyder frendes kynne ſo toke kyng scottes rode hym cytie yorke fro kyng lorde preſented kyng scottes ye quene excuſed hym ſo largely quene counſell content quene made good prouiſyon cytie yorke caſtell roſbourg cyte dyrham towne newcaſtell vpon tyne garyſons marcheſſe scotlande left thoſe marcheſſe lorde percy lorde neuyll gouernoure thanne quene departed fro yorke towardes london ſhe ſette kynge scottes ſtrong towre london therle morette priſoners ſette good kepyng ouer ſhe went douer tooke ſee ſo good wynde ſhorte ſpace ſhe arryued calays thre dayes feeſt alſayntes whoſe cō myng kyng made great feeſt dyner lordes ladyes ther quene brought many ladyes damoſelles aſwell acompany ſe huſbandes father bretherne frendes lay ſiege calays done longe ſpace ¶ howe yonge erle flaunders enſured kynges doughter englande cap c xl ſiege calais enduredde longe many thynges fell meane ſeaſon whiche canne nat write fourthe parte frenche kynge ſette men warre euery fortreſſe thoſe marcheſſe countie guynes thoyes boloyne aboute calays great nombre genowayes normayns ſee ſo whan th 〈…〉 glyſſhmen wolde goo forragynge 〈◊〉 horſebacke founde many tymes harde aduentures often ſkirmyſſhing gate dyke towne often tymes ſome ſlayne hurte bothe party ſome day y• one part loſt ſome day kynge englande cauſed engyns made oppreſſe theym within towne within made agayne reſiſt ſo toke lytell hurt nothynge coude come towne ſtelth meanes two maryners one called maraunt meſtryell dwelt abuyle theym two calays often tymes reconforted freſſhed ſtelth often tymes great • yll chaſed nere taken alwayes ſcaped made many englyſſhemen drowned wynter kyng lay •• yll ſiege thought ymagined euer kepe y• commentie flaunders frendſhyppe thought meanes ſoner c • e entent ſende often tymes fayre promyſes ſayeng myght gette calys wolde helpe recouer 〈◊〉 doway appurtenaunces occaſyon ſache promyſes whyle kyng normandy towardes creſſey calays went layd ſiege bethwyn ther captayne ſir dedeart de • onty banyſſhed fraunce helde great ſiege towne • ore conſtrayned aſſaut within • knyghtes captayns ſet ye frenche kyng kepe towne ſay ſir g • ſſray charney ſir ewſtace rybamount ſir ba • dwy • nekyn ſir john̄ landas defended y• towne ſuche wyſe flemmynges wa • nothyng ther ſo departed retourned agayne flaunders whyle kynge englande lay ſiege calys ſent ſtyll meſſāgers flanders made great promyſes kepe amyte hym oppreſſe drift french kyng dyde coulde drawe opynyon kyng englande wolde gladly y• erle loyes flaunders •• f • fte • e yere age ſhulde haue mar • age doughter iſabell ſomoche dyd kyng y• flēmynges agreed therto wherof kynge gladde thought mariage flēmynges wolde gladlyer helpe hym flēmynges thought hauyng kynge englande partie might well r • • yſt frenchman thought neceſſary profytable loue kyng englande rather frenche kynge yong erle ben euer noryſſhed amō ge noble men france wolde nat agre ſayd playnly wolde nat haue wyfe doughter hym ſle • e father alſo duke johan brabant purchaſed greatly y• erle flaunders ſhulde haue doughter maryage promyſing hym wolde take wyfe wolde cauſe hym enioy hole erldome flanders • ayre meanes otherwyſe alſo duke ſayde frenche kyng ſir erle flanders woll take doughter ſhall fynde meanes flemmynges ſhall take part ſake kyng englande whiche promyſe frenche kyng agreed maryage whan duke brabant kyngꝭ gode wyll ſent certayne meſſāgers flā ders burgeſſes good townes ſhewed ſo fayre reaſons counſayles good townes ſent erle naturall lorde certifyeng hym wolde come flanders vſe counſayle wolde hym trewe good frendes delyuer hym rightes iuryſdictyons flā ders aſmoche euer erle hadde erle toke counſayle went flaunders wher receyued great • oye gyuen hym many great preſentes aſſ one kyng englande harde ſende flaunders erle northampton therle arundell lorde cob • dyde ſomoche offycers common flaunders rather lorde therle ſhulde take wyfe kyng englandes doughter doughter duke brab • ſo affectuouſly deſyred lorde ſhewed hym many fayre reaſons drawe hym way ſo burgeſſes wer duke brabantes partie durſte nat ſay contrary erle nowyſe wolde concent therto euer ſayde wolde natte wedde whoſe father ſlayne though myght haue halfe hole realme englande whan̄e flemmynges ſawe ſayd howe lorde moche french yuell counſayled alſo ſayd howe wolde good hym ſyth wolde nat belyue counſayls toke putte hym cortoyſe priſon ſayd howe ſhulde neuer depart without wolde folowe byleue counſayls alſo ſayd erle father belyued loued moche frenchemen wolde byleued thē ſhuld haue ben greatteſt lorde chriſtendome recouered agayne lyſle doway bethwyn yet alyue thus mater abode certayne ſpace kynge englande lay ſtyll ſiege calays kept great court chriſtmas begynnynge lent came thyder gaſcoyne erle derby erle penbroke erle forte dyuers knyghtes ſquyers paſſed ſee erle thus erle flaunders long danger amonge ſtemynges cortoyſe priſon greatly anoyed hym laſt ſayde wolde byleue coūſayle knewe well ſayd ſhulde haue profet contrey theſe wordes reioyſed greatly flemynges toke hym priſon ſuffred hym go haukyng ryuer ſport erle loued well ▪ euer ther good watche layde hym ſhulde nat ſteale away fro theym charged lyues take good hede hym alſo ſuche fauourable kyng englād watched hym ſo nere coude nat pyſſe without knowledge endured ſo longe laſt erle ſayd wolde gladly haue wyfe kyng englandes doughter flemmynges ſende worde therof kynge y• quene poynted day ſhuld come bergus abbey bringe doughter theym wolde bring thyder lorde erle flanders cōclude vp maryage kyng quene gladde therof ſayde flemmynges good men ſo bergus bytwene newport grauelynge came mooſt ſaddeſt men gode townes flaunders brought thē erle lorde great eſtate kyng englande y• quene ther redy erle curteſly inclyned kyng quene kyng toke erle ryght hande right ſwetely ledde hym forthe ſayeng dethe erle father god helpe day batayle creſſey nexte day neuer herde worde hym heſhulde yong erle ſē blant made thoughe ben content kynges excuſe fyll communycacyon maryage certayne artycles agreed vnto kyng englande erle loyes flaunders great amyties ther ſwor • e bytwene holden erle fyaunced iſabell kyng englandes doughter promyſed wedde ▪ ſo iourney brake newe day apoynted leaſer flemmynges retourned flaunders lorde kynge englande quene went agayne ſiege calays thus mater ſtode certayne tyme kynge quene prepayred greatly agayne maryage iewelles thynges gyue away acordyng behauyours erle flanders dayly paſt tyme ryuer made ſemblant maryage pleaſed greatly ſo flemmynges thought ſure ynough hym ſo nat ſo great watch made hym knewe nat well cōdycion lorde ſoeuer coūtenance made warde inwarde courage frenche day went forthe hawkes ſame weke y• maryage ſhulde haue ben finyſſhed fauconer caſt faukon hearon therle caſt nother ſo theſe two faukons chaſed hearon erle rode folowe faucon whan gode way aduantage feldes daſſhed ſpurres horſe galoped forth ſuche wyſe kepars loſt hym ſtyll galoped forthright tyll came arthoyes ther ſuretie ſo rode fraunce kyng philyp ſhewed hym aduenture kynge frenchman ſayd howe dalt wyſely englyſſhmen otherſyde ſaid howe betrayed diſceyued ▪ kyng left nat kepe flemmynges amyte knewe well erle done dede nat coū ſell wer ſore dyſpleaſed therwith excuſe made kyng ſoone byleued behalfe ¶ howe ſir robert namure dyde ho • age kyng england calays cap c xli whyle kynge lay ſiege calays ther came ſe kynge quene dyuers lordꝭ knightes flanders ▪ brabant heynault almaygne departed none agayne great gyftes gyuen ſame ſeaſon newely come countie namure liege dut holy lande ſir robert namure lorde leſpentyne hadde made hym knyght holy ſepulcre ſir robert yong luſty knight nat deſyred bothe kynges came owne good mynde well acōpanyed richely ſiege calayes preſented hymſelfe kyng englande ioyfully receyued hym ſo dyde quene lordes entred greatly kynges fauour ▪ bycauſe bare name ſir robert de arthoys vucle thus ſir robert became kynges liege man kynge gaue hym thre hundred pounde ſterlynge yere cofers payde bruges taryed kynge calays tyll towne wonne ye ſhall ¶ howe thenglyſſhmen wanne rochdaren howe ſir charles de bloyes layed ſiege therto ca c xlii longe nowe ſyth ſpake ſir charles de bloyes duke bretaygne counteſſe mountforde bycauſe truſe takenne uannes whiche well kept durynge trewſe eyther partie kept peaſably poſſeſſyon aſſone trewſe expyred made agayne feerſe warr cōe bretaygne fro kynge englande ſir thomas dangorne ſir johan harewell came thyder fro ſiege calays hundred men armes foure hundred archer taryed countes moūt forde hanybout ſir 〈◊〉 caſtell bretone bretonant thenglyſſhmen breton y• part made often tymes iourneys agaynſt ſir charles de bloyes men ſomtyme wanne ſomtyme loſt cū tre expled diſtroyed reaſon theſe men warre day theſe englyſſhmen wēt layde ſiege good towne called rochedaren often tymes made •• autes towne ſo well defended thenglyſſhmen wanne nothyng captayne within towne taſſartde guynes within y• towne thre partes ratherenglyſſhe frenche ſo tooke capytayne ſayde wolde ſtee hym without wolde yelos hymſelfe englyſſhe thanne heſayde wolde wolde haue hym ſo thervpon let hym go • ryed englyſſhmen tourned countes mountfordes parte ſo ſtyll capytayne towne left certayne ſoudyers kepe towne caſtell whan ſir charles du bloyes herde therof ſware mater ſhulde natte longe beſo thatic ſende menne aboute bretaygne normandy▪ aſſembled cytie nauntes ſixtene hundred menne armes twelfe thouſande fote ther hym four hundred knyghtes xxiiii baners cāe layde ſiege rochdaren lately wonne englyſſhmen great engyns caſte day nyght ſore cōſtrayned within towne ſende meſſangers counteſſe mountforde acordynge promyſe ſende theym ſome ayde conforte counteſſe ſende aſſemble men toguyder ▪ ſhortely ſhe thouſande menne armes eyght thouſande fote ▪ ſhe made capytayns theym forſayd thre knyghtes ſayd wolde neuer retourne tyll reyſed ſeige rochdaren el dye y• quarell ſo ſette forthe came nere hooſt ſir charles bloyes lodged ryuer ſyde night thyntent fight next day whan euery man reſt ſir thomas dangorne ſir johan artwell cauſed halfe cōpany armed depted fro hooſt mydnight ſodenly entred lorde charles hooſt y• one ſyde ▪ beate downe ſlewe moche people taryed ſo longe hooſt moued euery man redy ſo coulde nat retourne agayne without batayle encloſed fought withall ſharpely ſo might nat bere frenchman dedes ther taken ſir thomas dangorne ſore hurt ſir johan artwell ſaued hymſelfe aſwell might ryuer retourned company ſhewed aduēture thanne determyned haue retourned agayne hanybout ¶ batayle rochedaren howe ſir charles de bloys taken thenglyſſhmen cap c xliii ſame ſeſon englyſſhemen thus counſayle determyned haue departed came knyght counteſſe mountforte called garnyer lorde cadudall hūdred men armes aſſone come knewe demenour h • ſayde nay ſirs lette v nat thus tourne agayne leape horſes ſuche haue non lette come fote lette v nowe go loke ennemyes nowe thynke ſelfe ſure warant ſhall dyſconfet thē horſemen rode forthe fotemen folowed aboute ſonne ryſinge daſſhed lorde charles ho • ſt euery manne ther ſlepe • reſt thought haue tyme thenglyſſhmen bretous bete downe tentes pauilyons ſlewe people downe right ſodenly taken ther moch people ſlayne ſir charles bloyes lordes bretayne normādy hym taken priſoners thus ſiege rochdaren reyſed lorde charles brought hanyboute ▪ ſuche fortreſſes partie helde ſtyll wyfe called ſelfe ducheſſe bretaygne toke warre hande ¶ howe frenche kyng aſſembled great hooſt rayſe kyng england fro ſiege fore calys ca c xliiii kinge philyppe knewe well howe men ſore conſtrayned calays ▪ commaunded euery manne hym feeſt pentecoſt cyte amyenſe ther ther non durſt ſay nay kyng kept great feeſt thyder came duke ode burgoyne duke normandy eldyſt ſonne duke orlya • ſe yongeſt ſonne duke burbon therle fo • tz lorde loyes sau • ſir john̄ heynalt erle armynake erle foreſtes therle ualentenoys dyuers erles baron knyghtes whan amyenſe toke counſayle y• frenche kyng wolde gladly paſſages flaunders myght haue ben opyned hym thought might ſende part men grauelyng way refreſſhe towne calys ſyde fyght eaſely thenglyſſhmen ſende great meſſangers flanders treat mater kynge englande ſuche frendes wolde neuer acorde yt curteſy frenche kyng ſaid howe wolde go thyder ſyde towarde burgoyne kynge englande ſawe well howe coude nat g • calays b • famyne made ſtronge caſtell hygh cloſe vp paſſage ſee caſtell ſet bytwene towne ſee well fortyfied ſpringalles bombardes bowes artillary caſtell threſcore men armes two hundred archer kept hauyn ſuche wyſe nothyng coude come thought therby within ſhulde ſoner famyſſhed ſeaſon kynge englande ſo exhorted flaunders yſſued flaunders hundred thouſande went layde • iege towne ayre ▪ brent con • rey • nyuell la gorge eſtelles le uentre marche called la loe gate ſaynt omer turwyne kyng went towne arras ſette many men warr garyſons arthoys ſpecially ſent conſtable ſir charles • aygne ſaynt omers erle ewe guynes conſtable fraunce priſoner englande hath ben ſhewed flemmynges dyd frēchmen great trouble departed whan flēmynges returned french kyng company deꝑted fro arras went hedyn hoſt ye caryage held well length thre l • agꝭ contrey ther taryed day next day blangy ther reſted take aduyſe way go forthe counſayled go contrey called la belme yt way toke hym cc one ſo paſſed countie franqueberg ſo came ſtreyght hyll sangattes bytwene calys wyſſant came thyder goodly order baners diſplayed • great beautie beholde puyſſaut array calys whan ſawe lodge ſemed newe ſiege ¶ howe kyng england • e paſſages calay • well kept frenche kyng ſhulde nat aproche • eyſe ſiege cap c xl • ſhall kynge englande dyd cauſed done whan̄e ſawe knewe french kyng came ſo great hooſt rayſe ſiege whiche coſte hym ſomoche good payne body loſt many mē knewe well howe ſo conſtrayned towne hit coulde nat longe endure defaute vitayls greued hym ſore depart aduyſed well howe frenchman coud • nat aproche nother hooſt towne two place downes ſee ſyde elles aboue hygheway many dyke rockes mareſſhes one way paſſe ouer bridge called newlande bridge than̄e kynge made na • drawe long coſt downes euery ſhyp well garnyſſhed • ōbardes croſ • owes archer ſpringalles artyllary wherby frenche hooſt myght • paſſe way kynge cauſed erle ••• go kepe newlande bridge great nō bre men armes archer ſo frē chemen coude natte paſſe way without wolde haue gone marſhes whiche vnpoſſyble otherſyde towarde calys ther hyghe towre kept 〈◊〉 archer kept paſſage y• downes fro frēchmen well fortifyed great double • ykes whan french men thus lodged mount sangate common turney fyftene hundred came towre within ſhotte paſſed dyke came fote wall pykes hokes fore aſſaute many tourney ſore hurte laſte wanne towre tha • within ſlayne towre beaten downe french kyng ſent marſhals aduyſe way myght aproche fyght englyſſhem •• ſo went forthe whan aduyſed paſſages ſtraytes retourned kyng ſayd howe nowyſe coude come englyſſhmen without wolde leſe people mater reſted day nyght nexte day maſſe frenche kynge ſende kynge englande lorde goffray charney lorde ewſtace rybamount guy nele lorde bea • ewe rodde ſtronge way ſawe well harde paſſe way praysed moche order erle derby kepte bridge newlande • paſſed rode tyll came kynge well acompanyed nobl • men aboute hym than̄e fou • e lyghted came kynge dyde reuerence hym lorde ewſtace rybamont 〈◊〉 ſir kynge maiſter ſendeth worde v come mount sangate v batayle canne fynde way come therfore ſir wol • e • ſhulde apoynt certayne counſayle lykewiſe bytwene theym aduyſe place batayle kyng englande redy aduyſed anſwere ſayd ſirs haue well vnderſtande ye deſ • • behalfe myne aduerſary kepe •• wrongfully fro myne herytage wher • ore ſor • e say vnto hym fro ye lyſt 〈◊〉 ſo haue bene nyghe ho 〈…〉 knewe right well might 〈◊〉 come hyther ſoner wolde hath ſuffred abyde • ere ſo long 〈◊〉 ben gretly coſte charge •• co • de ſomoche wolde ſone lorde • alays wherfore natte determynedd • folowe deuyſe • aſe depart 〈…〉 whiche poynt wynne haue ſo • ore deſyred derely bought ▪ wherfore men canne paſſe way lett • theym ſeke ſome paſſage thynk • come hyther than̄e theſe lordes departe • 〈◊〉 conueyed tyll paſte newlande bridge ▪ ſhewed frenche kynge kynge englan • e aunſwere 〈◊〉 ſeaſon whyle frenche kynge ſtudyed ho •• • ight kyng englande • ca 〈…〉 hooſt two cardynalles pope cl • ment legacion toke great pay • e 〈◊〉 bytwene theſe hooſtes procuredde ſo moche • graunted certayne tre • tie acorde reſpyte bytwene two kynges men beynge ſiege felde onely ſo • four lord •• apoynted eyther partie counſell togyder treat peace frēche kyng ther duke burgoyne duke burbone ſir loyes sauoy ſir john̄ heynalt thenglyſſhe partie therle derby erle northamton lorde reynolde cobham lorde gaultyer manny two cardynalles meanes bytwene party theſe lordes mette thre dayes many deuyſes put forthe none toke effect meane ſeaſon kyng englande alwayes fortifyed hoſt felde made dyke downes frenchman ſhuld nat ſodenly come thē theſe thre dayes paſſed without agrement two cardynalles returned ſaynt dmers whan frenche kynge ſawe coude nothynge next day dyſloged tymes toke waye amyens gaue euery man leaue depart whan̄e within calays ſawe kynge depart made great ſorowe ſome englyſſhmen folowed tayle french men wanne ſomers carte caryages horſe wyne thynges toke priſoners brought hooſt calays ¶ howe towne calys gyuen vp kyng england cap c xlvi frenche kyng thus departed fro sangate within calays ſawe well howe ſo coure fayled thē whiche gret ſorowe deſyred ſomoche captayn ſir john̄ uyen went walles towne made ſygne ſpeke ſome perſon hooſt whan kyng harde therof ſende thyder ſir gaultier many ſir baſſet ſir john̄ uyen ſayd ſirs ye right valy ant knyghtes dedes armes ye knowe well howe kynge maiſter hath ſende towne commaunded v kepe behofe ſuche wyſe take blame hym dammage haue done lyeth oure power nowe ſocours hath fayled v ſo ſore ſtrayned haue nat lyue withall muſte dye el e • rage famyn without noble gentyll kyng woll take mercy v requyre deſyre hym haue pyte v let v go depart lette hym take towne caſtell goodes therin y• whiche great habundaunce ſir gaultyer manny ſayde 〈◊〉 knowe ſomwhat entencyon kynge maiſter hath ſhewed vnto v ſurely knowe trouth nat mynde ye within towne ſhulde departe ſo wyll ye ſhulde put ſelfes pure wyll ranſome ſuche pleaſeth hym putte dethe ſuche lyſte calays hath done hym ſuche cōtraryes diſpyghtes hathe cauſed hym dyſpende ſoo moche good loſte many menne ſore greued agaynſt captayneſayde ſir harde mater v arhere within ſmall ſorte knyghtes ſquyers hath trewely ſerued kynge maiſter well ye ſerue yors lyk • caſe haue endured moche payne vneaſe ſhall yet endure aſmoche payne euer knyght • dyd rather thaune conſent worſt ladde towne ſhulde haue yuell gretteſt v therfore ſir pray humylite yet ye woll go ſpeke kynge englande deſyre hym haue pytie v truſte hym ſomoche gentylneſſe gace god purpoſe ſhall chaung sir gaultier manny ſir baſſet retourned kynge declared hym hadde ben ſayde kynge ſayde wolde none otherwyſe ſhulde yelde theym vp ſymply pleaſure ſir gaultyerſayde ſir ſauyng dyſpleaſure ye may wronge ye ſhall gyue yuell enſample ye ſende v ſeruauntes fortreſſe woll nat gladde go ye putte theym towne dethe yelded lyke wiſe woll deale v caſe fell lyke whiche wordes dyuerſe lordes preſent ſuſtayned maynteyned kynge ſayde ſirs woll nat alone agaynſt therfore ſir gaultyer manny ye ſhall goo ſay capytayne grace ſhall fynde nowe lette ſixe chiefe burgeſſes towne come bare •• ed bare foted bare legged ſhertess haulters neckess 〈◊〉 towne caſtell handes • lette ſi • e yelde themſelfe purely wyll reſydewe wyll take mercy ſir gaultyer retourned founde ſir john̄ uyen •• yll wall abydinge anſwere • hanne ſir gaultier ſhewed hym grace coulde gette kynge well 〈◊〉 ſir johan ſir requyre tary certayne ſpacetyll go towne ſhewe common towne ſent hyder ſir john̄ went vnto market place ſo wned cō mon bell incontynent men woman aſſembled captayne mane reporte done ſayde ſirs wyll none otherwyſe therfore nowe take aduyſe make ſhorte aunſwere thanne people beganne wepe make ſuch ſorowe nat ſo hard hert ſene thē wolde haue great pytie theym captayne hym ſelfe wepte pyt • •• laſt mooſt riche burgeſſe towne called ewſtace ſaynt peter roſe vp ſayde openly sir great ſmall great myſchiefe ſhulde ſuffre dye ſuche people towne famyn otherwyſe whan meane ſaue theym thynke ſhulde haue great merytte lorde god myght kepe theym fro ſuche myſchie • e parte haue ſo good truſte lorde god dye quarell ſaue reſtdewe god wolde pardone wherfore ſaue wyll firſt putte lyfe teopardy whan thus ſayde euery man worſhypped hym dyuers kneled downe fete ſore wepyng ſore ſighes thā another honeſt burgeſſe roſe ſay • e wyll kepe company goſſyppe ewſface called john̄ dayre roſe vp jaques wyſſant riche goodes herytage ſayd alſo wolde holde company two coſyns likwyſe ſo • yd peter wyſſant brother than̄e roſe two ſayde wolde ſame thanne went aparelled kyng • beſyred captayne went gate ther great lameutacyon made men woman chyldren departyng gate opyned yſſued vt burgeſſes cloſed gate agayne ſo 〈◊〉 bytwene gate barrier ſayd ſir gaultier māny ſir 〈◊〉 captayne calays hole conſent peple towne theſe ſix bu • geſſes ſwere truely day mooſt honourable riche moſt notable burgeſſes y• towne calys wherfore gētyll knyght requyre pray kyng haue mercy theym dye nat ꝙ ſir gaultier nat ſay kyng wyll ſhall beſt than̄e barryers opyned ſixe burgeſſes went towardes kyng captayne entred agayne towne whan ſir gaultier preſē ted theſe burgeſſes kyng kneled downe helde vp handes ſayd gentyll kyng beholde ſixe burgeſſes calays great marchantes haue brought kayes towne caſtell ſubmyt oure ſelfe clerely wyll pleaſure ſaue reſydue people calays haue ſuffred great payne sir beſcche grace haue mercy pytie v hygh noble erles barownes ther • wept pytie kyng loked felly theym greatly hated people calys gre • damage dyſpleaſures done hym ſee cōmaūded heedes ſtryken euery man requyred kyng mercy wolde mā behalfe ſir gaultier māny ſaid noble kyng goddeſſake refrayne courage ye haue name ſouerayn noble therfore nowe nat thyng ſhulde blemyſſhe renome gyue cauſe ſome ſpeke villany euery man woll ſay great cruelty put deth ſuche honeſt perſons owne wylles putte themſelfe grace ſaue cōpany kyng wryed away fro hym cōmaunded ſende y• hangman ſayd calys hath cauſed many mē slayne wherfore theſe ſhalt dye likewyſe quene beynge great chylde kneled downe ſore wepyng ſayd gētyll ſir ſyth paſſed ſee great parell haue deſpred nothyng therfore nowe hūbly requyre y• honour ſon virgyn mary loue yt ye woll take mercy theſe ſixe burgeſſes kyng helde y• quene ſtode ſtyll ſtudy ſpace thā ſayd dame wold ye ben nowe ſōe place ye make ſuche requeſt y• nat • eny wherfore gyue pleaſure theym quene cauſed thē brought chambre made ye halter taken fro neckes cauſed newe clothed gaue dyner leſer ſhe gaue ech ſire noble made thē brought thooſt ſauegard ſet lyberte ¶howe kyng england repeopled towne calys englyſſhmen cap c xlvii thus ſtrong towne calays gyuen vp kyng edwarde england yere lorde god ccc xlvi moneth auguſt kyng englād called hym ſir gaultier manny two marſhals therle warwyke therle stafforde ſayd thē sir take kayes towne caſtell calys go take poſſeſſyon putte priſon knyghtes ſoudyours came thyder ſymply wynne lyueng cauſe theym auoyde towne alſo men woman chyldren wolde repeople agayne towne wt pure englyſſhmen theſe thre lordes hundred went toke poſſeſſyon calys dyd put priſon ſir john̄ de uien ſir john̄ surrey ſir john̄ belborne made ſoudyers bring harneſſe place apoynted layed hepe hall calys thanne made maner people voyde kept mo perſons preeſt two auncyent perſonages ſuche knewe cuſtomes lawes ordynaunces towne ſigne herytagꝭ howe deuyded prepared caſtell lodge kyng quene prepared houſes ye kynges company kyng mounted horſe entred towne trumpet tabour nakquayres hormyes kyng lay tyll quene brought bedd fayre lady named margarete kynge gaue ſir gaultier māny dyuers fayre houſes within towne therle stafforde lorde bethene ſit bartylmewe bomes lordes repeople agayn towne kynges mynde whan cāe englande ſende london xxxvi good burgeſſes calys dwell ſomoche towne myght peopled wt pure englyſſhmen entent kynge fulfylled ye newe towne baſtyd made without towne pulled downe caſtell ſtode hauyn raſſhed downe great tymbre ſtones brought towne kynge ordayned men kepe ye gate walles barryers amēded thynges within towne ſir john̄ de uien cōpany ſent englande halfe yere london putte raunſome thynke great pyte burgeſſes men towne calys woman chyldren whasie fayne forſake houſes herytages goodes bere away nothyng reſtorement frenche kyng whoſe ſake loſt mooſt part went ſaynt omers cardynall guy de boloyne come frā ce legacyon frenche kynge coſyn cytie amyenſe purchaſed ſomoche truſe taken bytwene ye kynges englande fraunce contres herytages endure two yeres truſe ꝑties agreed bretayne clerely excepte two ladyes made ſtyll warre one agaynſt kyng englande quene retourned englande kyng made captayne calys ſir amery pauy lumbarde borne kyng greatly auaunced kynge ſende fro lōdon xxxvi burgeſſes calays ryche ſage wyues chyldren dayly encreaſed nombre kynge graunted ſuche lyberties franchyſſes men gladde go dwell ſame tyme brought lōdon ſir charles de bloyes called hymſelfe duke breten putte cortoyſe priſon towre london kyng scottes erle morette nat ben longe requeſt quene englande ſir charles coſyn germayne receyuedde fayth trouth rode london pleaſure might natly paſt one night london without kynge quene alſo ſame tyme ther priſoner englande therle ewe guynes right gentyll knyght dealynge ſuche welcome wher ſoeuer came kyng quene lordes ladyes damoſels ¶of dealynge br • gant languedocke called bacon cap c xlviii yere theſe two kynges helde well trewſe taken bytwene ſir wyllm̄ duglas ſcottes beyng foreſt gedeours made warre dayly englyſſhmen alſo ſuche gaſcoyne poyctou xayntone aſwell frenche englyſſhe kept nothyng trewſe taken bytwene two kynges conquered often tymes townes caſtels one vpon byforce purchaſe ſtelth nyght day often tymes ther fell bytwene thē many fayre auētures ſomtyme frenchman ſomtyme thenglyſſhmen alwayes poore brigantes wanne robyng townes caſtels ſome therby came riche ſo made capitayns brigantes ſome well worthe xl thouſande crownes often tymes wold ſpy wher good towne dayes iourney two fro wolde aſſemble xx xxx togyder go couert wayes day nyght ſo entre towne vnknowen ye mornynge ſette fyre ſome houſe towne wolde thynke done ſome men warre ſo flye away towne thanne theſe brigantes wolde breke vp cofers houſes robbe take lyſte ſlye away whan done among brigant languedocke ſpyed ſtronge caſtell couborne lymoſyn rode nyght xxx cō panyons toke caſtell ſtell lorde ſame caſtell priſoner called coubourne putte hym priſon owne caſtell kept hym ſo longe laſt raunſomed hym xxiiii thouſande crownes kept ſtyll ye caſtell made ſore warr contrey fayre promyſes frenche kyng bought hym caſtell gaue hym x • thouſand crownes made hym vſſher armes brigant bacon euer well horſed ap 〈…〉 led armed lyke erle ſo contynued longe lyued ¶ another page called croquart cap c xlix lyke caſe brigantes bretayne made warre wanne townes caſtelles lyued robery helde man wanne thei kept thēſelfe ſolde countrey townes caſtels derely among one mayſter called croquart poore page attendyng lorde dercle holland whan croquart began waxe man lorde gaue hym leaue depart go warres bretayne fyll ſeruyce man armes bare hymſelfe well aſkirmyſſhe maiſter taken ſlayne thanne bycauſe prowes felowes dyde chuſe hym capitayne ſtede mayſter dyd gette ſomoche wynnyng townes caſtelles eſtemed worthe xl thouſand crownes beſyde horſe wherof xx xxx good courſers double horſe brute one mooſt expert men armes countre choſen batayle one xxx englyſſhe partie wan ther price frēche kyng made hym offer promyſe wolde becōe frenche make hym knyght mary rychely gyue hym two thouſande pounde reuenewes yerely wolde nowyſe cō ſēt therto fortuned hym day ryde yonge horſe bought thre hundred crownes spu • red hym ſoo ſore horſe ranne away hym romnyng fell dyke brake mayſters necke thus ended croquart ¶ howe ſir amery pauy lumbar • ſolde towne calys wherof captayne lorde geffray charney fraunce cap c l ſeaſon towne ſaynt omers lorde geffray charney kept fronters ther vſing euery thynge touchynge warre kyng thought howe lumbardes naturally couetonſe wherfore thought aſſay gette towne calys wher amery pauy lumbarde capitayne reaſone trewſe ſaynte omers myght go calys calys ſaynt omers ſo dayly reſorted toguyder marchādyſes ſir geffray ſecretly fyll treaty ſir amery pauy ſo promyſed delyuer frēchmens handes towne caſtell calys xx thouſande crownes nat done ſo ſecretely kyng englande knowledge therof kyng ſend amery de pauy come england weſtmynſter ſpeke hym ſo came ouer thought kyng nat knowledge mater thought done ſo ſecretly whan kyng ſawe hym toke hym apart ſayd thou knoweſt well haue gyuen kepyng thynge worlde yt loue beſt next wyfe chyldren ſay towne caſtell calys thou haſt ſolde frēchmen wherfore thou haſte well deſerued dye lumbard kneled downe ſayd noble kyng cry mercy trewe ye ſay ſir bargayne may well broken yet haue receyued neuer peny kyrge loued well lumbard ſayd amery woll thou go forwarde thy bargayne day thou apoynteſt delyuer towne let haue knowledge therof condycion forgyue thy treſpas ſo thervpon lumbard retourned agayne calays kept mater ſecrete ſir geffray charney thought well haue calays aſſembled certayne nombre ſecretly v hundred ſpeares ther fewe y• knewe purpoſed thynke neuer made frenche kyng knowledge therof trowe kyng wolde nat conſented therto bycauſe truſe lumbard apoynted delyuer ye caſtell firſt nyght ye newe yere lumbarde ſende worde therof brother kyng englande ¶ batayle calays bytwene kyng englande vnder baner ſir gaultyer manny ſir geffray charney frenchemen cap c li whan kyng england knewe certayne day apoynted departed england thre c men armes vi c archer toke ſhyppyng douer euenynge arryued calays ſo ſecretely man knewe therof went layde men buſſhmentes chamber towres within caſtell than̄e kyng ſayde ſir gaultyer manny woll ye chiefe enterprice ſonne prince woll fyght vnder baner lorde geffray charney laſt day decembre nyght departed fro arras company came nere cali hour mydnight taryed abydynge company ſende two ſquyers poſterne gate caſtell calys founde ſir amery redy demaunded hym tyme lorde geffray ſhulde come lumbarde ſayde yes retourned maiſter ſhewed hym lumbard ſayd made men paſſe newlande bridge good order batayle ſende xii knyghtes hundred men armes go take poſſeſſion caſtell calays thought well myght haue caſtell ſhulde ſoone gette towne ſeyng ſo gode nōbre men hym dayly might haue mo whan̄e lyſt delyuered lorde edwarde ren • xx thouſande crownes pay lumbarde ſir geffray houed ſtyll feldes priuely baner hym entent entre towne ye gate orels nat lumbarde lette downe bridge poſterne ſuffred hundred men armes entre peaſably ſir edwarde delyuered poſtern xx thouſand crownes bagge lumbarde ſayde truſt haue leaſer tell wyll anone day caſt ye bagge crownes coter ſayde frenchemen cōe ſirs ye ſhall entre dongyon ſhall ſure lordes caſtell went thyder drewe apart barre gate opyned within towre ye king england two hundred ſpeares yſſued ſwerdes are handes cryeng manny māny reſcue weneth frenchman ſo fewe men wyn caſtell calays frenchman ſawe well defence coude nat auayle theym yelded thēſelfe priſoners ſo ther fewe hurt put y• ſame towre priſon thengly ſſhmen yſſued caſtell towne mounted horſes frenche priſoners horſes tharchers rode bolayne gate wher ſir geffray banner hym goules thre ſkuchens ſyluer great deſyre firſt ſhulde entre towne ſayd knyghtes lumbarde opyn gate ſhortely ar lyke dye colde name god ser ſayd pepy de werre lumbardes ar malycious people ſubtyll nowe lokynge crownes ſe good nat reken haue hole ſomme kynge englande prince ſonne redy gate vnder bauer ser gaultier manny dyuers baners erle stafforde erle suffolke lorde john̄ montagu brother therle salyſbury lorde beachame lorde •• le lorde dalawarre theſe lordes baners mo iourney great gate ſet open yſſued whan̄e frenchman ſawe yſſue herde cry manny reſcue knewe well betrayed ser geffray ſayd company ſirs ſlye clene loſt yet wer better fight gode hert truſte iourney ſhall englyſſhmen herd theſe wordes ſayd ſaynt george ye ſay trewely ſhame haue ſlyeth frenchman lighted fote put horſes fro ordred themſelf batayle whan kyng ſawe ſtode ſtyll ſayd let v order ſelfe fight ennemyes woll abyde v kyng ſende part company newland bridge herde ſay ther great nombre frenchman thyder went ſixe baners thre hundred archer founde lorde monau frenes lorde creques kepyng ye bridge bytwene bridge calays ther many croſbowes ſaynt omers ayre ſo ſore fray ſlayne drowned mo ſixe hundred frenchman ſoone diſcomfytted chaſed water erly mornyng cōtynent day frenchman kept grounde whyle many feates armes done bothe partes englyſſhmen euer encreaſed commyng calays frenchman abated frēchmen ſawe well coulde nat longe kepe bridge ſuche horſes mounted ſhewed horſes heles thenglyſſhmen thē chaſe many man ouerthrowen well horſed ſaued themſelfe ye lorde frenes ye lorde creques lorde sē py lorde louchinleych lorde namure many taken owne outrage might haue benſaued lyſt whan̄e fayre day euery man myght knowe ſome french knyghtes ſquyers aſſēbled togyder agayne turned fought feerſly englyſſhmen ſo ther ſome frenchman toke good priſoners wherby bothe honour profet ¶ nowe let v ſpeke kyng ther vnknowen ennemyes vnder banner ſir gaultyer manny fote among men ſeke enemyes ſtode cloſe togyder ſpeares v fore long firſt meatyng ſore rencountre kyng light lorde euſtace rybemount ſtronge hardy knight long fyght bytwene hym king ioy beholde thē laſt put ſondre great company bothe party came ſame way fought feerſly togyder frenchman dyd ther right valyantly ſpecially lorde euſtace ribamont ſtrake kyng ſame day two tymes knee finally kynge hymſelf toke priſoner ſo yelded ſwerde ye kyng ſayd ſir knyght yelde priſoner knewe nat kyng ſo iourney kyng england ther ser geffray ſlayne taken ther ſlayne ser hē ry boy ſir pepyn de la warre ſir geffray taken thꝰ iourney achyued cali ye yere lorde ccc lviii ye laſt day decēbre towarde next mornyng chapelet perles kyng englande gaue ſir euſtace rybemont cap c lii whan batayle done kyng returned agayne caſtell calays cauſed priſoners brought thyder ye frē chmen knewe well yt kynge ben perſonally hy 〈…〉 vnder baner ſir gaultier mā ny kynge ſayd wolde gyue •• ght ſupper caſtell calys hour ſupper cāe table couerd kyng knyghtes ther redy euery man newe • arell frenchman alſo ther made good chere thoughe priſoners kyng ſatte downe lordes knygh •• hym right honorably y• prince lordes knyghtes englande ſerued kynge firſt meſſe ſeconde ſatte downe table well ſerued great leaſer than̄e whan ſupper done table take away kynge taryed ſtyll hall knyghtes frenchman bare heeded ſauyng chapelet fyne perles y• ware • eed kynge went fro one another frenchman whan came ſir geffray charney lytell changed countenance loked hym ſayd ſir geffray reaſon ſhulde loue butte lytell wha • ye wolde ſteale night fro thynge haue ſo der • ly bought hath coſt ſomoch gode right • oyouſe gladde haue taken proffe ye wolde haue better markette haue whan ye thought haue calys xx thouſande crownes god hath holpen ye haue fayled purpoſe therwith kyng went fro hym gaue neuer worde anſwere y• kynge cāe ſir euſtace rybamont ioyouſly hym ſayd ſir euſtace ye knyght worlde haue ſene mooſt valyant aſſayle ennemyes defende hymſelf neuer founde knyght y• euer gaue ſomoche body body ye haue done day wherfore gyue price aboue knightes court right ſentēce kyng toke chapelet yt vpon heed beyng bothe fayre goodly tyche ſayd ſir euſtace gyue fought caſtell called auleon within capitayne kynge englandes bretayne called ſir thomas dāgorne ſame ſir thom̄s ther •• ayn nombre c men armes hym ſame yere xxii day auguſt king philypp̄ dyed e bloys ¶ howe kyng nauer made ſir charles spaygne conſtable france ſlayne ca c liiii yere lorde ccc lii vygill lady myddes auguſt lord guy neell lorde • femōt marſhall france bretayne ſlayne bataile lorde briquebeke cathelayne beau wayes dyuers noble aſwell bretayne march france iiii day septēbre ſhulde fought parys duke bo • ſme agayne duke lancaſtre certayne wordes ſhulde ſay ye duke boeſme duke apealed hym court frāce theſe two duke came felde armed lyſtes made y• ſayd duke almayne chalenger duke englande defender though thēglyſſhmen wer enemy french kyng thenglyſſh duke came thyder vnder ſaue cōduct fight 〈◊〉 defence honour yet frenche kynge wold nat ſuffre fight aſſone made othes ſuch caſe requyſite horſes redy ſpeares handes kyng toke hym y• mater dyd ſet acorde gremēt vi day decēbre folowyng pope clement vi dyed auygnon xi yere pōti • ic • te xi day ſame moneth hour thre choſen pope cardynall lymoſyn called tytle y• cardynall oſtre bycauſe byſſhoppe cleremont called moſt cōmonly y• cardynall cleremont whan choſen pope n • med innocēt owne proper name stephyn • ubert y• yere lorde iii c liii viii day january anone y• brekynge day mornyng kyng charles nauer erle eureur cauſed ſlayne towne egle normādy hoſtre lorde charles spayne conſtable frā ce bedde certayne men armes ſent dede hymſelfe abode towne tyll done retourned agayne hym ſayde hym lorde philypp̄ nauer brother lorde lovs harcourt lorde godfray hat court vncle dyuers knyghtes ſquyers aſwell normandy nauer kynge nauer cōpany went cyte deureur wherof erle fortifyed towne hym alſo ther lorde maule john̄ maler lorde grauyll lorde •• morie mulent dyuers noble normandy than̄e kyng nauer went towne mant ſent dyuers letter diuers gode townes france howe put deth conſtable dyuers great treſpaces cōmytted ſent erle namure french kyng parys excuſe hym kynge ſende mant cardynall bolayne byſſhoppe laon duke burbon erle uaudone treat kyng nauerr though cauſed dye cōſtable france yet thought ſhulde nat clene leſe fauour frenche kyng whoſe doughter maryed therfore made requeſt pardon kyng thought realme fraunce great warre ſhulde enſe bytwene theſe two kynges kyng nauer made great aſſembles men warre dyuers region fortifyed townes caſtles finally agrement made bytwene theſe two kynges vpon certayne cōdycions wherof part ſolo weth herafter ſay french kyng ſhall delyuer kyng nauer xxxviii • tornois lande aſwell certeyn rent kyng nauer yerely treſur pares vpon lā de frenche kyng ought aſſigne hym certeyne treat • graūted long bytwene predeceſſos bycauſe countie chā payne alſo maryage kynge nauer maryeng kyng • doughter maryage promyſed great landes ſay xii • land alſo kyng nauer wolde haue coūtie beamōt le roger land bretuell normādy conch dorbec vycoūt pōtheu ſee bayllage cōſtantyne thynges agreed vnto french kyng howbeit coūtie beamont landes conch bertuell dorbec parteyned lorde philyp duke orleāce brother french kyng gaue hym lādes recōpence therof alſo agreed lordes harcourt alyes ſhuld holde landes wherſoeuer france lyſt orels nat alſo agreed y• ſhuld holde ſtyll ſayd landes beſyde thē helde parie lyſt kepe eſ cheker two tymes yere nobly euer dyd duke normādy alſo french kynge ꝑdon deth cōſtable ſuche cōſentyng therto ꝓmyſe oth neuer hurt dāmage ꝑſon occaſion alſo kyng nauerr haue great ſom̄e money y• french kyng ar kyng nauer wolde cōe parys wolde haue hoſtage erle aniowe ſeconde ſon kyng came pares great nōbre men armes iiii day march came ꝑlyament chābre wher kyng ſatte dyuers peres realme counſell ther cardynall bolayne ther kyng nauer deſyred french kyng ꝑdon hym deth cōſtable france ſayeng gode cauſe ſo offred ther proue el kynges pleaſure alſo ſayd ſware dyd nat grudge kyng diſpyte offyce ſayeng alſo howe ther nothyng ſo greuous dyſpleaſur kyng lorde jaques burbone conſtable kynges cōmaundement ſette handes kynge nauer cauſed hym go backe kyng • preſ • n thā quene jane quene blanche ſuſter kynge nauer jane ben wyfe kyng philyppe laſt deed came frenche kyng kneled downe lorde reynold detrey ſayd right redouted ſoueraygne lorde beholde theſe two ladyes quenes jane blanche sir vnderſtande howe kyng nauer dyſpleaſur whereof ſorie requyre forgyue hym yuell wyll grace god ſhall ſo bere hymſelfe frohens forwarde people france ſhalbe pleaſed hym conſtable marſhalles went agayne king nauer ſo brought hym kynges preſence ther ſtode bytwene two quenes ye cardynall ſayd ſir kyng nauer kyng maiſter nat well cōtent dede ye haue done nede nat reherſed ye haue publyſſhed yourſelfe youre owne writyng ſo euery man doth knowe ye ar ſo bounde kyng ye ought nat thus haue done ye blode ſo nere euery man knoweth ye ought holde hym alſo ye haue wedded doughter fore treſpaſſe greatter howe beit inſtaunce loue theſe ladyes quenes hath effectuouſly requyred alſo kyng thynketh ye dyde wtout great aduyſement ſmall counſayle therfore ye kyng pardoneth good hert wyll two quenes kynge nauer kneled downe thanked kynge cardynall ſayd agayne let euery man fro henſforthe beware though kynges lynage ſuche lyke dede ſurely though kynges ſonne ſuche leeſt offycer parteyning kyng ſhall abyde iuſtyce realme caſe court brake vp ſo euery man departed xxi day marche knyght baneret lowe marcheſſe called ſir reynolde preſigny lorde maraunt beſyde rochell drawen hanged gybette iudgement parlyament kynges coū ſayle yere lorde god ccc liiii moneth auguſt erle harcourt ſir loyes brother counſayled frenche kyng▪ ſayde ſhewed kyng mater dethe conſtable septēbre cardynall bolayne went auygnon ſome ſayd kyng dyſpleaſed hym howe ſpace yere ben france preuy kynge ſame ſeaſon went realme france lorde robert de lorris chāberlayne kyng kyng takyn hym yre ſome thought ſhulde haue coſt hym lyfe bycauſe noyſed ſhewed kynge nauerre certayne ſecretes frenche kyng like wyſe lordes harecourt ſhewed kyng nauers ſecretes frenche kyng moneth nouembre kyng nauer went normandy without knowledge french kyng ſported hym dyuers place tyll came auygnon ▪ ſame moneth archebyſſhop rowan chanceler fraunce duke burbone dyuers englyſſhe lordes wente auygnon pope treat peace bytwene kynges england france alſo ye ſame moneth frenche kyng went normandy cane toke handes landes kynge nauers ſet offycers euery towne caſtell except ſixe ſay eareur pontheu chirburge gaurey auranges mortaygne theſe wolde nat yelde vp ther naueroys within theym anſwered ſayd wolde nat delyuer vp townes caſtels onely kyng nauer lorde ſette moneth january ſaue conduct cāe lorde robert de lorris frenche kyng xv dayes parys coude ſpeke kyng whan ſpoken hym yet nat reconſyled full returned agayne auygnon ordynance kynges counſell one ther treaty bytwene englande france ende february tidynges cāe howe trewſe taken bytwene ſayde two kynges endure feeſt▪ ſaynt john̄ baptyſt mean tyme pope myght make peace therfore ſende meſſangers bothe kynges ſhulde ſende authorite embaſſadours conclude maner peace ſame moneth frenche kyng made newe money fyne golde called florence ye lambe pyell grauyn lambe lii theym went marke weyght made kynge made xlviii goo marke weyght courſe florēs prohibyted ſame moneth ſir grāchet lore came parys ſpeke kynge meſſanger fro kyng nauer retourned agayne february bare hym letter ſaue cōduct kyng nauer ſame yere lent came dyuers englyſſhmen nere ye towne nauntꝭ bretayne entred caſtell ſcalyng lii ſir guy rochfort captayn towne dyd ſomoche aſſaut ſame nyght wanne caſtell agayne thenglyſſhmen taken ſlayne eaſter yere lorde ccc lv kyng johan france ſent normādy eldeſt ſon charles dolphyn uienoys lieutenāt ther taryed ſomer men contre graūted hym iii mē armes tor thre mouethes alſo moneth auguſt kyng nauer came nauer caſtell chierburge conſtantyne hym x men warr one ther dyuers treates cōmuned bytwene kyng nauer frenche kyng ſuche caſtell eurur pontheau robbed pylled countre ſome came caſtell couch whiche french handes wan newe fortifyed many thynges dyde nauereys agaynſt frenchman finally ii kynges agreed kyng nauer went caſtell uernell dolphyne brought kyng nauer parys y• xxiiii day septēbre kyng nauer dolphyn came frenche kyng caſtell lour kyng nauerr made reuerence excuſed hymſelfe honorably departed realme france alſo ſayd ſhewed hym y• kynge ſhulde nat well content hym y• frenche kynge deſyred hym ſhewe made report anſwered ſyth deth cōſtable nothyng agaynſt french kyng true man ought haue done howe beit deſyred french kyng pardon euery thyng promyſynge true ought father chiefe lorde than̄e duke athene ſayde kynges behalfe kynge doth pardon hym thynges good hert ¶ inpoſycion gabell ordayned fraunce thre eſtates feates warres cap c lv alſo yere oure lorde ccc lv y• moneth octobre prince wale eldeſt ſon kyng england went gaſcoyne went nere tholouz ſo paſte ryuer garon went cracaſſone brent borowe cytie well defended fro then went narbon brēnyng exilynge contrey moneth nouembre retourned burdeur great pyllage many priſoners man reſyſted hym yet contrey therle armynake lieutenant french kyng langnedocke alſo lorde foitz lorde janques burbon lorde pontheu cōſtable france lorde john̄ cleremont marſhall fraunce farre gretter company prince ſame yere ende octobre kyng england cāe calys rode great hooſt hedyn brake parke ther brent houſe within ꝑke entred nat town caſtell frenche kyng made aſſemble cytie amyens heryng kyng englande rode towarde hym kyng england returnyng calys french kyng folowed hym tyll came ſaynt omers ſend marſhall dauthayne dyuers kyng england offeryng fight body body power pouer day ſoeuer wold apoynt y• kyng england refuſed batayle ſo retourned agayn england frenche kyng parys ſame yere feeſt ſaynt andrue aſſembled pares kynges cōmaū ment prelate france barownes counſayls good townes ther chanceler france ꝑlyament chambre reſyted ſtate warres france deſyring thervpon take aduyce ayd might gyuen kyng mentayne defende ſayd warres alſo ſayde come kynges knowledge howe ſubgettes ar ſore greued reaſon mutacyon y• money therfore kyng offereth make gode money durable ſo y• wolde graunt hym ſufficient ayde mētayne warres anſwered ſay clergy mouth archbyſſhop reyns noble y• duke athene good townes mouth stephyn martell prouoſt marchantꝭ parys ſayde redy lyue dye kynge put bodyes goodes ſeruyce requyring haue deliberacyon ſpeke togyder graū ted thē ſame yere vigyll cōcepcion lady kyng gaue duchy normandy charles dolphyn uienoys eldeſt ſon next day made homage delyberacyon taken thre eſtates anſwered kyng ꝑlyament chā bre mouthes ſayde thre ꝑſons howe wolde fynde hym one yer xxx men coſtꝭ charge fināce pay wagꝭ ſo many men warre eſtemed l 〈◊〉 pariſien̄ thre eſtatꝭ ordenid ſom̄e leuyed euery ꝑſon euery eſtate mē y• noble euery man viii 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 euery pounde gabell ſalt ſhulde ron realme bycauſe nat certayne inpoſicyon ▪ • abell ſhuld ſuffyce therfore ordayned thre ſtates ſhulde retourne agayne parys ſe knowe inpoſicyon w • lde ſerue firſt day march day thyder agayne came except certayne y• great townes picardy normandy ſome noble ſame ſuch inpoſicion makyng came thyder founde firſt graunt wolde nat ſuffyce reyſ • ſayde ſome wherfore ordayned newe ſubſe • ſay euery perſon blode royall otherwyſe clerke lay relygious relygions except nat except houſeholders curate church hauyng rente reuenewes office admnyſtracyon woman wydowes chyldren maryed natte maryed hauyng thynge owne others kepynge none age admyniſtracion euery eſtate authorite priuylege •• thā vſed haue vſed tyme paſt c 〈◊〉 reuenues vnder befor terme lyſe herytage plege meanes office pē cion duryng lyfe wyll ſhall pay hiss ayde ſubſidy euery iiii 〈◊〉 xl ſouces x 〈◊〉 reuenues aboue xx ſouces labourer workemen lyueng labour ſhall pay x ſouces ſeruantes prentyſes lyueng ſeruyces takyng c yere ſhall likewyſe pay x taking theſe money y• rate parys money countre courney money currant partes ſeruantes haue nat yere c s 〈◊〉 ſhall pay nothing wourthey haue goodꝭ rate ſhall pay alſo beggers monkes cloyſtereus without offyce admyniſtracyon chyldren beynge warde vnder age xv yere hauyng nothyng handes noones hauynge reuenewes aboue x 〈◊〉 ſhall pay nothynge alſo woman maryed becauſe huſbandes payeth value huſbandess ſhalbe rekened aſwell haue wife owne clerkess men church prelat • abbottes pr • chanons curate beforeſayde worthe aboue c 〈◊〉 reuenewes yere benefic • church patrimony y• one ſom̄e v 〈◊〉 ſhall pay iiii 〈◊〉 firſt c 〈◊〉 euery c 〈◊〉 tyll ye come ſom̄e v 〈◊〉 xl s ſhall pay nothyng may spe •• e aboue v 〈◊〉 moua • l •• 〈◊◊〉 value benefyces ſhalbe eſtemed rate dymes whan pay 〈…〉 〈◊〉 excepcion priuyledge noble men men y• good townes may sp •• de aboue ſom̄e c 〈◊〉 reuenewes 〈…〉 pay tyll come ſom̄e v 〈◊〉 euery c xl beſyde iiii 〈◊〉 y• firſt c 〈◊〉 • men gode townes inſemblable maner tyll come 〈◊〉 reuenues mouables noble men haue na • c 〈◊〉 reuenewes mouables ſhalbe eſtemed rekenyd value 〈◊〉 farther men haue nat iiii c 〈◊〉 reuenewes good • ſhalbe rekenyd tyll 〈◊〉 iiii 〈◊〉 yt ſay c 〈◊〉 mouables 〈◊〉 x 〈◊〉 reuenues rate nay noble man haue nat reuenues onely c 〈◊〉 mouables nat paſt 〈◊〉 noble man hath nat reuenues nat paſt 〈◊〉 c 〈◊〉 mouables paſt iiii 〈◊〉 part mouables part reuenewes muſt eſtemyd togyder ſom̄e 〈◊〉 noble men iiii 〈◊〉 nat aboue ſaturday fyft day marche yere lorde ccc lvi roſe diſcēyon bytwene cōmons towne arras great men ſame cō mon ſlewe y• ſame day mo xvii y• chefe ꝑſonages towne monday ſlewe four baniſſhed dyuers nat towne ſo cō mon chefe maiſters y• towne ¶ french kyng toke kynge nauer beheeded erle harcourt roan ca c lvi alſo iueſday v day aprill myddes lent frenche kyng deꝑted day fro meneuell harnes accōpanyed wt cc ſpeares amonge therle aniowe ſonne duke orleance brother lorde john de arthoyserle ewe y• lorde charles brother coſyn germayn y• kyng erle tankernyll ſir arnolde dādrehen marſhall fraunce dyuers nombre aboueſayd kyng cāe ſtreyght caſtell rowan poſterne came nat towne founde hall dyner ſonne dolphyne charles kyng nauerr john̄ erle harcourt lordes preaux grauyll clere dyuers ther french kyng cauſed kyng nauer taken therle harcourt lordes preaux clere ſir loys ſir wylliam harcourt bretherne y• erle lorde frequent fryquant lorde tournbeu lorde maubeu mameſners two ſquyers olyuer double johan uaubatou dyuers kynge put priſon dyuerſe chamber within ſame caſtell bycauſe ſyth newe recō ſy •• acion made deth lorde charles late conſtable fraunce kyng nauerre ymagined treated dyuers thynges damage dyſhonour frenche kyng realme therle harcourt ſpoken iniuryous wordes agaynſt kyng caſtell ruell aſſemble conclude ayde gyuen kynge lettyng power ſame ayd graū ted frenche kyng dyned toke horſe rodde telde behynde caſtell called felde pardon thyder two cartꝭ brought therle harcourt lorde grauylle lorde maubeu olyuer double heedꝭ ſtryken foure drawen ye gybette rowan hanged heedes ſette gybette ſame day next day frenche kynge delyuered priſon except thre yt ſay charles kyng nauer caryed parys put priſon caſtell loure chatelette certayne frenche kynges counſell apoynted kepe alſo fryquet uaubatou put ſame priſon therfore lorde philypp̄ nauer helde handes dyuers caſtels pertayning brother kyng nauerre normandy frenche kynge ſende hym delyuer ſame caſtels yet refuſed ſo lorde godfray harcourt aſſembled togyder dyuers enemy french kynges brought ye contrey conſtantyne countre helde kept fro frenche kyng wednyſday eſter theyere lorde god ccc lvi ſir arnold dādrehen marſhall france went towne arras ther wyſely wtout beſyneſſe men warr toke mo hundred priſoners towne ſuche made rebellyon ther ſlayne dyuers chiefe burgeſſes towne next day made xx beheeded ye kept ſtyll priſon knowe kynges pleaſure behalfe ſo meanes towne brought trewe obeyſance kyng moneth june duke lancaſtre came cōſtantyne fyll company lorde philyp nauerr lorde godfray harcourt foure thouſande fyghtyng mē rode lyſeur orbec pō theau refreſſhed caſtell ben beſieged two monethes lorde robert hotetot maiſter croſbowes fraunce layne ſieg dyuers noble departed fro ſiege whan knewe commynge duke lancaſtre left behynde theym haſt engyns artillary caſtell toke duke lācaſtre company rode robbyng pyllyng townes contrey paſſed toward bretuell newely refreſſhed bycauſe knewe founde ye cyte caſtell eureux newely yelded ye frenche kynge longe kept ſiege alſo ſawe howe cytie brēt cathedrall churche robbed aſ well naueroyſe yelded vp caſtell compoſycyon frenchemen lay ſiege left duke lancaſtre lorde philyppe nauerr went uernueyll perche toke towne caſtell robbed towne brent great parte therof frenche kyng made redy aſſemble aſſoone herde tidynges duke lancaſtre wente hym great nombre men armes fotemenne folowed conde goynge ſtreyght towne uernueyll thanne duke company went towardes towne egle kynge folowed tyll came tuebufe two leages fro towne egle thā ſhewed kyng howe coulde folowe farther ther ſuche foreſtes ennemyes myght take hym whan lyſte ſoo ſhulde leſe labour go farther kyng retourned hooſt went caſtell thilyers whiche hādes nauaroes kyng toke ſette men warr therin kyng went caſtell bretuell wherin men kyng nauers ye kyng lay ſiege ſpace two monethes ye caſtell gyuen vp within went wher lyſt goodes lyues ſaued ¶ aſſemble frenche kyng made fight prince wale rode berry cap c lvii whan frenche kynge made iourney reconquered townes 〈◊〉 caſtelles baſe normandy pertaynyug kyng nauerre whome helde priſonne gone backe cytie parys nat long herde howe prince wale good nombre men warre ferre entred countrey aprochyng gode • otrey berry kyng ſayd ſware wolde ryde fyght hym whereſoeuer founde hym kyng made agayne ſpecyall aſſemble noble ſuch helde hym commaundement maner excuſes layde parte letter one ſene euery man payne dyſpleaſur ſhulde drawe mete hym y• march bloyes torayne entent ſyght thenglyſſhmen kyng make haſt deꝑted fro parys rode chartres better ſuretie thenglyſſh men dyd • ted dayly men warre reſorted thyder fro partes aunergne berrey burgoyne lorayne heynault uermandoyſe picardy bretayne normandy euer came ſet forwarde made muſters lodged countrey aſſ • gnement marſhalles lorde johan cleremont lorde arnolde dādrehen kyng ſende alſo great prouiſyon fortreſſes garyſon •• antowe poyctou dumayne torayne fortreſſes wher thought thenglyſſh men ſhulde paſſe entent cloſe paſſages kepe thē fro vitayl •• ſhulde fynde foragefor thē horse howe beit prince cō pany nombre two men armes ſir archer rode eaſe bitayls ynough founde cō tre auuerne right plentyfull wolde nat tary ther went make warre 〈◊〉 enemyes brent exyled cōtrey aſmoch might whan entred towne founde well replenyſſhed thyngꝭ taryed ther two thre dayes refreſſhe whan depted wolde diſtroy reſydue ſtrike heedes veſſels wyne bren barly otes thyngꝭ thyntent 〈◊〉 enemyes ſhulde haue ayde therof 〈◊〉 rode forthe euer founde good cōtres plētyfull berry torayne •• owe poyctou mayne plentyfull contre men warr thenglyſſhmen rode maner tyll came good cytie 〈◊〉 burges ther made gret ſkirmyſſh one gate capitayns within lorde conſant lorde hutyn 〈◊〉 kept cyte ther many feates 〈…〉 me done thenglyſſhmen deꝑted without doyng went iſſoldon ſtrong caſtell feerſly aſſayled thyder ca •• hole hooſt howbeit coud nat wy • gētylmen defended valiantly paſſed farther toke way u 〈…〉 〈◊〉 great towne good caſtell yuell cloſed peple ther nat ſufficyent make defence therfore perforce ther founde wyne vitayls gret plenty taryed thre dayes co refreſſhe hoſt thyder cāe tidynges prince french kyng charter gret aſſemble men warr howe y• tor • ne paſſagꝭ aboue ryuer loyre cloſed kept none coude paſſe ryue • prince counſelled returne paſſe torayne poycton ſo 〈◊〉 way bourdeaux prince toke way retourned whan done towne pleaſure 〈…〉 ken caſtell ſlayne mo • ſt part within rode towarde remoren tyne french kyng ſend y• countrey thre great barownes kepe fronters • lorde craon lorde boucequant hermyte chamont thre c ſperes rode contrey coſtyng thēglyſſhmen folowed thē ſixe dayes togyder • coude neuer fynde auantage ſet thēglyſſhmen rode euerſo wyſely coude nat entre ſyde aduauntage day frenchman putte themſelfe buſſhement nere remorentyne marueylous ſtrayte paſſage whiche englyſſhmen muſt nedes paſſe ye ſame day ther departed fro prince bataile leaue marſhals ye lorde bartylmewe breches lorde muſydent gaſcoyne lorde petyton courton lorde dalawarre lorde baſſet lorde danyell paſeler lorde rycharde pontchardon lorde nowell lorynch yong lorde spencer edwarde lorde dambretycourte two hundred menne armes ronne remorentyne paſſed foreby frenchman buſſhment nat ware aſſone paſſed frenchman brake came feerſly thenglyſſhmen well forwarde herde noyſe horſes commynge parceyued ennemyes tourned ſtode ſtyll abode frēchmen came thē great randon ſpeares reſtes ſo cāe ronnyng thenglyſſhmen ſtode ſtyll ſuffre paſſe nat paſt fyue ſir ouerthrowen y• firſt metyng thenglyſſhmen daſſhed forthe horſes frenchemen feerſe ſkyrmyſſhe en 〈…〉 red long many knightes ſquyers beaten downe partes dyuers taken reſcued agayn ſo long ſeaſon man coulde tell better ſo long fought batayle thenglyſſhe marthalles aproched whan frenchman ſawe theym commyng long woode ſyde • ledde might beſt toke wayes remorentyne englyſſhmen chaſe natte ſparyng horſes harde batayle many man ouerthrowen howe beit one halfe frenchman entred caſtell thre lordes ſaued theymſelfe dyuerſe knyghtes ſquyers well horſed howe beit towne taken fyrſt commynge frenchman entred caſtell ¶ howe prince wale toke caſtell remorentyne cap c lviii prince wale herde fore ryders fightyng toke way came towne remorentyne wherin moche people 〈◊〉 dyeng howe myght get caſtell prince cōmaunded lord ſir john̄ chandos go ſpeke theym caſtell ſir johan went caſtell gate made ſigne ſpeke ſome perſon within kept watche ther demaū ded name dyd ſende hym thyder ſhewed ſir boucyquant hermyte chamount came barryers whan ſir johan ſawe theym ſaluted curtelly ſayde ſirs ſende hyder fro lorde ye prince wyll ryght courteſſe vnto ennemyes thynketh ſayeth ye wyll yelde vpp̄ fortreſſe hym yelde ſelfe priſoners wyll receyue mercy kepe good company armes lorde boucyquant ſayde arnat purpoſe putte ourſelfe caſe great folly ſyth haue nede ſo thynke defende ſelfe departed prince lodged men towne without eaſe next day euery man armed vnder baner beganne aſſayle caſtell right feerſly archer dyke ſhotte ſo holly togyder none durſte ſcant apere defence ſwame ouer ye dyke bordes thyngꝭ hokes pike handes myned ye walles within caſt downe great ſtones pottꝭ lyme ſlayne ye englyſſhe partie ſquyer called remond derge du lache cōpany captall beoffes aſſaut dured day without reſt nyght englyſſhmen drewe logynges ſo paſt nyght mornyng whan ſonne ryſen marſhals hooſt ſowned trū pettes ſuch ordayned gyue aſſaut redy appayrelled whiche aſſaut prince perſonally reaſon preſence greatly encouraged englyſſhmen nat ferre fro hym ſquyer called bernarde ſlayne ſtonne prince ſware wolde nat depart styll caſtell within pleaſure aſſaut enforced euery part finally ſawe aſſautes coulde nat wyn caſtell wherfore ordayned engins caſte wylde fyre baſe court ſo dyde yt baſe court fyre ſo fyre multiplyed ſuche wyſe toke couerynge great towre couered rede whā within ſawe muſt yelde ye wyll prince orels peryſhe fyre thre lordes cāe downe yelded prince ſo prince toke thē hym priſoners caſtell left voyde ¶ great hooſt frenche kyng brought batayle poycters cap c lix takyng caſtell remorentyne therin prince company rode dyde diſtroyeng countre aprochyng antowe tourayne frenche kyng charterz departed came bloyes ther taryed two dayes amboyſe ne • day loch herde howe prince towrayne retournyng poyctou euer englyſſhmen coſted certayne expert knyghtꝭ frā ce alway made report ye kyng englyſſhmen dyd kynge came hay towrayne men paſſed ryuer loyre ſome bridge orleance ſome mchun saulmure bloyes towrs wher might nombre xx thouſande men armes beſyde ther xxvi duke erles mo ſixſcore baners foure ſonnes kyng yonge duke charles normandy lorde loyes ye fro thenſ forthe duke aniewe lorde johan duke berry lorde philyppe duke burgoyne ſame ſeaſon pope innocēt ſixt ſend lorde bertrand cardynall pyergourt lorde nycholas cardynall egle france treat peace bytwene frenche kyng enemyes firſt bytwene hym kyng nauerr priſon theſe cardynalles often tymes ſpake kyng delyuerance duryng ſege bretuell coude nothyng behalfe cardynall pyergourt went tour ther herde howe frenche kynge haſted ſore fynde englyſſhmen th 〈…〉 rodde poycters herde howe bothe 〈◊〉 hooſtes drewe thyderward frenche kyng herde howe prince haſted greatly retourne kyng feared ſhulde ſcape hym ſo deꝑted fro hay tourayn company rode chauuygny wher taryed thurſday towne without along ryuer creuſe next day kyng paſſed ryuer bridge ther weuyng englyſſhemen ben hym nat howe beit purſued paſſed ye bridge day mo th 〈…〉 hreſcore thouſand horſes dyuers paſſed chaſteleraunt euer paſſed tooke way poieters otherſyde prince wyſt nat truely frenchman ſuppoſed nat farre coude nat fynde forage wherby gret faut hooſt vitayle ſome repēted diſtroyed ſomoch done whan berry aniowe torayne made better prouiſion ſame friday thre great lordes france lorde craon lorde raoull coucy therle joigny taryed day towne chamygny part companyes ſaturday paſſed bridge folowed kyng thre leages tooke waye amonge buſſhes without wode ſyde go poicters ſame ſaturdaye prince cōpany dyſloged fro lytell vyllage therby ſent hym certayne currours ſe myght fynde aduēture frēchmen nombre threſcore men armes well horſed lorde euſtace dambreticourt lorde john̄ guyſtelles aduenture englyſſhmen frenchemen mette togyder forſayde wode ſyde frenchman knewe anone howe ennemyes haſt dyd helmyttes diſplayed baners came great paſe towardes thēglyſſhmen nombre two hundred men armes whan englyſſhmen ſawe ſo great nombre determined ſlye let frenchman chaſe knewe well prince hooſt nat farre behynde tourned hor • e toke y• corner wood frēchmen theym cryenge cryes made great noyſe chaſed came ye prince batayle ware therof themſelfe ▪ prince taryed ther haue worde agayne 〈◊〉 ſend forthe lorde raoll coucy baner went ſo farre forward vnder prince baner ther 〈◊〉 batayle knyght fought valiantly howe beit takenne erle wyng • vycoūt bruce lorde cha 〈◊〉 ▪ taken̄e ſlayne fewe ſcaped y• priſoners prince knewe howe frenche kynge folowed hym ſuche wyſe coude nat eſchue batayle aſſembled togyder men commaunded man ſhulde go marſhals baners thus prince rode ſaturday fro mornyng tyll agaynſt night ſo came within two lytell leages poicters captall de buz ſir aymenon punyers lorde bartylmewe brunes lorde euſtace dambretycourt theſe prince ſende forthe ſeyf myght knowe frenchman dyd theſe knyghtes deꝑted two hūdred men armes well horſed rodde ſo farre ſawe great batayle kynges ſawe feldes couered men armes theſe englyſſhmen coud nat forbers ſette tayle frenche hooſt caſt downe many yerth toke dyuers priſoners ſo hooſt beganne ſtyrre • idynges therof came frenche kyng entryng cytie poycters retourned agayne made oſt ſame ſo ſaturday late lodged felde ▪ thēgliſſh currours retourned agayne prince ſhewed hym ſawe knewe ſaid howe frenche hooſt great nombre people well ſayde prince name god lette v ſtudy howe ſhall fyght thē aduauntage night englyſſhmen lodged ſtrong place among hedge vynes buſſhes hooſt well watched ſo frenche hooſt ¶ order frenchemen batayle poycters cap c lx ſonday y• mornynge frenche kynge hadde great deſyre fight englyſſhmen herd maſſe pauilyon houſeled foure ſōnes hym maſſe ther came hym duke orleaunce duke burbon therle pontheu lorde jaques burbone duke athene conſtable france erle tankernyll erle salebruce erle dāmartyne erle uantador dyuers great barownes france neyghbours holdynge fraunce lorde cleremont lorde arnolde dandrehen marſhall france lorde ſaynt uenont lorde john̄ landas lorde euſtace ribamont lorde fyennes lorde geffray chargny y• lord chatellon lorde suly lorde neell ſir robert dura dyuers theſe kyng went counſell finally hit ordayned maner men ſhulde drawe felde euery lorde diſplay baner ſet forth name god ſaynt denice trumpet blewe vp hooſt euery man mounted horſebacke wēt felde wher ſawe kynges baner waue wynde myght ſene great noble fayre harneſſe riche armory baners penōs floure france ther none durſt abyde home without wolde ſhamed euer ordayned y• aduyce conſtable marſhals made thre batayls ech warde xvi men armes muſtred paſt men armes firſt batayle duke orleaunce gouern xxxvi baners twyſe many penons ſeconde duke normandy two bretherne lorde loys lorde john̄ thirde y• kyng hymſelfe whyle theſe batayls ſettyng aray y• kyng called hym lorde euſtace rybamont lorde john̄ landas lorde richarde beawyeu ſayd ſirs ryde ſe dealyng thenglyſſhmen aduyſe well nombre meanes may fight theym fote horſebacke theſe thre knyghtes rode forth kynge wyght courſer ſayde high men ſirs among whan ye parys chartres roan orleaunce ye thret thenglyſſhmen ▪ deſyre armes agaynſt theym nowe ye become therto ſhall nowe ſhewe thē nowe ſhewe forthe yuell wyll ye bere reueng dyſpleaſurs damage haue done without dout ſhall fyght suche herde ſayd ſir god deſname ſo wolde ſe gladly ther thre knightes retourned agayne kyng demaunded tidynges ſir euſtace rybamont anſwered ſayde ſir haue ſene englyſſhmen eſtymacion two thouſande men armes four thouſand archer fyftene hūdred howebeit ſtronge place farre imagyne ar one batayle howbeit wyſely ordred longe way haue fortifyed ſtrongly hedge buſſhes one part archer long hedge ſo none go ryde way muſt paſt way muſt ye go ye purpoſe fyght hedge one entre one yſſue likelyhode four horſemen may ryde front thende hedge mā go ryde men armes fote archer afore maner herſe ſo woll nat lightely diſconfyted well ſayd kyng woll ye counſayle v ſir euſtace ſayde ſir lette v lote except thre hundred men armes well horſed y• beſt hooſt mooſt hardyeſt entent ſomwhat breke opyn archer thane batayls folowe quickely fote ſo fight men armes hand hande beſt aduyce canne gyue thynke waye better let hym ſpeke kyng ſayd thus ſhall done two marſhalles rode fro batayle batayle choſe thre c knyghtes ſquyers mooſt expert men armes hooſt euery man well armed horſed alſo ordayned bataylles alwayns ſhulde abyde ſtyll horſebacke confort marſhalles nede wherof erle saleſbruce erle neydo erle noſco capitayns kynge johan france armed xx apayrell dyd put gyding eldeſt ſonne lorde ſaynt uenant lorde landas lorde thybault bodenay lorde reynolde quenoll called archepreeſt armed armoure yongerle alanſon ¶ howe cardynall dyergourt treated make agremēt bytwene frenche kyng prince batell poycters cap c lxi whan frenche kyngꝭ batayls ordred euery lorde vnder banner among owne men cōmaunded euery man ſhulde cutte ſperes fyue fote long euery man put ſpurres thus redy aproche cardinall piergort came great haſt king came ſame mornynge poycters kneled downe kyng helde vp handes deſyred hym goddeſſake lytell abſteyne ſettynge forwarde tyll ſpoken hym ſayde ſir ye haue floure realme agaynſt handfull englyſſhmen regarde company ſir ye may haue acorded without batayle ſhalbe profitable honourable haue theym maner rather aduēture ſo noble chiualry ye haue preſent ſir requyre name god humylyte y• may ryde prince ſhewe hym danger ye haue hym kynge ſayd pleaſeth well retourne agayne ſhortely cardynall deꝑted dilygently rode prince among men fote cardynall lyghted came prince receyued hym curteſſy cardynall ſalutacyon made ſayde certaynly fayre ſon counſayle aduyſe iuſtely puyſſaunce frenche kynge ye woll ſuffre treat make peace bytwene may prince yong luſty ſayd ſir honour people ſaued wolde gladly fall reaſonable way cardynall ſayd ſir ye ſay well ſhall acorde ſhulde great pytie yf ſo many noble men bothe party ſhulde come togyder batayle cardynall rode agayne kyng ſayd ſir ye nede nat make great haſte fyght ennemyes canne nat ſlye fro though wolde ſuche groūd wherfore ſir requyre forbere day tyll morowe ſon ryſinge kynge lothe agree therto forſome counſayle wolde nat cōſent finally cardynall wed ſuch reaſons kyng acorded reſpyt ſame place pyght vp 〈…〉 yon reed ſylke freſſhe rych gaue leaue day euery man drawe lodgynges except conſtables marſhalle • batayls ſonday day car 〈◊〉 〈…〉 yled ridynge fro one hooſt gladly agree frenche kynge wolde nat agree without myght haue foure princy •• lleſt englyſſhmen pleaſure prince yelde themſelfe ſimply howe beit ther many great offer made prince offred rendre kynges handes euer wonne voyage townes caſtels quyte priſoners men taken ſeaſon alſo ſwere nat armed agaynſt frenche kyng ſeuyn yere kyng counſayle wold none therof vttermaſt wold prince c knyghtes ſhulde yelde theym ſelfe kynges priſon otherwyſe wolde nat whiche prince wolde 〈◊〉 wyſe agre vnto meane ſeaſon cardynall rode thus bytwene hooſtes truſt ſome good certayne knightꝭ frā ce englande bothe rode forthe ſame ſonday bycauſe truſe day coſt hooſtes beholde dealyng enemyes ſo fortuned lorde john̄ cā do rode ſame day cooſtyng french hoſt like maner lorde cleremont one trenche marſhalles ryden auiewed ſtate englyſſhe hooſt theſe two knyghtes retourned towardes hooſtes mette togyder eche theym bare ou • maner deuyee blewe lady enbraudred 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 beame aboue apayrell lorde cleremont ſayd chandos howe long haue ye taken bere deuyce nay ye bere •• ſayd chandos aſwell myne pours deny ſayd cleremont 〈◊〉 nat truſe day bytwene v ſhulde make good incontynent ye haue right bere deuyce ſir ſayd cā do ye ſhall fynde morowe redy defend proue feate armes well myne cleremont ſayd cā do theſe well wordꝭ englyſſhmen forye deuyce nothyng newe yeſe good fayre departed doyng eche returned hooſt cardynall pyergort coude wyſe ſonday make agrement bytwene party whan nere nyght returned poicters night frenchman toke eaſe prouiſion ynough englyſſhmen great defaut coude get forage coude nat depart theſe without danger ennemyes ſonday thenglyſſhmen made great dyke hedge archer ſtronger monday mornynge prince company redy apayrelled ſonne ryſing lyke maner frenchman ſame morning tymes cardynall came agayne frenche hooſt thought preachyng pacify party frenchman ſayd hym retourne whyderye woll bringe hyder mo wordes treaty peace ye loue yor ſelfe depart ſhortely whan cardynall ſawe traueyled vayne toke leaue kyng went prince ſayd ſir ye canne remedy byde batayle fynde none acorde frenche kyng prince ſayd ye ſame entent people god helpe right ſo cardynall retourned poycters company certayne knyghtes ſquyers men armes fauourable frenche kyng prince whan ſawe ye party ſhulde fight ſtale fro maiſters went frē che hooſt made captayne catelayne impaſtre thā ther cardynall knewe nothynge therof tyll come poycters certentie order englyſſhmen ſhewed frē che kyng except ordayned threhūdred men horſebacke many archer horſebacke cooſt vnder couert mountayne ſtrike batayle duke normandy vnder mountayne fote ordynaunce made newe frēchmen knewe nat prince batayle downe amonge vynes cloſed wekyſt parte caryages wyll name ſome princypall lordes knyghtes ther prince erle warwyke therle suffolke erle saliſbury therle stafford lorde john̄ chandos lorde richarde stafford lorde reynold cobham lorde spencer lorde james audeley ye lorde peter brother lorde bercley lorde baſſer lord waren lorde dalawar lorde maulyne lorde wylly lorde bartylme brunes lord felton lorde rychard pē bruge lorde stephyne conſtracyon lorde braſfeton englyſſhmen gaſcon ther ye lorde prune lorde buger captall buz lorde johan chamont lorde delaſpare lorde roſen lorde conſeu lorde montferāt lorde landuras lorde soulech leſtrade nat name heynowers lorde euſtace dābretycourt lorde john̄ guyſtels two ſtrā gers lorde dauyell phaſell lorde denyce moerbertre prince company paſt nat viii men one ye frenchman lx fightyng men wherof ther mo thre thouſande knightes ¶ batell poycters bytwene prince wale frē che kyng cap c lxii whan̄e prince ſame ſhuld haue batell cardynall gone without peace trewſe makynge ſawe frenche kyng dyd ſette lytell ſtore ſaid men ſirs though ſmall company regarde puyſſance ennemyes let v nat baſſhed therfore ye vyctorie lyeth nat multitude people wher god wyll ſende yf fortune iourney ſhalbe mooſt honoured people worlde dye right quarell haue kyng father bretherne alſo ye haue good frendes kynſmen theſe ſhall reuenge v therfore ſirs goddeſſake requyre deuoyers thin day god pleaſed ſaynt george day ye ſhall ſe good knyght theſe wordes ſuche prince ſpake conforted people lorde ſir john̄ chandos day neuer went fro ye prince alſo lorde james audeley great ſeaſon 〈◊〉 whan̄e ſawe ſhulde nedes fight ſayd prince ser haue ſerued alwayes truely lorde father alſo ſhall long lyue ſay bicauſe made one vowe firſt batayle kynge father chyldren ſhulde howe wolde one firſt ſetters el dye payne therfore requyre yor grace rewarde ſeruyce euer dyde king yor father woll gyue ſycence depart fro ſette ſelfe may acomplyſſhe vowe prince acorded deſyre ſayde ſir james god gyue day grace beſt knyght ſo toke hym hande knyght departed fro prince went formaſt front batayles onely acompanyed foure ſquyers promyſed nat fayle hym lorde james right ſage valyāt knight hym moche hooſt ordayned gouerned day thus ſir james front batayle redy fight batayle marſhalles fraunce lykewyſe lorde euſtace dambreticourt dyd payne one formaſt ſette whan ſir james audeley began 〈…〉 tte forwarde ennemyes fortuned ſir euſtace dambretycourt ye ſhall ye haue herde howe almayns french hoſt apoynted ſtyll horſebacke ſir euſtace beyng horſebacke layed ſpear reſt ran frenche batayle knyght almaygne called lorde loyes coucoabras bare ſhelde ſyluer fyue roſſes goules ſir euſtace bare ermyns two hamedes goules whan almaygne ſawe lorde euſtace come fro company rode agaynſt hym mette ſo rudely bothe knightes fell yerth almayne hurt ſhulder therfore roſe nat ſo quickely dyde ſir euſtace whā vp taken breth came knyght lay grounde than̄e fyue knyghtes almayne came hym one bare hym yerth ſo perforce taken priſoner brought erle noſco toke hede hym nat ſay whyther ſware priſoner tyed hym chare lette hym ſtande batayle began partes ye batayls marſhals fraunce aproched ſet forthe apoynted breke ye ray archer entred horſebacke way great hedge bothe ſydes ſette full archer aſſone men armes entred archer began ſhote bothe ſydes dyd ſlee hurt horſes knyghtes horſes whan felt ye ſharpe arowes wolde wyſe go forward brewe backe ſtang toke ſo feerſly many fell maiſters ſo p •• ace coude nat ryſe agayne ſo moche marſhals batayle coude neuer come prince certayne knyghtes ſquyers well horſed paſſed tharchers thought •• ye prince coude nat lorde james judeley four ſquyers front batell dyd maruels marmes great prowes cāe fought ſir arnolde dandrehen vnder owne baner ther fought longe togyder ſir arnolde ſore handled batayle marſhals began dyſorder reaſon ſhot archer wt ayde men armes came among ſlewe dyd lyſt ther lorde arnold dādrchen taken priſoner men ſir james audeley four ſquters day neuer toke priſoner alwayes fought went enemyes alſo french partie lorde johan cleremōt fought vnder owne baner long coude endure ther beten • owne coude nat relyued ranſomed ſlayne wtout mercy ſome ſayde bicauſe wordes day ſit john̄ chandos within ſhort ſpace marſhals batayls diſconfyted fell vpon another coude nat go forth frenchman behynde coude nat get forwarde reculed backe came batayle duke normandy great thicke fote anon began opyn behynde whan knewe marſhals batayle dyſconfited toke horſes deꝑted might beſt alſo ſawe rowt englyſſhmen cōmynge downe lytell mountayne horſebacke many archer brake ſyde duke batayle trewe ſay archer dyd company day great aduauntage ſhotte ſo thicke frenchman wyſt nat ſyde take hede lytell lytell englyſſhmen wanne grounde theym whan men armes englande ſawe marſhals batayle dyſconfited duke batayle began̄e dyſorder opyn lept horſes whiche redy aſſembled gyder cryed ſaynt george gyen lorde chandos ſayd prince ſir take horſe ryde forth iourney yors god day handes gette v french kynges batayle ther lyeth ſore mater thynke verily valyantneſſe woll nat flye truſt ſhall haue hym grace god ſaynt george ſo well fought withall ſir herde ſay day ſhulde ſe good knyght prince ſayde lette v go forthe ye ſhall nat ſe day retourne backe ſayd auaūce baner name god ſaynt george knyght y• bare dyde commaundement ſore batayle perylous many man ouerthrowen one downe coud nat relyued agayne wtout great ſocoure ayde prince rode entred amonge ennemyes ſawe ryght hande lylell buſſhe lyeng deed lorde robert dura baner hym ten twelfe men hym prince ſayd two ſquyers thre archer ſirs take body knyght targe bere hym poycters preſent fro cardynall pyergourt ſay howe ſalute hym ye token done prince enformed cardynalles men felde agaynſt hym nat pertayning right order armes men churche cometh goeth treaty peace ought nat reaſon ber harnes fyght neyther party ought indyfferent bycauſe theſe men done ſo price dyſpleaſed cardynall therfore ſende vnto hym nephue lorde robert dura deed cathelayn ampoſtre takenne printe wolde haue heed ſtryken bycauſe pertaynynge cardynall lorde candos ſayd ſir ſuſfre ſeaſon entende gretter mater paraduenture cardynall wyll make ſuche excuſe ye ſhalbe content prince company dreſſed batayle duke athene cōſtable france many manne ſlayne caſt yerth frenchman fought companyes cryed mountioy ſaynt denyce ye englyſſhmen ſaynt george gyen anoue price company met batayle almaygnes wherof erle saleſbruce erle noſco therle neydo capitayns ſhort ſpace put • lyght archer ſhotte ſo holly togyder none durſt come danger ſlewe many man coulde nat come raunſome theſe thre erles ther ſlayne dyuers knyghtes ſquyers cōpany ther lorde dambretycourt reſcued owne men ſette horſebacke dyde day many feates armes toke gode priſoners whan duke 〈…〉 〈…〉 yle ſawe prince aproche thought 〈◊〉 thē ſelfe ſo duke kynges chrldren erle poycters erle tourayne ryght yong leued gouernors ſo departed fro felde mo eyght hundred ſpeares y• ſtake ſtroke day howe beit lorde guyſſhard dangle lorde john̄ sayntre erle poicters wolde nat ſlye entred thyckeſt preaſe batayle kynges thre ſonnes toke way chamigny lorde john̄ landas lorde thy bault woodney ſette wayt duke normādy whan brought duke long leage fro batayle tooke leaue duke deſyred lorde ſaynt uenant ſhulde nat leaue duke bring hym ſauegarde wherby ſhulde wyn thanke kynge abyde ſtyll felde met alſo duke orleaunce great cōpany hym alſo departed fro felde clere handes ther many good knyghtes ſquyers though maiſters departed fro felde yet hadde rather dyed haue reproche kyngꝭ batayle cā • englyſſhmen ſore fyght many great ſtroke gyuen receyued kyng yongeſt ſonne mette batayle thenglyſſhe marſhalles therle warwyke therle suffolke theym gaſcons captall buz lorde pomyers lorde amery charre lorde mucydent lorde lāguran lorde de la strade frenche partie came tyme ynough lorde johan landas lorde woodney lyghted fote wente kynges batayle lytell beſyde fought duke athene cōſtable frā ce lytell aboue hym duke burbone many good knyghtes burbonoyſe picardy hym lytell one ſyde ther poyteuyns lorde de 〈◊〉 lorde partney lorde 〈◊〉 lorde montahoton lorde suggeres lorde johan sayntre lorde guyſſhar de dangle lorde argenton lorde
