peace made bytwene duke normādy yong erle harcourt great part meanes lorde loyes harecourt duke coūſayle houſe duke gaue ſame erle mary age y• doughter duke burbone ſuſter duches normandy thus ſiege brake vp melune towne abode frēche yet peace realme france inuaded great warre made therin aſmoche truſe bytwene englande fraunce expyred ſuche men warre made warre iytell kyng nauer fraunce normandy burgone picardy champaigne brey beaufe made agayne great warre tytell kyng englande peace ther fortreſſe wolde tourne frenche companyons men warr hadde lerned ſo well robbe pyll countrey raunſome people coude nat leaue two thouſand ten twelfe horſes owne wolde haue made warre ſhorte tyme ſhulde haue fayne haue gone fote breakynge vp ſiege melune duke normandy deſyred lorde broquart feneſtrages nacyon lorayne hym wagꝭ fyue hundred cōpanyons wolde helpe driue champaygne englyſſhmen ſuche made dayly warre countre agreed therto certayne ſomme florens ſhuld▪ haue hym men aſſembled togyder men warr chā paigne burgoyne byſſhoppe troy therle uadumont erle jouy lorde johān chalon lorde broquart feneſtrages two thouſande ſpeares xv c ſo cāe ſtrōg caſtell han champaigne whiche englyſſhmen kepte yere halfe toke third aſſaut ſlayne lxxx englyſſhemen none take mercy frenchman went cytie troy whan well refreſſhed yſſued twelfe hundred ſpeares nyne hundred tode towarde nogent ryuer sayne lorde dambrety courte vnderſtode ryding abrode aſſembled garyſons vnder rule four hundred ſpeares two hundred archer departed fro pons rode clene armed except heed peace rode hackeney great courſer ledde hym nat ryden farre herde tidynges frenchman likewyſe frēchmen herde lorde euſtace knowen frenchman ben ſo great nombre wolde deſyred lorde peter audeley albreth haue ayded might well made four hūdred men lorde euſtace gathered togyder men without y• towne nogent toke hight lytell hyll amonge vynes ſette archer hym whan frenchemen came nere ſawe theym ordayned thre bataylles firſt gouerned byſſhoppe troy lorde broquart feneſtrages ſecond lorde john̄ chalon erle jouy thirde erle januyll ſir euſtace amonge men ſayde ſits lette v fyght good courage iourney ſhalbe ſhall lordes champaigne ſomtyme erldome may kyng england ſuche ſeruyce repute kyng france woll gyue erldome called hym certayne yong ſquyers couragyous manny coſyn johān parys martyne spaygne made theym knyghtes made men lyght fote cut ſpeares fyue fote long ſette penon hym whiche ermyns two hameddes goules ¶ batayle nogent bytwen lorde broquart feneſtrages nacyon lorayne frenche partie ſir euſtace dambreti▪ court nacyon heynalt englyſſhe partie cap c lxxx xix whan ser broquart feneſtrages hardy couragiouſe ſaw yt ſyr euſtace wolde nat remoue batel ſayd lette v ſette ſoeuer fall ſo aduaunced bataile ſyr euſtace receyued ſo firſt bataile ouerthrew ennemies mo lx nere hande clene diſcomfitted ſame bataile ii freſſhe bataile aproched whiche greatly ayded cōforted fyrſt thā ye third bataile came wynge comforted ii batailes frenche men iii agaynſt one sir euſtace glayue ouer threwe iiii herdieſt ennemyes whan ser broquart ſawe prowes ſtrake hym ouer mennes heedes ſtrake hym viſer ſtrake ſtroke thre tethe letted nat fight engliſſhemen vauntage hyll helde ſelfe ſo clooſe together none coude entre frenchemē horſbacke engliſſhemen fote littel beſyde englyſſhe archer part themſelfe ſhot quyckely ye frē chemen frenchemen turned engliſſhemē turned dyd ye ſame frenche fortemen came felde ix c paueſſes therby brake ye array archer ſhot coud nat hurt ſo ſure pa • eſſed thā archer ſore beten ſeconde bataile ye frenchemē came horſe backe ſlewe many went kept englyſſhe horſes ſlewe wanne fewe ſcaped meane ſeaſon two batailes fought engliſſhemen one ſyde fotemen ſide finally brake theyr array ſyr euſtace ſtandderde beaten downe torne many men ſlayne taken syr euſtace fell hādes knyght called ſyr henry quenelart great payne ſaue lyſe comons troye wolde haue ſlayne hym great dedes armes done countrey champaygne alſo taken ſyr johan parys lorde martine spaygne diuerſe knyghtes ſquyers ſuche ſaued ſelfe entred fortreſſe nogent whiche fewe nere ſlayne taken coragious manny left deed felde amonge deed men diſcomfytture frenchemen departed beynge ſore hurte nere deed lyfte vp litel heed ſawe nothynge aboute hym deed men lyeng grounde rounde aboute hym roſe welle myght ſatte downe ſawe well howe nat farre fortreſſe nogent whiche engliſſhe dyd ſo moche ſometyme crepyng ſomtyme reſtynge came foote towre nogent made token within ſhewynge howe one theyr companyons certayn came downe ye towre hym bare hym fortereſſe dreſſed woundes therehe gouerned hym ſelfe ſo well heeled bataile yere lorde ccc lix vigill ſaynt john̄ baptiſt ¶ howe theſe robbors pyllers kept theſe fortreſſes fraunce began declyne myracle cap cc dyſcomfetture nogent ye riuer seyn lordes men armes fraunce went troye boty cōqueſt brought theder non̄ theyr priſoners ſēt frenche garyſons comōs troye wolde haue ſlayne whan ſuche ſtyll garyſon pouns vnderſtode howe theyr capitayne lorde euſtace taken company ſlayne taken truſſed ſhortly myght departed bicauſe wer fewe lyke wyſe ſo dyd torey eſponay arcy mary pleuſy fortreſſes vnder obeyſaunce lorde euſtace dambreticourt left voyde doubte biſſhop troye lorde broquarte feneſtrages ſyr peter aubeley lefte nat garyſon beauforte john̄ segure nogente albret garyſon gey ryuer seyne ſame ſeaſon dyed ſtrangely caſtell herreell iii leages amienſe lorde johan piquygny ſaid ſtrāgled chamberlayn lyke maner dyed ſyr lucz bekuſey counſaile ſame ſeaſon day certayne cō pany ſyr peter audeleys rode forth entred towne called ronay robbed clene curate maſſe entred churche engliſſhe ſquier toke chalays fro aulter wherin preſt ſhulde haue conſecrated dyd caſte wyne bycauſe preeſt ſpake hym ſtrake hym gauntlet bludde felle vpon aulter departed went feldes ſquier hym patent corporal ſodaynly horſe beganne tourne ſo take none durſte approche nere hym horſe man fell erthe eche ſtrangled ſodaynly tourned pouder companion made vowe neuer aft er violate churche ſame ſeaſon gariſon mauconſell wanted prouyſion ſo ſolde theyr fortreſſe noyon countrey xii motons golde ſo departe theyr goodes ſo went fortreſſes craell cleremount hereell uelly pierpount rouſſey siſſome whiche fortreſſes ben long handes naueroys peace bitwene duke normandy kyng nauer englyſſe whan noyon maucōſel raſſhed erthe alſo john̄ segure ſolde fortreſſe nogent byſſhop troyes certayne ſome florens wherof wrytynge vnder byſſhops ſeale ſo came ye cite troye alyghted byſſhop lodgynge ſayd hym ser john̄ ye ſhall abyde thre foure dayes ye ſhall haue money come thether vnder aſſuraunce byſſhop agreed therto comons cite beganne ſaye howe dothe byſſhop tryfle mocke v ſythe kepeth aboute hym greatteſt brybour robber fraunce wolde ſhulde gyue hym oure money roſe great nōbre ſame opynyon ſente kepe theyr gate ſhulde nat ſkape theym came harneys ſyxe thouſande one ſorte ſlee hym byſſhops lodgynge whan byſſhop ſawe ſayde fayre frendes come hyther vnder ſaue conducte ye knowe treatye bargayne betwene hym accorde hit great ſhame vntrueth vnder aſſurance hym villanye ſo euer ſayd entred halle force ſo chā bre ſought ſo naro welye laſte founde hym ſlewe hym hewed hym peces ¶ howe frenchemen refuſed peace theyr kyng made englande cap cc longe ſythe ſpake kynge englande non̄ occaſion ſpeke hym tyll nowe long treuce endured war • made bitwene aſſoone y• truce exſpired fyrſte day may yere lorde ccc lix daye garyſons engliſſhe naueroyſe made warr title kynge englande anone peace made betwene kyng nauer duke normandy lorde arnolde dandrehen retourned englande nat quytte priſoner takyng batayle poieters ſame ſeaſon kyng englande prince ſonne frenche • ynge lorde jaques bourbon mette london ſo foure allonely guether counſayle agreed vpon peace vpon certayne article wrytten lettre ſent fraunce duke normandy erle ſyr arnolde paſſed ſee arryued boloyn ſo went parys founde duke kynge nauer ther ſhewed letter duke demaunded counſaile kynge nauer dyd counſayle hym prelattes noble fraunce counſayles good townes ſhulde aſſembled whiche thynge done ſemed kyng nauer duke bretherne counſayle realme ſayde treatye greuous borne wherfore anſwered one voyce ſayde two fordes letter brought •• ect therin ſo preiudyciall am▪ realme yet wolde endure greatter myſchiefe done rather myniſſhe ſuch wyſe realme france wolde alſo rather ſuffre kyng lye ſtyll englā de whan french kyng vnderstode realme fraunce wolde nat agre apoyntmēt ſayd ſonne charles ye coū ſayled kyng nauerre deceyueth woll deceyue ſuche xl ye whā kyng englād knewe report ſayd well wynter paſt ſhall entre realme france ſo puyſantly 〈◊〉 ſhall abyde ſo long tyll haue ende warre el peace pleaſure myne honour made gretteſt aparayle euer made ſame ſeaſon aboute myddes auguſt lorde johān craon archbyſſhop reynes cytie parys coūtre ther certayne knightes ſquiers countie • ethell laon went layed ſiege caſtell • oucy ther lay fyue wekes yelded vp lyues goodes ſaued go whyder lyſt letter patentes ſealed archebyſſhop erle porcyen erle brayne whan departed cōmons roſe agaynſt ſlewe moſt part lordes moche payne ſaue captayne hanekyn francoyſe thus therle roucy agayne towne caſtell ¶ howe ſir euſtace danbretycour • delyuerd priſon great raunſome cap cc ii thus wynninge caſtell roucy ſir peter awdeley dyed bedde within y• caſtell beauforde wherof ſuche companyons wer vnder right ſorowfull englyſſhmen almaygnes thought coude better ſyth made warr kyng englande make capitayne ſir euſtace dambreticourt than̄e hole hurtes ſtyll priſonere ſende faucon haraulde therle uandumant ſir henry • ue • ellart putte raunſome lorde ſir euſtace ſo put fynanſe pay xxii thouſande frankes france companyons englyſſhe garyſons champaigne payed ſayd raunſome ſo delyuered agayne courſer hackeney loſt batayle nogent horſes lady iſabell jullyers counteſſe kent englande ſende hym whan theſe cōpanyons lorde euſtace among made hym ſouerayne euery man drewe entred coū tie rethell neuer ſtelth wanne good towne athyen ryuer eſue founde mo hundred peces wyne ther made ſoueraygne garyſon ouer ranne countrey reynes ſpoyled eſpernoy damp • ary trayone good towne uertus wher englyſſhmen great profette ther made another garyſon ouer ranne countrey ryuer marne fertyll myllon athyen ranne dayly meſerees ryuer meuſe douchery chenpoulux ¶ howe ſir broquart feneſtrages made hymſelfe payed force wage duke normādy regent france ca c c iii ſame ſeaſon lorde broquart feneſtrages duke ayde agaynſt thēglyſſhemē naueroyſe holpen put y• fortreſſes champaygne yuell payed wage ther owynge hym thyrtie thouſande frankes ſende certayne meſſangers parys duke gaue none anſwere pleaſure retourned • without money promyſe knyght ſende defyance duke realme fraunce entred good towne called bare ryuer sayne wherin ther wer nyne hundred houſes men robbed y• towne coude nat gette caſtell ſo well kept toke thyem pyllage priſoners brende ſo towne diſtroyed went cōſtans made cheife garyſon dyde countre champaigne yuell vylayne dedes euer dyd englyſſhemen naueroyſe whanne men thus ouer ronne countre duke agreed hym deſyred departed went lorayne fro whens came ſo lefte realme fraunce countrey champaine peace whan done yuels ynowe ſame ſeaſon yere lorde god ccc li • sir robert canoll made iourney thre thouſande one wente marcheſſe bretaygne rode along ryuer loyre entred berry brennyng exylyng countre ſayd taken hym paſſe auuergne go ſe pope cardynalles auygnone haue ſome floring aſwell archpreeſt done ¶ iourney ſir robert canoll made berry auuergne lordes gentylmen countrey purſued hym cap cc iiii suche lordes knightes auuergne cō panyes purpoſe encountre ſir robert canoell came within dayes iourney hym thre thouſande ſpeares sir robert ryden berry brenning exilyng countre entred auuergne reſyſt hym lordes knyghtes aſſembled auuerne lymoſen therle foreſtes iiii c ſpeares thus rode ſir robert canoll men ſuch broght hym loritaygne callyng themſelfe englyſſhmen whan theſe lord • thus within dayes iourney ennemyes ther lodged nyght next day came lodged mountayne nere thenglyſſhmen lodged nother lytell hyll ſo eche theym might ſe others fyers made next mornyng french men auaunced farther noone cāe mountayne right agaynſt englyſſhmen ſo bytwene lytell medowe xii acre lande incontynent englyſſhemen made redy batayle fight ſette archer hangyng hyll frenchman ordayned two batayles euery batayle v men firſt ledde dolphyne auuergne erle cleremont called berault made knyght rearyd baner quartered auuergne merquell lorde robert daulphyn vncle lorde montagu lorde talencon y• lorde cochfort lorde serygnacke lorde godfray boloyne dyuers knightꝭ ſquyers lymoſyn quercy auuergne rouergue ſeconde batayle erle foreſtes lorde john̄ boloyn erle auuergne lorde darchyer ſonnes lorde dachon lorde du • e ſir renalt foreſt • brother therle many knyghtes ſquyers hauyng great deſyre fyght enemyes ſemyng ſyde ſir robert canoll cō pany ſhewed howe hadd alſo great deſyre haue batayle thus bothe hoſtes ſtode ſtyll tyll nere night eche without goynge ſtraytes ſaue certayne yonge knyghtes ſquyers get priſe armes diſcended downe party lycence marſhals came downe medowe iuſted one another wanne felowe hym priſonerr thus night eche partie drewe lodgynges made good watche french lordes went counſayle ordayned hour mydnight ſhulde dyſcend downe fro moūtayne ſyde fro enemyes ward go two leages ſo come otherſyde mountayne ther enemy ſyde y• hyll eaſy inough mount thought cōe ſo erly thyder thēgliſhmen ſhuld nat redy armed nat ſo ſecretly ſpoken y• thenglyſſhmen knoledge therof engliſſhe priſoner y• ſtale away fro frenche hooſt came ſir robert canoll ſhewed mater thā ſir robert wente counſayle ſuche truſted beſt ſo thought thynges cō ſydred nat beſt abyde puyſance frenchman truſſed deꝑted guydes men countrey ſuche priſoners hour mydnight frenchman putte themin array batayle rode ordayned tyme day came moūtayne wher thoght haue founde englyſſhmen whan knewe y• departed cauſed certayne mē mount vp moūtayne ſe coude knowe thynge theym retourned agayne reported howe ſene theym paſſe ſuche away named howe goynge lymoges lymoſyn whan lordes france herde brake vpp̄ iourney deꝑted euery man owne anone mariage made lorde berault daulphyne auuergne doughter erle foreſtes duke burbons ſuſter ¶ almaygnes abode kyng englande calays ryde hym realme france kynge johān beynge ſtyll priſoner englande cap cc v ſeaſon kynge englande made great prouiſyon come frā ce ſuche nat ſene lyke certayne lordes knyghtes empyre ſuche ſerued kyng prouyded ſame yer greatly horſe harneys thynges neceſſary degree aſſoone might came flaunders calays ther bode kynges cōmyng ſo kyng englande came nat ſo ſoone calays ſayde ſhulde haue done wherfore moche people reſorted thyder ſo wyſt nat wher lodge haue ſtablyng horſes alſo bredde wyne hay otes ꝓuiſyons dere ſcant ſo ther none gette golde ſyluer euer ſaid kyng cōmeth next weke thus taryed lordes almaygne behayne brabant flanders heynault fro begynnyng auguſt feeſt ſaynt luke ſo ther many wer fayne ſell beſte part iewelles kyng lodgyng wolde haue ben ſtrayter towne ſo full alſo dout theſe lordes ſpende wolde nat depart fro calays tyll contented agayne expēſes kyng ſende nat fourth part many come owne good wylles truſtynge haue ſome aduauntage ſome thought robbe pyll realme france kyng englande ſende ouer duke lancaſtre foure hundred ſpeares two thouſand archer whan̄e duke came calays theſe lordes ſtraungers made great ioye hym demaūded tidynges kyng commynge duke excuſed kynge taryeng ſo longe ſayde howe prouiſyon natte fully redy ſayd fayre lord • taryeng profyte woll go ryde fraunce ſe fynde ther wherfore ſirs requyre ryde iſhall delyuer certayne ſomme money pay withall coſtes lodgynges ye haue ſpent towne calays ye ſhall haue prouiſion vitayle cary ſomers theſe lordes thought great ſhame refuſe duke offre ſo graunted hym euery man newe ſhodde horſes truſſed deꝑted nobly fro calays duke went ſaynt omers two thouſande ſpeares ſyde archer fotemen paſſed ſaynt omers without aſſaut ſo rode bethwyne paſſed came mount ſaynt eloy good abbey riche two leages fro arras ther taryed four dayes refreſſhe theym horſes founde abbey well wherwith whan robbed waſted countrey rode cambrey ther made great aſſaut ſlayne baneret englande dyuers within defended themſelfe valyantly ayde conforte erle ſaynt poule lorde lamenall two hundred ſpeares came towne backe gate whan thenglyſſhmen ſawe coude gette nothyng departed folowed ryuer sōe great ſcarſnes bred wyne ſo came towne called chereſy founde plentie bredde wyne paſſed ryuer bridge nat broken ther taryed alhalowen day nyght ſame day tydynges came duke howe kyng aryued calays commaundynge hym incontynent drawe towardes hym company retourned towarde calays wt hym alſo ſir henry flaunders two hundred ſpeares brabant ſir henry beautreſen lorde bergues lorde gerarde de la herde lorde frāque de halle • heynault lorde gaultyer mā ny lorde john̄ gomegynes behayne ſir gaultyer de la haultpon ſir reynolde de boulaunt lorde godfray hardnamont lord john̄ ſonne lorde dura thyrey ferram lorde ruſe junepe lorde gyles sorles lorde john̄ bermont lorde reynolde berg • he dyuers almaygnes mercenaryes ſtrange countreis canne nat name preſent tyme ¶ great hoſt kynge england brought france make warre kyng john̄ beyng priſoner england order englyſſhe hooſt cap cc vi duke lācaſtre theſe lordes retourned towardes calys mette way foure leages fro calays ſo gret multytude people countrey couered therwith ſo rychely armed beſene great ioye beholde freſſhe ſhinyng armour baners w •• ynge wynde cōpanyes good order ridyng ſoft paſe whan duke theſe lordes mette kyng feeſted thanked ſeruyce theſe almayns mercenaryes brabances behannoyes togyder ſhewed vnto kyng howe ſpent goodes horſes harnes ſolde lytell nothyng left theym hym ſeruyce entent cōe nat wherwith go home agayn vnto countreis ſhuld depart wherfore deſyred noblenes take ſome regarde kyng anſwered ſayd howe nat redy gyue theym playne aunſwere ſayde ſirs thynke ye traueyled wherfore go wayes refreſſhe two thre dayes calays nyght morowe ſhall take counſell ſende vnto ſuche anſwere reaſon ye ſhalbe content theſe ſtrangers departed fro kynge fro duke rode towarde calays nat ryden halfe leage farther met great multytude caryages prince wale nobly richely beſene company wherof ther ſuche nombre coū trey couered rode ſoft paſe redy raynged batayle though ſhulde incontynent haue fought thus rode euer leage two kynges hooſt caryages bytwene hooſtes whiche order theſe ſtrāgers lyked marueluſly well ¶ whan theſe ſtrāgers well regarded company reuerently ſaluted prince ſuch lordes hym prince louyngly receyued thē coude ryght well toke leaue hym ſhewed hym nede deſyringe wolde regarde neceſſytie gladly promyſed thē ſo rode tyll came calays ſeconde day kyng ſent anſwere thre ſufficient knyghtes ſhewed theym playnly kynge nat brought hym treaſur ſufficient pay deſyred performe enterprice hath taken hande wolde go forthe hym take ſuche fortune falleth good yuell good fortune wynnyng fall haue part ſo demaunde wage loſſe horſe ſpence damage maye happ̄ haue ſaid kyng broght men ynough relame furnyſſhe enterprice anſwere pleaſedd nat greatly theſe lordes cōpany ſore traueyled ſpended goodes layed horſes harnes pledge ſolbe neceſſytie howbeit coude haue nothynge el kyng delyuerd thē certayn ſomme money bring home countrey howe beit ſome thoſe lordes went agayne kyng ſerue hym aduenture thought ſhame retourne agayne without thyng doyng ſhall deuyſe ſō order kyng englande toke departed england nat thyng ſhortly paſſe ouer ther neuer departed englande ſuche army ſo well ordred ¶ kyng departed realme made lordes france ſuche priſoners put dyuers pla • e ſtronge caſtelles realme ſurer thē frenche kyng ſet towre lō yonge ſonne hym moche pleaſure ſport reſtrayned ſtraytlyer kept euery man commaunded go douer ſhyppes redy paſſe ouer ſo euery man drewe thyder none abode home bytwene age twentie threſcore nere hande lordes knyghtes ſquyers went douer except ſuche kyng apoynted kepe realme caſtels march hauyns ſame whan aſſembled douer kynge toke muſters ſayde playnly entencyon paſſe ouer realme france nat retourne agayn tyll made ende warre el ſufficyent peace great honour profet el dye payne therfore ſayd nat well wylling go ouer returne agayn backe euery man ſayd gladde ſerue hym ſo entred ſhyppes name god ſaynt george arryued calays two dayes feeſt alſayntes yere lorde ccc lix ¶ kyng england departed fro calais order hoſt ridyng picardy ſo cytie reynes cap cc vii whan kyng prince ſon arryued calys alſo thre ſonnes ſay lorde lyonell erle ulſter lorde john̄ erle rychmont ye lorde edmonde yongeſt foure people hadde dyſcharged ſhyppes horſes prouyſion taryed ther foure dayes euery man cō maunded make redy depart ſayeng howe wolde ryde coſyn duke lancaſtre kyng mornyng departed fro calays company caryages beſt order euer army yſſued oute towne ſayd ſixe thouſand charyettes carte brought england well furnyſſhed ordred bataylles ſo richely beſene ioye beholde cōſtable erle de la marche fyue hundred knyghtes armed thouſand archer batayle kyngꝭ batayle thre thouſande men armes v thouſande archer good order ridyng conſtables batayle next kyngꝭ batayle came caryage contayned two leagꝭ length mo fyue thouſand charyettes carte caryeng prouiſyon y• hooſt withall thynges houſeholde nat beſene caryed men warre handmylles ouyns bake ſuche thynges neceſſary next came prince batayle bretherne wherin two thouſande ſpeares nobly horſed richely beſene order redy fyght rode nat paſt four leages day maner encountred duke lancaſtre ſtrange lordes bytwene calys abbey lykes fayre playn kynges hooſt ther fyue hundred varlettes wt matockes ax make euyn wayes caryage paſſe ¶ nowe ſhall name vnto certayne lordes knyghtes englande paſſed ſee kynge company duke lancaſtre kynges coſyn germayn firſt iiii ſonnes prince edward ſir lyonell ſir johāne ſir edmonde ſir henry duke lancaſtre ſir john̄ erle de la marche cōſtable englande erle warwyke erle suffolke marſhall englande erle herforde northampton erle salyſbury therle stafforde erle oxenford byſſhop lyncolne byſſhoppe dyrham lorde percy lorde neuell lorde spenſer lorde roſe lorde manny lorde renolde cobham ye lorde monbray lorde dalawar • lorde john̄ chandos ſir rycharde penbruge lorde manne lorde wylloughby lorde feltone lorde baſſet lorde crabalton lorde syluā • yer ſir james awdeley ſir bartylmewe de brunes 〈◊〉 lorde salyche ſir stephyn gonſanton ſir hewe haſtynges ſir johān lyſle ſir nowell lormych dyuers nat name rode arthoyes paſſed cytie arras toke ſame way duke lancaſtre paſte coude fynde nothynge lyue playne countrey lefte put fortreſſes alſo coūtre ben long poore ſore waſted dere ſeaſon realme france great famyne ranne generally contre yerth nat ben laboured thre yer otes whete nat come heynault cambreſis people arthoyes uermādoys byſſhoprike laone reynes dyed hūger kyng englande departed owne realme herde great famyne countre lordes brought prouyſion except otes ſtrawe wherfore made good ſhyft horſes might alſo ſeaſon ſore reyning weyt dyd great trouble horſes alſo mooſt part day night reyned without ceaſe ſo wyne yere lytell worth kyng england rode ſmall iourneys tyll aproched balpauſmes ſhall ſhewe aduēture fyll ſir galahault rybamont right hardy expert knyght picardy ye ſhall knowe townes cyties caſtelles paſſages way kyng went ſurely kept euery towne picardy tooke ſoudyours wage ſuretie erle ſaynt poule two hundred ſpeares cytie arras conſtable fraunce amyenſe lorde monſalt corby ſir edwarde rancy ſir ingram hedyn balpauſmes ſir baudwyn dannekyns maiſter croſbowes ſaynt nuyntines thus euery towne cytie knewe playnly kyng englande wolde come ley ſiege reynes ſo peron uermandoys whiche kyng englandes way capitayne ruler towne englyſſhmen aproched dayly wherfore nat well eaſe towne ſtandeth ryuer sōe thenglyſſhmen lightly euer folowed ryuers laſt peron remembred ſir galahaut rybamont nat receyued capitayne towne enfourmed tourney ſende courteſſe letter hym deſyryng wolde helpe kepe towne perone ſuche company coude gette promyſed gyue owne perſon euery day twentie frākes euery knight vnder hym ten euery ſpeare thre horſes one franke day sir galahaut deſyred exercyſe feat armes ſawe howe deſyred thē peron neyghburs lightly agreed ſende thē worde howe wolde ſeconde day prepared hym gette ſuche company coude ſo departed fro tourney thyrtie hym alwayes nombre encreaſed ſende ſir roger coloyne mete hym certayne place apoynted ſir roger came thyder twentie hym laſt ser galahaut fyftie ſpeares lodged one night ꝓchynge peron warde within two leages thenglyſſhe hooſt lytell vyllage feldes whiche boyde people countrey fledde fortereſſes next mornyng defmyned entre peron nat farre then whan ſupper hour mydnight ſette watche iangeled one another dyuers mater ser galahault ſayde ſhalbe morowe betymes peron yet entre ſhall counſell ryde frōter enemyes thinke ſome among theym auaunce themſelfe ſeke ſome forage woll come abrode mornyng may fortune mete ſuche ſhall pay ſcotte agreed company kept ſecrete brekyng day redy horſes ſadled ſo rode forthe good order went way peron cooſted wodes ſe coude fynde aduētur ſo came vyllage people fortyfied church ſir galahaut lighted knewe well bredde wyne vitaylles within offered hym take wolde whyle ther ſir galahalt called two ſquyers wherof bridoll tallone one ſayd thē ſirs go ryde forth foldes dyſcouer countre euery way loke ye ſe thynge come hyder agayne woll abyde theſe two ſquyers well horſed rode forthe feldes went wood halfe leage thenſe ſame mornynge ryden forthe ſir renault boulant almaygne company duke lācaſters returnyng agayne ſo came ſame place two ſquyers wende ben ſome men armes countre ther buſſhement laſt ſpyed well howe almaygnes than̄e two ſquyers ſpake toguyder ſayd muſt fayne v partie ſir renault boulant ſpake demaūded language almaygne bridoll anſwered coude well ſpeke lā gage ſayd ſir ꝑtayning ſir bartylmewe de bonnes wher ſir bartylmewe ſayd ſir renolde ſir ſayd yā der vyllage dothe tary ſayde knyght ſir ſayde v heſende v abrode ſe coude fynde forage abrode countre fayth ſayd knyght none haue ryden mornyng canne fynde nothyng wherfore go ryde hym bydde hym come away let v ryde togyder toward ſaynt quyntines ſe fynde ther better market good aduē ture sir ſayd ſquyer wolde haue hym cōpany call ꝙ knyght renolde boulande ſay ſo ſir bartylmewe two ſquiers returned vyllage aſſone ſir galahault ſawe demaunded tidynges haue ye thing ſone yes ſir ꝙ haue ſene ynough sir yander wood ſir renold boulant xxx wt hym hath ryden morning deſyreth ſore haue company ryde togyder towardeſaynt quyntines ꝙ ſir galahaut ſay sir renolde boulant knight almayne reteyned kyng englande y• ſir knowe well ſayde ſquyers howe departed fro hym ſayde ſir galahaut ſhall ſhewe ſayd ſir bridoll ſhewed hym ye wordes ben bytwene whan ſir galahaut herde ſtudyed lytell demaunded counſayle ſir ronger colayne ſuche knightes ther beſt anſwered ſayde ſir ye deſyre euer fynde aduentur ſyth fall handes take theym alwayes right armes man ought greue ennemy counſayle lightly agreed ſir galahault deſyrous fynde enemyes lept courſer dyd baſenet vyſer bycauſe wolde natte knowen ſo dyd cōpany yſſued vyllage toke feldes determyned wolde ſo rode ye right hande warde wode wher ſir reynold taryed lx • men armes ſir renolde nat paſt x •• whan ſir renolde ſawe theym diſplayed bauer hym came ſoftely ridynge towarde wenyng hym englyſſhmen whan̄e aproched lyft vp vyſer ſaluted ſir galahaut name ser bartylmewe de bonnes sir galahaut helde hymſelfe ſtyll ſecrete anſwered fayntly ſayd lette v ryde forth ſo rode men one ſyde almaygnes whan ſir reynolde boulant ſawe maner howe ſir galahaut rode ſomtyme hym ſpake worde thā began ſuſpecte nat ryden ſo ſpace quart houre ſtode ſtyll vnder baner among men ſayd ſir haue dout knyght ye thynke ye nat ſir bartylmewe de bonnes knowe hym well ſe well nat woll ye tell yo • name ryde farther company therwith ſir galahaut lyft vp vyſer rode towardes knyght haue taken hym raygne bridell cryed lady rybamont ſir roger coloyne ſayde coloyne reſcue whan ſir renold boulāt ſawe caſe nat greatly afrayed drewe ſwerde ser galahaut wolde haue taken hym bridell ſir reynolde put ſwerde clene throught hym drue agayne ſwerd hym toke horſe ye ſpurres left ſir galahaut ſore hurt whan ſir galahaltes men ſawe maiſter caſe ſore dyſpleaſed ſette ſir renaldes men ther many caſt yerth aſſoone ſir renolde gyuen ſir galahaut ſtroke ſtrake horſe ſpurres toke feldes certayne galahaultes ſquyers chaſed hym whan ſawe folowed ſo ner muſt tourne agayne el beſhamed lyke hardy knight tourned abode tormaſt gaue hym ſuche ſtroke y• lyſt folowe thus rode ſerued thre folowed hym woūded ſore good ben handes euery ſtroke ſtayne man dyd ſo moche daunger frenchman ſaued hymſelfe without hurt enemyes reputed gret prowes ſo dyd y• herde therof men ner ſlayne taken fewe ſaued ſir galahault caryed fro thenſe ſore hurt perone hurte neuer perfetly hole knyght ſuche courage hurt wolde nat ſpare hymſelfe wherfore lyued nat longe nowe lette v retourne kyng englande ſhe howe layed ſiege 〈◊〉 reynes ¶ howe kyng englande beſieged cite reynes caſtell chargny taken thenglyſſhmen warre began agayne bytwene duke normā dy kyng nauer cap c c viii englyſſhmen dyde ſomoche paſſed atthoyes founde poore contrey ſo entred cambreſis founde better market nothyng put fortreſſes bycauſe thought thēſelfe well aſſured kyng englande cōpany bycauſe helde thempyre y• kyng englande thought nat ſo kyng went lodged beauuoyes cambreſis ther abode foure dayes refreſſhe horſes ouer ranne mooſt part cābreſis byſſhopp̄ pyer cambray coū ſaylles lordes countrey good townes ſaue conduct ſend certayne meſſangers kyng englande knowe tytell made warre anſwered bycauſe tyme paſte made alyance conforted frenchman mayntened townes fortereſſes maner made warre enemyes wherfore englyſſhmen ſayd might well y• reaſon make warre agayne anſwere coude haue non wherfore cā breſys fayne bere damage aſwell might thus kyng england paſſed cambreſis ſo went thierache men ranne ouer countrey ſydes toke forage wher might gette day ſir bartylme de bonnes ranne ſaynt quintyne aduēture mette capitayne therof called ſir baudewyn danekyn ther great fray bytwene thē many ouerthrowen bothe partes finally englyſſhmen obtayned vyctorie ſir baudwyn taken priſoner y• bartylmew bonnes thenglyſſhmen retourned kyng lodged abbey fenney vitaylles ynought horſes rode forthe without lette tyll came march reynes kynge tooke lodgynge ſaynt wall beyonde reynes prynce wale ſaynt thierry duke lancaſtre erles barownes knyghtes lodged vyllages aboute reynes nat caſe hert wynter ſaynt andrewes tyde great wyndes rayne horſes yuell lodged entreated countrey two thre yere yerth nat benla boured wherfore forage gette abrode vnder x xii leages wherby many frayes ſomtyme thēgliſſhmen wan ſomtyme loſt good cytie reynes tyme capitayne ſir john̄ craon archbyſſhoppe ſame place erle porcyen ſir porcyen brother lorde de la bonne lorde canency lorde annore lorde lore dyuerſe lordes knyghtes ſquyers march reyns defended cytie ſo well tooke damage ſiege duryng cytie ſtronge well kept kynge england alſo wolde nat ſuffre aſſaut made bycauſe wolde nat traueyle hurte people kynge abode ſiege fro feeſt ſaynt andre beginnyng lent hoſt rode often tymes abrode fynde ſome aduēture ſome coūtie rethell warke mayſey douchery moyſon wolde lodge hoſt thre foure dayes robhe pylle couſrey without reſiſtence agayne repaire ooſt ſame ſeaſon • yr • uſtace 〈◊〉 breticourt toke good towne acherey ryuer eſne therin founde great plē tye victailles ſpecially wyne foūde ther veſſels wherof ſend great part kynge prince gaue hym great thauke therfore duryng ſiege knyghtes ſought aduentures fortuned ſyr john̄ chanoos ſyr james audeley lorde mucident ſir richarde pountchardon companyes rode ſo nere chalons champaigne came chargny en dormoy •• ryght faire caſtell well auewed made aſſaute couetted greatly haue caſtell two good knightes one named ſyr john̄ chapel bare armes gold ancre sable ſore aſſaute aſſaute lord mucident aduentured hym ſelfe ſo forewarde ſtryken heed ſtone ſuche wyſe dyed amonge men whoſe dethe knightes ſo ſore viſpleaſed ſware nat departe thenſe tyll caſtell theyr pleaſure wherby aſſawte encreaſſed many ſeaſes armes done gaſcoyns ſore diſpleaſed dethe theyr maiſter capitayne lorde mucident entred dyke without feare came walles moūted vp theyr targes ouer theyr hedes mean tyme archars ſhotte ſo holy guyther none appered without great parell caſtell ſo ſore aſſayled laſte taken 〈◊〉 loſſe hurte many 〈◊〉 two capytaynes taken certayne ſquyers reſide 〈◊〉 ſlayne oute mercy raſed downe brent muche myght caſtell bycauſe wolde nat kepe retourned theyr 〈◊〉 ſhewed kynge done duryng ſiege reinnes began agayne great grudge euyll wyll betwene kynge nauer duke normandye reaſon cauſe nat tell ſo kynge nauer departed ſodaynly parys went maunte ryuer seyne de • ied duke normandy bretherne great meruayle tytle renewed agayne warre ſo 〈◊〉 ſhadowe warre ſquyer bruceis called 〈◊〉 oſtraſte toke ſtronge callell robeboyls ryuer seyne leage maunte made garyſō whiche dy • moche hurte parys therabout alſo ſame ſeaſon lorde gommegines gone englāde quene whan kyng ſent ſtraūgers calayes repaſſed ſee agayn came heynalt hys companye certayne knyghtes ſquyers gaſcoyn england theyr entente go kynge englande ſo ſiege reines yonge lorde gommegines deſyrynge haue auauncement aſſembled certayne men warre guether iii c oone ſo departed maubuge ſo came ueſnes haynaulte paſſed forthe atrelon ſame tyme lorde ray laye grayſon ray thieraſe good nombre knyghtes ſquiers hym knewe ſuche ſpyeng made lorde gommegines aſſembled certayne • warre guether go y• ſiege reinnes ayde kynge englande knewe well muſt paſſe thierraſſe ſoone knewe certaynte ſettynge forewarde ſente worde therof certayne companyons thereaboute frenche partye ſpecyally lorde robert chanoyne roberſart gouerned yong erle coucis landes lay caſtell merle whan chanoyne knewe therof nat colde ſette forward incontinent went lorde roy ſourty ſpeares ther lorde roy made chie • capytayne iourney hit good reaſon great lorde pycardye well renowmed man armes well knowen many place went forthe nombre thre hundred men armes laye buſſhement knewe lorde gommegines ſhuld paſſe entred thieraſſe toke way reinnes nat doubtyng encountryng ſo mornynge came vyllage called haberguy thought reſt littell refreſſ hym company ſo alyghted entred y• village ſtable theyr horſes meane ſeaſon lorde gommegynes yong luſty ryght deſirous dedes armes ſayde howe wolde tyde village ſe yf coulde fyne better forage▪ toke hym certayne criſto 〈◊〉 • quyer bare penon ſo departed • abergey frenchemen ſay buſſhement lyttell village thynkyng haue entred towne nyght haue ſette theyr ennemyes knew well y• lorde g • meg • e fel ha •• whan frenchemen ſawe hym comynge ſo pre • company meruayle fyrſte ſent afore two currers brought worde agayne theyr • nnemyes whan harde brake theyr buſſhement cryed roy name lorde roy lord roy came bane • hym diſpla • ed hym lorde flamōt roy coſyn ſyr loys roberſart • hanoyn roberſart brother ſyr ••• ſtram bo • ne roy whan lorde gömegines ſawe caſe like hardy knyght abode ennemies wolde nat flee fyrſt brount lorde gömegines ouerthrowen coude nat ce • ouer vp agayne ſo finally taken two ſquyers gaſcoyne hym fought right val • auntly alſo criſtoferde mur taken bare penon ſlayne taken excepte theyr varlettes ſcaped ronnynge awaye well horſed alſo nat chaſed ¶ howe lorde roy dyſcomfetted lord gōmegines caſtell commercy taken engliſſhemen cap cc ix wwhan knyghtes ſquyers taken lorde gōmegines ſuche iſſued village hym toke theyr horse y• ſpo •• • anne village c • yenge roy name lorde roy wherof 〈◊〉 towne wer ſore abaſſhed whan ſaw theyr ennemyes ſo nere moſt parte 〈◊〉 vnarmed ſpred abrode village ſo • oude nat drawe together frenchemen toke theym theyr 〈◊〉 cha • • ne roberſart 〈…〉 priſonners bycause knowen baner fledde littell ſtronge howſe enuyroned water ſtandynge townes ende ſome theym ſayd howe beſt kepe affirmynge howe houſe ſtrenge ynough kepe tyl might ſend worde caſe wer kynge englande beyng ſiege reinnes nat doubtynge woll incontinent ſende ſome ayde ſome ſayd ſo doynge ſuerte theym ſeynge howe theyr ennemyes rounde thus ſtryfe among ſelfe myght mean ſpace theder came lorde roy ſayd ſ • r yelde vp ſelfe aſſaile ye deed incō • ynent ſhall take per force thoſe workes mooſt hardyeſt abaſſhed ſo yelded theymſelfe pryſoners theyr lyues ſaued allouly ſent priſoners caſtell coucy frenche garyſons aduenture fell yere lorde ccc lix wherof kyng englande whan knew ſore diſpleaſed coude nat amend tyme nowe let v returne ſiege • nne ſpeke aduenture y• fell ſyr bertilmewe brennes beſieged towne caſtell comercy within capitayne knyght champaygne called ſyr henry denoyr ſiege durynge reyns lordes oſt lodged abrode coūtrey lie theyr eaſe kepe wayes prouyſion ſhulde entre citie amonge ſyr bertilmewe de bonnes company ſpeares archer lodged nere comercy ſtrong caſtell parteynynge ar • hebyſſhoppe reynes whiche byſſhop made ſtronge garyſon ſo caſtell doubted none aſſaute ther • ſquare tou • e thick walled fenſably fourniſſhed warre syr bartilmewe de bonnes layde ſiege therto ſawe well howe coulde nat wynne aſſaute ſet warke certayne numbre miner gaue good wage begā werk night day dyd ſo moche myned farre vnder great towre went ſette vp proppes ſo within knewe nothyng therof whan myners made ende ſo towre 〈◊〉 fall whā • yſt ▪ came ser bar 〈…〉 ſayd syr haue ſo 〈◊◊◊〉 great towte ſhall fall whan pleaſeth well quo • knyght ye haue well done • tyll commaun • e toke johsi de guyltell hym went caſtell madeſigne wold ſpeke ſome within syr henry denoyr capitayne cameto bat •• mentes y• walles demaunded wolde haue woll ſayd ſyr bartilmewe ye ye •• york orels ye deed without remedy howe ſo quod ſyr henry began ſmyle prouyded thynges ye wolde haue v yelde ſymply whiche woll nat well quod bartilmewe ye knewe caſe ye ſtande ye wolde •• continent yelde vp withoute 〈◊〉 wordes quod ſyr henry caſe 〈◊〉 quod englyſſhe knyght ſhall ſhewe ye ſhall haue aſſurance entre agayn ye lyſte ſyr henry iiii hy •• iſſued came ſyr bar 〈…〉 johsi • e guyltelles brought hym myne shewed hym great toure ſtode ſtages tymbre whan knyght ſawe parell hys company ſayd syr 〈◊〉 ye haue done great 〈◊〉 yelde v pleaſure ſyr bartilme toke priſoners made euery mā come castell al theyr goodes ſet • yer myne brent ſtages toure claue ſouder fell erthe lo • 〈◊〉 ſyr 〈…〉 mewe ser henry beholde nowe yf 〈◊〉 truth nat syr trueſayd ser hery priſoners pleaſure thanke courteſye 〈◊〉 v caſe ſhulde nat haue ſo delte thus garison 〈◊◊〉 taken priſoners ca • tell 〈◊〉 kynge englande la • e ſiege reinnes vii weekes made none aſſaute knew well ſhuld haue loſt payne whan ha • 〈◊〉 ſo longe wer • hys men coulde fynde forage abrode loſt horſes beganne la • ke 〈◊〉 bay departed good 〈◊〉 • • e waye chalo • champaygne 〈◊〉 chalons 〈◊〉 ſo went 〈◊◊◊〉 •• nged mery 〈◊〉 〈◊◊〉 〈…〉 whiche called viii leages kynge laye mery counſtable • awarde went ſaynt florentyne ſy • edwarde rency capitayne ther great aſſaute good dyd kynge came thither lodged ther • yuer mouson departed came tonnerre toke towne aſſaute nat y• caſtell whiche towne englyſſhemen founde beyonde 〈◊〉 myne whiche neceſſary 〈◊〉 within caſtell lorde fyennes conſtable fraunce great nombre men warre ¶ howe kyng englande went waſted diſtroyed countrey howe came aguillo • taried great prouysyon came • oſt cc 〈◊〉 chapitre kynge englande ooſt • eſted 〈◊〉 ſpace v dayes 〈◊〉 yt good wynes foūde oftē tymes aſſayled ye caſtell therin goode men armes ſyr baudwyn •• neken maiſte • croſbowes whan kynge well refreſſhed ooſt tonuer departed paſſed ryuer armencon lefte waye auſſetre ryght hande toke waye noyers entent entre borgoyn • lente tyme paſſed noyers without aſſaute lorde therof priſone • euer ſyth bata • le poicters ſo kynge went towne called mo • royall ſo thenſe aguillon riuer selettes ſquier called john • enſon bare armes azute aſko • hy • ſyluer wonne towne flauigny nat farre theuſe founde therin great prouyſion maner victaylles ſerue y• oo •• ſpace moneth whiche came welle paſſe kynge laye aguillon fro wednysday tyll mydlēt alwayes •• hals currou • ouer • anne coūtrey waſtynge e • ilynge often tymes refreſſhed ooſt newe prouiſion kynge englande great men 〈◊〉 euer theym cariages • emes pa •• lion mylles ouyns forge syeth bake forge ſhoos horſes thynges neceſſary 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 carte euery carte leſt 〈◊〉 good horſes brought englande alſo brought theſe carte certayne botes made lether ſubtilly wrought ſufficiently • uery one receyue iii men row water riuers fyſſhe pleaſure whiche dyd great lorde moche pleaſure lent ſeaſon alſo kynge 〈…〉 ▪ • • koners horſbacke haukes 〈…〉 ple houndes many greyhoū 〈…〉 • ere euery daye eyther hunted hauked ryuer pleaſed hym 〈…〉 r great lordes hundes 〈◊〉 well kyng euer oſt 〈◊〉 went thre datailes euery ••• ayle vawarde euery ooſt lodged themſelfe eche leage th • kynge kept thirde bataile whiche moſt greatteſt maner kepte fro tyme remoued calais tyll came good towne charter kynge englande laye aguillon great • uiſion ooſt meanes john̄ alenſon found f • auig • whyle kynge lay aguillon th • yonge duke burgoyne counſayle requeſt al countrey ſent kyng englande certayne meſſangers lordes knyghtes treate reſpite nat burne • countrey ouer ronne theſe lordes went treate mater fyrſt lorde ser • ceaulme sallins great chaū 〈…〉 burgoyn ser jaques uiēne ser john̄ • e • ye ser hugh uiēne ser william tho ••• ſe ser john̄ mo • tmartin theſe lordes foūde kyng englande ſo treatable y• ther compoſicion made betwene ye kyng englande countrey bourgoyn kynge made aſſuraunce hym nat ouer ren countrey ſpace • ▪ iii yeres • haue redy ſomme ii frankes whan treaty agreed ſealed kynge diſlodged al ooſt • ke right waye paris lodged ye ••• er dyonne leon beſyde uoſelay peple laye alonge ryuer ſyde welnere 〈…〉 thentre coūtie neuers engliſſhemen entred gaſtenoys kyng ſped hym ſo iourneis y• came 〈◊〉 paris lay ii leagꝭ thēs burg • le royne thus kynge rode countrey diſtroyeng hym alſo garyſons made warre hym beauuoiſy • pycardy france brye chāpaigne deſtroyed nere countrey alſo kyng nauer march normā dy made alſo ſore warre thus ye noble realme france ſore greued ſides ſpecially ſyr euſtace dambreticourt laye chemy y• riuer eſne great gariſon ſoudiers waſted raunſommed pilled countrey ouer ranne countie rethel douchery meſieres chene pou • lleux • tenay countie bay rode lay countrey lyſt ii iii nyghtꝭ together without let trouble whan lyſt retourned agayne fortreſſe chemy true lordes knyghtes countrey thereabout ſore diſpleaſed fortreſſe aſſigned many dayes amonge ſelfe mete go lay ſiege chemy howe neuer dyd nothyng theſe companyons whoymagined nyght day howe might geat ſteale townes fortreſſes ▪ nyght • ame ſtrong towne good caſtell laonnoyſe nere montague fortreſſe called pierpont ſtandyng mareſſe ye ſame ſeaſon within towne great nōbre men coūtrey brought thither theyr goodes truſt ſtrēgth place whan chemy came thither watche within 〈◊〉 ſpared nat dangeroꝰ mareſſes went came walles ſo entred towne wāne without defence • obded pleaſure found ther rich euer founde towne wh • day brent y• towne returned che •• well furnyſſhed great pyllage ¶ kyng england put realme frāce great tribulaciō ꝓphicies frere auygnon thengliſſhe buſſhement layd paris cap c c xi ſeaſon frere minor full great clergie cite auignō called frere john̄ roche tayllade whiche frere pope innocent vi held priſon caſtell baignoux ſhewyng many meruailes come principally ſhewen many thynges fall prelate churche great ſuper •• uitie pryde vſed amonge theym alſo ſpake many thynges fall realme fraunce great lordes chri 〈…〉 ome oppreſſions dyd pore comō people frere ſayd wolde proue ſayynges auctorite ap ••• lippi bokes holy ſayntes prophettes y• whiche wer opened hym grace y• holy gooſte ſhewed many thynges harde beleue many thynges fell ſay • ſayd nat prophette ſhewed auctorite aunciēt ſcriptures grace holy gooſt gaue hym v • derſtādynge declare auncient proph • cie • ſhewe criſten people yeres tyme whan ſuche thynges ſhulde • made dyuerſe bookes founded great • ciences clergie wherof one made yere lorde ccc xlvi wherin written ſuche meruailes hard • beleue howe many thynges accordyng therto • ell whan demaūded warres france ſayd ben ſeen nat lyke ſhulde ſeen ſayde warres fraunce ſhulde nat ended tyll realme vtterly waſted exyled euery parte whiche ſayeng well ſeen noble realme fraunce ſore waſted exyled ſpecially y• terme ſayd frere ha • ſette whiche yeres lorde ccc 〈◊〉 lvii lviii lix ſayde thoſe yeres pryncis gentylmen realme 〈◊◊〉 feare ſhewe ſelfe agaynſt people 〈◊〉 lowe eſtate aſſembled cou 〈…〉 without heed capitayne ſhulde 〈◊〉 lyſte realme fraunce whiche 〈◊〉 ye haue herde howe companyons aſſembled theym guether 〈◊〉 〈…〉 son theyr robbery pyllage wa •• riche became great capitaynes nowe lette v retourne kynge englande laye bourge royne two lyttell leages • ro parys ooſte towardes mou 〈…〉 hery kynge ſente herauldes paris duke normandy laye great companye men warre demaunde batayle duke wolde nat agree therto meſſangers returned without thynge 〈◊〉 whan kynge ſawe ſhulde hau • batayle ſore • iſpleaſe • 〈◊〉 gaulter manny deſyred kynge myght make ſ • rymyſhe bayles parys kynge agreed therto named ſuche ſhulde go hym kyng made certayne newe knyghtes lorde fitz wa • er lorde siluacier ſyr balaſtre y• william torceaux ſyr thomas spencer ſyr johan neuell ſyr richarde doſtenay alſo kynge wolde haue made knyght colla •• dambreticourte ſonne ſyr nicholas ſquier kynges body ſqu • e • excuſed hym ſelfe ſayde coulde nat fynde baſſenette lorde manny dyd enterpriſe ▪ brought theſe new knyghtes ſkrymyſhe barrier parys ſore ſkrymyſhe within cite mane good knyghtes ſquiers wolde gladly haue iſſued ye duke normandy wold agreed therto howe defended theyr gate barryers ſuche wyſe • toke litell • ammage ſkrymy •• endured mornynge tyll noone diuers hurte partyes lorde manny withdrewe lodgynge taryed daye nexte nyght folowynge next daye kyng 〈…〉 ged toke waye towarde moutlehe • y▪ certayne knyghtes englande ga • coyne theyr diſlodgyng determined ly • buſſhment thought ther ſo many gentylmē parys ſome wold aduenture iſſue oute ſo two hundred choſen men armes gaſcoyns engliſſhe layed ſelfe buſſhemēt voyd houſe iii leages fro parys captall buz ▪ ſer edmonde pomiers y• lorde courton gaſcoyns ther engliſſhe lorde neuell lorde mombray ſyr richarde pounchardon theſe vi knyghtes chie • capitaynes imbu • ſhement whan frenchemen parys ſawe dyſlodgynge englyſſhe ooſt certayne yonge knyghtes drewe guether ſayd good iſſued cite ſecretly folowe engliſſhe ooſt perauenture may happe ſomwhat wynne anone agreed y• purpoſe ſyr ra •• coucy ſir rau • remenall lorde montſault lorde helay chatelayne beauuoys begue uillaines lorde beauſiers lorde ulbari • ▪ ſir gauwen ualouell ſir fla • ant roy ſyr • elles cauilly ſyr peter • armoiſes peter sauoiſe 〈◊〉 • peares theyr cōpany iſſued well horſed well wylled ſome dede armes rode way bourge le royne paſſed rode ſo forwarde paſſed y• engliſſe buſſhemēt whan paſſed englyſſhe men gaſcoynes brake ſette cryeng theyr cryes trenchemen returned great meruaile incontinent knewe howe theyr ennemies ſtode ſtyll ſet ſelfe ordre batayle couched ſpeares agaynſt engliſſhmen gaſcoyns firſt metynge ſore iuſtꝭ diuerſe caſt erthe bothe party wer well horſed thā drew theyr ſwerdes entred eche amōg gyuyng great ſtrokes done many propre feat armes fight endured great ſpace ſo none coulde tell ſhulde haue victory ther y• captall buz proued hym ſelfe good knyght dyd handes noble dedes armes finally engliſſhemen gaſcoyns bare ſelfe ſo well victorie abode theyr part many half many agayne frenche men frenche ꝑtie lord cāpremy good knyght fought valiauntly vnder baner bare ſlayne lorde taken priſoner frēche knyghtes ſquiers ſeing theyr euyll aduenture retourned towarde parys fought euer fled ſore pourſewed chace endured tyll paſte bourg le royne taken ix knyghtes ſquiers englyſſhemē gaſcoyns purſewed nat doubted iſſuynge paris ben takē ſlayne whan done theyr feat retourned moūtlehery kyng england brought thither theyr priſoners raunſomed courteſly ſame nyght ſuffred go whither lyſte truſted theyr faithes entencion kynge englande entre good countrey b • au • ſe ſo drawe alonge ryuere loyre ſo yt ſomer abyde britayne tyll auguſt vyntage retourne agayne france lay ſiege parys wolde nat retourne agayne englande bicauſe ſayd departed englande wolde nat retourne agayne tyll fraunce pleaſure lefte men gariſons make warre france champayn poicton ponthieu uimeu uulgeſyn normandy al realme fraunce good townes cite ſuche toke parte theyr owne good wylles ſeaſon duke normandye parys two bretherne duke orle aunſe theyr vncle counſailes ymagined well courage kyng englande howe mēbrought realme frāce great pouerte ſawe well howe realme coulde nat longe endure caſe rente y• lordes church nygh loſt euery parte ſage diſcrete perſone chauncellour fraunce called ſyr william montague byſſhop tyrwin whoſe coūſaile moche frāce ruled good cauſe • euer counſayle good true hym ii clerkes great prudence abbotte clugny maiſter frier prechers called ſyr symon langres maiſter diuinite theſe two clerkes deſyre duke normandy hole counſaile fraunce departed paris certayn article peace ſyr hewe geneue lorde autun company went kynge englande rode beauſſe towarde galardon theſe two clerkes ii knyghtes ſpake y• kyng began fall treatye peace hym hys alies whiche treatye prince wale duke lācaſtre erle marche called treatie nat concluded longe dryuynge allwayes kyng went forward theſe embaſſadours wold nat ſo leaue kyng ſtylſued folowed theyr pourpoſe ſawe howe frenche kynge ſo poure eſtate realme lykely great ieopardye warre contynued ſomer longer ſyde kynge englande requyred ſo great thynges ſo preiudiciall realme fraunce lordes wolde nat agree therto theyr honour al theyr treatie whiche endured xvii dayes ſtyll folowynge kynge ſent euer theyr proces dayely duke normandy citie parys euer deſyrynge haue agayne anſwere ſhulde farther whyche ꝓceſſe ſecretly ſufficiently examyned regentes chambre parys anſwere ſent agayne wryttynge ſhulde ſhulde offre ſo theſe ambaſſadours often tymes kynge went forewarde towarde cite charter place great offer made come concluſion warre haue peace whiche offer kynge england hard harted agree vnto entenſion kynge fraunce dye eſtate duke lancaſtre coſyn nat counſayled hym haue peace wolde nat agreed thervnto ſayd kynge syr warre ye make realme frāce ryght maruaylous ryght fauourable men wynne great ryches ye leſe tyme thyngess conſyderedde ye come entente ye maye happe make warre dayes lyfe syr wold counſayle ſyth ye may leaue warre honoure profytte accepte offer ben made vnto ſyr myght leſe daye haue wonne twenty yere suche fayre ſubtyle wordes duke lancaſtre ſayde good entencion welthe kynge ſubiectes cō uerted kynge grace holy gooſt chief warker caſe daye kynge charter fell caſe greatly hu •• led kyngess courage whyle theſe ambaſſadours treatynge peace none agreable anſwere fell ſodaynly ſuche tempeſt thō der lyghtnyng rayne hayle kyngess ooſt • ſemed worlde ſhulde haue ended fell heuyn ſuche great ſtoness ſlewe men horſes ſo mooſte hardyeſt abaſſhed kyng englande behelde churche lady charter auowed deuoutly lady agre peace ſayd confeſſed lodged avillage nere charter called bretigny made certayne compoſicions peace vpon certayne article ordeyned • ſyrmely concluded theſe ambaſſadours kynge englande counſayle ther ordeyned good delyberacion aduyce letter called charter peace wherof effecte foweth ¶the fourme tenor letter pea made charter bitwene kynges englande fraunce cap cc xii edward grace god kynge englande lord irelande aquitaine theſe preſent letter ſhall come ſende gretyng howe diſcenciōs debate ſtriffess moued hereafter moued bytwene v ryght dere brother frenche kynge certayne commyſſyoners procurer dere ſonne prince wale hauyng ſufficient power auctorite v hym hole realme one parte certayne commyſſyoners procurer dere brother frenche kyng right dere nephewe charles duke normandy dolphyn uienne eldeſt ſonne ſayd brother fraunce hauynge power auctorite father part alſo hym ſelfe aſſembled bretigny nere charter whiche place agreed accorded ſayd commyſſyoners procurer eyther party vpon diſcencions debate warres diſcordes whiche treates procurer ſonnes v hym alſo procurer ſayd brother ſayd nephew father hym ſwereth holy euangelyſtꝭ hold kepe accomplyſſhe treatie whithe accorde amonge thynges brother fraunce ſayd ſonne bounde promyſeth delyuer leaue v heires ſucceſſours euer county cite townes caſtels fortreſſes landes iles rente reuennues thynges foloweth beſyde haue holde redy guyen saſcoyne poſſede perpetually v heires ſucceſſours demayne fee tyme maner hereafter declared ſay caſtell countie poicters al landes countrey poictow fee thowars landes bellville cite caſtell xayntis landes counte xaynton ſydes ryuer charente towne fortereſſe rochelle theyr appurtenaunces citie caſtell agene countrey agenoyſe citie towne caſtell pierregourte countrey therto belongynge cite caſtell lymoges landes coūtrey lymoſyn cite caſtell caours caſtell countrey tarbe la • de coūtrey countie bigore countie countrey la • de gowre citie caſtell angoleſme countrey therto perteynynge citie towne caſtell rodaix ▪ coūtie coūtrey rouergne duchye guyne lordes erle foiz erle armmake erle liſle uicount carmaine erle pierregourt ▪ uicount lymoges holdynge la • de within foreſayde bondes ſhall homage v ſeruicis due accuſtomed landes place maner fourme haue done tyme paſt kynges englande aunciently haue alſo uicount muttrel ſee dyd tyme paſt kynges englande haue landes muttrell haue ben debate partage landes brother frā ce promyſeth make declaracion thero • v ſhortly canne comynge fraunce alſo countie poictow • nterly ſaue excepted thynge aliened awaye kynges englāde tyme paſt wherby ſayde countie purtenaunces haue ben holden perſones frenche kynges ſaid brother ſucceſſours ſhall nat boūde rendre v ſayde alienacions haue ben done frenche kynges tyme beynge without meane ▪ ſayd brother nowe hauynge agayne • poſſeſſion ſhall leaue entierly v excepte y• frē che kynges theym exchaunge landes kynges englande tyme beynge haue alyened tranſported thynge perſonnes frenche kynges perauenture yet nowe become handes ſayde brother ſhall nat bounde rend •• v alſo rendre v ſuche thynges ought homage v ſucceſſours ought none v ſucceſſours ▪ thā ſhall delyuer v tenour ought within yere y• ſhall departed calais alſo caſtell towne calais caſtell towne ſeignorie merle townes caſtelles ſeignories sangates coulougne baynes wale oye landes woddes mareſthes ryuers rente reuēnues ſeignories auouſons church appurtenaunces place lyenge bitwene boundes bourne folowynge ſay calais ryuer grauelyng alſo fro y• riuer falleth great lake guiens vnto fretin fro thenſe alonge valey moūtayn karlenly encloſynge mountayne ſo ſee sangatis apurtenauncis caſtell towne y• hole countie guynes townes ▪ caſtels fortreſſes lādes place homage men ſeignories woddes foreſtes right • belongynge entierly towne calais merle place named well v haue obeyed ſayd brother erle guynes tyme beyng thynges cōpriſed preſent article merle calais hold demayn excepte heritage perteynynge church whiche ſhall ſtyll remayne hooly ſame church whereſo euer alſo excepte heritage people merle calais vnder value c li lande yere money currāt vnder heritage haue ſtyll habitaciōs heritage beynge towne calais apurtenaunces ſhal abide ſtyll inhabitantes lādes townes countie guynes theyr demaynes ſhall ſtyll remayne except hath ben ſaid foreſayd boundes bormes article calais iles addreſſynge la • de coūties place named iles whiche helde tyme ſayd treatye hath bē agreed ourſayd brother eldeſt ſon ſhulde renounce maner ſoueraynte reſorte rightes ▪ ſhulde haue theym ſhall holde hys neyghbour without reſorte ſoueraynte ſayd brother realme france right oure ſayde brother hath foreſayde thynges yeldeth tranſporteth v perpetually alſo hit agreed ſemblably ſayde ſon expreſſely renounce thynges oughte nat delyuered v ſayde treatye ſpecially name right crowne fraunce realme homage ſeueraynte demayne duchye normandy countie thouraine th • coūties aniou mayn ſouer 〈…〉 homage duchie britaigne except right erle moūtfort ought myght haue duchye countrey britaygne whiche reſerue expreſſe wordes putte clene treaty sauynge ſayd brother whan come calais ſhal ordre mater aduyſe counſaylles deputed ſhal ſette peace concorde bitwene erle mountforte couſyn lorde charles bloys challengeth demaundeth right heritage britaigne renounce demaūdes make may make ſo euer except ſuche forſayd thynges ought abyde v ought delyuered v heires treatie tranſport ſeſe right myght haue theſe thynges oughte nat delyuered v treatie whiche thynges viuerſe altercacions ſame ſpecially bicauſe ſayde renounciacion trā ſportes ſeſſynge leauynge ſayde thynges ſhulde accomplyſſhed ſoone ſaid brother hath delyuered v deputy cite caſtell poicters al lande countrey poictou fee thouars fayre towne citie caſtell agene lande countrey agenoyſe citie caſtell piergourt lande countrey pierrigins cite caſtell caours lande courſin citie caſtell rodais y• lande countrey rouergne citie caſtell xaintes lande therto belōgynge citie caſtell lymoges kynges england aunciently helde towne monterell vpon ſee thappurtenaūces alſo coūtie pontheu hole entierly ſaue excepte tenoure article cōteyned ſayd treatie maketh mencion ſayde countie item caſtell towne calais caſtell towne ſeignorie sangates colougue baines wale oye landes ryuers mareſſhes woddes rente ſeignories thynges conteyned article ther makyng mencion alſo caſtell towne hole entierly countie guynes landes caſtelles townes fortereſſes place menne homage ſeignories woddes foreſtes ryghtes accordynge tenour article thero • makynge mencyon playnly ſayde treatye iles holde redy ſaye tyme thys ſayd treatye peace brother frenche kynge haue promyſed faythe oothe eche ſame treatye peace holde kepe accompliſſhe nat contrarye bound ſayde brother eldeſte ſonnes obligacion promyſe faythe othe one parte except certayne renounciacyons one accordynge tenour fourme ſayd article peace whero • tenour forme foloweth also hit agreed frenche kynge eldeſt ſonne regent theyr heires euer ſoone may without male engin leeſt feſt ſaynt michaell next comyng ſhall rendre delyuer ſayde kynge englande heyres ſucceſſours tranſport honour regalities obeiſaunce homage liegeaunces men fee ſeruices reconiſaūces othes rightes feaulties imperiall iuriſdictions hyghe lowe reſortes ſaue gardes ſeignories ſouerainties apperteyneth maye apperteyne maner wiſe kynges crowne fraunce perſone bicauſe y• kynge crowne fraunce ſo euer city townes caſtels landes iles countreys place named theyr appurtenaunces appendaunces ſo euer duke erle vicount archebyſſhop prelate holy churche baronnes noble kynges ſucceſſours crowne fraunce nothynge reſerued ſo none theyr heyres ſucceſſours frenche kynges reaſon kynge crowne fraunce make challenge demaūde tyme come kyng englāde heires ſucceſſours men ſubiectes ſayd bicauſe ſayd contreys place ſo forenamed ꝑſons theyr heires ſucceſſours perſones city county landes countreys iles caſtelles place named altheyr appurtenaunces appendaūces ſhall holde kynge england perpetually peaſably frely haue ouer ſeignorie ſouerainte obeyſaunce liegeaunce ſubiects predeceſſours frenche kynge haue tyme paſte kynges e • gl ••• theyr heires ſucceſſours ſhall haue holde peaſably fore named coūtreys theyr frauncheſe lyberties perpetuall lorde ſoueraygne liege neighbour frenche kyng realme frāce without knowledgynge ſouerayn ••• • b • • aunce homage reſorte ſubiection without doynge tyme come maner ſeruice reconiſaunce kynge crowne fraunce theſe city county caſtelles countres landes iles place perſonnes named alſo accorded frenche kyng eldeſte ſonne ſhall renounce expreſſely ſayd reſortes ſoueraynties • yght haue myght haue theſe • hynges ſuche preſent treatye ought apperteyne delyuered kynge englande ſemblably kynge englande eldeſt ſonne renoūſeth thynges ſuche preſent treatie ought nat delyuered hym renounſeth al demaundes realme fraunce ſpecially name right armes challenge crowne realme france 〈◊〉 homage ſouerainte demayne duchie normandy duchie thourayne county aniou ▪ mayn ſoueraynte homage coūtie countrey flanders demaundes kynge englande made tyme ſayde chalenge may make tyme come ſayd realme fraunce maner cauſe ſoeuer except thys treatye ſhulde delyuered kynge englande heires tranſport ceſſe leaue eche kyng perpetually al right ought haue theſe ſayd thynges whiche pre 〈◊〉 treatie ought deliuered eche tyme place whan ſaid renouncia • • ſhulde done bicauſe ſayd brother france eldeſt ſon holde accomplyſſhe article ſayde peace haue expreſſely renounſed reſortes ſo ••• ••• tie compriſed ſayd article right ought haue myght haue ſayd thynges ſayd brother hath delyuered left v thynges henſforth ſhall abyde ꝑ • eyne v reaſon ſayde treatye peace alſo lyke wyſe expreſſely renoūce ſuche thynges ought nat delyuered • v ſayde treatye heires alſo demaundes make may make ſayde brother fraunce ſpecially name ryght crowne fraūce realme homage ſoueraintie demayne duchie normandy coūties aniou main thourayn homage ſouerainte countie flanders demaū de make may make ſayd brother ſo euer cauſe alwayes except preſent treatie ought abyde v heyres ſhall tranſporte ſeſſe leaue hym v ſo eche beſt maner ſhortly canne ſuche ryght eche v oughte maye haue euery thynge whiche thys treatie peace ought abyde remayne delyuered eche v reſerued church menne churche perteyneth may apperteine occupied witholde occaſion warres ſhall agayne recompenſed reſtored rendred delyuered alſo townes fortereſſes habitacions dweller ſhall remayne abyde theyr liberty francheſes dyd came handes ſeignory confermed ſayde brother fraunce yf required ſo nat cō trarye foreſayde thynges ſubiections v thynges v heyres ſucceſſours juryſdiction coh • rcyon churche rome wyll conſent holy father pope ſhall conferme theſe ſayde thynges gyuynge monycions generall commaundementes accomplyſſhement theym agaynſte v heyres ſucceſſours agaynſte ſubiectes comons college vniuerſities ſyngular perſonnes ſomeuer gyue generall ſentences curſynge ſuſpencion enterdytynge renne vpon v vpon theym doth contrarye ren • e vpon v ſoone theym attempte occupyenge towne caſtell citie fortereſſe thynge doynge ratyfienge conſentynge gyuynge counſayle comfort fauour aide priuely openly agaynſt ſayde peace whiche ſentences curſe nat aſſoyledde vnto tyme full ſatiſfaction made haue ſuſteyne dammage behalf▪ ouer woll cōſent holy father pope entent thys ſayde peace ſhulde fyrmelier kepte holde •• perpetually paction • con • e • eracyons aliaunces couenauntes howe ſo euer named thyng preiu • icyall agaynſt ſaid peace maner way preſent tyme made ſuppoſed ferme delyuered certayne peynes othes confyrmed holy father pope cancelled ſtande nought thynge contrary comon weale vnprofitable peace chriſtente • iſpleaſāt god promeſſes othes ſuche caſes ſhalbe ſhewed diſcuſſed holy father pope ſo none b ••• de holde kepe ſuche promyſes othes aliaūces couenaūtes thentent tyme come ſuche ſemblable caſes ſhulde nat done attempt cōtrary voy • none effecte v ſhall punyſſ ſuche violaters brekers peace theyr bodyes gooddes ca ſhall requyre accordynge reaſon procure ſuffre done cōtrary god forbyd wol reputed fals vntrewe ren ſuche eſtate blame defame kynge ſacred •• ght ren ſuche caſe ſwere body lorde jeſu chriſt ſayde thynges holde kepe accomplyſſhe nat contrary nother v • one maner caſe entent theſe ſayd bondes ſhulde fulfylled • ynde v heires goodes v heires ſayd brother france heires alſo ſwere holy euangeliſt v corporally touched ſhall perfourme holde accompliſſhe forſayd caſes ſayd thynges v promyſed accorded woll like caſe brother deputy place 〈◊〉 terme maner made mencion preſent v letter cōpr • ſed therin ••• rt 〈◊〉 ſtrength ſayd letter haue pro • yſed
