renoncia • ion accordynge maner • euiſed tyll • one letter nat agaynſte v heires ſucceſſours maner wyſe foreſayd caſe witneſſe whiche haue •• tt • ſcale preſent letter yeuyn calais xxiiii day octobre yere lorde ccc lx whan letter chartre called letter renunciacion aſ well one kynge engroſed wrytten ſealed red openly counſayle chambre beyng preſent kynges theyr counſayles whiche ſemed eche ryght good well ordeyned agayne kynges ſware eldeſt ſonnes euangeliſt corporally touched body jeſu chriſt conſecrated kepe accōpliſſhe nat broke forſayd thynges yet farther aduiſe regarde frenche kyng counſa •• e ende parliamēt kyng englande requyred wolde gyue ſende generall commiſſ •• tyme held vnderſhadow warre townes caſtels fortreſſes realme fraunce werby myght haue ſuche commaundement auoyde departe kyng englande wo wolde nothyng welth good peace noryſſhed bitwene hym frenche kyng brother ſworne promyſed lyghtly agreed this▪ requeſte ſemed reaſon▪ kyng englande commaunded counſaile ſuche commiſſion ſhuld made beſt maner myght accordynge entent frenche kynge counſayle ſpeciall co • ſayle bothe kynges dr • theym guether wrytten engroſed aduyſe bothe counſayles certayn commiſſion wherof tenor ▪ foloweth edwarde grace god kyng englande lorde ireland aquitayne oure capytaynes kepers townes caſtelles adherauntes alies ▪ beynge party fraunce aſwell •• cardy borgoyn aniou berrey normandy britaigū auuerne chāpaigū mayn thourayne bondes lymitacion • demayne tenure fraunce 〈◊〉 gretynge peace accorde hath ben made bytwene v brother fraunce alies adherentes compriſynge debate diſcordes hath ben bitwene v tyme paſt may haue ſworne body jeſu chriſt alſo eldeſt ſonne child blodd outers prelate baron knyghtes mooſt notable realme englande like wyſe hath ſworne ſayd brother ſayd nephewe duke normandy nephewes ſaid child dyuers barones knyghtes prelate ſayd realme fraunce kepe peace though hit ſo fortune fall hereafter men warre realme ſubiectes enforce take thyng contrary ſayd peace takynge withholdynge fortreſſes townes cite caſtelles takynge pyllage priſoners reſtynge perſone goodes marchandyſes thynge doyng agaynſt peace whiche v ſhulde right diſpleaſaunt may nat wyll ſuffre paſſe vnder ſhadow diſſimulacion maner wyſe woll power theſe ſaid thynges fynde remedy therfore woll deſire ordeyne deliberacion of▪ counſaile none ſubiectes whatſomeuer eſtate cōdicion enforce thynge contrary ſayd peace indoynge pillage takyng withholdynge fortreſſes priſoners gooddes ſo euer perteynynge realme fraunce ſayd brother ſubiectes alies adherentes ſo euer doynge agaynſt ſayd peace▪ nat leaue ceace ſo wyll nat rendre agayne damage done within moneth requyred ſo officer ſergeauntes publike perſones dede allonlye without proceſſe condempnacion reputed banyſſhed mē realme power alſo oute realme landes oure ſayde brother theyr gooddes forfaited v demayn may founde within realme woll cōmaund expreſſely made traytours rebel agaynſt v accordynge cuſtome done cryme high treaſon withoute gyuynge yt case grace remyſſion ſufferance pardon like wyſe done ſubiectꝭ whatſoeuer eſtate realme 〈…〉 ſyde lee ſide take occupye holde fortreſſe whatſoeuer ayenſt wyll ſhuld perteyne vnto brenneth raunſometh townes perſones pyllage robbery mouyng warr̄ within power ſubiectes commaunde expreſſely enioyne ſeneſchals bailiffes prouoſtes chatelaynes officer eſchewynge hygh diſpleaſure peyne loſynge office publyſſhe cauſe publiſſhed theſe preſentes certayne notable place within theyr rule commaundement one ſen harde none ſo hardy abyde fortreſſe ꝑteynyng realm france beyng ordinance treatie ſayd peace peyne taken ennemie v ſayd brother frēche kynge ſee theſe ſayd thynges kept entierly fro poynt poynt woll euery man knowe negligent fayle thus beſide foreſayde payne ſhall cauſe rendre damage theyr defautes negligence ſhalbe greued damaged beſide ſhal punyſſhe ſuche maner ſhalbe enſamble wytnes whiche thynges haue made theſe letter patētes yeuyn calais xxiiii day octobre yere lorde iii c lx ¶how pea made king england frenche kyng called eche bretherne warres britayne hoſtages delyuered englyſſhemen frenche kyng deliuered theyr handes ca cc xiii theſe letter cō myſſyons made deuyſed deliuered well ordeined aduyce coū ſayle party ſo bothe kynges content fell communycacion lord charles bloys lord john̄ mountford claymes made duchie britayn eche clamed great right haue yt heritage theyr coīcaciō might bring peace cōcorde yet finally ther nothyng done ī yt mat er infurmed aff kyng england 〈◊〉 great affectyon make peace ſuppoſed ye tyme come men warr ye theyr parte ſhulde auoyde ſuche fortreſſess gariſons hewe ye tyme helde realme france muſte depart ſome place therfore kyng england counſaile thaught erpedient profitable theſe men warre thus lyued pillage ſhuld drawe ye duchie britayn whiche good plentifull countrey rather ſhulde retourne agayne englande robbe pille imaginacion made ſhortly englyſſhemen breke fro cōmunicacion article britayne whiche euill done great ſynne dyd nomore mater dyd kynges ben well wyllyng therto aduice counſailles peace might haue ben made bitwene party eche haue ben content hadde ben gyuen reaſon treatye therby lord charles bloys myght haue agayn child lay priſoners england alſo perauenture lyued longer dyd bycauſe ye nothyng done mater warres neuer ſo great duchie normādy ye peace made bitwene kyngꝭ ye ſhall recorded hiſtorye ſuche barous knyghtes coūtrey britayne vphelde ſuſteyned ſome parte ſome duke henry lancaſtre right valiant ſage ymagined knyght greatly loued ye erle moū • ford aduaūcement ſayd kyng john̄ france preſens kyng englād mooſt parte theyr counſailes syr yet truce taken raines bitwene ye lord charles bloys erle mountforde nat expired hath day endure vnto firſt day maye next comyng whiche ſeaſon kyng england preſent aduice coū ſaile conſent prince ſonne ſhall ſende yonge duke lorde john̄ moūtforde certayne counſayle fraunce ſhall haue full aurtorite power comyn determyne ſuche ryght ſayde lorde john̄ ought haue ſucceſſiō father duchie britayne thus counſaile guether ſome good way ſhal taken bytwene 〈◊〉 thynke good trew • e relonged vnto feſt ſaynt john̄ baptiſt nere folowynge duke lancaſtre deuyſed ſo done concludedde lordes ſpake mater rynge john̄ france great deſyre retourne fraunce reaſon ſhewed kynge englande good corage ſignes loue might alſo nephewe prince wale lyke wyſe ſo dyd kynge england hym confirmacion loue theſe two kynges ordinaunce peace called eche brother gaue iiii knyghtes eche theyr partes ſomme viii frankes yerely reuenues ſay eche haue ii frankes alſo bicauſe lande ſaynt sauiour ye uicoūt conſtantyne profite whiche came yerely englande gyft ſale lorde godfrey harcourt made kynge englande hath ben ſhewed whiche lande nat compriſed ordinaunce ſayd treatye peace therfore ſo euer ſhulde holde lande ſhulde become ſubiecte homage therfore frēche kyng therfore kyng englande gaue lande ſyr john̄ chā do done often tymes acceptable ſeruyce hym child requeſt kyng englāde frenche kyng good delyberacion good courage loue cōfyrmed ſealed gyfte ser john̄ chandos poſſede haue ſame landes true heritage euer whiche fayre lande profytable one yere well worthe xvi hundred frankes beſyde yet diuerſe letter alyaunces made whiche cannat make mencion ſpace fyftene dayes orthere aboute whyle theſe two kynges theyr ſonnes counſailours calais dayly commonynge newe ordinaunces deuyſed confermed ratifye peace nat hyndrynge brekynge fyrſt letter euer made berynge one date ye ſurete whiche haue ſen copy regeſtres chaunceryes kynges ¶and whan theſe thynges ſo well made deuiſed ordeyned coude nat amended corrected ſo thought reaſon great alyaunces boundes wherin ſaid kynges theyr childrē bode ſo ſworne kepe peace nat likely haue ben broken howe peace helde nat longe ye ſhall boke whan hoſtages ye redemption frenche kynge comen calys kynge englande • worn̄ kepe peaſably realme vi frankes payd kyng englandes deputy kyng englande made ſupper frenche kynge caſtell calais right wel ordered kynges child duke lancaſtre mooſt greatteſt lordes baron englande ſerued kynges bare heeded ſupper fynally theſe two kynges toke leaue eche ryght gracyouſly amyably • frenche kynge returned lodgyng y• next mornyng ye whiche vigill ſaynt symonde jude frenche kynge departed calais ſuche thulde departe hym kynge went 〈◊〉 fote pilgrimage lady boloyn prince walys two bretherne company lorde lyonelle lorde aymō ſo went fote dyner boloyn reſceyued great ioy duke normandy redy taryenge ſo theſe lordes went fote churche lady dyd offerynges right deuoutly returned abbay whiche apparelled kynge receyue lordes englande ſo day nexte nyght retourned agayne calats kynge theyr father ſo fynally guether paſſed theſee hoſtages fraunce whiche vigill sayntes yere lorde c c c lx reaſon name nobleman realme fraūce entred englande hoſtage frenche kyng first lorde philip duke orliaunce ſometyme ſonne kynge philip france alſo two nephewes duke aniou ye duke berry alſo duke bourbon erle alanſon lorde john̄ stampes guy bloys countie loys bloys brother erle ſaynt poule erle harecourt erle daulphyn auuergne ser ingram lorde coucy ser john̄ ligny erle porccen erle breſme lord mō morency lorde roy lorde preault lorde stouteuill lorde clerettes lorde ſaynt wenant lorde toure aunergne diuers ye whiche cannat name alſo good cite parys roen reinnes burges berry towrs tourayn lyon riuer roan seins bourgoyn orleance troye champaigne amiens beauuoys arras tournay caen normandy ſaint omers lyſle dowaye euery cite ii burgeſſes ſo thus fynally paſſed ſee came good cite london kyng englāde commaunded enioyned officer great paynes ſhuld theſe lordes theyr company curtoyſe fauorable kepe defende theym theyr company euill rule whiche commaundement well kept vpholde al poyntes ſo theſe lordes hoſtagers ſported withoute perill daunger cite pleaſure great lordes went huntynge haukyng theyr pleaſure rode countrey dyſited lady damuſels without cō trollynge founde kyng england ſo curtoyſe amiable nowe let v ſomwhat ſpeke frenche kynge come boloyn departed fro calais ye haue harde ¶ commyſſyoners ordeyned bothe party auoyde gariſōs realme france companion aſſembled together realme great euils dyd cap c c xiiii frenche kynge taried nat longe boloyn departed feeſt saintꝭ went montrell hedyn ſo good cite amiens taryed tyll nere chriſtmas departed went parys ſolemnly reuerently receyued clergye parys ſo conueyed palys alyghted ſo 〈…〉 philip al lordes ther hym noble dyner apparelled neuer ſhewe deuiſe howe 〈◊〉 frenche kynge wa receyued retourne realme maner people preſence greatly deſyred amonge gaue hym many fayre riche gyftes viſite hym thither came prelate baroness realme felted made great chere hym asshit wa theyr duite kynge receyued right ſwetely anone ofter kyng john̄ wa returned fraunce ther paſſed ſee ſuche perſones commytted kynge englande take poſſeſſyon landes countreys county ba •• wykes cite 〈◊〉 ca • telles fortereſſess ſhulde delyuered reaſon teeatie peace made howe ye nat ſo ſoone done diuerſe lordes languedor wolde nat • yr •• e obeye yelde ſelfe holde kynge englande frenche kynge hadde quyted theyr faith homage ſhulde haue done hym ſemed right cōn trarte obey engl •• hemen ſpecially farre macches • 〈◊〉 marche erle piergourt erle gomegines vicount chaltellon 〈…〉 ount carmaing lorde pyncorne • dyuerſe maruailed greatly reſort alligeance frenche kyng quyted wold haue engliſſhemen ſo •• e ſayd kyng ought nat ſo acquite right myght ſo ſayd ther ī gaſcoy • olde auncient charter priuileges graunted great charlemayne kynge fraunce myght nat put reſort aliegeaunce court allonely therfore theſe lordes firſt •• lde nat obey pointmēt frenche kyng wolde hold accomply •• ſworne ſealed vnto ſent thither lorde james bourbon dere • oſyn apeaſed mooſt parte ſayd lordes ſo became liege menne kynge england erle arminacke lorde dalbret many deſyre frenche kynge lorde bourbon hiss coſyn obeyed englyſſhemen full ſore agaynſte theyr wylless alſo ſee ſyde poictou rochelss • aynton thyss compoſicion right diſplea 〈…〉 lordes knyghtꝭ good townes con̄ trey whan ſawe 〈◊〉 theym become engliſſhe ſpecially y• towne rochell wolde nat agree therto ſo excuſed ſelfe often tymes ſo contynued hole yere wolde nat ſuffre engliſſhemen entre towne meruaile reherſe amiable ſwete word •• wrote frenche kynge deſyrynge hym goddess ſake wolde nat acquyte faith owe hym put demayne hades ſtraungers ſayeng rather taxed yerely halfe theyr subſtanc • vnder handes engliſſhmen frenche kynge ſawe well good wyls trouth bare hym theyr often excuſacionss great p • e • ow • ſent wrote affectuouſly theym entent ſhulde fulfyll deſire ſhewynge elles peace ſhulde broken ī defaute whiche ſhulde great preiudice realme france ſo wha • rochell ſawe remedye 〈◊〉 ſydered diſtreſſe 〈◊〉 theyr 〈…〉 uſacionss deſire coude nat accepted obeyed full ſore againſ •• theyr wylles honeſt men towne ſayde ſhall obeye englyſſhemen henſe forth harte ſhall nat remoue frenche parte thus kyng england poſſeſſion ſeſ • nynge duchie aquitayne countie ponthieu guynes landes ought hau • ſyde ſee ſay realme fraunce gyuen hym ordinance ſayd treatye ſo ſame yere ser john̄ chandos paſſed ſee reget lieutenāt kynge englande toke poſſeſſion ſayd lades ye faithess homage erles vicountess baroness knyghtess ſquyers townes fortereſſes • et 〈◊〉 euery place conſtabless capitayness 〈◊〉 officer hiss ordinaunce laye hym ſelfe nyort helde great eſtate noble well wherwith ye kyng englande entierly loued hym wolde ſhulde ſo well worthy good knyght curteſſe benynge amyable liberall preu • ſage trewe cauſes valiauntly mayntayned hym ſelfe among lordes lady dammuſelless neuer knyght tyme better beloued prayſed euery creature meane ſeaſon 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 kynge englande takynge poſſeſſions forſaid landes accordyng treatye peace certayne deputy ſtablyſſhed kynge englande bondes limitation frāce certayne perſones commytted frē che kynge cauſe maner men warre auoyde departe oute holdes 〈…〉 ſo • helde cōmaundement • kyng englande ſtraitly 〈◊〉 peyne theyr lyues gooddes reputed ennemies kyng englande ſhulde leaue delyuer vp ſuche fortereſſes helde ſhulde perteyue frenche kynge ſome knyghtes ſqu • er ſuche owed 〈…〉 geaunce kynge englande ob •• ed kynges commaundement rend • ed • rcauſed rendred fortreſſes helde ſome wolde nat obeye ſayeng howe made warre title kynge nauarre alſo many ſtrangers great capitaynes great pyllers wolde nat departe almayns brabances flemmynges • aynows 〈◊〉 manſo • frāco • pore reaſon warres wherfore thought recouer ſelfe makynge warre realme fraunce whiche people perſeuered ſtyll theyr euyll doynge ſo dyd moche euyll realme agaynſte diſpleaſure whan capitaynes thus departed courteſſe maner theſe fortreſſes helde felde gaue leaue theyr men warre departe lerned ſo pylle robbe thought retourne theyr owne countreys nat profitable perauenture durſte nat bicauſe ſuche vyllayne dedes accuſed gathered ſelfe guyther made amonge ſel • e newe capitaynes toke election worſte mooſt vnhappy perſonne theym ſo rode forthe one fro mette guether agayne fyrſte champaygne bourgoyn aſſembled great companyes whiche called late commers bicauſe hadde lyttell pylled realme france ſodainly went toke ſtrengthe fortereſſe genuille great gooddes therin whiche brought thyther theym countrey truſte ſtronge place whan theſe cōpanions thus found place ſuche great rich whiche eſtymed value hū dred thouſande frankes deuyded hit amonge longe wolde laſte ſo kepte ſtyll caſtell certayne ſpace tyme ouer ranne waſted countrey champaigne buſſhopryches uerdun langers whan well pylled countrey paſſed firſt ſolde caſtell genuill theym countrey xx frankes entred bourgoyne reſted refreſſhed taried mo theyr company dyd moche euill many villayne dedes theyr accorde certayne knyghtes ſquyers ſame countrey ladde guyded theyr euyl doynges taryed longe ſpace aboute beſancon digon beaulne robbed countrey none reencoūtred toke good towne guiercy beauuoys robbed pylled taried ſeaſon aboute uuergi bicauſe coūtrey plentyfull alwayes theyr nombre encreaſed ſuche departed oute fortereſſes lycence theyr capitaynes go whither 〈◊〉 drewe parte ſo lent guether xvi thouſand fyghtyngmen whan ſawe ſelfe ſo great nombre ſtablyſſhed amonge certayne capitaynes ſhuld obey thynges ſhall ſhewe name ſome greatteſt maiſters amonge theym fyrſte knyght gaſcoyne called 〈◊〉 segu • n battefoill company two thouſande fyghtyng men alſo callebert callabaton guy pineſpiote litel mechin batailler hānequin francois y• bourge eſpace nandon de baquerant bourg bourc bretuel nucharge y• scot arbretoury almayne bourdonnell bernarde salle robert briquet carnelle aymemon drtige garſiotte caſtell gironnet paux lortingo salle dyuerſe ſo aboute myddes lente theſe companyons aduyſed ſelfe drawe warde auignon go ſe pope cardynals ſo paſſed countrey maſcon addreſſed theymſelfe go countie foreſtes plē tyfulle countrey towarde lyon riuer roſne whan frenche kyng herd theſe tidynges howe theſe companion daily multiplied waſted exyled realme therwith ryght ſore diſpleaſed ſhewed hym aduyſe counſayle theſe companion myght ſo ſore encreaſe multiply myght euyll vilayn dedes realme fraunce euer done warre endured engliſſhemen therfore kynge counſayled ſhuld ſend army men warr fyght kyng wrote ſpecially coſyn lorde james bourb • towne montpellier put newely ſir john̄ chādos poſſeſſion kynge englande dyuerſe landes city townes caſtels •• rtreſſeslyteynynge duchie acquita 〈…〉 ſayde kynge ſayd wrytyng deſired coſyn bourbon chief • capttayne encountre fyght theſe companion take men warre hym ſuche nōbre myght ſtrōge ynough fyght ſoone lorde bourbon herde theſe tidynges incontinent went citie agenoiſe without reſtynge way ſent letrers meſſangers euery parte deſirynge commaūdyng frenche kynges name knyghtes ſquiers come hym apparelled warre euery man obeyed commaundement whan aſſembled drewe toward lyōs riuer roſne willynge fyght theſe euill people lorde james bourbon well beloued realme fraunce euery man gladly obeyed hym ſo knyghtes ſquiers party auuergne • ymoſyn prouēce sauoy dolphynne uien party folowed hym alſo diuers knyghtes ſquiers duchie bourgoyn whiche yong duke bourgoyn ſent thither ſo al theſe men armes drewe forwarde paſſed lyon countie maſcon came coūtie foreſtes lord james bourbon ſyſter lady right child erle foreſtes huſbande newely deed therfore ſhe gouerned countrey ſo ſir reynalt foreſtꝭ brother ſayd erle receyued lorde james bourbon company ryght ioyouſly fealted well myghty▪ alſo two nephewes preſented ſelfe ryde 〈◊〉 armes beſende countrey companion drawyng parte thā chaſlon thourain whā vnderſtode frēche men gadered gether fyght capitaynes drewe guether take counſayle howe ſhulde maynteyne themſelfe nombred theyr company found xvi fyghtyng men one ſayd amonge ſelfe let v go agaynſt theſe frenche men deſyre fynde v let v fyght aduauntage may orels nat fortune v ſhall riche great ſeaſon well reaſon good priſoners goodes also ſhalbe ſo redoubted whereſo euer go none ſhalbe ſo hardy encountre v leſe ſhall leſe wage pourpoſe agreed diſlodged went vp mountaynes entre countie foreſtes come riuer loyre ſo founde way good towne called charlien 〈◊〉 maſcon made f • erſe aſſa 〈…〉 〈◊〉 wiche endured hole day coude wynne thynge ſo well defended gentylmen countrey ſuche 〈◊〉 orels ben taken departed thenſe ſpred abrode countrey perteynyng lorde beauteu ther 〈◊〉 great dammage entred byſſhopriche lyon went euer toke ſmall holdꝭ y• way lodged 〈◊〉 euer dyd moche trouble whe • came daye toke caſtell lo •• e y• lady within whiche caſtell called brunay thre leages lyon ther • lodged reſted perfect knowlege howe frenche men drawen feldes apparelled fyght ¶ howe lorde james 〈◊〉 company diſcom 〈…〉 companyōs howe 〈◊〉 pe made cried croſſe theſe companyons taken brydge ſaynt eſperyte anſwere made cap cc xv men warr thus aſſembled lorde bourbon beyng ly • vnderſtode route cō panyous aproched faſte toward wōne towne caſtell brunay dyuerſe holdes howe ſore waſted eriled countrey theſe tydynges greatly diſpleaſed lorde bour 〈◊〉 bicauſe gouernynge erle 〈…〉 ſtes landes ſōnes nephewes went felde ſawe well howe great nombre men armes knyghtes ſquiers ſo ſent theyr courrours know theyr ennemies dyd ſhulde founde nowe ſhall ſhewe great malice theſe companyons lodged moūtayne ſuche pla 〈◊〉 coude nat diſeryed auewed ſpecially chief beſte harneyſed reſidewe worſte harneyſed arenged alonge hylle ſyde 〈…〉 red frenche currours aproche nere retourne agayne withoute •• mage lorde james bourbon erle duzes 〈◊〉 raynalt foreſtes frenche company reported ſeen ſayd syrs haue ſeen yonder company ennemies power wel aduyſed thynges ſen cōſydered eſtimacion paſſe nat 〈…〉 perſones meruailouſly euil harneyſed whan lorde bourbon herd report ſayd archepreſt sir ye haue tolde nombre 〈◊〉 fyghtyng men ye 〈◊〉 contrary sir quod thought neuer vnder ye ſayd ſome nat god thanked better v therfore nowe take hede ye wyl name god quod lorde bourbon wyll go fight ordered batayles ſet good araye redy fyght myght ſe ennemies hym made certayn newe knyghtes firſt owne •• deſt ſonne peter rayſed baner alſo nephewe yonge erle foreſtꝭ lorde tournon lorde mo 〈…〉 er lorde groſlee daulph •• e alſo lorde loys ſir robert beau 〈◊◊〉 • ewe chaalon ſyr hewe uien erle 〈◊〉 dyuerſe good knyghtes ſquiers deſyrynge auaunce honour ouerthrowe theſe companyōs thus pylled countrey without title reaſon ordeyned archepreſt ſir reynolde carnoll ſhuld gouerne firſt bataile good expert knyght bataile xvi hundred fyghtynge men theſe route companyons moūtayne ſaw right well orderynge frenche men coude nat ſo well ſe theyr gydyng aproche well theyr great daunger damage theſe companyons hadde mountayne thouſande cart lode great ſtones whiche greatly aduaūtage profitte theſe frenche men ſo ſore deſired fyght ennemies howe ſo euer dyd coude nat come nexte waye therfore dreuen neceſſite coſt aboute mountayne ennemies whan came ſyde great prouiſion ſtones began caſte ſo ſore downe hyll dyd aproche bette downe hurte maymed great nōbre ſuche wyſe myght durſte nat paſſe aproche nerer theym ſo fyrſt bataylle ſo ſore beaten defoyled daye dyd litell ayde theyr ſuccour approched bataylles ſir james bourbon ſonne nephewes theyr baners great nombre good men warre went loſte whiche great damage pite y• hadnat wrought better aduice counſayle dyd archepreſte dyuerſe knyghtes ſayde hadde beſte haue ſuffered theyr ennemyes haue diſlodged oute holde haue fought caſe coulde nat herde ¶ thus lorde james bourbon lordes theyr baners penons approched coſtedde ſayde mountayne worſte armed companyous caſte ſtyll contynewally ſtones theym ſuche wyſe hardyeſt dryuen abacke thus helde eſtate great ſpace great freſſhe bataylle theſe companyons founde awaye came aboute mountayne well raynged hadde cutre theyr ſpeares ſyxe foote lengthe ſo came • ryenge one voyce brake amonge frenche men firſte metyng ouerthrewe many erthe ſore ſtrokes bothe partess theſe companyons fought ſo ardētly marueyle cauſed frenchemen recule backe archpreeſt lyke good knight fought valyantly taken priſoner force armes ſore hurte dyuers knightes •• uyers company wherto ſhulde make lengar reherſall mater effecte frenchman worſe lorde james bourbone ſoore hurte ſir peter ſonne ther ſlayne yong erle foreſtes taken ſir reynolde foreſtes vncle therle duzes ſir robert beauieu ser loys chalon mo hundred knyghtess moche payne lorde bourbone ſonne peter borne cytie lyon batayle yere lorde god thouſande thre hundred threſcore one friday eaſter day ¶ greatly countre aba •• hed whan herde people dyſconfyted ther none ſo hardy ſo ſtronge caſtell trymbled feare wiſe diſcrete men ſuppoſed ymagined great myſchefe ſhulde multiply therby without god put ſom remedy lyon gretly abaſſhed whā knewe companyons vyctorie howe beit receyued ſwetely retourned ſcaped fro batayle ſore dyſpleſed hurtes lorde bourbon ſir peter ſonne towne ladyes damoſelles right goodly dyde viſyte hym lorde james bourbon dyed thre dayes felde ſir peter ſonne lyued nat longe ſore way led euery creature dethe thiss lorde bourbon frenche kyng ryght ſore diſpleaſed coude nat amende ſo behoued hym paſſe ouer ſorowe well might lette v ſpeke theſe companyons parſeuered ſtyll yuell ded people reioyſed cōforted dedes well wynnynge iourney raunſomyng many good priſoners thus theſe cōpanyons ledde tyme •• pleaſure countrey none came agaynſt theym incontynent diſcōfyture brunay entred ſpredde abrode countie foreſtes pylled waſted countre • except ye foreſſess bycauſe ſo great company almooſt nothynge helde agaynſt theym ſo deuyded thē two partes ſir seguyn batefoyle leſſe parte • howe beit company thre thouſā de fightyng men went lay 〈◊〉 myle fro lyon fortefyed place maruelouſly ſo company ther marcheſſe whiche one ye plentyfull countrees worlde whiche ouer ranne raunſomed people pleaſure ſay countres ſyde beyond ryuer coū tie maſcon archebyſſhoprike lyon lande lorde beauieu countrey marcylly nonnes countie neuers parte ſame company nandos beaugeraunt eſpyot carnell robert briquet ortyngo bernarde salle lamyt bourge camas bourge bretuell bourge leſpare dyuers one ſorte affinyte drewe towarde auygnone ſayd howe wolde ſe pope cardynalles haue ſome money orels hare pyll countre ſo taryed abydynge raūſome ſuche priſoners taken alſo ſe truce helde bytwene fraūce englande went towarde auygnon toke way townes fortreſſes ſo none helde agaynſt countre afrayed alſo countre vſed warre ſo y• ſuche theſe ſmall holdes wyſt nat howe defende thēſelfe fro ſuche men warr theſe companyons herde howe bridge ſaynt eſperyte ſeuyn leages fro auygnon great treaſure richeſſe countre aſſembled ther togyder truſt ſtronge fortreſſe ſo companyons aduyſed among might wynne holde ſhuld gretly aduauntage profyte thanne thought mayſters roane theym auygnon purpoſe ſtubyed tyll laſt caſte aduyce haue herd reported maner g • yot • pyn ye lytell methyn rode company one nyght fyftene leages mornynge brekynge day came towne bridge ſaynt spyryt ſodenly toke within ye whiche great pyte ther ſlewe many honeſt perſon defoyled many da 〈…〉 wan ſuche tycheſſe coude 〈…〉 great puruyaunces lyue 〈…〉 ſo meanes might r • nne • aſe without daūger one ••• ſon realme fraūce another tyme empyre aſſembled togyder companyons euery day ran • • e auygnon wher pope 〈…〉 great affray drede theſe companyons made ſoueraygne 〈◊〉 amonge euer mooſt • omonly enemy god worlde beſyde fraūce great nombre pyliers robber englyſſhmen gaſcoyns almaygnes ſayd muſt nedes lyue helde ſtyll certayne garyſons fortreſſes kyng englandes deputy cōmaū ded auoyde departe wolde nat obey wherwith frenche kynge ſore diſpleaſed counſell whan theſe companyons dyuers place herde howe theſe companyons ouer throwen lorde bourbon two thouſande knyghtes ſquyers taken many good priſoner alſo taken ye towne ſaynt e • pyrite ſo great rycheſſe thyuge mcomparable thynkynge howe lykely wynne auygnon el putte mercy pope cardynalles coutre prouynce thā thought departe go thyder couetyſe 〈◊〉 yuell dedes cauſe dyuers left vp fortreſſes wente cōpanyous hope gette • yllage whan p • pe 〈…〉 colledge ro 〈…〉 • ered theſe curſed p • opl • • greatly abaſſhed 〈…〉 agaynſt theſe 〈◊〉 chriſten people dyde payne diſtroy chr • ſ •• ndom • bandes done wt tytell reaſon waſ • ed countrey without cauſe robbed without spa • yng euer coude gette 〈◊〉 de • oyled woman olde yong without pytie ſlewe men woman chyldren without mercy doyng trespace ſuche dyde mooſt ſhamefullyſt dedꝭ reputed mooſt valyaunt pope cardynalles preached openly 〈◊◊〉 aſſoyled pena • cul 〈◊〉 thoſe wolde take croy 〈◊〉 wolde abandon bodyes wil lyngly diſtroy theſe yuell peple cō panyons ther choſen among cardynals ſir peter monſtier cardynall arras called dſte chefe capitayne y• croyſey mcontynent departed auygnon wente taryed carpentraſe ſ • uyn myle fro auygnon ther retayned maner ſoudyers ſuche wold ſaue ſoules matteynyng theſe ſayd perdous ſhulde haue none wage wherfore tourney brake euery man deꝑted▪ ſome lombardy ſome owne coūtrees ſome went ſayd yuell company ſo y• dayly encreaſed thus haryed pope cardynals marchauntes auygnon dyd moche yuell tyll ferr ſomer ſeaſon yere lorde god thouſande thre hudred threſcore one pope cardynals aduyſed noble gentyll knyght good warryoure marque mounferrant kept warr done long ſpace agaynſt lordes myllayne y• pope ſent forhym ſo came auygnon honorably receyued pope cardynals ſo atreaty made hym reaſon ſomme money ſhuld haue entent ſhulde get ceuntre ſayd yuell cōpanyons retayne thē warres lombardy marque treated captayns companyons reaſon threſcore thouſand florens ſhulde haue among great wage ye marque ſhulde gyue thē agreed depart go hym lobardy ſo might aſſoyled pena ct culpa agreed acomblyſſhed florēs payed rendred vp ye towne ſaynt eſpyrite lefte marche auygnon paſſed forthe marque wherof kyng john̄ france realme right toyouſe whan ſawe howe delyuered theſe yuell people howbeit many retorned burgoyn ſir seguyne batefoyle departed nat ye garyl ence wold nat leaue maner 〈◊〉 promyſe realme france ferr better reſt peace whan mooſt parte companyous thus paſſed forthe marque lande pyemōt ther marque dyde well deuoyre agaynſt ye lordes myllayne conquered dyuers townes caſtes fortreſſes countrees agaynſt dyuers encountrynges skyrmiſſhes honour profyte 〈◊〉 yere y• helpe theſe 〈◊〉 better hande part entent agaynſt two lord myllayne ſir galea ſir bernabe raygned gre • proſperite fortuned ſir seguyn batefoyle ſeaſon garyſon ence ryuer •• ie toke ſcalyng good cyte auuergne called b • od therin taryed yere fortifyed ſuche wyſe douted nothyng ouer ran coūtre cler 〈…〉 ty • lacke puy caſe dieu moūtferant 〈◊〉 ryon nonnet uſſoyre • udalle lande countie dalphyn lorde wherof ſame tyme hoſtage englande theſe countrees company dyde moche yuell whan ſore enpoueryſſhed countre ther treaty deꝑted toke hym great pyllage treaſure ſo went gaſcoyne fro whēs came firſt ſir seguyn write iherde recoūted dyed marueluſly god forgyue hym treſpaces amen ¶ dethe duke lancaſtre occaſyon warre bytwene frenche kyng • kyng nauer howe prince wale came acquitayne ordre taken englande cap cc xv • ſeaſon de • ted worlde englade gentyll duke lancaſtre called henry wher •• kynge 〈◊〉 ne knightes squyers ryght ſorowfull coude nat remedy behynde left two doughters lady maha • lt lady blanche therle heynault 〈◊〉 wylliam ſonne lorde loyes banyer 〈◊〉 lady margarete heynalt maryed yonger ſuſter lorde john̄ erle richmont ſonne kynge englande maryed ſuſter duke lancaſtre right wyfe lorde james burbone abode ſtyll ſhall hyſtorie ſame ſeaſon frenche kyng • purpoſe go auygnone 〈◊〉 pope cardynals go 〈◊〉 • hy burgoyn whiche newly fallen hym kyng made redy iourney departed fro parys ſe 〈…〉 ſaynt john̄ baptyſt yere lorde ccc lxii left charles eldeſt ſonne duke normandy regent gouernour realme kyng hym welbeloued coſyn lorde john̄ artoyſe erle tankernyll therle dampmartyn boucequant marſhall fraunce dyuers ſo long rode ſmall iourneys great dyſpence taryeng euery 〈◊〉 ne cytie rode bourgoyn ſo feeſt ſaynt michaell came newe towne • auyguon lodgyng prepared cōpany gretly ••• lled pope hole coledge viſyted eche often tymes thus kynge taryed ther ſeaſon wynter chriſtmas pope innocent departed lyfe great dyſcorde bytwene cardynals choſynge newe pope 〈◊〉 wolde haue dignyte ſpe 〈…〉 ly cardynall boulay •• cardynall 〈…〉 ourt two y• grettell colledge ſo diſcencyon longe dyſcorde 〈…〉 nalles finally dyde putte 〈◊〉 mater vnto two foreſayd cardynalles whan ſawe coude nat haue theymſelfe papal 〈…〉 thaūe concluded bytwene none ſhulde haue dyde cho •• electe abbot ſaynt uyctor mar • ell pope good deuout holy man vertuous lyueng gret clerke greatly traueyled churche lombardy place ano • creacion y• frenche kyng vnderſtode lorde pi • r luzenon kyng cypre hyeruſalem ſhulde come 〈◊〉 toſ • pope howe y• paſt ſ 〈…〉 〈◊〉 frēche kyng ſayd wolde tary ther tyll comynge great deſyre ſe hym great goodneſſe herde reported hym warre made agaynſt ſarazyns kynge cypre newly taken ſtrong cyte salate agaynſt enemyes god ſlayne euer within none except ſame ſeaſon wynter ther great counſell englande orderyng realme ſpecially kinges chyldren cōſydred howe yt prince wale held great noble eſtate might well was▪ valyant man puiſſant riche great herytage acq •• tayne wher habundaunce welth proſperite king counſelled ſhulde ſend prince ſon thoſe pattes lande ſufficyēt duchy maynteyne withall dignyte eſtate alſo barones knightꝭ acquitayne wolde gladly haue hym among whiche made requeſt kynge ſir john chādos thē ryght courtelſe amyable yet rather haue owne naturall ſoueraygne lorde prince lightly agreed ordynaūce prepared hym ſelfe good lady wyfe acordyng eſtates whan euery thyng redy toke leaue kyng quene bretherne departed england aryued rochell ſame ſeaſon departed world kyng englandes mother isabell fraū doughter kynge philyp le beau ſōtyme frenche kyng ſhe buryed fre • r mynors london right nobly reuerētly ther beyng prelate barones englande lordes fraunce ſuche hoſtage ye prince prince deꝑted england obſequy done departed aryued rochell wher receyued great ioy tayed ſpace four dayes ¶ howe kynges fraunce cypre toke croyſey agaynſt mfydeles gret purchace entent kynge cypre made many kyngꝭ prince dyuers place chriſtendome cap cc xvii ſoone ſir johan chandos alonge ſeaſon gouerned duchye acquitayne herde howe prince comyng thyder departed fro nyort came goodly company knyghtes ſquyers y• towne rochell wher well receyued prince prince ſo prince great honoure ioye brought cytie poycters thyder came ſe hym great ioye barownes knyghtes poy • tou xaynton dyde hym feaultie homage ought wente burdeaux taryed long ſeaſon prince thyder came ſe hym erles vycoūtes barownes knyghtes gaſcoyne receyued right ioyouſly ye prince acquyted hym ſelfe ſo nobly amonge theym euery man well content erle foyz came thyder ſe prince great chere feaſt peace made bytwene hym erle armynake whiche long ſpace made werr eche anone ſir john̄ chandos made conſtable countrey guyene ſir guychart dangle made marſhall thus prince made ſuche knightes houſe loued beſt great offycers throughout duchy acquitayne▪ tylled conſtableſhyppes bayl • wykes englyſſhe knyghtes kept great puyſſaunt aſtates parauenture greatter countrey wolde done matter wente nat ordynaunces ¶ nowe lette v leaue ſpeke prince wale acquitayne prince ſpeke kynge johan fraunce newe towne without auygnon tyme candelmaſſe yere lorde thouſande thre hundred 〈◊〉 kyng peter cypre came auygnon whoſe comynge hole courte greatly reioyſed dyuers cardynalles went mete hym brought hym paleys ye pope urbayne ryght ioyouſly receyued hym alſo ſo dyde frenche kynge preſent whan ha •• e 〈◊〉 • g • ther certayne tyme taken wyne spice two kynges departed fro pope eche went theyr owne lodgyng ye ſame ſeaſon wage • atell frenche kyng bitwene two noble expert knyghtes ſyr aymon pommters ſyr fouques archiac whā fought ſufficiently frenche kynge treated peace accorded gether ſo lente ſeaſon theſe two kynges • aryed auignon often tymes viſited pope receyued right •• • uſly often tymes whan kynge ciper pope freche kyng beyng preſent cardinalles declared howe chriſtedome ſhuld noble worthy thyng open paſſage ouer ſee go agaynſt y• enemyes chriſten fayth whiche wordes frenche kynge gladly herde pourpoſed hym ſelfe myght lyue iii yere go thither two cauſes moued hym therto fyrſte bicauſe father kynge philyp auowed ſo ſecondly entent therby drawe realme maner men warre called companyous • ylled robbed countrey withoute title ſaue theyr ſoules pourpoſe entente frenche kyng reſerued hym ſelfe without worde ſpekyng therof vntyll good fryday pope urban hym ſelfe preched chapell auignon beynge preſent kynges hole college cardinalles holy predicacion whiche right humble moche deuoute frēche kynge great deuocion toke hym croyſey ſwet • h • requyred pope accord conſyrme voyage pope lygh • ly agreed therto ſo kynge toke • oith hym ſyr calleran cardinall pierregourt erle artoiſe erle ewe erle dampmartyn erle tankeruille ſyr arnolde dandrehen great priour france ſyr boucequāt dyuerſe knyghtes preſent enterpriſe kynge • cyper ryght ioyouſe thanked ryght hartely lorde therof reputed hit great ſyngular meryte thus ye maye ſe frenche kynge ſayd lordes toke • weare aboue theyr garmentes 〈◊〉 • roſſe holy father pope 〈…〉 voyage cauſed preched dyuerſe place ſhall ſhe howe kyng cyper come thither 〈◊〉 moue voyage great 〈◊〉 go ſe emperour hyghe baroues empyre ſo englande ſe kyng ſo great lordes ••• •• en • ome thus purpoſed ſo dyd ye ſhall hiſtory holifather pope frenche kynge offered promyſed hym theyr bodyes goodes ſubſtances furnyſſhe voyage gaue hym full power publyſſhe grace pardon holy voyage therby cauſe lordes prynces rather enclyne thys holy voyage ſo kynge ſo well beloued reaſons ſhewed fayre language vttered lordes voyage rather haue herd hym predicacion ſo poynt •• ed anone eaſter yere lorde ccc lxiii kynge cyper departed fro auignon ſayd wolde go ſe emperour lordes empyre promyſed returne agayne brabant flaunders haynault ſo toke leaue pope frenche kynge caſes acquyted ryght well ward hym gaue hym many fayre gy • tꝭ ••• wels pardon ye pope gaue hym men anone departyn • kynge cyper frenche kynge toke leaue pope went towne mo •• pell •• er viſite languedor 〈◊〉 longe ſpace let v ſpeke kynge cy • voiage 〈◊〉 made rode ſo longe • ourne •• came almayn cite pragne foūde emperour almayne ſyr charles behaigne receyued hym graciouſly lordes empyre preſent kynge cyper taryed thre wykes exhorted greatly theym empyre holy voyage euery place paſſed almayne emperour payde hys coſtes kynge cyper wente duchye jullyers duke made hym ryght great feaſt • tha • thenſe went 〈…〉 ante alſo duke ducheſſ • receyued hym great honour towne bruzels diuers ſuppers juſtis tournays paſtymes honor coude ryght well hit departynge gaue hym great gyftes ieowels went flanders ſe erle loys like wyſe dyd greatly feaſt honour hym ſpecially brugꝭ dyd ſo moche kynge well contente hym taryed ſomer alwayes exhortyng euery man holy voyage wherof dyuerſe lordes great ioy deſire ¶ frenche hoſtages englande purchas kynge ciper made croiſey cap cc xviii ſeaſon kynge englande dyd grace iiii frenche duke ihoſtage ſay duke orleaunce duke aniou duke berrey duke bourbon theſe lordes calais yt kyng content ſhulde ryde aboute calais ſpace iiii dayes lyſte euer y• iiii dayes ende come agayne calais ſonne ſettynge thys kynge englande dyd good entente bicauſe ſhulde rather france purchaſe theyr delyueraunce theſe iiii lordes thus beyng calais ſent meſſangers dyuers tymes frenche kynge duke normandy eldeſt ſonne deſyrynge entende theyr delyueraunce accordynge promyſed ſworne whan entred englande ſayeng el wold take hede therto ſelfe thought theymſelf priſoners though theſe lordes right nere lignage kynge yet theyr meſſangers nat herde delyuered theyr pleaſure wherwith theſe lordes right ſore diſpleaſed ſpecially duke aniou ſayd wold right wel prouyde remedy frenche kynge counſaile duke normandy wer ſore beſied voyage croyſey taken vpon hym warres kynge nauarre made realme ſent lombardy certayn companyons helpe hym warre theſe y• cauſes toke regard lordes laye hoſtage ſay foreſayde iiii duke delyuer meſſangers whan came fraunce whan kyng ciper viſited theſe lordes theſe ſayd countreys rode ſo iourneys came calais founde iii theſe ſayd duke duke orleaunce duke berrey duke bourbon duke aniou gone fraūce nat tell eſtate theſe iii duke priſoners receyued kynge ciper calais right ioyouſly kynge acquyted hym right ſwetely ſo wer guether ii dayes kynge cyper paſſed ſee arryued douer taried two dayes refreſſhed hym tyll cariage vnſhypped rode ſmalle iourneys eaſe tyll came london honorably receyued feaſted lordes fraunce alſo england ſent mete hym kynge englād erle herforde ſyr gaulter manny lorde spenſer ſyr rawoll feryes ser guyſhart pēnebruges ser richard stury accompanied brought hym lodgyng cite london nat recoūt hole day noble diner ſuppers chere feaſtes made hym kynge englande preſentes gyftes ieowels gyuen hym ſay • trouthe well worthy hauehit come thither fro farre great expenſe exhorte kynge take hym redde croſſe helpe open paſſage againſt goddes ennemies kynge englande excuſed hym ſelfe graciouſly right ſagely agayne kynge cyper repaſſed ſee arryued boloyn herde waye howe frenche kynge duke normandy lorde philyp yongeſt ſonne great parte counſayle ſhulde good towne amyenſe thither rode kynge cyper founde kynge newly come thider part counſaile nobly receyued recounted ſpedde voiage whiche glad whan kynge cyper ben certayn ſpace tyme ſayde tought hadde nat yet thynge done tyll hadde ſeen prynce wale ſay enge grace god wolde go ſehym lordes poictom acquitayne frenche kynge accorded wel ſhulde ſo deſired hym retourne wolde come fraūce kyng ciper promyſed ſo • thus departed amience went towarde beaunoyſe paſſed riuer seyn laſt came poicters tyme prince angoleſme ſhulde kepe great feaſt juſtis tournay xl knyghtes many ſquiers loue princeſſe brought bedde faire ſonne called edwarde ſoone prince knewe cōmynge kyng ciper ſent mete hym ser john̄ chaudos great nombre knyghtes ſquiers houſe brought hym great ioye reuerence prince receyued hym right honorably 〈◊〉 nowe let v leaue 〈◊〉 kynge ciper returne frē che kynge recount entencion counſatle come amience enfourmed true hit kynge johſt fraunce inpourpoſ • go englande ſe kynge edwarde brother ye quene ſyſter cauſe aſſembled counſaile tyme counſaile coude nat make hym vary fro pourpoſe yet counſa •• ed hym ſore contrarie diuers prelate barones fraunce ſayd howe toke hym great foly put hym ſelfe daunger kynge englande kyng anſwered ſayd syrs haue foūde kynge england brother y• quene child ſo moche trouth honour nat prayſe moche wherfore doubte nothynge wyll ryght courteſſe true frende caſes alſo wyll excuſe ſonne duke aniou returnyng frāce wordes none durſt ſay contrarie ſyth ſo determined ihym ſelf kyng ordeyned agayne ſon duke norman dye regent gouernour realme fraunce vntyll retourne agayne promyſed lorde philyp yong ſon returne agayne wolde make hym duke borgoyn heriter duchie whā purueyaunce redy accordynge entent prouiſion bolloyn hym departed amience rode tyll came hedyn kept chriſtmas daye thither came ſe hym loys erle flaunders kyng taried ii iii dayes innocētis day departed fro hedin ¶ howe kynge john̄ fraunce returned england dyed duke normandy defended hym agaynſt naueroyſe mante meulent taken howe ſyr bremont de la • diſcomfetted ca cc xix king john̄ dyd ſo moche iourneis came boloyn lodged abbay taried tyll wynde wyll hym ſir john̄ artoyſe erle ewe erle dampmartyn great priour fraunce 〈◊〉 boucequant marſhall fraunce ſir triſtram maguelles ſir peter ſyr john̄ uillers ser john̄ anuil ser nicholas braque diuers knyghtes ſquiers whan theyr ſhips charged yt ye mar • ners ſaw good wind gaue knowlege therof kyng ſo thā ye kyng entred ſhip aboute mydnyght people ſhippes ſo longe ſayled y• arriued englande douer day vigill epiphany anoue tidynges came kyng england quene eltham vii leages fro london frenche kyng come lande douer ſente thither diuers knyghtes houſe ser bartilmewe brunes ſir alayne bouqueſels ſir richarde pennebruge dyuers departed fro kynge rode toward douer founde frenche kynge made great honoure chere hym amonge thynges ſayd howe kynge theyrlorde right ioyous comynge frenche kynge lyghtly beleued theym nexte day kyng hys companie lepte theyr horſes rode caunturburye came thither dyner entrynge churche ſaynt thomas kyng dyd ryght great reuerence 〈◊〉 offred sh • •• ryche 〈◊◊〉 ▪ 〈…〉 e kynge tar • ed 〈…〉 〈…〉 de dare departed • ood • towarde 〈…〉 dou laſt • came 〈…〉 ame 〈…〉 kynge • england • great nom 〈…〉 hym recey 〈…〉 comynge thy 〈…〉 dyner bitwene 〈…〉 ther great daūſyng 〈…〉 yonge lorde 〈…〉 ed hym ſelfe daunce 〈…〉 bothe frenche englyſſhe 〈…〉 olde hym▪ • became hym ſo 〈…〉 〈◊〉 dyd canne nat ſhe 〈…〉 honorably kynge en •• ande quene receyued frēche kyng 〈…〉 day departed elthame 〈…〉 london maner people 〈…〉 • itie mette receyued hym 〈◊〉 great • er • ce brought • reat 〈…〉 london lodgyng sa •• whiche ordeined 〈◊〉 ſame caſtell lodged ſuche 〈◊〉 blodde laye hoſtage firſt 〈◊〉 orleaunce brother ſonne 〈◊〉 duke berrey • oſy • duke bout 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 alenſon guy bloys erle 〈…〉 powle dyuers thus y• 〈…〉 kynge taried parte wynter • mong lordes owne blodde right ioy 〈◊〉 often tymes kynge englande 〈◊〉 child viſited hym duke • larence duke lancaſtre lorde •• mon one kynges ſōnes ſo diuers •• me made great feaſtes guether dy • er • upper diuers paſtymes lodgynge sauoy whan pleaſed • frenche kyng went kynges palaice weſtm̄ ſecret • ryuer temes often tymes theſe two k • nges whan met •• wayled lorde james bourbon ſayeng great damage hym great myſſe hym theyr cōpany became hym right well among great lordes nowe let v leaue ſpeke frenche kyng returne kyng ciper came aguillon prince wale co • ſyn receyued hym right ioyouſly like wyſe ſo dyd y• barones knyghtes 〈…〉 er poictou • ainton ſuche 〈◊〉 prince vicoūt tho ••• yong lorde pouns lorde per ••• ey ſyr loys • arcourt 〈◊〉 guyſſharde ••• ngle englande ſ • r john̄ • handos 〈◊〉 thomas felton ſir nowell lorwiche ſyr richarde pountchardon ſir symon baſſell ſir ba • wyn franuill ſir daugoriſes diuers aſwell ſame coūt • ey englande kyng ciper well honored feaſted prince prin • eſſe ſayde barones knyghtes taried monethe ser john̄ chandos ledde hym ſportynge aboute xainton poictow went ſawe good towne rochell • eaſt whan hadde viſited countrey retourned agayne angoleſme great feaſt prince helde tyme great plen tye knyghtes ſquiets anone y• feaſt kyng ciper toke leaue prince knyghtes countrey fyrſt ſhewed theym principally wherfore come thither taken hym • edde croſſe ba • e pope confermed dignite priuilege perteyned voyage howe frenche kyng deuocion diuers great lordes enterpriſed ſworne ſame thā prince knyghtes anſwered curteſly ſayd truly voiage maner men honour take hede y• pleaſure god paſſage one open ſhulde nat alone ſhulde fynde y• wolde gladde deſyre auaunce honor theſe wordes kynge ciper well content departed ſir john̄ chandos helde hym company tyll principalite vnderſtode retourned agayne fraunce parys wenynge haue founde kynge dyd nat kynge nat retourned oute englāde lay ſore ſicke lodgyng sauoy london euery daye enpayred worſe worſe whiche greatly diſpleaſed kynge englande y• quene phiſi • iens ſayde great pa • ell knewe right well duke normandy parys gouernynge realme fraunce ſyr boucequant come oute englande hadde enfourmed duke howe ſtode kynge hys father kynge nauarre alſo knewe certaynte therof thynge ſorye hoped frenche • yng dyed warre whiche made ſhulde better hym wrote captall beuſm erle foyes deſyringe hym come normādy hym ſayeng howe wolde make hym ſouerayne capt • ayne retynewe captall departed fro erle foyes toke way kyng nauer went deſyred certayne knightes ſquyers go hym howbeir fewe thus meane ſeaſon captall thus comyng war • e kyng nauerre kynge john̄ fraunce dyed bedde englande sauoy cytie london wherof kyng englande quene chyldren many •• englande right ſory heuy y• great honour loue kynge hym euer ſythe peace made bytwe • e thā duke orleaūce brother duke berry ſonne ryght ſorowfull dethe ſent incōtynent great haſt worde therof ouer ſee duke normādy wherof duke right ſory •• good reaſon howbeit knowynge hym ſelfe ſucceſſour herytage fraunce ſeynge howe kyng nauerr dayly fortifyed garyſons agaynſt hym thought tyme prouyde good counſell remody 〈◊〉 behalfe ſame ſeaſonne knyght bretayne toke euer frenche partie called ſyr bertram • e gueſcly • renowme hym nat greatly knowen 〈◊〉 tyme ſauyng among knyghtes bretayne hym abydinge ſtyll brerayne alwayes makynge warre lorde charles bloys ſo con̄ tre ſyr bertram reputed valyāt knyght welbeloued men warr greatly y• duke normādes grace grea • vertues y• h • herd reported hym whanthe duke herde dethe father dout • greatly kynge nauerre ſayd ſir boucequant sir ſuche men ye haue wyll ye ryde normandy ther ye ſhall fynde ſir bertram gueſc • yue loke togyder make army agaynſt kynge nauerr kepe ſurely ryuer seyne ſir boucequant ſayd ſhulde done ſo departed toke hym good nombre knyghtes ſquyers toke way normandy ſaynt germayns ſhewed wolde go caſtell roleboſſe wherin certayne companyons dyde ſo • che •• yll throughout worlde roleboſſe ſtronge caſtell • yuer • yne leage fro 〈…〉 tyme full companyons made warr aſ well kyng nauer frenche kyng capy ••• whome obeyed retayned certayne wage gaue called uātayre auſtarde expert man arm • bolde borne towne bruſels cōpany robbed countre hym ther none durſt go fr • parys maunt roane ponthoiſ • aſ well bete downe y• naueroyſe frenchman ſpecially conſtrayned • ore maūt whan ſir bo •• equant parted fro parys fayned take way role • oſſe howbeit taryed certayne place ſir bertram gu • ſcly • e company ryden caſtell deur • u • • ſpoken within wold • 〈◊〉 wyſe open gate lette hym fierſly dyde caſt ſtones hym whan ſawe departed wente marſhall ſyr boucequant taryed hym lytel • fro roleboſſe whan met togyder fyue hūdred men armes ſo theſe two capitayns great counſell togyder ſ • howe ſhulde mayntene themſelfe ſpecially gette yf myght towne maūt determyned boucequaunt hundred hym ſhulde ryde maunt haſt though ſore afrayed ſay howe garyſone roleboſſe dyde chaſe deſyringe open gate let ſaue garde lyues lette take ſeaſon gate ſir bertram hole company ſhulde come entre towne lyſt ſo thought without coude get maner wyſt nat howe elles gette • counſell determyned good lordes kept ſecrete among ſelfe▪ ſo thus ſir boucequant ••• ed ſayd company rode towarde maunte ▪ ſyr bertram rode thyderwarde another way put thēſelfe buſſhment nere maūt whan ſir bouceq • uant aproched nere maunt ▪ ſpar • led brode lyke men 〈◊〉 diſcōfyted chaſed ſo knyght ſir boucequant came maunt 〈◊〉 reſydue came one another called y• • arryers ſayd ye good people maunt open gate let v entre 〈…〉 r fold weth yuell murdr • r 〈…〉 ro • eboyſe chaſeth v hath vtterly diſc • • ted v within ſayd ſir 〈◊◊〉 ser boucequāt marſhall duke normady ſent hym haue fought thē rol • boyſe theues wt haue 〈◊〉 ſo behoued 〈◊〉 whyder wolde nat wyll • ake myne without ye wyll open gate let v come forſocour wt anſwered wenynge wordes • ad ben true ſayd ſir knowe well yt 〈◊〉 roleboyſe enemyes alſo care nat whem haue warr alſo thother part duke normādy ha 〈…〉 kyng nauer lor 〈…〉 therfore great dout leſt ſhulde 〈…〉 marſhall frāce • 〈◊〉 ſaytheye ſhall haue hurt • 〈◊〉 nat come countre 〈◊〉 roleboys ſo theſe wor ••• opened gate ſuffred ſir boucequant 〈◊〉 alwayes lytell lytell 〈…〉 wed ſo bytwene hyndermaſt 〈…〉 quantꝭ men formaſt ſir 〈…〉 me men maunt leaſer 〈…〉 ne gate ſir boucequant 〈…〉 n logyng vnarmed ther 〈◊〉 apeaſe thē towne ſhuld na • myſtruſt ſir bertram cō pany came galoppyng entred ye tow 〈…〉 ſaynt jues cleſquy dethe 〈…〉 eroyſe ſo enterd logyn ••• pylled robbed euer foun 〈◊〉 coke priſoners ſlewe lyſt •• ſame ſeaſon thus entred 〈…〉 another company breton came 〈…〉 ke leage then entred therm 〈…〉 lly ſayd men 〈…〉 nt thyder ſir wyllyam grāuyll 〈◊〉 maunt many mo 〈◊〉 meul •• thought wordes 〈◊〉 bycauſe came way fro maunt 〈…〉 well coulde come none way 〈…〉 ſe ryuer seyn brige 〈…〉 therfore beleued opened 〈…〉 ryers theſe breton entred 〈…〉 gate cryed ſaynt yue eleſ 〈…〉 people downe right fledde 〈…〉 themſelfe aſwell myght 〈…〉 ſawe ſelfe ſo diſceyued 〈…〉 hus maunt meulecke ta 〈…〉 duke normandy right 〈…〉 kyng nauer right ſore diſpleaſed whan knewe therof thā kyng nauerr ſet good capitayns townes caſtels toke great domage loſſe maūt meulec fayre entre fraunce ye ſame weke captall beuſz arryued chyerbourge foure hundred men armes kyng nauerr made hym great feſt ſhewed hym maner cō playnt howe duke normandy cauſed townes maunt meuleck ſtollen fro hym captall anſwered ſayd ſir pleaſe god ſhall go forwarde truſt ſhall ſpede ſo well ſhall haue theym agayne many mo ſayd howe duke normandy goynge reynes crowned ſhall go hym ſome noyaunce domage thus y• comynge captall beuſz yt kynge nauer ryght ioyouſe ſayd yt incōtynent wolde make iourney fraunce ſende men warre partes wher coudymagen haue ſame ſeaſon normandy marne knyght englāde tyme ben kynge nauerr warres ryght well expertman armes called ſir john̄ jonell cōpany thre hūdred men armes kyng nauer ſent hym deſyringe wolde come ſerue hym ſuche nombre knyght condyſcended kynges deſyre came put hym ſeruyce duke normandy knewe ryght well howe kyng nauerr aſſembled army howe captall ſhulde chiefe capitayne wrote ſir bertram cleſquy deſyring hym bretōs kepe fronter warr kyng nauer promyſyng ſend hym people ynowe fight agaynſt power kyng nauer ordayned ſir boucequāt ſhulde tary kepe maūt meulec ſo ſir bertran company breton went towarde uernon ſhorte ſpace duke normandy ſend hym great nombre men warre therle aucer vycount beaumount lorde beauiewe dyuers knyghtes ſquyers ſame ſeaſon come fraūce ſerue y• duke normandy gaſcone lorde dalbret ſir aymon punyers ſir peteton corton y• soldyche leſtrad dyuers wherof duke normādy coude thē great thank • deſyring thē ryde normandy agaynſt ennemyes theſe lordes obeyed duke rode normandy excepte lorde dalbret taryed ſtyll duke men rode forthe iourney alſo ſame ſeaſon fronters bretayne breton knyght frenche partie called beamont uale company xl ſperes breton came eureur within towne ther knyght called ſir guy granuyll alſone herde fray armed ſoudyers mounted ontheir horſes rode felde tyme ſir beamont done enterprice departynge ſir guy grauyll aſctyed ſayd beaumount ye ſhall nat thus departe firſte ye muſt ſpeke eureux ſhall teche knowe whan ſir beamont herd tourned horſe layed ſpeare reſt came agaynſt ſir guye two knyghtes mette rudely toguyder ſon ſpeares ſheuered peace ſatte ſo ſurely none fell ſo paſſed forthe courſe theyr retournynge drewe ſwerdꝭ therwith cōpanyes mette tyme many borne yerthe bothe partyes br • ton acquyted theym ſelfe valiantly howbe finally coude nat obtayne place fayne ther abyde people came ſtyll towne thē ſo ſlayne taken none ſcaped taken ſir beaumont dela uale ſir guy granuyll ledde hym priſoner caſtell eureur 〈◊〉 ſo reſydewe ſuche taken thus happed aduenture wherof ſir guy greatly prayſed beloued kyng nauer eureux ¶here begynneth featꝭ warre done 〈◊〉 tyme kyng charles 〈◊〉 wherof beginnyng ſpeketh obſequy kyng john̄ yong kyng charles honorably crowned reynes gret expēſes done beginyng batell cocherell thus asye haue herde kyng cypre retorned frā ce came parys duke normādy ther duke bretherne duke ani • ou lorde philyp duke burgone taryed body ye 〈◊〉 ge father whiche comyng englande kyng cypreholpe cōplayne dethe kyng maruey louſly diſpleaſed therwith bycauſe hyndringe vyage croyſe ſo cl • thed hym ſelfe veſture doloure day came thar body frenche kyng aproched parys body broght thyder therle artoyſe therle dā marten great priour fraūce duke normādy bretherne kyng cypre mooſt part clergy parys went fote met body beyonde ſaynt denyce fraūce ther ſolemply buryed tharchbyſſhop senceſang maſſe ſeruyce done dyner whiche right noble lordes prelate returned parys helde parlyament generall counſell determyne realme ſhuld ordred ye realme might nat longe without kyng counſelled thaduyce prelatis noble realme ſhulde drawe cite reyns ther crowne duke normā dy yet called none wiſe alſo wrote vncle uyncelant duke brabant luzēburge alſo therle flā ders deſyring coronacyon trinyte ſonday next comyng ſame ſca ſon whyle lordes made theyr puruey aunce kynges coronacyon frenchemen naueroyſe aproched nere togyder normādy cite eureux come captall beuz made ther aſſemble men warr companyons ſuche coude get ¶ nowe let v ſpeke hym ſir bertram cleſquy iourney batayle bytwene tueſday •• nyte ſonday duke normāndy ſhulde crowned kynge cathedrall churche reyns whan captall beuſz made aſſemble cite eureux archer brigans left cytie capyten called ſir mychell dorgery ſent couch lorde guy grauyll kepe fronter warr departed fro eureur men armes archer herde ſay • ow frēchmen wer abrode wyſt nat were▪ toke feldes great deſyre • ynd th • 〈…〉 red cōpany ••• de yt ſome v •• c ſpetes iii c archer 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 c men warr h •• dyuers good knightꝭ ſquiers ſpecially baneret realme nauer called y• blaſſoll marenell 〈◊〉 •• uers wyll encoūter ser bertrā cleſquy fight h •• thā drue paſſy ye b •• ge tharch thoght 〈◊〉 frēchmen ſhulde paſſe ye ryuer seyne ther ware nat paſſed redy ¶ happed y• friday whytſon w • ke y• captall cōpany rode wode auē ture met haraude armes called kynge faucon ſame mornynge deꝑted fro y• frēche hooſt aſſone captall ſe hym knewe hym well made great • •• e •• yng y• kyng england thā •• maūded hym fro whens • ame k •• tidyngꝭ frēchmen▪ ſir ꝙ name god knowe well wher depted fro day ſeke aſwell ye ꝙ captall beyond b •• ge tharche ſyde sir ꝙ fau • paſſed y• bridge uernon beleue • nowe paſſy nōbre • e ꝙ captall cap • ten haue • pray ſhewe ser ꝙ fau • ar well 〈◊〉 c fightyng men ſir bertrā cleſquy hath y• gretteſt cōpany bretōs alſo ther therle aucer y• vycount beamont y• lorde loys chalon y• lorde bea 〈…〉 y• maiſter croſ bowes tharchpreeſt lorde edward remy gaſ • one ther cōpany lorde dalbret lorde • mon punyers y• lorde suldyche l • ſtrad whan y• captall herd thoſe gaſcons named marueyled gretly bluſſed dyſpleaſure ſayd faucon true ye ſay yt theſe lordes gaſcone ar ther lorde dal br • • c • pany ſir ꝙ harald ye • fayle wher y• lorde dalbret hiſelfe ꝙ captall ser ꝙ faucon parys y• regēt duke n • rm • dy aparelleth hiſelfe go reynes ſayd y• ſonday next comyng ſhulde crowned kyng y• captall layd hand • heed ſayd great diſpleaſur ſaynt antones cap gaſcon agaynſt gaſcone ſir ꝙ faucon taryeth harald tha • chpreſt ſent ſpeke fro hym vnderſtand y• harald tharch preeſt wolde ſpeke captall ſayd faucon ſay y• frenche haralde nede nat go farther let hym ſhewe tharchpreſt y• wyll nat ſpeke hym ser johan jonell ſtept forthe ſayd ſir wyllye nat ſpeke ꝑauentur pro • yte y• captall ſayd nay warrant nat ꝓfyte tharchpreſt ſo great brauler y• come v wyll • angle ye meane tyme ymagen ſtrengthe auewe nōbre whiche parauēture ſhall torne pre •• dyce aduauntage therfore haue haſt ſpeke thā faucon y• harau • wēt thother haraud wher taryed vnder hedge excuſed y• captall ſo wyſely well content went tharchpreſt ſhewed hym faucon ſayd ¶ thus frēchmen naue royſe knolege eche y• report two haraldꝭ aparelled thēſelf echeto mete whan 〈◊〉 captall herd faucon nōbre frēchmen incōtynēt ſent certayne meſſāgers y• cyte eu • eu • ye capten ther deſyringe hym ſende cite maner cōpanyons yt able warr yt ſhulde mete hym cocherell thought fynde frenchman ſurely ſayd wherſo euer met wolde fyght thē whan theſe tidynges came y• capten eu • eu • named 〈◊〉 leger dorgery cōmaū ded euery man y• able ryde horſe ſhulde go cyte drawe y• captall ſo ther deꝑted towne •• ſixſcore yong men na • yon y• towne y• wednyſday captall lodged noone moūtayne cōpany frenchman 〈…〉 de forwarde fynde thē tyll cāe ryuer called yt countre iton ran towarde eureux ſpringeth nere couch lodged y• wedn • ſday fayre medowe longe yt ryuerſyde ſo next mor • yug bothe partyes ſent c •• rous ſe coude tidynges eche ſo eche thē made report within two leages togyder y• naueroyſe rode faucon led thē ſame way came fro thē ſo noone came way cocherell ſawe y• frenchman thē orde • yng theyr • • el ther great nōbre baner • 〈◊〉 • enōs ſo y• ſemed double • ombre y• dede naueroyſe reſted without lytell wode capitayns drue togyder ordred batayls firſt made thre batayls well proply fote ſent caryages page y• lytell wode ſet ſir john̄ jonell inthe firſt batayle withall men armes archer englande ſeconde batayle ledde captall beuſm batayle 〈◊〉 iiii c fightynge men one 〈◊〉 hym lorde saulx nauer yong luſty knight lorde wyll •• grauyll ser peter sankeuyll third batell ledde thre knyghtes yt ſay lorde baſcles • nell lorde bertram franke lorde sanſ • lo • yns iiii hūdred whan ordeyned batayls toke vaūtage lytle hyll ther beſyde right hand bytwene wode ſo fronte hyll aranged ſelfe enemyes ſette captals baner buſſhe thornes ſet lx men armes defende fro enemyes y• dyde thentent yf ſparkeled abrode ſhulde drawe ſtandarde ſo determyned nat dyſcende downe fro moū tayne maner cauſe let enemyes come thē wolde fight thē ¶ howe poleſy counſell ſir bertram cleſquy nau •• oiſe dyſcēded downe fro moūtayne fight frēchmen captall taken cap cc xxi thus ye haue herbe naueroyſe englyſſhmen arenged y• moūtayne whyle frē chmen ordred batayls wher made thre rere garde firſt ſir bertram cleſquy breton ordeyned • co • captals batayle ſeconde therle aucerr hym vycount beamond lorde baudwy • • enekyn maiſter croſ bowes thē frē chmen pycardꝭ normayns ſir edwarde rency ſir ingram • yn ſir loys • enekerques dyuers good kynght • ſquyers thirde batayle archpreeſt burgonyons hym lorde chalons lorde beau • e • lorde john̄ uyen dyuers batayle aſſigned aſſemble agaynſt b • ſcle marnell rout batayl • whiche reregarde gaſcoyns wherof ſir aymon pomyers lorde sul dyche • e ſtrade lorde perducas dalbreth lorde peteton curton ſoueray g • e capitayns theſe gaſcoyne knightes aduyſed well behauynge captall howe ſtandarde ſet buſſhe kept certayne nombre ſayd yt behoued whā batayls aſſembled togyder ſhulde endeuoure thēſelfe cōquere captals ſtanderde ſayeng howe might get enemyes ſhulde ſone diſcōfyted alſo theſe gaſcons auyſed thē another ordynaunce thē day right ꝓfitable lordes fraūce wer along ſpace togyder coūſell howe ſhulde mayn • tene themſelfe ſawe well enemyes great auauntage gaſcons ſpake worde well herde ſaid ſirs knowe well captall worthy knight founde lande long able fight ſhall v great domage let v ordayne xxx horſbacke beſt men armes company let xxx take hede nothyng addreſſe themſelfe captall whyle e • tend cōquere ſtanderd y• might horſes let breke y• prea • ſo may come captall take hym cary hym felde done ſhal haue ende batayle may taken meanes iourney ſhalbe people wyll ſo ſore abaſſhed takyng knightes fraunce bretayne acorded lyghtly y• • euyce ſayd good counſell ſo wolde among thē choſe xxx beſt men armes among mounted xxx beſt horſes cōpany drewe ſyde felde well determyned ſhulde reſydue taryed felde fote good array ¶ whan fraūce well ordred batayls euery man knewe ſhuld ther comonyng amōg thē ſhulde crye y• day ban •• ſhulde drawe ſo determyned cry lady aucerr mak • capitayne yt day cherle aucerr erle wolde wyſe agree therto take charge hym excuſed himſelfe right graciouſly ſaying lordꝭ thanke ye honour ye wolde put ſurely wyll nat therof ouer yong haue ſuche charge honor ye firſt iorney yt euer therfore ye ſhall take another many good knightꝭ ſir bertram cleſquy tharchpreſt maiſter ye croſboſe lorde loys chalon lorde aymon pomyers ſir edwarde rēcy theſe haue ben many great iorneys knowe howe order ſuche mater better therfore pray holde excuſed ye knyghtes regarded eche ſayd hym noble erle aucer ye ar ye greteſt among v lande lynage therfore right ye ought heed certenly ſirs ꝙ ye ſay pleſeth day ſhalbe one copanyons ſhall lyue dye byde myne auē ture ye ſoueraynte ſurely wyll none therof beheld eche aduyſed might make chefe capiten auyſed yt beſt knight cōpany ben beſt proued ſit bertrā cleſquy thā ordeyned comon acorde yt cry ſhulde yt day lady cleſquy ſhulde obey y• day ſir bertrā thingꝭ ordeyned ſtablyſſhed euery lorde knight vnder owne ſtā derd penon regarded enemyes hye ye hyll wolde nat departe fro ther ſtrength thought nat gretly anoyed frēchmen bycauſe yuell moūtyng yt hyll alſo ſon̄e hote biggeſt thē faynt faſtyng nother wyne vitayle thē dyde thē good wtout certayne lordes yt lytell flagon wyne anon empty made ye mornyng prouiſion vitayle thought haue fought enemy ſame mornynge dyde nat eſcryed nere myght naueroyſe englyſſhmen ſo ye day ferr gone coude aſſembled togyder whan lordes fraūce ſawe behauyng naueroyſe drue thē toguyder maner counſell de • myne whyder ſhuld go fight enemyes nat ſo dyuers opinyons ſome wold go fight wt ſayng ſhulde gret blame thē otherwyse yt ſadde well • yſed argued ye cōtrary ſayd go fyght thē wher auaūtage ſhalbe gret ꝑell v v wyll haue iii ſo finally wolde nat agre go danger yt myght fall ye naueroyſe aduyſed well maner ſayd among thēſelfe beholde yonder enemyes wyll cōe anon fight v beſemyng make thē redy therto ther certayne knightꝭ ſquyers normayns priſoners ye naueroyſe let go faythes went priuely frēche hoſt ſayd lordes ther ſirs auyſe well ye let day paſſe wt batell yor enemyes wyll morowe gretly recōforted ſayd among thē yt lorde loys nauer ſhulde cōe thē iiii c ſperes ſo theſe wordꝭ enclyned thē gretly fight enemyes ſoeuer dyd ſo made thē redy haue ſet forwarde poynt thre four tymes euer ye wyſemen helde thē backe ſayd ſirs let v abyde lytell ſpace ſe wyll hertꝭ arſo great preſūptuous yt wolde gladly fight v thē ther many ouercome hete ye ſon̄e thā noon faſted day armed ſore chafed ſayd among thē go vp hyll fight thē ar lykely loſt therfore let v drawe day logyng morowe let v take coūſell thus dyuers opinyons whan lordes knight fraūce ſawe ye gouernyng thēglyſſhmen naueroyſe howe yt wolde nat deꝑte holde yt hye noon day alſo herde ye wordes yt priſoners y• came fro thē ſayd alſo ſaw ye moſt ꝑte peple ſore traueyled hete ye ſonne thē right diſpleſant thaduyce ſir bertram cleſquy toke coūſell ſaid ſirs ſe well yt enemyes deſyreth ſore fight v howbeit wyll nat diſcende holde wtout meanes yt ſhall ſhewe let v make ſemblant wtorawe backe nat fight day alſo people ar ſore traueyled hete let v ſende varlettes caryage ſpare horſes ouer bridge water let v withdrawe backe lodgyng goynge backe lette v redy tourne agayne nede let v ſe wyll wyllyng fight v wyll dyſcend downe hyll chaſe v ſe ſo let v redy tourne agayne theym ſhall deale eaſely counſell accepted company euery lorde drewe hym vnder owne ſtanderd cauſed trū pettes ſowne retrayt commaunded knightes ſquyers varlet paſſe bridge cary ouer caryages thus paſſed ouer ſome men armes paſſed fayntly whan ser john̄ jonell expert knyght great deſyre fyght frēchmen ſawe maner thē howe drue backe ſayd captall ſir let v go quickely ſe nat howe flye away ſaid captall truſt nat therto yuell entēt begyle v ſir john̄ jonell auaūced hymſelfe great deſyre fight wt enemyes ſayng company ſaynt george ſoeuer loueth let thē folowe wyll go fight enemyes ſo toke ſpeare hande wente forthe batayls dyſcended downe hyll ſome company captall knewe therof whan ſawe yt ſir john̄ jonell gone fyght without hym toke great preſūpcyon ſayd thē hym ſirs let v go downe hyll quickely ſir john̄ jonell ſhall nat fight without captall cōpany auaunced downe hyll whan frenchman ſawe thē diſcend fro ye hyll came playne feldes ryght ioyouſe ſayd lo nowe may ſe haue deſyred day ſo ſodē ly torned cryed lady cleſquy dreſſed baners agaynſt ye naueroyſe ſo aſſē bled togyder fote ser john̄ jonell coragiouſly aſſēbled baners agaynſt ye batayle breton whome ser bertram chefe capitayne dyde many feat armes hardy knight thus knightꝭ ſquiers ſparcled abrode playne fought togyder ſuche wepyns eche entred others batayle ſo fought great corage wyll englyſſhmen naueroyſe cryed ſaynt george frē chemen lady cleſquy many good knightꝭ frenche parte ſir bertram cleſquy ye yong erle aucer vycoūt beamont ser baudwen denekyn ser loys chalon ye yong lorde beauieu ſir antony yt day rered baner ſir antony daneſkerly ser edward rēcy ser ingram hedyn alſo gaſcoyns firſt ser aymon pomyers ser perducas dalbreth ser suldych de le ſtrade ser peteton corton dyuers ſorte gaſcoyns dreſſed agaynſt captall company 〈◊〉 agaynſt thē great deſyre mete eche ſore batayle many noble feate armes done acheued mā ought nat ly willyngly might deman̄ ded wher tharchpreeſt ſeaſon great capitayne great company vnder rule bycauſe make mencyon hym ſhall ſhewe trouthe ſoone archpreeſt ſawe batayle begyn gette hym ſelfe preaſe ſayd company hym bare ſtanderd charge ye loue fere diſpleaſur ye abyde thende batayle deuours aſwell ye can̄e wyll departe nat retorne agayne may nat day fight armed agaynſt ſome knight felde agaynſt v demaunde anſwere haue ſhewed thus departed one ſquyre onely hym ſo repaſſed ryuer lette remnant deale ſo reſydue felde myſt nat ſawe baner company thende batayle wherfore beleued ſurely yt ben ꝑſonally nowe ſhall ſhewe ye bataile howe ended begynnyng batayle whan ſir johan jonell come downe hyll company hym captall alſo company truſting haue vyctorie howe beit caſe tourned otherwyſe ſawe frēchmen torned good array ordre perceyued well howe ben haſty cōe fro aduauntage howbeit lyke valyant knyghtes baſſhed nothynge thought wynne victory handes playne felde ſo lytell reculed backe aſſēbled togyder people made way archer come forthe behynde whan archer forwarde ſhotte fierſly togyder frenchman ſo well armed ſo ſtrongely pauyſſed toke lytell hurt letted nat fyght ſo entred among thenglyſſhmen naueroyſe lykewiſe among ſo ther bytwene cruell batayle toke ſtrentgh armes wreſtlyng ſperes are wepyns eche fro toke priſoners bothe partes thus fought hand hand ſo valiātly y• marueyle holde • ye may well beleue y• great preas parell many ouerthrowen ſtay • e ther none y• ſpared ſay playnly y• frēchmen nede thā ſlepe hande people hardy full corage wherfore behoued euery man aquyte thēſelfe valyantly defende bodyes kepe countre take aduantage whan came poynt el ben diſconfyted surely breton gaſcons dyd acquyte thēſelfe right well y• day dyd many noble feate armes ſhall ſhew y• xxx y• apoynted ſet captall right well horſed toke hede nothyng el executyng •• enterprice y• charge ſo togyder cāe captall wher fyghtyng great axe hande gaue therwith ſo great ſtrokes y• none durſt aproch nere hym theſe xxx force horſes brake peaſe came captall clene • e toke began batayls ſore euery place captals men cryed y• reſcue payne au • yled nothing y• captal caryed y• felde tyme herd tell y• bett ¶howe thenglyſſhmen naueroyſe diſcōfyted batayle cocherell howe y• yong kyng fraūce made broder duke burgoyne caſtels fortreſſes wonne cap cc xxii great batayle thenglyſſhmen naueroyſe entended folowe reſcue captall ſaw caryed away frenche ꝑte ſir aymon pomyers ser petyton corton ſir souldyche de la ſtrade lorde dalbretes company entended coragyous wyll dreſſe thē towarde captals ſtanderd ſtode buſſhe ſore batayle ſtanderd well defēded good men warr ſpecially ſir baſcle marnell ſir geffray rouſelone▪ ther many reſcues many one hurt caſt erthe nowe beit naueroyſe y• ſtanderd ouerthrowen baſcle marnell ſlayne ſir geffray rouſelone taken priſoner ſir aymon pomyers man coude tell became whider ſlayne taken whan captals ſtāderd taken torne peace meane ſeaſon breton frēchmen pycardes normayns burgonyons fought valiātly ſtode thē well hand y• naueroyſe cauſed thē ſomwhat recule▪ ther deed frēche ꝑtie y• vy coūt beamont y• great domage luſty yong knyght lykely haue pued noble man cōpany great payne caryed felde herde recounted thē bothe ꝑties nat benſene aforei ſuche batell ſuche nombre ſo well fought batayle fote hand hand medled togyder eche ꝑtie fought ſuch wepyns ther many gret ſtroke gyuen are ſteell ther ſore hurt ser petyton corton ſir suldich de la ſtrade ſuche wyſe y• coude good y• day sir john̄ jonell whome batell began dyd y• day many feate armes hurt dyuers placꝭ body finally takē priſoner ſquyer briten cōpany ser bertrā cleſquy caryed y• preaſe ther ſlayne y• frēche ꝑtie y• maiſter y• croſbowes ſir loys hennebreq̄ dyuers y• naueroyſe y• lorde ſaul • many men ſame day dyed priſoner ser john̄ jonell ther taken ser wyllm̄ grauyll ser peter sankuyll ser geffray rouſelon ser bertram frāke dyuers fewe y• naueroyſe ſaued wer nere takē ſlayne y• place batayle normādy nere cocherell tueſday xxiiii day may y• yere lorde iii c lxiiii ¶after diſcōfytur y• deed diſpoyled euery man takyng hede priſoners dreſſyng thē y• hurt y• moſt part frēchmen repaſſed y• bridge drawyng lodgyng right ſore traueyled wery ſame ſeaſon ser guy grauyll ſon ſir wyllm̄ grauyll departed y• ſame mornyng fro y• garyſon couch l ſperes thentent haue come captall y• batayle began wherfore made great haſte came place batayle ben frenchman wer behynd cryed cōpany ſayng • ne agayne ſirs behold cometh mo enemyes ſir aymon company ther redy whan ſawe naueroyſe ſet ſtāderd high buſſhe cauſe frenchman drawe thyder whan ser guy herd cry lady cleſquy ſa • e nat captall none cōpany ſawe moche peple lye deed groūde parceyued well naueroyſe ben diſconfyted retorned ſame way came y• euenyng frenchman toke hede priſoners ther moche ſpekyng enquiring archpreeſt whan knowen y• nat batayle▪ men excuſed hym aſ well coude xxx y• toke captall neuer ſeaſſed tyll brought hym caſtell uernon next day frēchmen dyſloged went 〈…〉 one lefte parte priſoners ¶df coronacyon kynge charles fyfte cap cc xxiii trinyte ſonday yere lorde ccc lxiiii kyng charles ſo • e heyre kyng john crowned ſacted kynge great churche lady reyns alſo quene wyfe dought duke peter burbone tharchebyſſhop ſame place ther preſent kyng peter cypre duke anion duke burgone ſir uyncelāt behayne duke luzenburge brabant erles ewe dāpmactyn takernyll uādemont many prelate lordꝭ cite great feeltꝭ ſolemnytees v dayes kyng departed wente parys nat recounted hole day solēnyties great f • ſtes parys made lordes retourned owne countrees ſuche ben kynges coronacyon kynges comynge parys yongeſt brother put poſſeſſyon duchy burgone ſo departed fro parys great nōbre men 〈◊〉 went toke lyuery ſeaſon homage baron knyghtes cytes caſtels good townes duchy burgone whan viſited coutre retorned parys ſame ſeaſon tharchpreeſt apeſed kyngꝭ diſpleaſur ſuche excuſacions layd hymſelfe y• nat iourney cocherell ſhewynge might nat armed agaynſt y• captall captall y• requeſt lorde dalbret let priſon faithe trouth captal ayded gretly excuſe arch preeſt kyng knightꝭ fraūce ſuche ſpake yuell hym alſo th • newly ouerthrowen burgone beſyde dyuyn iiii c cōpanyons pyllers coutre wher gyllot du pyn talbert tacylbordon john̄ chafour capitayns ſame ſeaſon kyng cauſed beheded ser peter sanguyll cytie rone bycauſe become naueroyſe ſit grauyll ben y• ſame caſe ſir guy ſon nat ſent worde y• kyng y• put dethe father wolde lyke wiſe ſerue ſir beamon de la uale great lorde bretayne priſoner wherfore lynage kynred dyd ſomoch ſute y• kyng y• exchange made bytwene ſir beamon ſir grauyll eche delyuerd ſeaſon ser bertrā cleſquy gate agayne y• caſtell roleboyſe vi frākes y• payd y• capten therof named uaſter retorned agayne brabāt fro whens came yet dyuers cōpanyons y• helde ſtyll ſudry treſſes calr normādy perch becauſe • placs y• dyd moch hurt trouble y• realme fraūce ſome tytle y• king nauer ſome owne quarell robbe coūtre without reaſon true tytle frē che kyng ſent brother y• duke burgone agaynſt theſe pyllers ſo duke made ſomons y• cyte charter thā drue felde hym ser bertram cleſquy ſir boucequāt therle aucer ſir loys chalon y• lorde beauieu ser aymon punyers ſir rauenall y• begue vyllayns ser nicholl lyne maiſter croſbowes ser edmarde rācy ser ingrā hedyn nōbre v fightynge men whan ſawe wer ſo great nōbre deuyded thre ptes wherof ſir bertram cleſquy wet toward cōſtātyne throwe y• march cherburge kepe frōters y• naueroyſe ſhuld hurt domage y• coūtre mandy hym y• lorde auter erle joney ſir arnold dandrehen many knightes ſquiers briten normandy ſeconde bataile lorde de la ryuer cōpany dyuers knyghtes ſquyers fraūce pycardy ſent 〈◊〉 erldome eureux duke hymſelfe gretteſt company went layd ſege marchranuyll ſtronge caſtell naueroyſe brought thyder many engyns fro cyte charter whiche dyde caſt day night dyde within moche trouble 〈◊〉 iourney duke burgone made agaynſt garyſons naueroyſe ſocour frēche kynge ſent ſir charles bloys ca cc xxiiii meane ſeaſon theſe mē warr thus beauſe normandy makyng warre agaynſt naueroyſe enemyes realme ther ſir loyes nauer charge warr vnder brother y• kyng defyed frēche kyng bycauſe warr touched chalenge enherytance batell cocherell aſſembled togyder men warr coude get dyde ſo moche meanes gat certayne capitayns cōpanyons ſo y• nombre xii hundred ſperes hym ſir robert canoll ſir robert ceney ſir robert briquet carſnell dayly encreaſed loged bytwene ryuer loyre ryuer dallet ſo ouerran great ꝑte coūtre burbonoyſe mo • lyns auuergne ſaynt peter mynſter ſaynt purſayn ſir loyes cōpany day ccc whome ſir bertram de la sale ortyngo capitaynes departed paſſed loyre beſyde marcilly nonnes rode ſo long night day aryued charytie ryuer loyre great towne well cloſed incōtynent ſealed entred taryed ſtyll place entred feared leſt towne ſet buſſhmen thē therfore durſt entre farther tyll fayre day meane ſeaſon y• towne caryed goodes botes whiche ryuer loyre themſelfe wyues chyldren ſorowed away towarde cytie neuers whiche fyue leages then whā day naueroyſe englyſſhmen gaſcoyns ſuche ſcaled towne went forward towne founde houſes voyde thā determyned kepe towne fortify thought ſtode metely ouer ron countre bothe ſydes ryuer loyre thā ſent worde therof ſi • lois nauer marche auuergne incōtynent ſent ſir robert briquet thre hundred ſpeares paſſed countre without reſyſtence ſo entred bridge ouer loyre charite whan met togyder thought ſelfe ſtrong ynowe began make ſore warre realme fraunce nowe lette v ſpeke duke burgoyn lay ſiege marcherāuyll oppreſſed within ſo ſore y• yelded vp towne ſauyng lyues goodes ſo departed duke ſent ſir boucequant ſir johan uyen marſhall burgoyn take poſſeſſyon y• towne made capitayne therof ſquyer called guyllyam charter hym fourtie ſoudyers duke went company canerolles layd ſege ther ſtode playne countre nowe let v ſpeke ſir john̄ de la ryuer lay ſyege acqueney nere paſſy coūtie eureux cōpany ii ſo gret kyng y• might ſpende lyſt wtin caſtell aqueney englyſſhmen norman frenchman naueroyſe bene ther euer ſythe batayle cocherell defē ded right valyantly well fortifyed artyllary vytels howbeit finally fayne yelde vp caſtell lyues goodes ſaued ſo departed caryed goodes cherbourge taryed thā ſir john̄ de la ryuer garniſſhed caſtell frenchman wente towarde cytie deureux hym ſir hewe caſtell lorde sāny ſir mathewe roy ſir monfange lorde ely lorde creſques lorde cāpy ſir edwarde roucy ſir ingram hedyn dyuers knightes ſquyers fraū ce y• meane ſeaſon duke burgon dyde ſo moche canerolles fayne yelde thē pleaſure ſo ſoudyers ſtraūgers taken mercy certayne pyllers nacyon fraū ce ther taken put dethe came duke certayne burgeſſes charter deſyred duke wolde gyue wage rewarde engens caſtell canerolles whiche done thē great hurt tyme paſt duke gaue wolde therwith charter ſette men warke beate clene downe erthe duke wente vnto caſtell called drewe playne countre beau therin certayne pyllers duke 〈◊〉 〈◊〉 within slayne duke went caſtell named pru •• beſiged made many aſſaut wanne 〈◊〉 finally yelded vp lyues onely ſaued goodes bare away nothyng frenchman within kept ſtyll priſoners y• duke toke poſſeſſion caſtell gaue knight beauſſe called ſir peter du boyes thentent ſhulde fortify kepe ſufficyently duke went refreſſhed cytie charter part hooſt whan ben fyue dayes went beſeged caſtell conuay whiche done moche trouble countre duke cauſed sixe great engens reyſed agaynſt meane ſeaſon whyle y• duke made theſe aſſantes normādy ſir loys nauer ouerran y• lowe coū tre auuerne kept ſtyll feldes ſore enpoueryſſhed countre none duell encountre hym alſo garyſon char • te dyd lyſt alſo therle mounthelyert alyes almayne entred duchy burgoyn beſancon waſted countre whrefore y• frēche kyng ſent duke gone y• ſhulde breke vp ſege cō uay drawe parys ſo go burgone whan duke herd 〈◊〉 ry promyſed nat depart fro conuay tyll coūſell ſayd ſythe kynge ſent hym myght well depart breke promyſe made therof semblaunt thē conuay marſhall enquired wolde yelde vp ſimply duke pleaſure anſwered nay howebeit ſayde content yelde vp caſtell theyr lyues goodes ſaued whiche fre accepted departed y• duke delyuered caſtell knyght beau named philyppe • arciers newly fortifyed duke wēt charter gaue charge mooſt parte
