ther men came helpe hym ther ſlayn alſo knight england called ser rafe helme ſomtyme called ye grene ſquier ſquyer called james roulant bycauſe made defence domfe rant caſters none yuell remayned priſoners begue uyllayns ſir lyon kaonet thus ended kyng dampeter caſtell ſomtyme reigned great proſperyte ſlayne lefte thre dayes aboue y• erthe thynke great pyte next day lorde nātueyle yelded hym kynge henry toke hym mercy tho wolde tourne tidynges ran ouer caſtell kyng dāpeter ſlayne wherof frēdes ſory enemyes ioyfull whan kynge portyngale herde howe coſyn kyng dāpeter deed right ſorowfull ſware ſayde dethe ſhulde reuenged ſo ſentincōtynent defyā ce kyng henry made hym warr kept marcheſſe ciuyll agaynſt certayn ſeaſon kyng henry left nat purpoſe purſuyng enterpriſe returned tollet yelded vp ſtreight hym countre ther laſt kyng portīgale thought nat kepe lengar warr agaynſt kyng henry ſo ther peace made bytwene thē meanes prelate lordes spayne thus kinge henry abode peace kyng caſtell hym ſir bertram cleſquy ſir olyuer māny knightes ſquyers frā ce bretayne kyng henry dyd moche thē bounde without helpe nat obtayned purpoſe ſo made ſir bertram conſtable spayne gaue hym lande soyrie whiche yerely worthe xx trankes ſir olyuer nephue gaue lande crete yerely worth x frākes alſo gaue fayre landꝭ dyuers knightes ſquiers kynge went lay burgus wife child proſperyte good aduēture gretly reioyſed frenche kyng duke aniou alſo kyng aragon ſame tyme dyed ſir lyon englande duke clarence paſt ſee ye haue herde maried doughter galays lorde myllayne bycauſe dyed ſtrāgely lorde edwarde spens company kept warr agaynſt hym certayne ſpace finally enformed trouthe ¶ nowe let v retourne aduentures duchy acquitayne ye haue herd howe prince determyned reyſe fowage lande people thought ſhulde theyr gret charge ſpecially gaſcone lowe march poytou xayton rochell acorded lightly therto bycauſe nere prince abidyng alſo wer euer obeyſant ferme ſtable prince tho coū tree bring mater paſſe ye prince counſell dyuers ꝑlyamentes nyort angoleme poyters burdeux bergerat alwayes angoleme mē teyned ſtyll ſayd wolde pay nothyng ſayd wolde nat ſuffre fowage ryn coūtre sayeng howe theyr reſort hath ben alwayes chābre frē che kyng whiche reſorte prince ſore diſpleaſed argued agaynſt ſayd ought haue reſorte ther affirmynge howe french kyng quyted reſortes iuriſdyctions whan rēdred landꝭ kyng england well aparēt tenour charter ye peace wherin maketh playne mēcion ſo ther article reſerued frēch kyng peace y• anſwered agayne y• gaſcons ſayeng howe nat power frenche kyng aquyte thē fro reſort prelate baron cyties good townes gaſcone wolde neuer haue ſuffred neuer wyll agayn though realme fraūce ſhuld euer abyde warr thus y• prince lordes gaſcoyne ſuſteyned ſtyll opinyon abode parys frenche kyng therle armynake lorde dalbret therle pyergort erle comygines dyuers dayly enformed kyng howe prince great pride preſumpcion wolde trede vnder reyſe vp newe thyngꝭ countreis whiche ſayd wolde neuer ſuffre done conſydering reſorte hym therfore deſyred y• prince ſhulde apelled chambre ꝑlyament peres fraūce anſwer ther grefes trouble wold french kyng wolde entertayne theſe lordes gaſcone y• requyred ayde confort ſouerayne lorde y• ſhulde drawe none court leſynge ſeignory cōdiſcended requeſt agaynſt wyll cauſe ſawe well ſhuld turne haue opyn warr without good tytell reaſon wolde lothe moue alſo ſawe realme ſore troubled cō panyons enemyes alſo brother ye duke berry hoſtage england therfore toke great leyſer caſe ye ſame ſeaſon came fraūce lorde guy ligny erle ſ poule without taking leaue thenglyſſhmen great ſubtylte maner howe longe reherſe therfore wyll paſſe ouer brefely erle hated ſo englyſſhmen yt coude ſay good dyd aſmoche might frēch kynge ſhulde cōdiſcend requeſt ye gaſcons knewe well prince apeled ye court ꝑlyament ſhulde great occaſion mouyng warr opynion erle ſ poule agreed dyuers prelate erles baron knightes realme frāce ſayd kyng howe kyng england nat well kept peace whervnto ſworne ſealed acordinge tenor treaty made bertiguin beſyde de charter cōfermed calays ſayd thenglyſſhmen hath hated realme fraūce ſyth peace made dyde ſir ſay ye ſhall fynde trouth ye cauſe charter peace reed kyng england ſon bounde faithe othe kynge better enformed trouthe kepe ye rightes realme cauſed brought chābre counſell charter peace made reed ouer often tymes better examyne ye poyntes artycles cōpriſed thē amonge ther one ſubmyſſion wheron kyng counſayle areſted mooſt bycauſe ſpake clerely playnly loked tenour wherof foloweth edward grace god kyng england lorde irlande acquitayn preſent letter ſeyth ſend gretyng knowe finall laſt acorde peace made bytwene v oure right dere brother french kyng conteyned two artycles cōpriſyng ye forme folowing firſt wher ſayde foreſayd kynges bounde cauſe cōfermed ſayd artycles cōpriſed peace ho la father pope ſo delyuerd ſentence fro court rome touchyng ꝑfection accōplyſſhment preſent treaty ſo delyuerd ꝑties leſt within thre wekes french kyng ſhulde aryued calys alſo thentent theſe artycles treaty paſſed ſhulde ferme ſtable ther ſhulde made certayne bondes delyuered foloweth ſay letter ſealed ſeales bothe kynges eldeſt ſonnes ſuche ſhulde deuyſed counſayles bothe kynges alſo ſayd kynges child ſhulde ſwere gret lynage nōbre xx ſhulde kepe ayde kept aſmoche thē lyeth ſayd artycles acorded agreed acō plyſſhe ſame without fraude male engin alſo bothe kynges ſhuld beſt power frēdes bring rebel obeyſance acordyng forme truce alſo bothe kyngꝭ ſhulde ſubmyt thēſelfe realmes correction pope thētent ſhulde cōſtreyne cenſuries churche ſo euer ſhulde rebell fall concorde peace beſyde bothe kynges heyres othe aſſurance ſhulde renoūce grace proſſes dede done thē though diſobeyſance rebellyon puyſſance ſubgettꝭ french kyng wherby kyng ſhulde let accomplyſſhe ſayd artycles yet kyng england heyres yt ſhuld make warr realme frāce kynges togyder ſhulde enforce thēſelfe reduce rebel peace concorde alſo though ſubgettꝭ kyng england wolde nat rendre townes caſtels fortreſſes helde realme fraunce whiche ought delyuerd reaſon peace iuſt cauſe wherby kyng englande ſhulde let acōplyſſhe ought reaſon treaty kynges togyder ſhuld make warr agaynſt ſuch rebel bring thē good obeyſance recouer ſuche townes caſtels fortreſſes delyuer thē ther ought ſhulde ther made ꝑfyte ſure bandes coude deuyſed aſwell holy father pope coledge cardynalles alſo ther another artycle ye ſame treaty ſayeng thus token perfyte knowlege deſyre haue noriſſhe ꝑpetuall peace loue bytwene v brother france renounce theſe preſentes renounce grace proceſſe dede agaynſt ſayd brother heyres ſucceſſours realme france ſubgettꝭ therof promyſe ſwere haue ſworne body jeſu cryſt v ſucceſſours ye ſhulde nat ſuffre done dede worde thyng ayenſt renūciaciō agaynſt thyng cōteyned forſayd artycles ſuffre done cōtrary maner way whiche god beve wyll yt reputed falſe forſworne ryn ſuche blame diſfainy kinge ſacred ought ſuche caſe clerely renoūce diſpēſacions abſolucions ye pope obteyned wyll ſtande nought valure yt ayd v nat maner caſe fermlyer vpholde ſayd artycles put v heyres ſucceſſours iuriſdyction correction ye church rome wyll conſent yt holy father pope conferme ſayd treaty ordayne monycions generall cōmaūdemētes agaynſt v heyres ſucceſſours agaynſt ſubgettꝭ comōs vniuerſiteis collegꝭ ſinguler ꝑſons ſoeuer gyueng ſentēce generall curſyng ſuſpēdyng interdityng ryn v thē aſſon atēpt cōtrary ye ſaid trety ocupyēg waꝭ caſtels fortreſſes thing doyng ratifyeng gyueng coūſell cōfort fauour ayde priuely openly agaynſt ſayd artycles alſo haue cauſed dere eldeſt ſonne edwarde prince wale ſwere ſame alſo yonger ſōnes lyonell erle ulſter john̄ erle richmont edmond langley right dere coſyn phylyp nauar duke lācaſtre bretayne therles stafford saliſbury ye lorde māny caprall befz lorde mōtford james audley roger beauchampt john̄ chandos rafe ferres edward spens thom̄s wyllm̄ phelton eu ſtate dābretycourt frāke de hall john̄ mō bray bartylmewe brome henry percy dyuers alſo ſhall cauſe ſwere aſſone cōueniently chyldren mooſt ꝑte great prelatꝭ erles baron noble realme england witneſſe herof haue put ſeale theſe preſentꝭ gyuen towne calais yere lorde ccc threſcore xxiiii day octobre ¶ among writynges ben graū ted aſwell bertigny beſyde charter calays whan kynge johan ther ſayd charter one thē well reed examyned kyng charles preſēce chefe coūſell ye prelate baron france ſayd kyng sir ye kynge england prince ſon haue nat fulfylled ſayd peace haue taken townes caſtels kepe thē great domage realme raūſometh pylleth people ſo paymēt redēcion yet ꝑtie vnpayed therfore ſir ſubgettes haue good ryght iuſt cauſe brek peace make warr agaynſt thēglyſhmen take fro thē bretayn haue ſyde water alſo ſome counſayle ſhewed ſecretly great delyberacion ſayeng ſir hardely take warre forye haue cauſe ſo ſir aſſone ye one begyn warr ye ſhall ſe fynde yt ye duchy acq qui tayn ſhall turne aſwell prelate baron erles knightꝭ ſquiers burgeſſes good townes ye may ſe ſir howe prince wolde ꝓcede reyſing fowage nat bring purpoſe ſo ther hatred withall ꝑſons poictou xaynton querry lymoſyn rouerne rochell ſuche nature yt wyſe loue thēglyſhmen thēglyſhmen thē ſo proude preſūtuous neuer dyd alſo beſyde ye officer price dothe ſuche extorciōs people xaintō poitou rochell take abādon reyſeth ſomoch thē tytell ye price ſo ther none yt ſure haue thing owne alſo gētylmen countre attayne offyce prefermēt ye englyſhmen ſeruantꝭ prince hath thus french kyng moued coūſayled moue warr nāely duke aniou lay tholous deſyred gretly warr leued nothing thēgliſhmen bycauſe ſuche diſpleaſures done hym tyme paſt alſo gaſcons ſayd often tymes kyng dere ſir bounde haue reſorte court therfore hūbly requyre yt ye wyll right lawe ye moſt rightfull price worlde v right great grefes extorcions yt price wale people doth wolde v ſir ye refuce v ryght ſhall thā purchace ſelfe ſome remedy ſome place ſhall yelde put ſelfe vnder iuriſdyction ſuche lorde ſhall cauſe v haue reaſon ſo therby ſhall leſe ſeignory ouer v french kynge • othe leſe thē ▪ thinkyng might great hurt preiudice realme anſwered thē right curteſly ſayd sir faute lawe good counſayle▪ ye ſhall nat nede reſorte court onely mynde howbeit ſuche beſyneſſe behoueth worke folowe good coūſell aduyce thus kyng draue nigh ye ſpace yere kept ſtyll hym parys payed e • pences gaue great gyftes iowelles alwayes rauſed beſecretly enquered amonge peace broken bytwene hym englande whyder wolde maynteyne quarell nat anſwered warr one open frenche kyng ſhulde nat nede care part ſayd ſtronge ynough kepe warr price puyſſance alſo kynge ſent thē abuyle knowe yf wolde tourne take parte become frenche anſwered deſyred nothynge worlde ſo moche french hated ſo deedly •• glyſſhmen thus french kyng gate hym • r • de ꝑtes el durſt nat haue done y• dyde ſame ſeaſon borne charies kynges eldeſt ſon yere lord 〈◊〉 ccc l • viii wherof realme france ioyfull lytell borne charles dalbret byrthe theſe two coſyn germayns realme ioyefull ſpecially frenche kyng ¶ howe french kynge ſent ſo •• n prince wale apell yere perſonally chambre • eres france parys anſwere agaynſt baron gaſcone cap cc xliii moche french kyng exhorted coū ſayle ſo ofte requyred thē gaſcoyne ther apell made formed ſent 〈…〉 quitayne apele prince wale • lyament paris deuyſed • rle armynake lorde dalbret erle •• ergo • rt therle comynges vycont •• rmayne▪ lorde de la barde lorde •• ncornet dyuers chiefe cauſers mater apele cōteyned howe great grefes theſe gaſcons cō pleyned prince wale acquitayne wolde thē people therfore made reſort frenche kyng reqryng prince might apelled ſyth made frēch kyng iuge whan apell made duely corrected wyſe coūſell france concluded ſayd counſell ſhulde ſignifyed prince ſhulde apelled apere proper perſon parys chā bre peres france anſwere cō playntes made ther agaynſt hym bere apell cōmaunded clerke well langaged ſuche beſyneſſe knyght wt hym called cāponell cāponall ſo cōpany deꝑted fro parys toke theyr way towarde poictou ſo paſſed berry tourayne poyctou xaynton came blay ther paſſed ryuer ſo came burdeux wher prince princeſſe alwayes euery place ſaid meſſangers fro french kyng wherfore ye better welcome euery place toke vp logynge taryed ther night next mornyng cōuenyent hour went abbey ſaynt andrewes wher prince loged ther well receyued whan prince knewe comyng cauſed thē cōe whan came preſens kneled downe made reuerence delyuered prince letter credence prince toke reed thē ſayd ſirs ye welcome declare meſſage yt ye haue charge ſhewe v thā y• clerke ſaid right dere ſir let • delyuered v paris lorde french kyng y• whiche letter ꝓmyſed faithes publyſh openly preſens ſir touche prince began change colour great marueyle might ſo knightes howbeit refrayned hymſelfe ſayd say ſirs ye wyll good tidyngꝭ wyll glad clerke toke ye writyng reed word word y• tenor y• herafter foloweth charles grace god french kyng nephue prince wale ac • tayne ſend gretyng dyuers prelate baron knightꝭ vnyuerſites comynaltes college march lymitacyōs coūtre gaſcone dweller habitantes bondes realme beſyde dyuers duchy acquitayne drawen cōe court haue ryght certayne grefes trouble vnlaufull y• feble counſell ſymple informacion haue bē purpoſe whiche haue marueyle therfore withſtande remedy ſame mater ſo cōioyned thē ryall mageſty ſegnory cōmaunde come cyte paris proper 〈◊〉 ſon ther ſhew preſent v chambre peres ther right forſayd complayntes grefes moued people claymeth haue reſorte court▪ nat fayled haſty wyſe ye ſight herynge theſe letter wytnelſe wherof theſe preſentes haue ſet ſeale gyuen parys xxv day january ¶ whan prince wale reed letter great marueyle ſhoke heed behelde ferſely ye frenchman whan lytell ſtudyed anſwered maner s wyll gladly go parys vncle ſythe hath ſent thus v aſſure y• ſhall baſſenet heed l • men company two frenchman kneled downe ſayde dere ſir goddeſſake take pacy • ce take nat apell ſo great diſpyte nat diſpleaſed v sir meſſangers ſent lorde french kynge whome muſt nedes obey ſubgettes ought obey wherfore ſir behoueth v cōmaundement ſir ſoeuerye wyll gyue v • charge ſay ſhall ſhe kyng prince lorde nay 〈◊〉 price ſirs nat diſpleaſed thē ſent hyder kyngyomaiſter nat well counſelled cōpoy • e hym ſelfe oure ſubgettes make hym ſelfe iudge wher hath nothyng maner ryght ſhalbe well ſhewed rendring puttyng poſſeſſyon ye kyng father duchy acquitayne quited maner reſortes hath cauſed appele agaynll hath none reſort right court england kyng dere father ſhalbe otherwyſe enſure ſhall coſt hundred thouſande mennes lyues therwith prince departed went chambre lefte thē ſtyll ther knightes englande came ſayd sir • e may depart whan yelyſt logyng ye haue right well acōplyſſhed meſſage loke none anſwere ye haue knight clerke departed went lodgyng ſo dyned dy • er truſſed mounted horſbacke departed fro burdeur toke way tholous warde thy • •• ſhewe duke iou ſpedde prince ſore dyſpleaſed apele ſo knightes hym counſayled prince yt two french meſſāgers ſhulde haue ſ • ayne laboure prince charged cōtrary howbeit agaynſt many ſore ymaginacyon whan ſhewed hym howe deꝑted without lycence yt rydden towarde tholous thā called hym ser thomas phelton ſeneſhall rouergne ſir thomas pountchardone ſir thomas percy chauncellour byſſhoppe bale prince demaunded yf frenche meſſangers ſaue conducte hym nat anſwered knewe none hath ſayd prince ſhoke heed ſayd nat cōuenyent yt ſhulde thus lightly deꝑte coūtre make tāgelingꝭ ye duke • ou loueth v lytell • wyll glad yt haue thus ſomoned v ī owne hous trowe thingꝭ cōſydred rather meſſāgers myne owne ſubgettꝭ therle armynake lorde dalbret therle pyergort therles comynges carmayne y• frēch kyngꝭ therfore bycauſe great diſpite yt haue done v wold ouer taken put priſon prince coūſell right ioyouſe ſayd ser fereye haue taryed long fro purpoſe cōtynēt ſeneſhall dagenois cōmaū ded take ser wyllm̄ mōke right good knight england yt ſhulde ryde ſtoppe ye meſſāgers ſo deꝑted folowed ſo long thē yt laſt ouertok thē lande dagenois areſted thē made occaſyon price cō maūdemēt areſtyng ſpake worde prince ſayd howe hoſt wher lay laſt compleyned thē horſe yt ſayd changed knight ye clerke great marueyle tidynges excuſed thēſelfe excuſe coude nat auayle ſo brought cytie dagen putte priſon let ſome page departe went cytie tholous recorded y• duke aniou hole mater wherof nothyng diſpleaſed thought well y• therby ſhuld begyn warr hatred ſo prepared couertly therfore tidyngꝭ came y• french king ▪ pagꝭ went recoūted hole mater hym herde ſene whiche kyng ſore diſpleaſed toke great diſpyte▪ toke coūſayle aduyſe theron ſpecially wordes y• ſhewed price ſhulde ſay ▪ whan ſaid wolde come ꝑſonally vncle anſwere apell made agaynſt baſſenet heed lx men warre cōpany ▪ agaynſt french kyng made prouyſion ryght ſubtelly wiſely thought well weighty mater make warr agaynſt kyng england puyſſance seyng howe put predeceſſours tyme paſt ſomoche labour trauell whefore thought harde mater begyn warr ſo ſore requyred great lordes gaſcon guyen alſo ſhewed great extorcions domagꝭ thenglyſſhmen dyde dayly likely tyme come graūted warr yuell wyll cōsydring diſtruction y• poore people thought ſhulde enſue therby ¶ howe duke berry dyuers hoſtage englā de returned frāce ca c cxliiii agaynſt ferſe āſwere prince frēch kynge counſell ꝓuyded therfore priuely y• ſame ſeaſon returned france england duke john̄ berry kyng englande gaue leaue hole yere ▪ bare himſelfe ſo wiſely neuer retourned agayne made ſuche excuſacious meanes warr opyn ye ſhall herafter▪ alſo lorde john̄ harcort retourned owne coūtre kyng england gaue leaue deꝑte inſtance ſir loys harcort vncle poyctou ꝑteyning price fell ſicke whiche happy hym ſickenes endured tyll warr newly begon ſo therby neuer returned agayne englande guy bloys yong ſquyer brother therle bloys frāke fre delyuerd england whan ꝑceyued french kyng whōe lay hoſtage dyd nothyng delyuerance fell treaty lorde coucy wedded doughter king englā de yerely great reuenewe kyng englandꝭ cofers bycauſe wyfe ſo ther ſuch treaty bytwene y• kyng englande ſon̄e lawe ſit guy bloys y• coūſell bothe bretherne lord john̄ blois ſir guy agrement frenche kyng clerely reſigned kyng englandꝭ handes therldome soyſſons land kyng englād gaue ſon lawe lord coucy dyd quyte hym iiii • yerely reuenewes thus couenāt made engroſed ſir guy bloys delyuered alſo therle peter alanſon leue kyng eng returne frāce ſpace wher abod ſo long founde ſo many excuſacions yt neuer returned hoſtage howbeit beleue finally payed xxx frākes aquytall alſo duke loys burbone happy lay alſo hoſtage england ſuche grace kynge engl ſhewed returned france whyle parys french kyng byſſhop wyncheſtre diſceſſed chaū cellour england ther preeſt y• kyng england called ſir wyllm̄ wycan ſo great kynge ▪ thyng done without nothinge done ſo whan byſſhoprike wyncheſtre voyd kyng englāde deſyre ſayd preeſt wrote y• duke burbone wolde ſake make ſuche ſute holy father pope urbane y• chapelayne might haue y• byſſhoprike wyncheſtre promyſing duke ſo doyng entreat hym right curteſly priſoumēt hoſtage whan duke burbone ſawe kyng englandꝭ meſſāgers letter ▪ therof right ioyouſe ſhewed mater french kyng kyng coūſayled go pope ſame ſo dyde departed went auygnon pope nat gone rome ſo duke made requeſt y• pope graū ted gaue byſſhoprike wyncheſtre pleaſure content ſo y• kyng englād wold fauorable y• cōpoſycion delyuerance y• foreſayd wy ſhulde haue ſayd byſſhoprike duke burbone returned frāce ſo englande treated kyng coūſell delyuerāce wolde ſhewe bulles fro pope kyng loued ſo well preeſt y• duke burbone delyuered quyte payed xx frankes ſo ſir wyllm̄ wy biſſhop wyn cheſter chancellour englande thus lordes delvuered hoſtagꝭ england ¶ let v returne warres gaſcoyne whiche began bycauſe appell ye haue herde ¶ howe therle piergourt vycōt carmane baron gaſcoyne diſcōfyted ſeneſhall rouergne cap c c xlv haue herde price wale toke great diſpyte ſomonyng made appere parys full intē ſyon acordyng ſayd y• meſſangers apere ꝑſonally france great army next ſomer ſent incontynent thēglyſſhe capitayns gaſcons y• acorde ſuche ryuer loyre deſyring thē nat deꝑte farr then ſayd truſted ſhortly ſet thē warke tidyngꝭ mooſt part cōpanyons right ioyouſe ſo prince dayly impered ſickeneſſe y• taken spayne wherof men greatly dismayd caſe might nat ryde frenche kyng well enformed perfyte knowlege diſeaſe ſo phicyſions ſurgions france iuged malady dropſy ▪ vncurable ſo ſir cāponell cāponall clerke taken reſted ſir wyllm̄ monke put priſon y• caſtell dagen ye haue herde erle comynges therle piergort vycont carman ſir bertrm taude lorde de la barde lorde pyncornet ther owne countreis toke great diſpyte takyng ſaid meſſangers name thē cauſe went meſſage wherfore thought counterueng opyn warre ſayd ſo great diſpyte nat ſuffred vnderſtode ſir thom̄s wake ridyng roddes fortefy fortreſſe ſhuld departe fro dagenois lx ſpeares whan theſe ſayd lordes knewe therof right ioyouſe layd buſſhment c c c ſpeares encoūtre ſir thom̄s wake cōpany thus ſayd ſeneſhall rode lx ſpeares c c archer ſodenly thē brake great enbuſſhment gaſcoyns wherof thenglyſſhmen ſore abaſſhed thought lytell buſhment defēded thēſelfe aſ well might frēchmen ferſely aſſayled thē ſo firſt metyng many caſt erthe finally thēglyſhmen coude endure leger diſcōfyted ſtedde many taken ſlayne ſir thom̄s ſtedde el ben taken ſo ſaued hymſelfe ayde horſe entred caſtell mōtaubon gaſcons returned coūtreis ledde thē priſoners cōqueſtes tidyngꝭ anone brought prince y• tyme angoleme howe y• ſeneſhall rouerne diſconfyted therle pyergort ſuche apeled hym y• court parys y• right ſore diſpleaſed ſayd ſhulde derely reuēged thē landes done outrage incontynent prince wrote ſir john̄ chādos cōſtantyne ſ sauyour le vycont cōmaū dyng hym incōtynent ſight letter cōe hym wtout delay ſir johan chādos wolde nat diſobey prince haſted aſ moch might come ſo came angoleme prince receyued great ioye prince ſent hym certayne men armes archer y• garyſon mōtabon make warr agaynſt gaſcons frēchmen dayly encreaſed ouer ran prince lande ſir thomas wake aſſone myght went roddes refreſſhed fortifyed newly cytie alſo towne caſtell myllan marcheſſe ▪ mountpellyer euery place ſet archer men warr sir john̄ chā do beyng mōtaubon kepe march frōters ther agaynſt frēchmen wt ſuch baron knyghtꝭ y• price ſent thyder wt hym lorde captall beutz two bretherne pomyers ſir john̄ ſir hely soldyche leſtrade lorde partney lorde pons ſir loys harcourt ▪ y• lord pyname lorde tanyboton ſir rich pountchardon theſe lordes knightes made often yſſues therle armynakes cō pany lorde dalbretꝭ men kept fronter ther agaynſt ayde therle pyergourt therle comynges vycoūt carmane vycont tharyde lorde de la barde dyuers alyance one affinyte thus ſomtyme one ꝑte wanne ſomtyme thother aduentur falleth feates armes ſeaſon duke anioy lay ſtyll ſtyred nat thinge herde brother frenche kynge cōmaunded hym wyſe make warr agaynſt prince tyll commaunded otherwyſe hym ¶ ſeaſon frēch kyng drewe hym certayne capitayns cōpanyons howe ſent defyance kynde englande cap cc xlvi frenche kyng ſeaſon ſecretly ſubtelly get hym dyuers capitayns companyons ſent thē march berry auergne kyng cōſented ſhulde lyue vpon coūtre cōmaundyng thē make warr tyll otherwyſe cōmaunded frenche kynge wolde nat knowen warr therby thought ſhulde leſe ye enterprice truſted haue therldome poictou kyng englande perfetly knowen french kyng wolde haue made hym warr wolde right well haue wt ſtande domage poitou wolde ſo well prouyded ye good towne abuyle englyſſhmen ſo well haue furnyſſhed garyſons ye ſaid coū tre wolde haue ben ſtyll ſouerayne ouer thē ſeneſhall ſame countie englyſſhman called ſir nycolas louayng good fauour kyng englande worthy ſo true drawen wylde horſes wolde neuer cōſent ſhame cowardneſſe villany ſame ſeaſon ſent englā de therle salebruee ſir wyllm̄ dorman fro frenche kyng ſpeke ye kyng england counſayle ſhe wyng howe partie ye peace dayly yuell kept aſwell reaſon warr cōpanyons made ſixe yere cōtynually realm france dyuers accydentes wherof frenche kyng enformed nat well cōtent therwith kyng englande cauſed theſe ambaſſadours tary ſtyll england ſpace two monethes ſame ſpace declared dyuers artycles often tymes kyng wherof ye kyng ſore diſpleaſed howbeit ſet lytell ther charged french kyng counſayle ſhewe whan french kyng ſecrete certayne knowlege howe within abuyle wolde become french warres opyn gaſcone howe people redy aparelled gode wyll make warr agaynſt prince entre principalyte howbeit thought haue reproche tyme cōe ſayd hym ſhuld ſend people kyng englande prince lande take townes cyties caſtels fortreſſes wt defyāce wherfore coūſelled ſend defy kyng england ſo dyd letter cloſed breton varlet bare thē whan came douer ther founde ye erle salebruce ſir wyllm̄ dorman returnyng frāce acōplyſſhed meſſage whome varlet declared ꝑte meſſage ſo cōmaūded whan herde yt deꝑted englande faſt might paſſed ſee right ioyfull whan aryued bolen ſame ſeaſon prince ſent rome pope urbane ſir guyſſhard dāgle dyuers mater touchyng qui tayne foūde pope right fauorable ſutes ſo returned agayne way herde howe gaſcoyns frenchman made warr agaynſt prince howe ouerran pricipalyte wherof ſore abaſſhed feare might returne without dāger howbeit cāe gētyll erle sauoy founde pyemōt towne pyneroll made warr agaynſt marque saluces erle sauoy receyued ioyouſly company kept two dayes gaue great gyftes ſpecially ſir guyſſhard dangle therle greatly honoured bycauſe noble chinalry ſo whā deꝑted aproched nerer bondes fraunce bolone herde euer tidyngꝭ worſe worſe purpoſe ſaw well yt caſe coude nat returne guyen well knowen therfore gaue gouernāce cōpany knight called ser iohn̄ ſore wedded dought good frēchman borne ye march breten toke charge conduct home father lawes company went lande lorde beauieu ther paſſed ryuer acquyted hym ſelfe ſo lorde beauieu brought hym company ryon auuerne duke berry ther offerd good frēche ſayd ſo myght brought peaſably owne houſe bretayne father lawe ser guyſ ſhard dangle diſgyſed hym ſelfe lyke poore preeſt yuell horſed arrayed ſo paſſed fraunce marcheſſe burgoyne auuerne dyde ſomoche great payne entred pricipalyte came angoleme price wher right welcome another knight went rome called ſir wyllm̄ cens feare came homwarde came abbey cluny burgone ther taryed fyue yeres durſt neuer go oute houſe yet laſt yelded hymſefe french nowe let v retourne breton y• brought frēche kyngꝭ defyāce ye kyng englād ¶ defyance delyuered kyng englande howe erle ſaynt poule lorde chaſtellon conquered therldome poictou cap cc xlvii foreſayd varlet dyde ſo moche came london vnderſtode ye kyng coūſayle weſtm̄ holdynge great counſayle prince warres bytwene hym baron knightes gaſcone ſe ſhulde maynteyned men ſhulde ſent england ayde hym ther came newe tidynges ye whiche made thē haue buſyneſſe frenche varlet dyd ſomoch entred chambre wher kyng counſayle ſayd howe varlet ſent french kyng brought letter kyng englande ſo kneled downe kyng offred hym letter kynge greatly deſyred knowe ment cauſed receyued opyned reed ¶ kyng con̄ſayle great maruell therof whan vnderſtode defyance behelde well ſeale ſigue ſawe clerely howe authorite cauſed varlet departe ſayeng hym howe hadde right well done meſſage wherfore might departe whan wolde ſhulde haue let ſo returned aſſone might ſame ſeaſon ther ſtyll england hoſtagers erle dolphyn auuergne therle porſeen lorde mallurer dyuers wer great heuynes hert whan herde thoſe tidynges knewe nat ye kyng wolde kyng counſayle great diſpyte varlet ſhulde thus bringe defyāce ſayd howe nothyng aꝑtenant warr bytwene two ſuch gret prince kyng englande frenche king ſhulde publyſſhed varlet thought ben metely y• ſhulde haue ben done prelat ſome valyāt man baron knyght beit ſawe remedy coūſayled kyng incontynent ſhulde ſende great army poyctou kepe fronters ther ſpecially ye towne abuyle ye whiche great danger leſyng kyng content ſo ſo ther apoynted go thyder lorde percy lorde neuyll lorde carbeſton ſir wyllm̄ wynſore ccc men archer mean ſeaſon whyle theſe lordes made redy cōe douer paſſe ſee ther came tidynges poictou ye nothyng ioyfull aſſone therle guy ſ poule ſir guy chaſtellon maiſters croſbowes france thought likelyhod y• kyng englande defyed drue toward poictou ſent ſecretly cōmaūdemēt ye knightes ſquiers artoyſe heynalt cambreſis uermādoſe uyen picardy yt ſhuldꝭ incōtynent come thē ſo dyde nombre ſixſcore ſpeares came abuyle ſet vpon gate ſo determyned ſo men warre entred without doyng hurt thē towne thā ſir hewe chaſtelon chefe leder theſe men warr went ſtreyght wher thought fynde ye ſeneſhall poictou ser nicolas louayng dyd ſomoche y• foūde toke priſoner alſo toke riche clerke valyāt man treſourer poitou yt day frēchmen toke many riche priſoner thengliſſhmen loſt towne abuyle ye ſame day frē chemen ran ſaynt ualery entred therin toke crotay alſo towne derne ſee ſyde anone came ye erle ſaynt poule bridge ſaynt remey ryuer somme whervnto ther certayne englyſſhmen withdrawen erle aſſayled great ſcrymyſſhe many noble dedes armes done atcheued therle made knight ther galetan eldeſt ſonne dyde day right nobly thenglyſſhmen ther ſo ſore aſſayled finally diſcōfyted ſlayne takefie bridge fortereſſe alſo brefely ſpeke countre coūtie poictou clene delyuered fro thenglyſſhmen ſo none abode ther hurte countre tidynges came kyng englande london howe poyctou forſaken hym become frenche wherwith ryght ſore diſpleaſed many harde ymaginacyon agaynſt hoſtagers france ſtyll lō howe beit thought ſhulde great crueltie ſhulde bewreke diſpleaſur yet ſent burgeſſes cyties good townes fraunce whome hoſtage dyuers townes fortreſſes englande kept thē ſtrayter harder kepte therle dolphyne auuergne raunſomed xxx thouſande frankes therle porſeen x thouſand frā kes lorde roy kept ſtyll priſon great daunger nat well beloued kyng englande none courte wherfore behoued hym endure moche ſorowe trouble vntyll ſuche ſeaſon delyuered great fortune aduenture ye ſhall hyſtorie ¶ howe kyng englande ſent great nombre men armes fronters scotlande duke berry duke aniou made ſomōs go agaynſt prince wale cap cc xlviii whan kyng englande ſawe thus defyed frenche kyng coū tie poictou loſt coſt hym ſo moche repayring townes caſtels houſes ſpent theron hundred thouſande frankes ouer aboue reuenewes therof ſawe well howe lykely haue warr party alſo ſhewed hym yt ſcottes newly alyed frēche kyng purpoſe make hym warre wherof ſore diſpleaſed douted warr ſcottes frēchmen knewe well ſcottes loued hym nat bycauſe domages done thē tyme paſt kynge ſentemen warr fronters scotlande berwyke rokeſborowe newcaſtell place ye frō ters alſo ſent great nauy ſee aboute hampton gernſey yle wyght ſhewed hym howe frenche kyng apparelled great nauy go ſee come lande englande ſo yt wyſt nat whiche part take hede thus thenglyſſhmen ſore abaſſhed bycauſe ſodayne warre aſſoone duke aniou duke berry knewe defyance made warr opyn thought nat ſlepe made ſpeciall ſomōs one auuerne tholous aſſemble make warr ye principalyte duke berry redy cōmaundement barownes auuergne byſſhoprike lyon byſſhop ryke maſcon alſo lorde beauteu lorde uyllers lorde tornon ſir godfray boloyne ſir johan armynacke ſir johan uyllemure lorde mō tague lorde talenſon ſir hugh dolphyn lorde rochfort dyuers incōtynent theſe drewe towrayn marcheſſe berry began make ſore warr good countrey poyctou founde well garnyſſhed men warre bothe knightes ſquyers ſo ther great aduauntage marcheſſe towrayne french garyſons fortereſſes ſir loyes ſaynt julyan ſir wyllyam bordes carnet breton theſe thre companyons great capitayns men warr dyd feates armes agaynſt thenglyſſhmen ye ſhall ¶ howe kynge englande ſent erle cambridge erle penbroke prince ſōne howe paſſed bretayne capitulo cc xlix duke lancaſtre enheritaūce champayn caſtel betwene troy chalons called beauforte wherof englyſſhe ſquyer called purceuaunt damors capitayne whan ſquier ſawe warr open bitwene frenche kynge kyng englande tourned hymſelfe became frenche ſware then forth fayth alligeance frenche kyng greatly rewarded hym left hym ſtyll capitayne ſame caſtell accompanyed another ſquier champayne called yuan ii great companyons gether dyd many feates gether agaynſt engliſſhemen alſo chanoyn roberſart always ben good frencheman al renewyng warr became engliſſh dyd fayth homage kyng englande ryght gladde ſeruice thus knyghtes ſquiers turned theyr copy partes duke anion ſo procured companyōs gaſcoyn 〈◊〉 ser perducas dalbreth lyttell mechin bourg bertueil aymon dortingue peter sauoy raff bray nandon pan became frēche wherof engliſſhmen ſore diſpleaſed theyr ſtrēgth dayly laſſed nādon bagerant bourg leſpare burg camus ser robert briquet robert thin john̄ trenelle gailard dela mote aymery rochecho art abode ſtyll good englyſſhe theſe companyons engliſſhe gaſcoyns theyr accorde affinite abode byſſhopryke man baſe normandy taken towne called uire diſtroyed coū trey thus companyons turned ſome one parte ſome ſo eyther engliſſhe frenche kynge englande counſayled ſende ſonne erle cambrydge erle penbroke duchie acquitayne prince certayne nombre men warre ſo named ſhuld go voyage lorde tarbeſton ser brian stapleton sir thomas baleſtre ser john̄ truues dyuers entred aſſoone myght y• ſee iiii c men armes iiii c archer ſo ſayled towarde britayne wynde wyll arryued hauen ſaynt malo iſle whan duke bretayne ser john̄ mountford knew arryued countrey right ioyous ſent incontinent knyghtes receyue ser john̄ laigingay ser john̄ auguſtin comynge erle cambridge erle penbroke right ioyous knewe nat whether lordes knyghtes good townes bretayne wold ſuffre paſſe coūtrey nat theſe ſayd lordes england deſyred duke myght paſſe duke fauorable engliſſhemen loth diſpleaſe acorded theyr requeſt ſhulde paſſe countrey payeng ſhulde take without riot grudge erle cambridge erle penbroke theyr company drew companyons caſtell gontierland towne uire ſo toke forth paſſed ryuer • oire bridge nātes without doyng hurt ye coūtrey ſame ſeaſon sit hugh caurell great nombre companyons march arragon newly come spaigne ſoone knewe frenchemen made warre prince company paſſed fo •• arragon entred bigore ſo came prince cite angoleſme prince made great chere gladde hym kept hym ſtyll tyll companion come normandy hadde ſolde theyr fortreſſes come hym ſoone wer come angoleſme ye prince ordeyned ser hugh caurel theyr capitayn ſo nombre ii thouſande fightyngemen prince ſende landes erle armynack lorde dalbreth burne exile countrey ſo made great warre dyd moche great domage countrey ¶ howe erle cambridge erle penbroke arryued angoleſine howe prince ſent • ouerrenne countye piergourt cap cc l erle cambridge erle penbroke arryued ſaynt malo ye haue harde taried tyll theyr company paſt agrement duke bretayne whan well refreſſhed leaue departe ſo went nantes duke receyued right honorably taried hym iii dayes refreſſhed people fourth day paſſed ouer great ryuer loyre bridge nantes rode ſo longe iorneis yt came angoleſme foūd prince princeſſe prince right ioyous comyng brother erle cambridge erle penbroke demaunded kynge father quene mother bretherne dyd whan taryed iii dayes prince ſente make iourney countie piergourt ſo theſe ii lordꝭ theyr company made redy ſo toke leaue prince went forth goodly array wer iii fyghtyng men helpe dyuers knyghtes ſquters poictou xainton lymo ſyn quercy rouergue ſo theſe lordes entred coūtie piergourt dyd many great domagꝭ whan burned ouerran moſt parte coūtrey went layd ſiege fortreſſe called bourdeill ii ſquiers bretherne capitaynes within called erualdon bernardyn batefoll beſide countie diuers good capitaynes whiche erle piergourt ſende thether kepe gariſons fortreſſes whiche right well prouyded fore artillarie vitailes thynges neceſſarie maynteyne kepe place long ſpace alſo within good wyll ſo thus durynge ſiege bourdeill many featꝭ armes many ſaute many reculyng many ſkrymyſſhe nere hande dayly ii ſquiers within right hardy prowde loued lytell engliſſhe men came oft tymes barrier ſkrymyſſhedde without ſome day wanne ſome day loſte aduentures warre often tymes falleth nowe vp nowe downe ſyde march aniou towrayne fyghtynge men well frenchemen breton bourgonyons pycardes norman angeuyns dyd aften tymes great domage princis lande ouer whome capitaynes ſyr john̄ de belle ſir wylliam bourdes ser loys ſaynt julian • carnet breton agaynſte men warr fronters poictou xainton dyuers knyghtes princis ſpecially ſir symon burle ser dangouſe nat iiii part men frenchemen frenchemen thouſand fightyng men mo engliſſhemen paſt nat two thre hū dred moſt prince ſent great nombre mē iiii army mō taban v hundred ser john̄ chādos cōpanions landes erle armynacke lorde dalbreth alſo great company ser hugh caurell greatteſt company brother therle cābridge ſiege bourdeil wherfore fewe agaynſt frēchemen poictou howe acquited themſelfe right nobly dyd theyr deuour kepe fronters gariſons neuer refuſed fight ſkrymyſſhe frēchemen thoughe nothynge lyke nombre ſo day frenchemen certayne knowlege englyſſhemen brode feldes wherof right ioy full ſo layde ſelfe buſſhement engliſſhemen ſhulde returne cō myng fro enterpriſe done bytwene mirebel luſignen ſo broken way frenchemen came nōbre v c ser john̄ de bueil ser wyllyam de bourdes ser loys ſaynt julian carnet bretō capitayns company ſore fight many man reuerſed erth engliſſhemen right hardely fought valiantly defē ded ſelfe long myght endure ser symon burle ser angouſe proued y• day noble knyghtes howe finally auayled nothyng hādful mē regard frenche partye diſcomfitted per force cauſed flee ser angouſe ſaued hym ſelfe aſ well myght entred ye caſtell luſignen ser symō burle ſo ſore purſewed taken priſoner companye eyther taken ſlayne fewe ſkaped frē chemen returned theyr gariſons right ioyous theyr aduenture lyke wyſe frenche kynge whan herd therof prince rightſore diſpleaſed ſorowefull takynge ser symon burle loued entierly good reaſon cauſe ſo euer ben right noble coragious knyght alwayes right valyantly borne hym ſelfe ſuſteynynge kynge englandes parte ſo bē al companyons ſlayne taken ſkrymyſſhe wherof ye prince al parte right ſorowfull whiche meruayle comonly ſayde one worthe c c nat worthe one truely ſometyme fortuneth one man hole countrey ſaued wytte prowes nother hole countrey lo •• thus fortune chaunces world oftē tymes falleth ¶ howe ſir john̄ chādos toke tarriers howe erle piergourt dyuers othe knyghtes beſieged riamulle quercy ca cc li thys aduenture thus fell bitwene mirebel luſignē ye haue herd engliſſhemē theyr companyons rode wiſelier together nowe letvs ſpeke ser john̄ chandos ser guyſſhard dangle cōpanies mōtaban vii leages tholouſe made many horrible enterpryſes whan ſawe layne longe ſpace thought nat enployed well ſeaſon except kepyng frōters therfore determined go lay ſiege tarriers tholouſayn ſo prepared thyng redy departed fro mō taban went tarriers beſieged rounde perceyued well howe coude nat geat noaſſaute none wayes eaſe without mynynge ſette theyr mynours warke atcheued theyr warke ſo well 〈◊〉 day toke entred ye towne within ſlayne towne robbed ſpoyled ſame iourney thought haue taken another towne iii leages tholouſe called lauall layde buſſhement wodde xl couertly armed vnder ha byte villaynes countrey goyng towne diſceyued villayne boye foote theyr company diſcouered theyr enterpriſe ſo fayled entēt returned agayne mō taban ſame ſeaſon abrode feldes erle piergourt therle comynges erle liſle uicount carmayn uicount brunikel uicount lautre ser bertram tharide lorde de la barde lorde pincornet ser perducas dalbreth bourge leſpare bourge bertueill ayemon dortingue jaquet de bray perrot sauoy arnolde pan nombre x entred quercy cōmaundement duke aniou cite tholouſe brought lande great tribulacion brent exyled coū trey came riamulle quercy beſieged towne ſeneſchall quercy well prouyded towne maner thynges therin many good engliſſhe men whiche wold nat yelde vp ye towne dye therfor ye towne wolde gladly haue gyuen vp lordes knyghtes france ſent iiii great engins cite tholouſe whan come dreſſed reiſed vp caſte nyght day ſtones great peces tymber ye fortreſſe beſyde ſet mynours warke made theyr boſte wynne towne breuely alwayes englyſſhemen within lyke noble valiant men comforted eche ſet lytell theyr mynynge ¶ howe archebyſſhopp̄ tholouſe conuerted frenche kynge prayer requeſt citie caoure dyuerſe townes howe duke guerles duke julliers defied french kynge cap cc lii meane ſeaſon whyle theſe frenche knyghtes thus quercy march lymoſyn auuergne duke betrey auuergne great nombre menne warre ſyr john̄ armynac hys vncle lorde john̄ uillemur roger beaufort lorde beauiew lorde uillers lorde sergnac lorde calēcon ser griffith mōtague ſir hugh dolphin great nombre good knyghtes ſquiers ſo ouerran march rouergue quercy lymoſyn dyd great domage enpoueryſſhed greately countrey nothynge helde agaynſte ſo meanes duke berrey archebyſſhop departed tholouſe right good clerke went caours wher brother byſſhopp̄ preched publyſſhed ſuche wiſe frenche kyngis quarell meanes citie caours turned frenche ſware faythe homage thence forthe frenche kynge ſayd archebiſſhop rode forth preched declared frenche kynges right title quarell ſuche wiſe al countrey became frenche cauſed turne mo lx townes city caſtelles fortreſſes helpe ayde duke berreys company men warr ſyr john̄ armi nake rode abrode coūtrey cauſed turne frenche sigac gaignac capedonac diuers good townes ſtrong caſtelles preched frenche kynge ſo great ryght iuſte cauſe quarell people harde hym beleued hym alſo naturally ye people myndes rather frenche engliſſhe ye whiche helped moche matter lyke maner archebyſſhop went aboute prechynge ſhewyng right quarel frenche kyng bondes lymitacions languedoc pycardy dyuerſe prelate clerkes well ſufficiētly dyd deuours ſhewe preche ſayd quarel frenche kynge comon people cyties good townes ſpecially ſir wylliā • ormans preched ſayd quarel fro cite citie fro towne towne ſo wyſely ſo notably harde hym lent ſelfe opinion ſo buſyneſſe realme hym wordes ſo coloured marnayle ſpeke therof beſyde frenche kyng hym ſelfe ſo moued deuocion cauſed made contynual proceſſions clergie hym ſelfe quene wolde go bare foote requyrynge beſechynge god deuoutely aſſiſt mainteyne ye right realme france whiche hath ben ſeaſon great tribulacion alſo kynge cauſed ſubiectes conſtreynte prelate ſame lyke maner dyd kynge englād realme byſſhop tyme london made many prechynges declaracions ſhewyng people frē che kynge great wronge hadde renewed warre dyd agayngſte ryght good reaſon proued diuers artycles poyntes openely ſhewed ſaye trouth neceſſite kyngꝭ ſyth determyned make warre ſhewe people ordre cauſe quarelles ſo myght better wyls helpe ayde theyr lordes whiche awakened one realme kynge englande ſent brabant haynault knowe myght geat ayde deſired duke aulbert rule gouernance countie heynault tyme wolde open coū trey ſuffre hym go come abide nede waye paſſe realme france army duke aulbert requeſte kynge englād vncle deſyre ye quene aūte lyghtly condyſcended theyr deſyres ayde good mocyon edwarde duke guerles kynge englandes parte wedded duke doughter duke julyers couſyn germayne theſe two tyme faythe homage boūde kyng englāde deſyred ſhulde retaygne eche nombre thouſande ſpeares coſte charge wherfore theſe ii lordes aduyſed well ſhulde good kynge englande geatte alied hym duke aulbert ſore tempted therto great gyftes kynge englande promyſed hym ſuche knyghtes hadde ſente vnto hym whan lorde comynges frēche kynge herde therof returned heynaulte counſayle lorde john̄ werthyn ſ • neſchall heynaulte countrey moſte gouerned wyſe valiant knyght good frēche hart ſo well beloued ye duke ducheſſe brake purpoſe engliſſhe meſſā gers helpe therle bloys ser john̄ bloys brother lorde ligny lorde barbāſon duke countrey abode neuter held none partes anſwere made jane ducheſſe brabant kynge charles frāce ſage wyſe ſubtyle wrought treatie iii yere knewe well good frendes heynault brabant ſpecially moſt parte coūſailours ye great lordes colour make warr ſeme ye fayrer copied diuers letter touchyng peace confirmed calays ther cloſed ſubſtan̄ce dede thynge kynge englande childrē ſworne kepe article letter ſealed ſubmytted make renūciacions reſityng ſuche cōmyſſions ought haue delyuered theyr people al article poyntꝭ made thyng hym quarell condempnynge engliſſhemens deades theſe letter kynge cauſed publyſſhed courtes great lordes entent ſhulde better enformed quarel inlyke wyſe oppoſit dede kynge england ſhewed quarel almaygne place thought haue ayde duke guerles nephewe kynge englande ſonne ſuſter duke juliers coſyn germayne child tyme good true englyſſhe great diſpight defiaunce frenche kynge made ye kyng englāde done varlet myndes greately blamynge frenche kynge counſaile ſo doyng ſayd warre bitwene ſo great princis frē che kynge kynge englande ought publyſſhed defied notable ꝑſones prelate byſſhops abbottes ſayeng howe frenche men dyd great preſumpcyon pryde wherfore ſayd wolde ſend defye frēche kyng notably ſo dyd dyuerſe knyghtes almayne entētꝭ ſhortly entre fraunce ſuche dedes armes remembraūce therof ſhulde ſeen knowen xx yere howe dyd nothynge purpoſe broken another way thought ye ſhall hiſtorie ¶ duke bourgoyn maryed doughter erle flaunders cap cc liii haue harde howe ye ſpace v yere gether ye kyng eng • made moche purchaſe haue doughter therle flā ders haue ben maried ſon edmond erle cambridge deuiſes ordenances longe reherſe wherfore wyll paſſe ouer breuely kynge england coude maner geat pope urban conſent gyue diſpenſacion mary erle fraunders ſued vnto fro partes ſpecially frenche kyng brother duke bourgoyn whā ſawe maryage wolde nat take england howe tyme doughter maryed mo child thought yōge duke bourgoyn mete mariage ſent certayne meſſangers england treate kyng acquitaunce meſſangers dyd ſo well deuour kynge englande thought none euyl quited erle flaunders couenauntes touchynge ye mariage doughter ſo theſe meſſangers returned bruges ſhewed erle lorde howe ſpedde wher ryght ioyfull nat longe mariage duke bourgoyn erles doughter driuē agreed ſhewed mariage erle flaunders fyfty thouſande frankes towne doway liſle delyuered gage money yt frenche kynge gaue thys maryage erle flaunders toke poſſeſſyon therin dyd putte people ſo theſe two townes attributed flaūders reaſon gage ſhewed ſay anone compoſicion proceded mariage whiche done confirmed towne gaūt great feaſte ſolempnyte day ye maryage ther many lordes barones knyghtes ſpecially ye gentyl lorde coucy ſent thither frenche kynge euery man greatly feaſted great iuſtes tryumphes euery man wenſe owne whan kynge englāde ſawe erle flaunders bycauſe ſayde maryage alyed fraunce wyſte • ſuppoſe whether erle flaunders wolde take parte agaynſt hym duke bourgoyne ſonne lawe ſucceſſion ſhulde heyre diſceace ornat alſo myſte nat rou • nauntes 〈◊〉 b • twene frenche kynge erle flaunders wherfore kynge englande harder flemmynges bothe lande ſee came marchandiſe wherof frēche kynge nothynge diſpleaſed wolde gladly warre hadde ben open bitwene engliſſhemen flēmynges howe wiſe men flaunders bourgeſſes good tow • e wyl ye warre comynalte flaunders ſuſteyned rather opinion quarell kynge englande better frenche kynges kynge englande ſought frendes party • ede hym ſo ſeynge great warres rebellion dayly roſe agaynſt hym vnderſtode well kyng charles nauarr coſyn baſe mandy wolde ſoone agree accord behated frenche kynge bicauſe certayn landes kept claymed enheritance whiche frenche kyng • n • ed whiche theyr counſayles ben often tymes guether coulde neuer make agrement bitwene ſo mat • er hanged ſtyll eche takyng good hede kynge nauarre fortifyed greatly townes caſtels conſtantine countie deureur good townes normandye helde hymſelfe ch • erburge men warr euery gariſon hym ser euſtace dā •• er • court gouernour towne • oud paſſage ſaynt clement cloſe conſtantyne whyche perteyned kynge nauarre parcell •• age called towne carentyn ſyr • uſtace chief kynges counſaile kynge englande ſent vnto hym alſo hisman knyght entent ſhulde knowe kynge nauarres mv • de knyght dyd ſo moche kynge nauarre pr • uy company entred ſhyppe called ly • came kynge england made hym great feaſt ſo longe gether fynally concluded ſoone kynge nauarre returned chierbourge ſhulde ſende defye frenche kynge put al caſtelles fortreſſes engliſſhe men whan confyrmed kynge nauarre departed returned agayne normandy towne chierbourge brought thyther certayne knyghtes englande euyllfortune theyr returnynge home ward ſee mette norman pyrates fierſely aſſayled farre ſtronger engliſſhmen norman conquered ſlewe wolde nat take one mercy whiche aduenture kynge englande right ſore diſpleaſed howe coude nat remedy anone y• kynge nauarre returned chierbourge ser euſtace dambreticourt ſent prince toke leaue ye kyng nauarr go ſerue prince whiche kynge gaue hym leaue ſore agaynſte hysmyll howe ser euſtace ſhewed hym ſo many reaſonable cauſes laſte departed toke ſee arryued company ſaynt malo rode nauntes paſſe ryuer loyre agrement duke bretayne ſtered nat partye ſo ſyr euſtace trauayled ſo longe came poictou came towne angoleſme prynce receyued hym great ioy thā anone ſente hym ſyr john̄ chandos captal beu • montaban makyng thyr fronter agaynſte frenche men thyther ſyr euſtace ryght well come company ¶ howe conſtable france conſtable heynaulte reyſed army men warre aſſaile arde howe fortreſſe reainuille taken englyſſhemenne ſlayne cap c c liiii ſame ſeaſon knyghtes pycardye aſſembled together go aſſaute arde ſir more fyennes conſtable france ſir john̄ uertyn conſtable heynau •• capitaynes companye commaundement frenche kynge aſſembled guether towne ſaynt • mer thouſand ſpear • knyghtes ſquyers ſo went moſtred baſtid arde whiche well furnyſſhed englyſſhe men ſo frenche men ſayde wolde laye ſ • ege therto englyſſhe men thyng abaſſhed made redy defende theyr fortreſſe nede daye frenchemen heynowes aſſembled together y• felde good array freſſhe mauer goodly ſyght beholde baners ſtandardes wauynge wynde ſo gaue aſſaute towne nat greatly theyr profyt diuerſe ſore hurt wounded conquered nothynge ſhewed ſyft daye beparted fro arde without doynge great hurte ſo returned euery man home owne howſe thus brake vp • urney ¶ howe lette v ſpeke farther countreys ſiege • iamuille quercy layde frenchemen xii thouſande fyghtyngemen companyons theyr felaweſ •• ppe within two dayes iourney lay duke berreys companye ſyr john̄ armynake ſyr john̄ uillemure lorde beau • ew auuergne bourgoyne well iii thouſand whiche redy come ſiege nede aſſy • te frenchemen ſyr john̄ chandos captall beufz ſyr guyſſhard dangle englyſſhemen kept fronter montaban knewe well howe frenchemen hadde layde ſiege reainuille nombre ſawe well nat able fyght themnor reyſe ſiege erle cambridge erle penbroke laye ſiege bourd •• lf wolde •• wyſe breke vppe ſiege ſo frenchemen reainuille ſet • myners awarke alſo hadde engyns dyd caſte daye nyght myners cauſed great payne walle • ſalle wherby towne taken englyſſhemen within ſlayne without mercy whiche great pitye forthere many good ſquyer nacion towne taken tomercy • coudicio • fro thence forth ſhulde • e good 〈◊〉 frenchemen •• newe capitaynes officer kepe towne nede theſe men warre departed went abrode con̄trey • uercy rouergue refreſſhe lye theyr caſe companyons went citie caours capitaynes aymon • rtingo pecotte sauoye lyttell mechin jaques braye arnolde pan ouerranne diſtroyed countrey erle pierregourt erle liſle erle comynges u • count carmayn lordes returned theyrowne coūtreys ſyr hugh caurell ſyr robert brequet joh • treſnelle lanut nandon bergerat bourge camus bourge bretueil bourge leſpare nombre companyons made great warre burned diſtroyed landes erle armynacke lorde dalbreth ¶ ſame ſeaſon ſeneſchall rouergue right valyaunt man good englyſſhe knyght called ſyr thomas witeualle kepte towne caſtelle millan dayes iou • ney fro montpellier howe countrey aboute hym turned frenche yet kept fortreſſe yere halfe alſo fortreſſe bretayne called wanclere whiche ſpace made many noble iſſues vnto tyme ſyr bertram cleſquy put hym oute ye ſhall thys hiſtory wayes ſtyll ſiege endured bourdeilf ¶ ſeneſchal poictou bu • ned exyled lande lorde chauuigny toke aſaute towne breuſe newely turned frenche capitulo c c lv march po • tou ſir john̄ bue • ſyr wyllyam bourdes ser loys ſaynt julyan carnet bretō • • ii hundred fightyng men imagined ſtudied night day howe myght geat aſſaute ſkaynge wyſe townes fortreſſes poictou day gatte ſlelth ſkalynge caſtell called roche poſay entre poictou ye riuer creuſe two leages fro haye tourayn nere chatellerault ſame riuer coū trey poictou great feare frenchemen layde great gariſon repayred caſtell fortyfyed furnyſſhed artillarie victayles whan theſe tydynges came prince ſore diſpleaſed coude nat amend ſent ser guyſſharde dangle ser loys harecourte lorde parteney lorde pinane diuerſe beynge montaban ser john̄ chandos ſhulde come hym purpoſe ſende place accordynge princis cōmaūdment departed fro montaban came angoleſme prince incontinent ſent poicters kepe citie make fronter agaynſt frēchemen ſame tyme great baron poictou lorde chauuigny vicount breuſe forſoke englyſſhe parte became frenche towne alſo furnyſſhed towne breton men warre went hymſelfe fraunce kynge aduenture prince barones poictou ſore diſpleaſed vicount rochecoart inſuſpecte enfourmed prince howe wolde turne frenche wherfore prince ſent hym ſhewed hym entent vicount excuſed hym ſelfe well myght howe commytted priſon ſo abode longe ſpace daunger ſame ſeaſon great ſeneſchall poictou vnder prince ser james audeley right ſage valiant knyght aſſembled gether great armye baron knyghtes poictou hym ſyr guyſſhard dangle ser loys harecourt lorde pons lorde parteney lorde pinane ser geffey dargenton ser maubrun l 〈…〉 er lorde tannaybouton ser william moutaudire diuers knightes ſquiers poictou xii c ſpeares alſo hym ser band wynſeneſch xainton theſe lordes made theyr aſſembly poicters ſo departed good arraye rode tyll came berrey began burne exile coū trey dyd many great domages went ito tourayn ſoeuer went coūtrey ſore turmēted brought great tribulacion ſo ſtrong kepte ſtyll felde laſt entred lorde chauuignys countrey newly turned frenche parte ſo burned diſtroyed except fortreſſes day came towne breuſe gaue therto aſſaute whiche endured hole daye day wonne lyttell withdrewe lodged ſayde howe wolde nat departſo thought well towne preignable roſe ſprynge day ſowned trompettꝭ aſſaute ſo approched towne euery lorde good arraye vnder owne baner whiche ſaturday fiers aſſaute within towne defēded ſelfe wel myght knew wel ſtode ieoꝑdy lyues ther done day many noble feat armes englyſſhe archer ſhotte ſo holly gether none durſt loke loope defēde towne ſo finally pure force ye towne wōne gate caſt downe euer • man entred wolde xvi beſte yt within taken hanged theyr harneis diſpight vicoūt maiſter ſo falſely become frēche ye towne burned inhabitauntes within loſte euer many ſlayne drowned englyſſhemen returned poicters refreſſhe ſelfe ¶ ſyr robert canol made maiſter gouernour princis cō panye howe ſyr perducas dalbreth turned engliſſhe cap cc lvi sir robert canol • bretayne fayre heritage alwayes ben good engliſſhe loued ſerued kynge england ſone ben dyuers iourneis whan vnderſtode frē chemen made prince ſo great warre wolde dyſheryte hym hys enherytaunce acquytayne conquerynge wherof hadde ſore dyſpleaſed therwith mynde pourpoſed aſſemble guether ſuche people myght go ſerue prince owne coſte charge ymagyned ſo dyd gatte gether frendes nombre lx men armes many archer prepared foure ſhyppes hauen bretayne called kaouke whan prouyſion redy departed deruall drew porte toke ſee company ſayled ſo longe arryued kaye rochell bourgeſſes rochel • made hym good chere agaynſt theyr harte howe durſtedo none otherwyſe founde ſyr john̄ deureux capitayne rochel • vnder prince seneſchall ſyr john̄ chandos ſir thomas percy ſyr roberte canol • wel receyued capitayne kept hym good companye taryed ii dayes rode forthe tyll came angoleſme prince princeſſe right gladde comyng made hym ſuche chere prince made hym mayſter chyef ſoueraygne knyghtes ſquyers hys courte bycauſe valoure noble chyualrie commaundynge courte obbey hym theyr ſoueraygne anſwerd well content ſo whan hadde ben ſpace fyue dayes euery man redy ſhulde go hym toke leaue prince departed fro goleſme acompanyed prince knyghtes ſyr richarde pontchardon ser stephyn goſenton ſyr dagloiret ſyr noel lorniche ſir wyllyam torciel ſir hugh haſtinges ſir john̄ triuet ſir thomas spenſer ſir tancon ſir thomas balaſter ſir nicolas bonde ſir wyllyam monke ſeneſchall agenoys ſir baudwyn franuille mo thre ſcore knyghtꝭ lx men armes fyue hundred archer many brigantes hauyng good myudes fynde frenchemen fyghte thus ſir robert canol • companye rode forthe towarde agen come quercy companyōs rode ſo longe came citie agen taryed lytell ſpace refreſſhe ſelf abyde theyr eunemies ſame ſeaſon ſir robert canoll knowledge howe ſir perducas dalbreth capitayne certayne nombre companyons iii c aboute ſame ſeaſon countrey purchaſe duke aniou turned frenche ſir robert canoll ſent certayne herauldes meſſangers hym gaue hym ſalue conducte come ſpeke hym feldes certayne place lymytted ſo came hym ſir roberte made hym great chere ſo lyttell lyttell fell together talkynge ſir robert canol ſhewed hym howe greatly blame turne hym ſelfe frenche forſake ſerue prince ſo well hath honored loued hym tyme paſte wherto ſhuld make lōge proceſſe ſir robert canol • preched ſo moche ser perducas dalbreth turned agayn became engliſſhe company hym turned companyons gaſcoynes mo v c wherof duke aniou ſore diſpleaſed thought laſſe ſurete ſayd ſir perducas theſe tydynges came citie caours cō paniōs aymon ortigo lytel mechin jaques bray perot sauoy arnolde pan ther kepe garyſon whiche tidynges ſore troubled myndes conſidered thought wel gariſon great feble kepte agaynſte puyſſaunce engliſſhe men ſo departed thence gaue vp towne byſſhop bourgeſſes ye ſame went priory called durmel whiche fortified determ •• ed kepe agaynſt theyr ennemyes ſoone englyſſhe men knewe ther came thither beſieged place made many aſſaute within ſo well fortified artillary ablementes warre toke litell hurt whan ser john̄ chandos ser thomas phelton captall beufz ser john̄ pō mers ser thomas percy ser euſtace dambreticourt knyghtꝭ princis montaban vnderſtode ser robert canol • beſieged fortreſſe durmell thā determined go thether ther thought enploy well ſeaſon ſo departed fro montaban mo iii c ſpearꝭ lefte ii c behynde kepe gariſon capitayns ser aymery charter souldiche leſtrade ser bernarde dalbreth lorde geronde aboue ſayd lordes rode ſpedely come ſiege durmell rode founde way ſtronge frenche towne called monſac ye kept alonly ye towne y• knewe nat ſo aduiſe ye towne ſente forthe theyr courrours brought worde agayne y• towne ſtrōge ſo without ſiege ſaute wold nat wōne toke counſayle gether ſe beſt ſo determined nat beſte let theyr enterpriſe guyng durmell wherfore paſſed yerly mornynge nat gone leage thence mette certayn men foure ſomers laden vitayle anone toke reſted demaūded fro whens came whyther wolde ſayd departed tholouſe entent go monſac brynge thyther theyr victayle ſtraytlyer examyned ſtate towne people within afrayed 〈◊〉 feare theyr lyues ſhewed howe towne lacked victayle nat vitayle • nough 〈◊〉 twone abyde ſiege ſpace •• fo •• e dayes howe neuer gē cylman name man warre within towne ſaue onely dweller within thā drewe counſayle agayne vtterlye determyned wolde go farther tyll hadde aſſayed geat ſayde towne monſac ſo returned agayne toke • ictayle themſelfe deliuered horſes agayn vitailers badde go ſeke newe prouiſyon wente layde ſiege monſac harbored themſelfe though wolde nat go thence moneth made ſemblant aſſaute ye towne next day layde ſuche artyllarie agaynſt walles whan 〈…〉 towne ſawe afrayed knewe well coude nat longe endure bycauſe lacke victayle beganne treate englyſſhe knyghtes fynally knoweledged prince wale theyr lorde kepe holde towne • ym euer fro thence forth without fraude 〈◊〉 •• gyn ſo myght ſytte ſtyll reſt nothynge theyrs taken ser john̄ chandos companye requeſte towne ordeyned capitayne knyght called ſyr roberte mytton twenty men armes hym fourty archer coſtes wage towne rode forthe tyll came durmell ser robert ca 〈◊〉 companye laye ſiege eche made great chere feaſte token loue ſo laye ſiege good ordre ¶ howe ſir robert canol ſir john̄ chandos departed fro durmell without wynnyng wente layde ſiege garyſon dōme cap cc lvii ſiege thus endured durmelle many ſkrymyſſhes dedes armes done many good knyghtes men armes without within good men warre well expierte vſed therin orels coude nat haue endured halfe ſo long dyd lay ſiege without great aduantage worſe caſe within ii cauſes one rayned day nyght whiche euyl men horſes defaute vitayles ſo wiſt nat eate loffe breade worthe iii olde grotes yet worſe ſometyme coude geat none money howe often tymes hadde plentye wynes whyche dyd great comforte caſe fyue wekes finally whan ſawe coude wynne nothynge bycauſe garyſon ſo ſtronge laye ſo great jeopardye diſeaſe determyned departe thence ſo dydde drewe caſtell towne dōme whyche ſtode plentyfull countrey ſo beſieged garyſon within capitayne lorde gouernour ſyr robert dōme hym coſyn called ſyr peter sanglette geat fortreſſe victayle abrode countrey aboute whan englyſſhemen gaſcoynes noumbre fyftene houndred men armes two thouſande archer brygauntes hadde thus layde ſiege fortreſſe aſſauted place couragiouſly reiſed vp dyuerſe great engyns ſo dayly ther ſautes ſkrymyſſhes many feates armes acheued whan hadde layen thus ſiege ſpace fyftene dayes ſawe gatte conquered nothynge laye great payne trauayle toke aduiſe coū ſaile concluded ſende worde angoleſme prince certifieng hym theyr eſtate chandos heraulde cōmaunded go meſſage ſo dyd ſo moche come prince thā hym ſmall company knyghtes ſquyers one way warre whan heraulde came prince kneled downe recōmended hym ye knyghtes ſquiers left ſiege dōme ther ſagely diſcretly declared prince ſtate ordynaūce ſiege alſo delyuered prince letter credence whan prince wel vnderſtād matter ſayd wolde take aduyſe matter cauſed ye herauld abyde ther v dayes ye vi day delyuered hym letter ſealed vnder owne ſeale ſayd departyng chandos recōmaunde v al company ſo departed toke way towarde quercy nowe let v ſpeke • oſte howe dyd mean ſeaſon thys heraulde wente came theyr meſſage ¶ howe ſir robert canol ſir john̄ chandos departed fro dōme without hurt doyng went toke gauaches rochemandor diuers townes wet newly turned frenche ca cc lviii anone chā do heraulde departed meſſage fro ye oſte ser john̄ chandos ser roberte canoll ſyr thomas pheltō ye captall beufz ser james audeley knyghtes ſquiers went counſayle concluded breke vp ſiege perceyued well howe coude geat nothyng determined go ye coū trey wynne townes gariſons ſuche newly turned frēche exhortyng duke berrey thus theſe knyghtes diſlodged departed fro dōme went gauaches whiche incontinent yelded vp became engliſſhe reſted iii dayes toke coūſayle ſhuld whan departed went fortreſſe whiche frenche companyons newely taken called foins ſoone within fortreſſe ſawe engliſſhemē come ſuche puiſaunce gauaches gyuen vp alſo yelded vp theyr fortreſſe became engliſſhe ſo ſware alwayes continue yet wer forſworne ye ſhal engliſſhemen paſſed forth came rochmador gariſon eaſely fortified yet thought nat yeld vp fortreſſe whan engliſſhemen came towne wel aduiſed maner within ſet forth theyr artyllarie gaue aſſaute good ordre many wer hurt ſhotte within without whiche aſſaute endured hole day nyght engliſſhemen withdrewe theyr lodgynges mynde aſſayle agayne next day ſame night within toke coūſaile together perceyued wel howe ſorely aſſauted mooſte wyſeſt ſayd howe length coude nat endure taken force ſhulde dye towne brent ſpoyled without mercy thynges conſidered good euyll fell treatie yelde vp engliſſhemen agreed fro daye forth ſhulde become engliſſhe fulfyll made ſolempne othes beſide theyr 〈…〉 charge ſende theyr town 〈…〉 • oſte xv dayes gether 〈◊〉 ſomets 〈◊〉 vitayles paye vitayle certayn price ſet amonge thus rochmador abode ſtyll reſt engliſſhemen paſſed forth towarde uille franche tholoſain waſtynge diſtroyenge countrey puttyng pore people great miſerie conquerynge townes caſtels newely turned frēche ſome force ſome treatye laſt came uille franche whiche well purueyed maner vitayle artyllarie al playne coūtrey drawē thither beſieged ye towne within foure dayes gaue many great aſſaute werby dyuers hurte bothe within without thynges conſidered within perceyued well coude nat long endure knewe maner apparant reskewe comyng warde cō poſicion became engliſſhe ſo y• ſhuld haue domage thus uile frāche became engliſſhe wherof y• duke aniou lay tholouſe ſore diſpleaſed whā knewe therof coude nat amende y• tyme sir john̄ chandos left capitayne engliſſhe knyght called ſir robert roux ſo paſſed forther diſtroyeng countrey nowe let v returne ſiege bourdeill erle cambridge erle penbroke perceiuered theyr warre ¶ howe erle cambrydge erle pēbroke toke great aduyſe garyſon bourdeill cap c c lix meane ſeaſon yt barones knightes englande made iourneys aſwell rouergue quercy agenoyſe ſiege al ſeaſon endured ſtyll garyſon bourdeill whiche ſpace xi wekes whiche ſeaſon many • autes ſkrymyſſhes feates armes done acheued nygh euery day moſt comōly daily wtin wold come al theyr power barrier theyr wne without gate valiauntly ſkrymyſſhe commers bare ſelfe ſo proprely prayſed ooſte without thus eſtate endured great ſeaſon likelyhod longer done pryde preſumpcion hadde nat men •• owe ryght hardy well fournyſſhed vitailes artillary oſte without beganne ware werie ſawe wel howe laye theyr great cooſte charge wanne lytell ſo day toke theyr counſayle howe maynteyne theyr ſiege aproche towne ther cōcluded next day mornyng ſhulde armed ſo kepe ſelfe lodgynges ſecretly ſende certayne nombre ſkrymyſſhe within thought welle within wolde iſſue accuſtomed ſo whan fought returne agayne make ſemblaunt though fledde entent drawe ennemyes fortreſſe ordeyned haue nombre horſemen redye come bitwene towne ſtop whan wolde returne ſo appoyntment concluded ſayenge yf nat meanes ſhulde nat geat towne eaſely none wayes ſo nexte mornynge yerly cauſed theyr people armed ſente cc towne ſkrymyſſhe whan capitaynes within erualdon bernardya ſawe come ryght ioyous armed al theyr company vii ſcore yonge luſty companyons ſo opened theyr gate came barrier encountred theyr ennemies right fyerſly ſo laſte englyſſhemen reculed back none whan within ſaw iſſued theyr ſtandardꝭ ſaid let v auaunce ſurely oures ſo folowed ſo fierſly fleer fledde ſo fayntely ſome ouerthrowen taken priſoners bicauſe wolde haue lytel olde ſayenge coueteth al leſeth theſe companyōs folowed ſo farre fro theyr fortreſſe whan wolde haue returned coude nat ser john̄ mō tague kept buſſhment v hundred fyghtyng men made knight ſame tyme erle cambridge ther encoūtred enemy whā bour deill ſawe knewe well foolyſſhely aduentured ſelfe drewe gether lyke valiaunt men fought dyd ther feates armes meruaile record ſo helde ſelfe vndiſcomfitted ſpace ii houres ſtyll fyghtynge theyr enemy doynge ſuche dedes armes yt englyſſhemen toke great pleaſaūce theyr valiant dedes ſyr john̄ montague day good knyght valiant finally bourdeill diſcomfited ſlayn taken ſo none ſkaped engliſſhe priſoners reſkewed agayn erualdon bernardyn batefoll capitaynes taken meane ſeaſon ſkrymyſſhe erle cambridge therle penbroke auaūced barrier conquered gate alſo ſo erle cābridge baner entred forttes thus ye engliſſemen gariſon bourdeill cauſed men towne ſwere fayth trouth kepe towne ye prince ther made newe capitayne lord mucydent companye lx archer within brake vp theyr armye concluded go angoleſme prince knowe pleaſure wolde commaund thus ſiege brake vp bourdeill euery mā returned nowe let v returne knyghtes england gaſcoyne rode quercy let v ſpeke chandos herauld newes brought fro prince wale ¶howe ſir robert canoll ſir john̄ chandos ſir thomas phelton ordred people retourned prince cap cc lx thus theſe forſayd men warr companyes rode march rouergue quercy turned theyr parte townes caſtels brought countrey great tribulacion chandos herauld came fortres quercy ſoone ſawe ye herauld come made hym great demaunded hym tydynges anſwered ſaid prince ſaluted al deſired moche ſe ſo velyucred princis letter toke red wherin founde howe prince wold ser john̄ chandos ser thomas phelton captal beufz ſhuld returne hym ye cyte angoleſme ser robert canoll men cōpanyons ſhuld abide ſtyll make warr dyd whā theſe lordes chief al company vnderſtode theſe tidynges beholde eche demaūded ech beſt ſayd one voyce sir robert canoll ser ye ſe vnderſtand howe lord prince hath ſent v hath ordeyned ye ſhuld abide ſtyl countre chief gouernor al men warr sir ſayd lorde prince putteth honor wold s knowe trouth wt wyll nat abide veyt wyl departe determined returne prince knowe pleaſure entent playnly thus brake vp great vyage iorney ther departyng ſent ser perducas dalbret towne rochemador kepe fronter agaynſt frenchemen ſayd companiōs ſirs ye haue herde howe prince hath ſent v yet knowe nat ye cauſ ther fore ſhall ſhew ye ſhall ye ſhall aſſemble toguyder companyes entre marcheſſe lymoſyn auuergne make ther warre wtout warr ye nat lyue ſirs promyſe faithfully ye wynne towne fortereſſe orcaſtell wher ſoeuer yf fortune ye ther beſieged wyll ſo confort wyll reyſe ſiege whā herde promyſe ſayde sir ſhall beſt truſt yor promyſe paraduenture ſhall haue nede therof thus departed eche fto ſo brake vp iourney theſe lordes wēt ſtreight angoleſme prince made thē great chere lytell ther come prince oute countie pyergourt erle cambridge erle penbroke ſir johan mountagu ¶nowe let v ſpeke englyſſhe companyons departed fro ſir john̄ chā do howe perceyuered ¶howe englyſſhe companyons toke caſtell bell perche therin duke burbons mother alſo toke ſtrōge caſtell ſaīt seuere berry cap cc lxi among theſe ſayd companyōs ther thre ſquiers great capitanes hardy well experte mē warr ſpecially ſautyng ſcalyng townes fortereſſes one named ortygo ſeconde bernarde de wyſke thirde de la sale theſe thre thought nat ſyt ydell ſome dede wherby ſpoken cōpany wēt lymoſyn ſeneſhall gouernoure ther vnder prince ſir johan deureux theſe thre forſayd ſquyers toke aduyſe aſſay get ſome fortereſſe fraunce knewe well bell perche burbonoyſe ſtronge caſtell therin dwelled duke burbons mother mother frenche quene vnderſtode ſpyes good lady caſtell alone without company good watche harde reported howe ye conſtable caſtell wolde often tymes ryde take ly tell hede ſaue kepynge place 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 theſe cōpanyons certayne thē ſuch dyde choſe ſlept nat purpoſe rode day night mornyng came bell perche ſcaled caſtell toke good lady within than̄e ſawe well howe fortereſſe good ſtrong good plentyfull coūtre ſayd truſted kepe agaynſt men alſo ſame night toke another caſtell called ſaynt seuere marcheſſe lymoſyn gaue ſir johan deureux theſe tidynges anone knowen france howe bell perche taken thenglyſſhmen quenes mother within wherof frēche kyng ſore diſpleaſed ſo ye quene duke burbone coulde nat amende tyme ſame ſeaſon ſir loyes sanxere right valyant knight hardy choſen admytted one ye marſhals warr france howbeit lyued ſir arnolde dandrehen ſo aged bruſed armes trauayle tyme paſſed yt coude nat well helpe ſelfe coulde lengar attende office howbeit wolde • ere harneſſe tyme nede ¶ nowe let v ſpeke ſomwhat buſyneſſe picardy aſſembly made tornehen frenche kyng ſeaſon ſomer made great appayrell ſhyppes veſſels porte hareluce entent haue ſent army englande well furnyſſhed good men armes knightes ſquiers wherof ſir philyppe brother duke burbon admytted chefe gouernour thentent haue diſtroyed englande frenche kyng lay cyite roane better bring purpoſe euery weke two thre tymes wolde go ſe ſhyppes ſo great mynde affection beſyde cōmaundement ſo ſpredde ouer realme rone ueulgueſſyn beaumoſyne ther came dayly men warr ſo great nombre marueyle regard dayly great pruiſyon came yf ben caſtyle portyngale howebeit lorde clyſſon one chiefeſt kynges counſayle acorded nat age diſcounſayled kyng noble realme fro iourney englā de sayeng howe nat ſo well accuſtomed make warr thenglyſſhmen alleged therto dyuers reaſons knewe cōdicyons nature englyſſhmen ſtate englande dyd natwithſtādyng coude nat breke ye kyngꝭ purpoſe ſome coūſell y• viage ſhulde go forward king england ſon duke lācaſtre dyuers counſell well enformed army viage frenchman wolde cōe make warr owne coūtre wherof right ioyouſe furniſſhed porte paſſages ſee agaynſt poictou normandy receyue came ye realme englande fully determyned fight thē wolde come realme kyng england counſayled ſend ſon duke lancaſtre certayne nombre men warr calais kyng himſelfe named ſhulde go ſon thyder erle saliſbury therle warwyke ſir water manny lorde roſe ſir henry percy lorde baſſet lorde wyllouby lorde dalawar lorde de la poule ſir thom̄s graūtſome ſir aleyn bourchier ſir richard story dyuers v c men armes v c archer ſo cāe douer whan ſhyppes redy paſſed ſee arryued ſtrong towne calays ther toke landyng lodged towne ſame ſeaſon kyng england writen ſpecially deſyring ſir robr̄t framur ſerue hym warres certayne nōbre men warr ſir robert ben alwayes good englyſſhe anſwered ſaid wolde redy whan ſoeuer pleaſed kyng england cōmaund hym aſſone knewe ye kyng child ſhulde aryue calys ye felde make warr frāce aſſone herde ye duke lācaſtre aryued calys ſomoned company ſuch thought wolde ſerue ayde hym apparelled voyage haſtely coude let v retorne ye buſyneſſe poictou ¶ caſtell roche ſur yone rendred thenglyſſhmen capitayn therof put dethe cōmaundement duke aniou cap cc lxii le ſhall knowe deytyng baron knyghtes guyen chandos heraud brought tidynges fro prince went one accorde towne angoleme founde prince receyued ioyounlly lytell retourned erle cambridge therle penbroke ye conqueſt burdeyll ye haue herde thus theſe lordes made great feaſt chere togyder whan mette toke coū ſayle aduyſe toguyder beſt enploy forthe ſeaſon remembred howe party aniou fayre caſtell ſtronge parteynyng ye duke aniou called roche ſur yon ſo determyned go ley ſiege therto wynne might prepared iourney ther came baron knightes po •• tou ser james audeley lorde pouns lorde partney ſir loys harcourt ſir guyſſhard dangle lorde pynan lorde ta •• boton ſir mabrion lymyers ſeneſhall rochell ſir thom̄s percy whan aſſembled togyder mo thre thouſand ſpeares departed rode ſo long y• came caſtell roche ſur yone whiche ſtrong well kept well prouyded defence wt men warr purueyance artyllary capitayne ther ſet duke aniou called ſir johan blōdeau vnder many good companion coſt charge duke aniou ſayd lordꝭ layd ſege roūde caſtell good order made brought thyder fro towne thoars fro cytie poycters dyuers great eugins cauſed reared vp agaynſt caſtell beſyde gonne ſpringals hooſt vytayle ynough ther came plentie fro poyctou fro marcheſſe adioynynge whan ſir johan bloudeau ſawe howe beſiged ſo many good men warr ther nighe baron knyghtes acquitayne perceyued well howe conforte ayde comyng towarde hym fro ꝑte began afrayed ſawe well lordes ther wold nat departe tyll caſtell byforce otherwyſe erle cambridge company ſir johan chandos byuers knyghtes well acquaynted capitayne ben company tyme paſſed came barryers dyde ſo moche promyſe aſſurance ſpake hym handeled ſuche wyſe nat ſubtell howbeit good knight rē dred vp caſtell nat reſcued ſpace moneth thā haue vi thouſande frankes purueyaunces ye caſtell ſo treaty without abyde ſtyll ſuertie without makyng warr bothe party duryng terme ſayd cōpoſicyon nat reſcued within ſame terme aforeſayd rendre vp caſtell treaty thus concluded capitayne within ſignifyed mater duke aniou french kynge duke berry lordes whome thought ayded thentent might better excuſed fro blame reproch layd charge ſendyng caſtell fayre ſtronge right neceſſary frenche countrey aniou tourayne yet nother reſcue confort aſſone moneth paſſed expyred englyſſhe lordes deſyred capytayne kepe promyſe alſo delyuered good pledge ſo ſayd capitayne ſayd company sirsſyth frenche kyng duke aniou woll wylfully leſe fortreſſe nat kepe alone without ayded ſo ther yelded vp caſtell thenglyſſhmen toke poſſeſſyon therof right gladde therof delyuered capitayne vi thouſande frankes ſuche prouiſyons within caſtell cōpany ſurely cō neyed towne angyers aſſone come thyder areſted gouernour towne put caſtell priſon herd ſay night put ſacke caſt ryuer drowned ſtrayte cōmaūdement duke aniou bycauſe toke golde ſyluer ye delyerance caſtell whiche able ſelfe haue kept ye ſpace yere nede ſo reqred thus thēglyſſhmen poſſeſſyon caſtell roche ſur yone aniou ther ſet great gariſon repeyred caſtell ſufficiently returned agayne angoleme prince ſome thē toke leaue departed owne houſes ſir james audeley valyant knight ſeneſhall poictou went lay fōt neythe countie fell ſicke ſore malady ſo yt therby length dyed wherof prince princeſſe right ſoroufull lykewiſe baron knightes poictou obſequy ſolemply done cytie poicters prince beyng ther perſonally anone requeſt y• baron knightes poicton ſir john̄ chandos conſtable aquitayne made ſeneſhall poictou ſo wēt ſay cyte poiters made ten yſſues iourneys agaynſt frēchmen helde thē ſo ſhorte durſt nat ryde great route cōpanies ſame ſeaſon delyuered priſon vycont rochchoart whome prince kepte priſone bycauſe ſuſpect haue tourned frenche requeſt frendes poictou ſuche aboute prince prince delyuered gaue agayne landes aſſoone ſame vycount delyuered priſone went priuely parys frenche kynge tourned became frenche retourned owne lande without knolege parys ſet thybault du pont breton fortereſſe contynent ſent defyed prince wale made great warre ¶ nowe lette v ſomwhat ſpeke duke lācaſtre ¶ howe duke burgoyne deꝑted fro cyte roane thentent fight duke lancaſtre howe lodged eche agaynſt tornehen cap cc lxiii whan duke lancaſtre come calays ye haue herde well refreſſhed people ther thought nat lye ther ydelneſſe rather ſome dedes armes france intent departed fro calays day thre hūdred ſpeares many archer ſo paſſed beſyde guynes rode ſo long tyll paſſed ryuer oſtre ther ſpred abrode countre toke way towarde abbey lynques ther toke great pray ledde calys another day toke another way went towardes boloyne dyde great domage playne countre ſame tyme therle guy ſaynt poule ſir galeran ſofie certayne nōbre men warr lay cytie turwyn yſſued nat herde thēgliſſhmen rode abrode coū tre thought ſelfe nat able fight kepe felde agaynſt thē none tidynges came frenche kyng lay roane made great aſſē ble ye haue herde howe duke lancaſtre come calais howe dayly men made rodes yſſues france whan frenche kyng herde yt bothe counſayle newe ymaginacions ſame weke determyned duke burgoyne ſhulde haue taken ſee haue gone england kyng coūſayle debated beſt yt caſe go fight thenglyſſhmen yt ſyde ſee el kepe forthe iorney england ſo ther fermely cōcluded yt euery man ſhulde dyſloge make redy go towarde calays duke burgoyne ſo firſt purpoſe broken determyned go fight thenglyſſhemen yt ſyde ſee wherof euery man glad aparelled thēſelfe duke burgone deꝑted cōpany toke way paſſe y• ryuer abuyle dyde ſo moche iourneys came muttrell hedyn ſaynt poule ther frēch men abode eche ſhewed duke lancaſtre frēchmen aproched nere fight wherof glad yſſued calais intent toke felde valey tornehen nat ben ther long gentyll knight ser robert namur came thyder ſerue hundred ſpeares well furnyſſhed whoſe comyng duke lancaſtre right ioyfull ſayd fayre dere vncle ye right hartely welcome sir ſhewed v howe duke burgoyne aprocheth ſore fight v sir ꝙ goddes name ſo wolde
