gladly ſe thus thēglyſſhmē loged vale tornehen fortefyed campe ſtrong hedge dayly ther came prouiſyon thē calais currors ran ouer countie guyens forage vitayls lytell gat playne countre diſtroyed loſt euery thynge fortreſſes came duke burgoyne company lodged hyll tornehen agaynſt englyſſhmen frenchman lodged good order toke great ſpace grounde herde ſay duke burgoyne ther mo foure thouſande knightes conſydre reſydue nat great nombre thus ech agaynſt long ſpace without thyng doynge though duke burgoyne great nōbre ſawe ther hym good men warr ſeuyn agaynſt one engliſſhmen yet wolde nat fight without leaue ye kyng brother nat mynde shuld fight yet trouthe yf frenchman ſet forwarde haue fought englyſſhmen wolde nat haue refuſed redy euery daye receyue good order euery man fully determyned ſhulde dyd yſſue bycauſe ſo fewe nō bre ſo ſtrōg place thought nat departe nyſely oute aduantage ſundrie tymes dyuers bothe party wolde yſſue ſcrimyſſhe ſomtyme wanne ſomtyme loſt chaunce often falleth ſuche aduentures ſame tyme loyes erle flaunders greatly inclyned honoure profyte ſonne duke burgoyne lay ſame ſeaſon fayre houſe newly buylded beſyde gaunt often harde tidynges duke hym meſſāgers comynge goynge alwayes counſayled duke ſhulde wyſe breke paſſe ordynaunce kynge brother counſayle ¶ nowe let v leue thus retourne buſyneſſe farther coūtreis knightes ſquyers hadde ynough bycauſe warres habundant place ¶ howe ſir johan chādos brought countre aniou great trybulacion howe waſted dyſtroyed landes bycount rochchoart excepte fortereſſes cap cc lxiiii meane ſeaſone iorney thus made tornehē ther fell dyuers aduētures poictou whiche ought nat forgotten ſir johan chandos ſeneſhall ther lyke hardy valyāt knight euer deſyringe fynde frenchman fyght aſſembled togyder poicters certayne nombre men armes ſayenge howe wolde ryde aniou retourne agayne towrayne ſe frenchemen marcheſſe fronters whiche purpoſe ſignifyed therle penbroke lay mortaygne garyſon two hundred ſpeares whiche tidynges erle ioyfull well content haue rydden forthe ſome knightes counſayle brake purpoſe ſayde sir ye yet yong nobleneſſe yet come ſir put ſelfe cō pany ſir john̄ chandos whatſoeuer ye ſhall haue brute voyce therof ye ſhall reputed companyon therfore ſir better ſythe ye ſo great lorde ye ye enterpriſes ſelfe parte let ſir johan chandos ſelfe ſythe bacheler regarde eſtate theſe wordes abated erles desyre ſo therby wyll go forthe ser johan chandos ſo made excuſe hym howebeit ſir john̄ chandos wolde nat breke purpoſe goyng forth enterprice made aſſemble poicters ſo deꝑted thre hundred ſpeares knyghtes ſquyers two hundred archer hym ſir thomas percy ſir stephyn goſenton ſir richarde pountchardon ſir euſtace dābretycourt ſir richard tēcon ser thom̄s spens ſir nowell lornyſſhe ſir dangoſes ſir thomas balaſtre ſir johan tryuell ſir wyllm̄ mountendre ſir wyllm̄ manbrius lymers ſir geffray dargēton dyuers theſe men armes archer rode forthe good ordynaunce paſſed poitou entred aniou ſent forthe currours bren exyle ye playne countrey dyde many yuels good plentyfull countrey aniowe none came fight taryed ther ſpace xv dayes ſpecially plentyfull co •• called londonoys cetourned agayne bytwene aniou tourayn long ryuer creuſe ſo entred lande vycont roche choart brent waſted countre left nothyng abrode without fortreſſe ſo came towne roch choart aſſay • ed right valyantly howbeit wanne nothyng ther towne well fortifyed 〈◊〉 good men warr thybault pont lyon talay capitayns within ye towne ſo thēnglyſſhmen paſſed forthe ſir johan chandos knowledge howe marſhall frāce ſir loyes sanxere great nombre men warr hay tourayne thā great deſyre go thy 〈◊〉 ſent worde therof therle pēbroke de ſyringe go hym y• hay tourayne mete hym caſteleraulte chandos heraude wente meſſage founde therle mortayne redy aſſembled certayne nombre tent make iourney enemyes y• erle made excuſe counſayle knightes ſayeng might nat cōe ſir john̄ chandos tyme heraude retourned foūde maiſter caſteleraut ſhewed hym anſwere fro therle pē broke whan ſir john̄ chādos herde nat well content mynde ꝑceyued well howe therle left enterprice preſumpcion pride ſayde well goddes name ſo ſo gaue leaue mooſt parte company departe went agayne cytie poicters ¶ howe ſir loyes sanxere cāe therle penbroke ſlewe diuers people beſieged erle houſe cap cc lxv nowe let v ſhewe ſō therle john̄ pē broke dyde aſſone knewe ſir johan chandos gone backe agayne poycters gyuen leue men departe erle prepared ryde forthe hym thre hūdred ſpeares englyſſhe po • ctenyns ſo departed fro mortaygne ther certayne knightes ſquyers poictou xaynton ſome england ben ſir johan chandos came erle penbroke went forth company rode forthe paſſed poyctou toke ſame waye ſir johan chandos taken ſo entred aniou brent exyled countre toke lefte ſo taryed certayne ſpace countre lōdo noyſe tooke way lande vycont roche choart wher dyde great domage hurt whan y• frenchman garyſons march tourayne aniou poyctou herde theſe two iourneys thus made countrey aniou herde howe pride therle pēbroke yonge man diſdayned go forthe cōpany ſir john̄ chandos determyned encountre might thinkyng eaſely diſconfyte ſir johan chandos aſſembled togyder ſecretely certayne nombre euery garyſon ther aboute made capitayne ſir loys sanxer marſhall france ſo ſecretely night went forthe roche poizay poictou frenche company ſir robert sanxere coſyn marſhall ser johan uyen ſir johan bulle ſir wyllyam bordes ſir loys ſaynt julyan carnet breton nombre vii hundred erle penbroke done iourney retournynge entred agayne poyctou made ende brennyng vycont roch • hoartes landes company ſir bauden fanuyll ſeneſhall xaynton ſir thomas percy ſir thomas spenſer ſir dangoſes ſir johan ornych ſir john̄ herpedan ſir james surgeres ſir johan couſon ſir thomas ſaynt albyn ſir robert twyforde ſir symon auſagre ſir john̄ mortayne ſir john̄ couchet dyuers thus theſe englyſſhmen poyctenyns rode forthe diſmay herde maner tidynges men warr ſo great pyllage praye entred agayne poyctou day came hye noone village called puiernon toke lodgynge wenyng ſurety varlettꝭ •• ſettyng vp horſes dreſſing ſupper ſodenly frēchmen well aduyſed ſhulde came towne ſpeares reeſt cryed cryes lady sanxere marſhall fraunce ſo beate downe euery ſyde englyſſhmen ſt • etes houſes ſo noyſe ſo gret reyſed men vp great affray ſodenly taken noyſe came therle pē broke ſir thom̄s percy ſir thomas frā uyll knightes howe y• frenchman wer come aſſayled theſe lordes went lodgynges aſſembled companyes togyder coulde nat drawe togyder frenchman ſo ſtronge englyſſhmen coulde nat endure firſt brunt ther taken ſlayne mo ſixſcore ſo erle hadde remedy withdrawe aſſone might place templers cloſed ſtone walles ſo erle ſuche entred place reſydue taken ſlayne mooſt parte harneſſe horſes loſte ther erle penbroke loſt baggage richeſſe whan̄e frenchemen knewe place therof right ioyouſe sayeng amonge theym ſelfe ▪ nat ſcape v oures ſhall nowe derely abye domagꝭ haue done aniou towrayne frenchman drewe place good order redy aſſayle ſawe well y• place p̄ignable aſſayled place right fierſly ſhewed many 〈◊〉 noble feate armes frenchman good men warr aſſayled place rounde right valyantly erle thenglyſſhmen payned themſelf moche might defende theymſelfe ſtode well hande frenchman hadde certayne ſcalynge ladder ſome theym aduentured thē selfe mount vpon walles paueſſes theym feare ſhotte caſtyng ſtones whan vp fierſe lye receyued knightes ſquyers ſpeares ſwerdes handes ſoo fought frenchman hand hande cauſed diſcende downe faſter came vp ſuche archer within ſhotte ſo fierſly frenchman drue abacke aſſaut endured tyll night frenchman right wery ſore traueyled 〈◊〉 retrayt reculed backe ſayeng 〈…〉 • hat day tyll y• nexte mornyng purpoſed come agayn thaſſaut thynges cōſydred frenchman ſayde ſurely nat long endure ayenſt v ſhall rather famyſhe ſo lodged night kept good watch ye place ye may knowe trouhe therle penbroke cōpany natte well eaſe ſawe well great ieopardy parceyned well howe 〈…〉 nat ſtronge ynough endure 〈…〉 ſo many good knightes 〈◊〉 thē alſo 〈…〉 artyllary 〈…〉 place lon 〈…〉 made ſembl 〈…〉 thought 〈…〉 night yf nede whan wa 〈…〉 night de •• red ſquyer 〈…〉 ey great truſt depart backe p •• terne ſo ryde poicters ſpeke ſir john̄ chādos ſhewe caſe wynge alſo howe yf lyſt might come tyme ynough reſcue truſted defende place tyll nexte day paſt noone ſquyer ſawe great dāger ſaid wolde gladly meſſage alſo ſayde knewe well 〈◊〉 way thider ſo mydnight 〈…〉 backe poſterne toke way 〈◊〉 whiche thought ſhulde haue ben •• xt way howbeit knowledge went night way ſo yt faire day coude get right waye mornynge frenchman armed thē ſowned thaſſaut ſayeng wolde aſſaut y• place y• cole mornyng rather y• heate day erle penbroke ſlept lytell night cōpany fortifyenge walles ſtones thynges ſawe well howe frenchemen ordeyned aſſayle agayne within frenchemen drewe y• place good ordre made aſſaute ſkalyng ladder ſome moūted vp y• walles paueſſes defend heedes thought great honour ſoeuer coude mount fyrſt howe thēngliſſhmen nat idle redy defēd thēſelfe el ben taken ſo defē ded thē ſelfe merueylouſly caſt downe ſtones paueſſes baſſenettꝭ ouerthrue ſlewe hurt dyuers dyde ſuche dedes armes yt ye neuer herde ſo feble place ſo well defēded ſo fewe people agaynſt ſo many good knightes ſquyers ther▪ ſo aſſaut endured fro mornyng tyll noone ¶ howe ſir johan chandos came ſocour erle penbroke ca cc lxvi bitwene mornyng ix ye day whan thaſſaut moſte fereſeſt frenchman ſore dyſpleaſed thēglyſſhmen endured ſo longe wherfore ſent vyllagꝭ ther pike matockes breke downe vndermyne wall whiche thyng englyſſhmen douted mooſt erle pē broke called ſquyer hym ſayd frende take courſer yſſue backe poſterne ſhall make waye ryde ſtreight poicters ſhewe ſir john̄ chā do ſtate dangere recomaunde token toke ryng fro fynger delyuered ſayd take ſir johan chandos rynge knoweth right well ſquyer tooke enterprice thought ſhulde great honour might acheue ſcape ſpeke hym toke rynge mounted incō tynent courſer departed preuy way ſaute endured toke way poycters meane ſeaſon aſſaute terryble feyrſe frenchman englyſſhmen defended ſelfe right valyantly good courage ſtode theym well hande ſo nowe let v ſpeke firſt ſquyer departed fro puirenon hour mydnight night rode way whan mornyng fayre day thā knewe way ſo rode toward potter tyme horſe wery howheit came thyder nyne clocke ther alyghted ſir johan chandos lodging entred founde maſſe • nd ſo came kneled downe dyde meſſage cōmaunded ſir johan chandos nat content day therle pēbroke wolde nat ryde hym ye haue herde wherfore nat lightly enclyned make great haſt ſayde wyll harde v com thyder tyme ynough maſſe anone maſſe y• table couered redy dyner ſeruauntꝭ demaūded wolde go dyuer ſayde yes ſythe redy wente hall knightes ſquyers brought hym water waſſhynge came hall ſeconde ſquyer fro erle penbroke kneled downe toke rynge purſe ſayde ryght dere ſir erle penbroke recommaundeth token deſyreth tely come conforte hym bring hym daunger puyrenon ſir johan chandos tooke rynge knewe well ſayd cōethyder tymes harde yt caſe ye ſhewe lette v go dyner ſo ſat downe cōpany eate firſt courſe ſeruedde ſeconde courſe eatynge therof ſodenly ſir johan chandos greatly ymagined mater laſt caſt vp heed ſayd company sir erle penbroke noble man great lynage ſonne naturall lorde kynge englande hath wedded doughter euery thyng companyon therle cābridge hath requyred come hym beſyneſſe jought conſente deſyre ſocour confort may come tymes ther put table fro ſayde sir wyll ryde towarde puyrenon wherof people hadde great ioye incō tynent apparelled theym trumpettes ſowned euery man mounted horſes beſt might ſoone herde ſir johan chandos wolde rydeto puyre non conforte erle penbroke company beſiege euery knight ſquyer man armes went felde mo two hundred ſpeares alway encreaſed thus rode forthe toguyder tidynges came frenchemen hadde contynually aſſawted fortereſſe mornynge tyll highe noone ſpyes ſayd theym sir aduyſe well ſir johan chandos deꝑted fro poicters mo thā cc ſpeares comynge hyderwarde great haſt hath gret deſyre fynde whan ſir loyes sāxere ſir john̄ uyen ſir john̄ bulle capitayns herd thoſe tidyngꝭ wiſeſt among thē ſaid sir people 〈◊〉 ſore wery traueyled aſſautyng thenglyſſhmen bothe • ſter day day therfore thynke better fayre eaſely returned ſaue garde ſuch wynninges priſoners haue gote rather abyde aduenture comyng ſir johan chandos company freſſhe luſty feare may loſe ſhall wyn ye whiche counſayle well beleued behoued nat long tary trūpettes ſo wned retrayt company drewe fro aſſaut aſſembled togyder truſſed vp harneſſe cariage ſo retourned toke way poizay erle penbroke company knewe anone therby howe frenchman knowledge comyng ſir johan chandos erle ſayde sir lette v yſſue ryde toward poicters mete dere frende ſir johan chandos lepte horſebacke ſuche horſes ſome fote two two horſe ſo yſſued caſtell rode towarde poycters nat rydden aleage encountred ſir johan chandos company ioyfull metynge ſir john̄ chandos ſayde ſore diſpleased came nat frenchman departed ſo rode togyder talkynge ſpace thre leages than̄e toke leaue eche sir johan chandos retourned poitters erle penbroke mortaygne fro whens firſte departed marſhalles fraunce company returned potzay departed • otie euery mā went owne gariſon ledde priſonerss raunſomed theym courteſly lyke maner acuſtomed bytwene englyſſhmen frenchman ¶ nowe lette v retourne aſſemble tornehen ſpeke ye deth mooſt gentyll quene mooſtly detail mooſt courteſſe yt euer quene vdayes whiche fayre lady philyp heynault quene englande irelande ¶ howe quene philyp englande trepaſſed mortall lyfe thre gyftes ſhe deſyred kynge huſbande ſhe dyed cap cc lxvii meane ſeaſone whyle noble men frā ce thus aſſembled tornehen whome y• duke burgon chefe ſouerayne y• duke lancaſtre thēgliſſhmen parte fell england heuy caſe comon howbeit right pyteouſe kyng chyldren realme good quene englande ſo many good dedes done tyme ſo many knightꝭ ſocoured ladyes damoſels cōforted ſo largely depted goodes people naturally loued alwayes nacyon heynaulte countrey wher ſhe borne fell ſicke caſtell wyndſore whiche ſickeneſſe contynewed ſo longe remedye dethe good lady whanne ſhe knewe parceyued remedy dethe ſhe deſyred ſpeke kynge huſbande whan ſhe put bedde right han • e toke kynge right hande right ſorowfull hert ſhe ſaid sir haue peace ioye great proſperyte vſed oure tyme toguyer sir nowe pray departyng ye wyll graūt thre deſyres kynge tyght ſorowfully wepyng ſayd madame deſyre ye wyll graunt sir ſayde ſhe requyre firſte maner people ſuche haue dault marchaundyſe ſyde theſee beyond may pleaſe pay euery thynge owe theym ſecondly ſir ſuche ordynaūce promyſes haue made church well countrey beyonde ſee wher haue hadde deuocyon maye pleaſe accomplyſſhe full fyll ſame thirdely ſir requyre may pleaſe take none ſepulture whan ſoeuer ſhall pleaſe god call tranſytorie lyfe beſyde weſtmynſter kynge wepynge ſayde madame graunt deſyre good lady quene made ſigne croſſe cōmaunded kyng huſbande god yongeſt ſofie thomas beſyde anone ſhe yelded vp ſpiryte whiche beleue ſurely holy angel receyued great ioy vp heuen lyfe ſhe dyd neyther thought dede thyng wherby leſe ſoule ferr creature coulde knowe thus good quene englande dyed yere lorde ccc lxix vigyll lady myddes auguſt whoſe dethe tidynges came tornehen englyſſhe hooſt wherof euery creature ſore diſpleaſed ryght ſo roufull ſpecially ſon duke lā caſtre howbeit ther ſorowe behoueth length borne forgoten therfore thenglyſſhmen left nat order remayned long ſpace frēchmen certayne knightes ſquyers france ther dayly ſawe enemyes concluded toguyder nexte mornynge go ſerimyſſhe englyſſhmen ſame acorde mo thre hūdred knightes ſquyers uer mandois artois corbois ſo eche thē gaue warnyng without knowledge marſhals ſo ye next mornyng yt day lyght horſbacke redy armed toguyder aſſembled ſo rode forthe without noyſe makyng rode hyll tornchen take aduantage come one corner thenglyſſhe hooſt whiche corner loged ſir robert namure company ſame nyght kepte watche mornynge drawen tent ſet table eate ſome meate armed ſaue baſſenet ye lorde poicten therwith came frenchman ſame ſyde happe ſuche kepte watche nat vnarmed fortuned well anone redy defende ennemyes ſo encountred brake way anone tidynges cāe ſir robert namure howe men fightyng frenchman therwith put table fro hym ſayd let v go helpe men incontynent put baſſenet heed cauſed one take baner diſplayed one ſayd sir thynke beſt ye ſent duke lancaſtre fight nat without hym anſwered ſhortly ſayd send ſo wyll wyll go nexte way men loue lette folowe therwith went forth glayue hande aprochyng ennemyes lorde poicten ſir henry sanxels hym dyuers knightes ſo founde men fightyng frenchman great nombre lykely haue done great enterprice aſſoone ſawe ſir robr̄t namures baner come drewe abacke gyder feared hooſt ſtyrred ſo dyuers place ſir robertes baner ſlayne knyght uermandoiſe called ſir robert coloyne great domage right ſwete courteſſe ryght good knight frēchmen retourned agayne without doyng feared rather leſe wyn ſir robert thought nat folowe foliſſhely aſſembled men togyder ſo went lodgyng whan ſawe frenchman gone ¶ howe duke burgoyne depted fro duke lācaſtre without batayle howe duke lācaſtre went calays ca cc lxviii thys aduenture ther nothing done ought remembred diſpleaſed mochſom party yt ſo long ſo nere togyder fought nat ſayde euery day among ſhall fight y• whiche day cāe neuer ſayd duke burgoyne wolde nat breke ordynaunce kynge brother hadde ſtraytely commaunded ſhulde gyue batayle thenglyſſhmen euery day meſſangers bytwene comyng goynge duke burgoyne than̄e enfourmed ymagyned conſydered howe lay great coſt charge howe coude lye lengar honour hadde four thouſande knyghtes mo ſawe well enemyes handfull men nombre nother fought thē ſhulde nat wherfore heſent knightꝭ ye kyng brother ſhewyng mynde wolde haue leue fight el 〈…〉 departe kyng knewe well duke deſyred reaſon commaundyng ſight letter ſhulde dillodge gyue leaue men warr departe come hymſelfe parys sayenge howe wolde go himſelfe owne propre ꝑſone fight englyſſhmen whan duke burgoyne herde thoſe tidynges gaue knoledge therof ſecretly greatteſt hoſt ſayeng thē sir muſt diſloge kyng heth cōmaunded ſo hour mydnight thyng truſſed euery man moū ted horſes ſet fyre logynges whiche tyme ſir henry sāxels kept watche ser robert namures cōpany ſpyed fyre two thre ſo mo ſayd hymſelfe fere frenchman wyll wake v night ſemeth ſo dealyng ſaid thē hym let v go awake lorde robert namure entent y• frenchman fynde v nat ſlepe ſir henry came lodgynge lorde namur called chāberlayns ſayd sir houefull ye wake lorde went bedde ſyde awoke hym ſhewed hym mater anſwered well ſe ſhall ſhortely tidynges call vp folkes let euery man quickely armed ſo dyde alſo ſhortly armed whan men aſſembled togyder cauſed one take baner went ſtreight duke lancaſtres tent nere armed warnynge mater ſo anon redy lordes lytell lytell drewe anone aboute euer came raynged batayle fayre ſoftely without noyſe light cauſed archer redy raynged theym ſuche place thought frenchman ſhulde cōe purpoſe come fight theym whan ſtand thus ſpace two house ſawe none came great marueyle duke demaunded lordes beſt hym ſayd one thyng ſome ſayd another euery man opinyon duke ſayd ſir water manny ſir howe ſay sir ſayd nat tell ſhulde ſay ſir ye ſhulde myne opinyon ye ſhulde ordayne men armes archer maner batayle euer lytell lytell auaūce forwarde ſir anon wyll day lyght ſhall ſe perfitely duke agreed counſayle howe ſome counſayled contrary wyſe wolde haue duke remoue fro felde ſtrife togyder certayne ſpace laſt ordayned y• certayne ſir robert namures company certayne ſir ualeran de brome company ſhulde mount horſ backe bycauſe mete able ſuch enterprice ſo xxx beſt horſemen deꝑted rode towarde frenche hoſt agayne ser galtyer manny ſayd duke ſir neuer beleue without frenchman fledde therfore mount horſe company folowe quickely ye ſhall haue day fayre iourney duke ſayde sir haue hytherto alwayes folowed aduyſe counſayle euer wyll • neuer beleue ſo many valyant men armes noble knightes frenche partie wolde thus ſhamfully depart parauenture fyers haue made drawe v warde ſo begyle v anon currours wyll come wyll bringe v perfyte knowledge euery thynge thus talkynge currours came ſayd purpoſe ſir gaultyer māny ſhewed ſene founde ſayde howe founde body certayne poore vitaylers ſuche folowed hoſt ſir gaultier manny great honoure opinyon duke lancaſtre drewe lodgyng vnarmed thought haue gone dyned frenche men lodgynges ſauynge fyre ſmoke made wolde nat ſuffre nyght went thyder ſupper lodged night toke eaſe ſuch next mornynge diſlodged retourned calays whan duke burgoyne dyſloged went ſame day ſaynt omers lay hoſt deꝑted euery man whyder wolde whiche great payne bringe togyder agayne ¶ ſame weke erle penbroke beynge poyctou great diſpleaſure ſir loys sanxere ſir johan uyen ſir john̄ bulle ſo delt puyernon hath b • wed thought reuenged might departed fro mortayne company two hundred ſpeares ſo came angoleſme prince made great erle deſyred lette haue certayne nōbre men haue leaue make iourney sayeng great deſyre reuenge diſpites frēchmen done late price loued hym entierly graūted deſyre ſame ſeaſon ther newly come price fro countie armynake ſir hugh caurell brought hym moo fyue hūdred men warr companyons prince commaunded hym go erle penbroke iourney alſo erle deſyred ſir loys harcourt ſir guyſſharde dangle ſir percyuale coloyne lorde pōs lorde parteney lorde pynan ſir thomas percy ſir thomas pontchardon dyuers knightes princꝭ houſe gladly graūted go hym whā togyder fyue c ſperes thre hundred archer fyftene hundred men maner brigantes launce paueſſes folowynge hooſt fote thus therle penbroke deꝑted cō pany rodeſo long rāe aniou began brenne waſt diſtroy countre ſo paſſed one ſyde brennynge winnynge townes ſmall holdes raunſomed playne countrey sauyour loyre lodged ſubbarbes aſſayled towne coude nat get within ſir robert sanxere kepte defended towne coūtre aboute brent diſtroyed 〈◊〉 hughe caurell company came bridge ryuer loyre called bridge see anone kept diſcō fyted bridge wonne •• yed ſuche wyſe kept long alſo ſame iourney englyſſhmen toke wanne abbey ryuer loyre called ſaynt whith newly fortifyed ſuche wyſe made therof great garyſon whiche greatly domaged countre wynter ſomer ſame tyme ther poyctou abbey yet called ſaynt saluyn 〈…〉 euyn leages fro poycters whiche abbey monke gretly hated ſuper abbot ſhewed well bycauſe hatred yt betrayed abbot couēt meanes delyuered abbey towne ſir loys ſaynt julyan carnet breton toke frenche kynges name repeyred made ther good garyſone takyng ſaynt saluyn ſir johan chandos ſore diſpleaſed bycauſe ſene ſhall poictou thought hymſelfe lyued long get agayne howeſoeuer dyde hadde taken ſhulde repent ¶ nowe let v lytell ſeaſon leaue ſpekyng buſyneſſe poictou ſpeke duke lancaſtre ¶ howe countre uermādoiſe countie ſaynt poule waſted ſir hugh chaſtellone taken cap cc lxix whan duke lācaſtre come agayne calays departyng fro tornehen company refreſſhed thē thre dayes thanne thought agayn ryde forth make ſome iourney france y• two marſhals therle warwyke lorde roger beauchampt commaunded euery man drawe felde wherof euery man gladde deſyringe ryde fraunce departed fro calays good ordre euery man knewe ſhulde y• firſt day went fyue leages nexte day came ſaynt omers ther great ſcrimyſſhe gate thēglyſſhmen reſted nat ther greatly paſſed went lodged morres herſault thirde day came turwyn within towne therle guy ſaynt poule great nōbre men warr thengliſſhmen paſſed toke way hedyn yt day loged lytell ryuer whan erle ſaynt poule ſawe yt thenglyſſhmen wēt towarde countre knewe well went nat thyder profyte hated hym moche departed night delyuered cyte lorde ſaynt pye ſir johan ray ſo rode tyll cam towne ſaynt poule nexte mornynge engliſſhe men came thyther made great ſkrymyſſhe ſo commynge thyther erle ſaynt poule happy y• towne hym company towne kept ſaued el ben great aduēture leſyng thus duke lancaſtre companye toke theyr pleaſure coūtie ſaynt poule burned exiled playne countrey dyd great domage caſtell perides lady dowaire duke aduyſed caſtel gauged ye depneſſe dyche ſpeare howe aſſyed nat made good face ſo ſo paſſed came fayre caſtell called lucheu whiche perteyned erle ſaynt poule ſo burned towne dyd nothynge caſtell paſſed came ſaynt require engliſſhemen rode day nat paſt iii foure leages euer burned countrey went ſo paſſed ryuer somme plancheſſe vnder abbeuille entred countrey uimeu purpoſe go harfle ryuer seyne burne frenche nauy erle ſaynt poule ser moreau fiennes conſtable france great nombre folowed purſued coſtynge englyſſhe huſt wherfore ye engliſſhemen durſt nat ryde farre abrode high waye euer kepte themſelfe cloſe gether redy fight theyr enemy nede ſo thus rode uimeu countie ewe entred y• archeby ſſhopryke roan paſſed depe rode ſo longe came harflewe lodged erle ſaynt poule gotē entred y• towne ii c ſpeares thus engliſſhmen laye harflewe aſſayled nat iiii daye diſlodged made theyr retourne lande lorde stouteuille ſo burned vp mooſt parte countrey came francqueſin drewe toward oyſemont repaſſe riuer somme blanchetache ſame ſeaſon towne abuille capitayne hugh chaſtellon maiſter croſbowes france whan perceyued duke lancaſtre wolde repaſſe riuer ſomme armed hym cauſed x xii company lyke wyſe arme mo ſo moūted horſes ſayeng howe wolde go ſe kepyng gate rowray thentent thengliſſhmen paſſed ſhulde nat ſe well kepte early mornyng great myſt ſame tyme sir nicholas louuaing tyme paſte ben ſeneſchall poictou ſame yere ser hugh chaſtellon taken hym pryſoner raunſomed hym x frākes ſtacke ſore mynde great deſyre entent reuenged geat agayne loſte ſame mornynge xx hym departed fro duke lācaſtres hoſt knewe right wel paſſages ſtraytes aboute well vſed ſpace ii iii yeres gether ſo thought putte hym ſelfe auenture buſſhement bitwene abbeuille caſtell rouuray ſo paſſed lyttell ſtreyght way maryſe reſted hym certayne olde waſt broken howſes man wolde neuer haue thought company engliſſhemen wolde haue lyen buſſhement ſo nere towne thus ser nicholas company kepte ſelfe preuy ſo laſt ye ſame waye came ser hugh chaſtellon x hym armed except baſſenet whiche page bare hym great courſer ſo paſſed ouer lyttell ryuer thought haue gone haue ſpoken croſbowes kepte gate knowe yf harde thyng engliſſhemen whanne ſir nicholas louuayng ſawe hym knewe hym wel coude nat haue ben ioyous one gyuen hym xx thouſād frankes came buſſhement ſayd company come ſyrs luſtely beholde yonder deſire haue maiſter croſbowes deſyre haue hym aboue creature lyuynge ſet ſpores horſe ſydes cowched hys ſpeare reſte came towarde ſir hugh chaſtellon ſayd yelde chaſtellon thou arte deed syr hugh great meruayle whens thoſe men warre came ſo ſodaynly vpon hym leaſer put baſſenet mount courſer whā ſawe ſo hard caſe ſayd shuld yelde sir nicholas anſwered lauuainge ſyr hugh eſchewe ye perel deth ſawe wel coude nat flee ſayde yelde takē ſir nicholas ſayde come ryde v behold yonder cometh duke lācaſtre company wyll paſſe foreby ſame brunt ther ſlayne valyāt burgreſſe abuyle called laurence dancons great domage thus great fortune ſir hugh chaſtellon maiſter y• tyme croſbowes france capitayn abuyle taken ſir nicholas louuayne whoſe takynge duke lancaſtre right ioyfull ſo englyſſhmen sir hugh chaſtellons frendes y• men towne abuyle right ſorie takyng coude nat amend tyme englyſſhmen paſſed ryuer blanchtache drue towardes towne rue ſee ſyde ſo monſtrell dyde ſomoche iorneys retourned agayne cāe towne calays duke lancaſtre gaue ſtrangers leaue deꝑte ſo deꝑted fro hym ſir robert namure ſir ualeran borme almayns y• duke lancaſtre retourned agayne england thynkyng make warr tyll nexte ſomer thā ſaynt martyns day wynter deꝑted ſayde ſtrangers howe whan came agayne wolde come moche ſtronger dyd tyme deſyring coſyns duke guerles duke jullyers cōe mere go france ¶ nowe let v leue ſpeke beſyneſſe picardy ther nothyng done thoſe ꝑties gret ſeaſon let v ſpeke mater poitou wher mooſt dedes armes fell ¶ howe ſir john chādos ſlayne batayle howe finally frēchmen diſōfyted taken ſame batayle cap cc lxx greatly greued ſir john̄ chandos takyng ſaynt saluyn bycauſe vnder rule ſeneſhall poyctou ſet mynde might recouer agayne byforce ſtelthe cared nat ſo might haue entēr dyuers nightꝭ made ſūdrie buſſhmētes aueyled nat ſir loyes kept toke euer ſo good hede therto defēded fro dāgers knewe well takyng therof greued ſore ſir johan chandos hert fell night firſt day january ſir johan chandos beyng poycters ſent aſſemble togyder dyuers baron knightes ſquiers poitou deſyring thē cōe hym priuely coude certeyned thē wolde ryde forthe refuſed nat deſyre loued entyerly ſhortely aſſembled togyder cyte poicters thyder came ſir guyſſhard dā gle ſir loyes harcourt lorde pons lorde partney y• lorde pynan y• lorde tanyboton ſir geffray dargenton ſir maubruny lyniers ſir thomas percy ſir baudwyn feſuyll ſir richarde pontchardon dyuers whan togyder aſſembled thre hundred ſpeates departed night fro poicters none knewe whyder ſhulde go except certayne lordes redy ſcalyng ladder ſo came ſaynt saluyn ther lighted delyuered horſes varlettes whiche mydnight ſo entred dyke yet hadde nat entente ſo ſhortely ſodaynly herde watche horne blowe ſhall tell wherfor blewe ſame nyght carlonet departed fro roche poiſay xl ſpeares hym cōe ſame tyme ſaynt saluyn ſpeke capitayne ſir loys ſaynt julyan thentent haue ryden togyder poictou ſe coude gette pray ſo called vp watchman y• whiche made hym ſounde horne ſo englyſſhmen otherſyde fortreſſe herynge watche blowe great noyſe place feared leſt ben ſpyed ſome ſpyes knewe nothyng ſayd frenchemen ſyde haue entred place therfore drue backe agayne dyke ſayd let v go hen night haue fayled purpoſe ſo remoūted horſes retourned hole togyder chauuigny tyuer cruſe two leages then poictenyns demaunded ſir john̄ chandos wolde cōmaunde farther ſeruyce anſwered ſayd sir retourne home agayne whan pleaſe name god day wyll abyde ſtyll towne ther departed knightes poictou ſome england nombre cc ſpeares ſir johan chādos went houſe cauſed made good fyre ſtyll hym ſir thomas percy company ſcneſhall rochell ſayd ſir john̄ chandos sir entent tary day ye truly ſir 〈◊〉 demaūde sir y• cauſe deſyre ſyth ye wyll nat ſtyre day gyue leue wyll ryde ſome way wt cō pany ſe fynde aduēture go yoway ſir name god 〈◊〉 ſir johan chandos ſo departed ſir thomas percy xxx ſpeares cōpany ſo paſſed bridge chauuigny toke longe way ledde poicters ſir john̄ chādos abode ſtyll behynde full diſpleaſure fayled purpoſe ſo ſtode kechyn warmyng fyre ſeruantes tangeled hym thētent bring melancoly ſeruantꝭ prepared hym place reſt hym demaunded nere day ther wt cāe man houſe came hym ſayd sir haue brought tidynges tell sir ſurely frēchmen ryding abrode howe knoweſt thou ser ſayd deꝑted fro ſaynt saluyn waye ryden sir nat tell certentie ſurely toke high way poiters frēchmen canſt thou tell sir ſir loys ſaynt julyan carlonet breton well 〈◊〉 ſir johan chandos care nat haue lyſt night ryde may happe encoūtred thoughe nat ther ſo taryed ſtyll certayne ſpace gret ſtudy laſt whan well aduyſed hymſelfe ſayde whatſoeuer haue ſayd trowe good ryde muſt retourne poicters anone wyll day true ser 〈◊〉 knightꝭ hym ſaid make redy wyll ryde forthe ſo dyd moūted horſes deꝑted toke right way poicters coſtyng ryuer frēchmen y• ſame tyme nat paſt leag hym ſame way thinkyng paſſe ryuer bridge luſar ther englyſſhmen knowlege trake frēchmen frēchmens horſes cryed brayed bycauſe thēglyſſhe horſes y• thē ſir thomas percy anone fayre light day begynnyng january mornyngꝭ ſoone light whan frēchmen breton within leage bridge ꝑreyued otherſyde bridge ſir thom̄s percy cōpany lykewiſe ꝑreyued frēchmen rode faſt might get aduantage bride ſayd beholde yonder frē chmen great nombre agaynſt v therfore let v take auātage bridge whā ſir loys carlonet ſawe thēglyſſhmen make ſuche haſt gette bridge dyde lykewyſe howbeit thēglyſſhmen gate firſt lighted fote ſo raynged thēſelfe good order defende bridge frēchmen likewyſe lighted fote delyuered horſes page cōmaundynge drawe backe ſo dyde put thē ſelfe good order go aſſayle thēglyſſhmen kept thēſelfe cloſe togider nothyng afrayed though handfull men y• regard frēchmen thus frēchmen bretous ſtuyed ymagined howe meanes aduantage might aſſayle engliſſhmen therwith ther came behynd thē ſir johan chandos baner diſplayed berynge therin ſyluer ſharpe pyle goules jakes lery valyant man armes dyd bere hym xl ſpeares aproched fierſly frēchmen whan thre forlonges fro bridge frenche page ſawe comynge afrayed ſo ran away horſes left maiſts ther fote whan ſir john̄ chandos come nere ſayd harke ye frēchmen ye yuell men warr ye ryde youre pleaſur eaſe day night ye take wyn townes fotereſſes poyctou wherof ſeneſhall ye raunſome poore folke without leaue ye ryde clene armed ſhulde ſeme coūtre enſure nat ſo ye ſir loyes carlonet year great maiſters yere half haue ſette myne entent fynde encountre nowe thanke god ſe ſpeke ſhall ſene ſtronger hath ben ſhewed often tymes ye haue greatly deſyred fynde nowe ye may ſe john̄ chandos aduyſe well great feates armes wherwith ye renowmed goddes leaue ſhall proue whyle ſuche langage ſpoken ſir john̄ chandos cōpany drewe toguyder ſir loyes carloner kept ſelfe cloſe togyder makyng ſemblāt glad fought withall mater ſir thomas percy otherſyde bridge knewe nothynge bridge hyghe myddes ſo none coude ſe ¶ whyle ſir johan chandos reaſoned thus frenchman ther breton toke glayue coude bere lē ger cāe englyſſhe ſquyer called sunekyn dodall ſtrake ſo breſt yt caſt hym downe fro horſe sir john̄ chā do whan herde ye noyſe beſyde tourned way ſawe ſquyer lye erth frēchmen layeng thā chafed thā ſayd company sir howe ſuffre ſquyer thus ſlayne fote fote ſo lepte fote company ſo sunekyn reſcued batayle begone sir johan chādos right hardy coragyous knight baner company cote armes hym great large beten armes whyte ſarcenet two pylies goules one behynde ſo ſemed ſufficyent knyght great feate armes one formaſt glayue hande marched ennemyes ſame mornyng ther fallen great dewe ſo grounde ſom moyſt ſo goyng forwarde ſtode fell downe ye ioyning enemyes aryſing ther light ſtroke gyuen ſquier called jakes ſaynt martyn glayue whiche ſtroke entred ye fleſſhe vnder eye bytwene ye noſe forheed sir john̄ chandos ſawe nat ſtroke commyng ſyde blynde ye one eye loſt ye ſight therof fyue yere hunted hart laundes burdeaur alſo vyſer ſtroke rude entred brayne whiche ſtroke greued ſo ſore ouerthrue erthe tourned payne two tymes vp ſo downe woūded dethe ſtroke neuer ſpake worde whan men ſaw myſfortune right dolorouſe thā vncle edward clifforde ſtepte beſtrode frēchmen wolde fayne haue defended ſo valyantly gaue rounde ſuch ſtokes none durſt aproche nere also 〈◊〉 john̄ chambo ſir bertram caſe ſemed lyke men myndꝭ whan ſaw maiſter lye ye erth breton frēchmen gretly cōforted whan ſawe capitayne enemyes ye erthe thynking verily yt dethes woūde auaunced ſelfe ſayd ye englyſhmen yelde ye ye canne nat ſcape v ther englyſhmen dyd marueyls armers aſwell defende themſelfe reueng maiſter ſir john̄ chandos whome ſawe lye harde caſe ſquyer ser john̄ chandos ſpyed jaques ſaynt martyn hadde gyuen maiſter mortall ſtroke ran hym fierſly ſtroke hym ſuche voylence glayue pearſed bothe thyes howe ſtroke lefte nat ſtyll fight ſir thomas percy cōpany knowen aduenture otherſyde ye brige ſhulde well haue ſocoured hi bycauſe knewe nothyng therof herde frenchman wenyng ben gone backe therfore company departed toke waye poycters knewe nothynge buſyneſſe thus englyſſhmen fought ſtyll bridge luſac done many feat armes breuely englyſſhmen coude endure lenger agaynſt frēchmen ſo mooſt parte diſconfyted taken alwayes edwarde clyfforde wolde nat depte fro nephue lay thus yf frenchman hadde ben ſo happy haue horſes ther redy nat page ronne away fro orels might haue departed moche honour profite many gode priſoner lacke loſt wherfore ſore diſpleaſed ſayd among ſelfe yuell order iourney yet faute page nat departe seyng heuy armed ſore traueyled ſo cānat go fote countre whiche full enemyes contrary v ſixe leages fro next fortereſſe haue alſo dyuers cōpany ſore hurt may nat leaue theym behynde v thus caſe wyſt nat ſent two breton vnarmed feldes ſe yf might fynde page horſes ther came ſir guyſſharde dangle ſir loyes harcourt lorde parteney lorde tanyboton ye lorde dargenton lorde pynan ſir jaques surgyers dyuers englyſſhmen nōbre two hūdred ſpeares rode ſeke frenchman ſhewed howe abrode ſo fell trake horſes cāe great haſt baners penons wauyng wynde aſſoone breton frenchman ſawe comyng knewe well enemy thā ſayd englyſſhmen whome taken priſoners sir beholde yonder cometh bande company ſocour perceyue well nat endure agaynſt thē yebe priſoners wyll quyte ſo ye wyll kepe v wyll become priſoners rather yeld v thā cometh yonder aunſwered ye wyll ſo 〈…〉 e content thus englyſſhmen loſed priſons poictenyns gaſcoyns englyſſhmen came ſpeares reſtes cryeng cryes frēchmen breton drewe ſyde ſayde thē ſirs leaue v hurt priſoners redy englyſſhmen affirmed ſame ſaid priſoners carlonet priſoner ſir bertram caſe ſir loyes ſaynt julyan ſir johan cambo ſo none maiſter uhe barowns knightes poicto •• ſore diſconforted whan ſawe ſeneſchall ſir johan chandos lye erthe coude nat ſpeke lamentably complayned ſayd ſir johan chandos floure chiualry vnhappely glayue forged thus hath woūded brought parell dethe wept piteouſly hym herde vnderſtode theym well coulde ſpeke worde wronge handes tare heeres made many pytefull complaynt ſpecially ſuche owne houſe ſeruauntes vnarmed layde paueſſes ſo bare ſoftely mortymer next fortereſſe baron knyghtes retourned poycters ledde priſoners vnderſtode ſame jaques martyn yt thus hurte ſir johan chandos ſo lytell taken hede hurtes dyed poiters noble knight ſir johan chandos lyued nat hurte paſt day nyght ſo dyed god haue mercy ſoule hundred yere ther nat curteſſe fuller noble vertues good condycions amonge englyſſhmen whan prince priceſſe erle cambridge erle pēbroke barowns knightes englande ſuche guyen herd dethe 〈…〉 orted ſayd loſt ſyde ſee dethe frendes alſo ſome enemyes right ſoroufull englyſſhmen loued bycauſe noble neſſe founde hym frenchman hated bycauſe douted hym yet herde dethe greatly complayned among right noble valyant knightes france sayeng great dommage dethe ſayd better ben ben taken lyue ben taken lyue ſayd ſo ſage ſo ymaginatyue wolde haue foūde ſome maner good meanes wherby peace might haue enſued bytwene realmes englande fraunce ſo welbeloued kyng englande kyng wolde beleue rather worlde thus bothefrenche englyſſhe ſpake dethe ſpecially englyſſhmen hym guyen kept recouered ¶ howe lorde coucy lorde pomyers wolde nat entre warre nother one part howe lorde maleuall lorde marneyle tourned frenche cap cc lxxi dethe ſir johan chandos ſir thomas percy made ſeneſchall poictou ſo fell lande ſaynt sauiour vycount fell kynge englandes • andes gyue wher ſhuld pleaſe g •• e knyght called ſir alayne bourchier experte man armes sit johan chandos whiche yerely uenewes ſomme four hundred thouſande frankes prince ſucceſſeſſour heyre neuer maryed none heyres within certayne ſpace ſuche hadde ben taken bridge luſac put fynance raūsome payed ayde helpe frenche kynge ſo retourned agayne garyſons ſir loyes ſaynt julyan carlonet breton ſir wyllyam bourdes ſame ſeaſon ther ſome knyghtes france fore troubled mynd bycauſe ſawe thus nightly dayly warre multiply bytwene theſe two kynges france englande ſpecially lorde concy touched gretly fayre enherytance englande aſwell hym ſelfe wyfe doughter kynge englande whiche lande muſt renounce wolde ſerue frenche kynge whoſe blode ſame nacyon determyned ſelfe diſſemble bothe kyngꝭ ſo forget tyme thought departe realme france ſeaſon go ſporte ſome otherplace ſo ordered departure ſagely toke leaue frenche kyng ſmall cō pany departed rode sauoy honorably receyued erle baron knightes countre whan 〈◊〉 ther long pleaſed hym departed paſſed forthe lombardy came lordes myllayne lorde galea lorde barnabo begynning right welcome lyke maner departed duchy acàtayne ſir aymon pomyers knight price ſayeng howe long warr dyde endure wolde nat beare armes nother one parte ſo knyght went cypre holy ſepulcre dyuers pylgrimages alſo ſame ſeaſon newly come parys ſir johan burbone helde parte lande prince frenche kynge wolde gladly haue hym renounce homage prince become frenche erle wyſe wolde ſo lyke maner wolde lorde pyerbuffier another baneret lymoſyn alſo parys two great baron lymoſyn ſir loyes maleuall ſir raymon marneyle nephue alſo ye ſame ſeaſon parys forſoke prince became frēche garyſons made gret warre prince wherof kynge englande counſayle ſore diſpleaſed alſo dyuers barones guyen became frenche without conſtraynt owne wylles kyng englande counſayled ſhulde write couert letter ſealed ſeale borne two thre knightes poictou acquitayne ther publyſſhe theym cyties caſtels good townes ſame ſeaſon delyuered prison dagen ſir camponell camponall excha • ge another knight prince ben taken ſcrimyſſhe pyergourt called ser thomas balaſter clerke yt ſaid knight remayned ſtyll priſon dagen ſir camponell returned frāce ¶nowe lette v ſpeke letter ſent acquitayne kyng englande tenour wherof herafter foloweth ¶the copy letter ſent kyng englande acquitayne howe chaſteleraut taken bell perche beſieged frenchemen cap cc lxxii edwarde grace god kynge england lorde irelande acquitayne thē preſent writynge ſhall ſe reed knowe conſyderyng regardyng buſyneſſes ſayd march lymitacions ſeignorie acquitayne ſtretchynge fro heed heed haue ben enformed y• certayn trouble greffes vexacyons done thought bedone right dere ſon prince wale ſay de countreis whiche bounde withſtande remedy thynges touchynge hate yuell wylles bytwene v true frendes ſubgettes therfore theſe preſentes anoūce pronoūce certify ratify good wyll great delyberacyon counſayle therto called woll dere ſonne ye prince wale forbere leaue maner accyons done bedone reſtore agayne ſuche hath ben greued oppreſſed hym ſubgettes offycers acqtayne coſtes ſpences domagꝭ leuyed leuyed ye name ye ſayd aydes fo wage true ſubgettes frendes aſwell prelate men holy church vnyuerſiteis collage byſſhops erles vycontes baron knightes comynalties men cyties good townes tourned kepe holde falſe informacion ſymple aduyſe opinyon aduerſary french kyng pardon treſpas ſo ſight theſe letter retourne agayne v within moneth deſyre true frendes kepe thē ſelfe ſtyll ſtate nowe ſaue faythes homagꝭ ſo nat reproched whiche thyng ſhulde greatly diſpleaſe v lothe wolde ſe vpon dere ſon̄e prince men make laufull cōplaynt thyng greued oppreſſed haue ben tyme paſt ſhall cauſe haue amendes ſuche wyſe reaſon ſhall ſuffice entent noriſſhe peace loue concorde vnite bytwene v thoſe march ly mytacions aforeſayd bycauſe euery man ſhulde repute mynde wyll trouthe wyll euery man take haue copy theſe preſentes whiche haue ſolemply ſworne kepe maynteyne nat breke precyous body jeſu chriſt preſent right dere ſonne johan duke lancaſtre wyllm̄ erle salyſbury erle warwyke therle hertforde gaultier manny lorde percy lorde neuyll lorde bourchier lorde stafforde richard pēbroke roger beauchāp guy brian lorde •• e lorde dalawar alayne boncqueſell richard stry knightꝭ gyuen palys weſtm̄ ye yere reigne xliiii v day nouembre theſe letter brought fro kyng englande principalyte duchy acqtayne notifyed publyſſhed copyes ſent ſecretly parys vycont rochchoart lorde leuall lorde marneyle ſuche turned frenche nowbeit y• theſe letter thus ſent publyſſhed countrey acqtayne herde nat left lyſt nat ſtandyng dayly turned frenche ꝑte ſo aſſone ſir loys ſaynt julyan retourned roche poy ſay ſir wyllm̄ bordes gariſon hay tourayn carlon et ſaynt saluyn ſecretly made forthe iorney mē armes hardy cōpanyons well mounted mornyng came chaſteleraut ſcaled towne nerehand taken ſir loys harcourt lay bed ſlepe logyng towne ſo ſ • ry fayne flye ſherte barefote barelegged fro houſe houſe fro garden garden great dout feare takyng frenchman ſcaled fortreſſe ſo ferr ſledde cāe put ſelfe vnder bridge chaſteleraut whiche men fortifyed ſo ther ſaued ſelfe kept ſelfe long ſpace thus breton frenchman maiſters ye towne ther made good gariſon made carlonet capitayn dayly breton frenchman went bridge fought ſcrimyſſhed kepte duke loyes burbon ſawe well englyſſhmen companyons countre burbonoiſe howe drtygo bernard de wyſt bernard de la sale helde caſtell bell perche good lady mother wtin wherof great diſpleaſur aduyſed hi make iourney go lay ſiege bell percly nat deꝑte then tyll wonne whiche enterprice deſyred frēche kynge gyue leaue whiche kynge lightly agreed vnto ſayeng howe wolde helpe maynteyne ſiege thus departed fro parys made aſſemble molyns auuerne ſaynt porcyns ſo great nombre men warre lorde beauieu came ſerue hym thre hundred ſpeares ye lorde uyllers roſellon hundred ſpeares dyuers barowns knightes auuergne foreſtes wher lorde right wyfe doughter gentyll lorde berault erle dolphyn thus duke went layd ſiege bell perche made great baſtyd • n dayly drawe vnder couert ſo dayly ſcrimyſſhed thē within alſo duke ther four great engins caſt night day great ſtones ſo toopes towres houſes beaten downe great parte towres wherof duke mother priſoner within gret feare ſent meſſangers duke ſonne deſyringe hym ceaſe aſſantes thengins ſore feared troubled duke burbone knewe well requeſt deſyre done meanes ennemyes aunſwered wyſe wolde ceaſe forbere ſoeuer fell whan within ſawe howe ſo ſore oppreſſed howe ſtrength ye frenchemen daylye multiplyed theym newly come ſir loyes sanrer marſhall fraunce great plenty men warre determyned gyue knowledge poore eſtate ſir johan deureux ſeneſhall lymoſyn lay soubterayne two lytell tourney fro thē certifye howe lordes poictou gaſcoyne whan departed fro iourney quercy promyſed faythes toke fortreſſe france beſieged howe ſhulde comforted thus incōtynent wrote letter ſecretly night ſent varlet ye fortereſſe ſir john̄ deureur whan meſſāger came remembred well mater ſuche token ſhewed hym whan reed letter ſayd wolde gladly ayde helpe rather ſped • ſayd wolde go ſelfe angoleſme prince lordes ther truſtyng ſo enduſe thē bell perche ſhulde conforted delyuered parell ſo departed fro fortreſſe rode ſo longe came angoleſme wher founde prince erle cambridge therle pē broke ſir john̄ montagu ſir robert canoll ſir thomas percy ſir thomas phelton ſir guyſſharde dangle captal beufz dyuers ther ſagely ſhewed howe companyons beſieged caſtell bell perche duke burbon erle ſaynt poule frenchman whiche wordes ye lordes gaue good heryng ſayd howe gladly wolde cōfort acordyng promyſed enter price chefe erle cambridge erle penbroke incontynent prince ſent cōmaundement ſubgettes ſight letts ſhulde haſt drawe towne lymoges thyderwarde auaunſed knightes ſquyers cō panyons men armes ſo cam thyder commaunded whan aſſembled mo xv c ſpeares thre thouſande men warr ſo quickely paſſed cāe bell perche lay otherſyde towne agaynſt frenchman lay kepte ſtyll baſtyde whiche ſtronge aſwell fortified aſwell enuyroned towne thengliſſhe forager wyſt nat whyder reſorte forage howbeit ſome vitayls brought fro poyctou whan might conuey ſir loys sanxere marſhall france ſignifyed ſtate thenglyſſhmen parys ye kyng knightes ther made writynges ſeadules ſet vp pale place ſayeng thus among knightes ſquyers deſyring fynde dedes armes certifye trouthe erle cā bridge therle penbroke cōpany ar come bell perche thentent reyſe ſiege ther layd men ther ſo longe hath endured payne haue ſo cōſtreyned within fortereſſe pure neceſſyte muſt yelde vp el fyght v byforce armes therfore come thyder haſtely ther ſhall ye fynde noble dedes armes certaynly thēglyſſhmen lye ſmall order ar ſuche place might ſoone haue great domage thus exortacion marſhall dyuers good knyghtes realme fraunce auaunſed part howe beit knewe well gouernour bloyes allart touſtayne l ſpeares came thyder ſo dyd therle porcyen ſir hugh porcien brother ¶ howe therle cābridge erle penbroke ledde way fro garyſon bell perche duke burbons mother thoſe within cap cc lxxiii whan erle cābridge erle penbroke ben thus ye frē chmen ſpace xv dayes ſaw howe wolde nat yſſue baſtyde fight thē toke coūſayle aduyſe ſende heraulde knowe wolde ſo ſent chandos heraude meſſage ſhuld ſay ſo went ſaid sir lordes mayſters hath ſent wolde ye knowe yt gretly marueyled ſythe ye haue perfyte know lede haue ben ſpace fyftene dayes yet ye wolde nat yſſue ſtrayte fight thē therfore ſend worde ye wyll cōe towarde thē wyll ſuffre take plot groūde fight let thē haue vyctorie god wyll ſende vnto duke burbon ſayd chādos ſhall ſay maiſters yt wyll nat fight thē wylles apoyntment knowe well yonder wyll nat departe hen breke vp ſiege tyll haue wonne caſtell bell perche sir ꝙ heraude ſhall ſhewe pleaſure departed heraud retourned maiſters ſhewed anſwere y• whiche nothyng pleaſant went counſayle ſayd agayne chandos go agayne yonder lordes ſhewe wyſe ſo declared hym meſſage went whan came ſayd lordes maiſters lordes ſendeth worde ſithe ye wyll nat fight surely purpoſe iii day hen houre ix noone ſette horſebacke lady burbone conuey awaye ſyght lorde burbone ſonne ſir bydde reſcue ye well ꝙ duke ſe lady mother ledde away ſhalbe right diſpleaſant beit truſt haue agayne whan may ſir heraud ſyth ye haue ſayde mocheto v ſay agayne maiſters wyll put ye felde afyftie company ſhall put many take vyctorie may get sir ꝙ heraude ſhall ſhewe ye haue ſayd therwith chādos departed came agayne therle cambridge lordes ſhewyng duke burbons anſwere alſo demaunde howe beit thought nat ſoo ordayned departe then lede lady burbon within tereſſe ben ſore traueyled engens hooſt ¶ howe duke burbone gaue leaue men whan knewe good lady mother ledde away cap cc lxxiiii whan day cāe ſet mornyng ſowned trūpettes armed company drewe felde good aray batayle fote horſebacke redy fight baners ſtā dardes thē houre ix mynſtrels blewe vp highe voyded caſtell bell preche maner men lady burbone moūted 〈…〉 rey well dreſſed ladyes damoſelss englyſſhmen departed aboute noone lady awayted ſir euſtace dābreticourt ſir john̄ deureux ſo drewe principalyte lady priſoner certayne ſpace among companyons roche uā cloyre limoſyn takyng prī ce neuer well content whan ſoeuer caſe ſpoken ſayd yt men taken beſyde cōpanyons wolde incontynent haue cauſed haue ben delyuered without delay whan companyons ſpoken vnto delyuerance ſayd ſoeuer bargayne made wold haue knight agayne ſir symon burle priſoner among frenchman nat douted duke burbone ſore dyſpleaſed englyſſhmen ledde away mother anon ſhe departed ſent take poſſeſſion caſtell bell perche owne whiche englyſſhmen lefte clene voyde duke repayred newe fortefied caſtell made ſtrōger thus brake vp great iourney euery man went owne frēchmen ben ther duke burbone went agayne owne garyſons duke retourned knightes ſquyers france kyng made great chere gladde comyng therle pēbroke company went towne mortaygne poictou men armes companyons retourned poytou xaynton ſerched coūtre get lyuengꝭ dyd many villayne dedes coulde nat abſteyne ſelfe fro doyng yuell anone departed fro prince ſir robert canoll went bretayne caſtell doruall nat ben ther paſt moneth king englande ſent hym incontynent without delay excuſacions layd ꝑte ſhuld paſſe ſee came englande ſpeke whiche cōmaūdement wolde nat breke aparelled ſelfe toke ſee arryued cornwall ſaynt myghels mount rode ſo longe came wyndſore founde kyng great ioye comyng ſo baron realme cauſe thought ſhulde haue nede hym good capitayne leader men ¶ howe duke aniou came fro tholous parys howe kyng charles ſent duke berry brother acqtayne agaynſt englyſſhmen cap cc lxxv ſeaſon duke aniou deꝑted fro tholous rode great array realm france cāe cyte parys founde kyng brother duke berry duke burgoyne bretherne receyued ioyoully ſo bytwene theſe foure bretherne whyle laye parys dyuers counſayls togyder ſtate buſyneſſe realme france ſe warre ſhulde make howe maynteyne ſame ſomer folowynge fully purpoſed ordayned ſhulde make two great armyes iorneys acqtayne wherof duke aniou cōpany ſhulde gouerne one entre guyen ryall bergerath duke berry ſhulde gouerne army entre lymoges quercy ſo bothe armyes mete towne angoleſme beſiege prince within alſo concluded great delyberacion coūsell ſend ser bertram cleſquy valy āt knight ſo oft valy antly hath fought ſauegard crowne frāce deſyre take cōſtable france whan ye king bretherne fully determyned coū ſell ſported thē ſpace tyll begynnig moneth may duke aniou toke leue thē thinking firſt returne owne countre bycauſe longeſt iorney deꝑted firſt cōueyed baron knightꝭ frāce bycauſe welbeloued long duke rode yt came moūtpellyer ther taryed moneth went tholous aſſembled togyder men warr wher might get thē ther many yt kept feldes kept fronter agaynſt thēglyſhmen • n rouergne quercy lytell mechyn nandon pauns perot sauoy bourge camus antony lenegre lamyt james bray theſe great nōbre ſeaſon caours done moche hurt coūtre duke berry alſo cāe burges berry made ther great aſſemble knightes ſquyers france burgoyne alſo duke burbon went coūtre aſſembled great nōbre knightes ſquiers countie forest burbonoiſe alſo ſir peter alenſon brother prouyded ſelfe gretly warr ſame ſeaſon ſir guy bloys newly retourned spruce wher bē made knight reyſed baner ſcrimyſhe made agaynſt enemy god aſſone gentyll knight returned heynault herde tidynges great iourney y• towarde coſyns duchy acquitayne purueyed ſelfe greatly go yt viage ſo dented heynalt wente parys preſented hym ſelfe kyng glad ſe apoynted go duke berry certayne nōbre mē armes knightes ſquiers ſo ser guy bloys deꝑted fro paris rode ward orlyance go berry lyke maner ye frē che kyng ordayned army king england alſo ſet forth two great armyes duke lācaſtre ordeyned iiii c men armes many archer go duchy acqtayne cōfort ayde bretherne thought ſurely yt thoſe ꝑties gretteſt warr ſhulde made frēche king also kyng england thaduyſe coū ſell made another army go picardy ser robr̄t canollſhuld chefe gouernour thought knight metely ye leder men armes long tyme vſed warr ſene great experiēce ther therfore deſyred thus kynge englande ioyouſly condiſcended therto ſo toke voyage go calays ſo france fight frenchman might mete thē felde whiche thought ſure ſo prouided iourney ſuche went ſame ſeaſon delyuered priſon duke burbons mother exchaunge ſir symon burle ser euſtace dambreticourt dyde helpe moche treaty wher duke burbone frenche quene thanked greatly ſeaſon ther ben great treatyes bytwene frenche kynge kynge nauarr lay chierbourge ſo moche dyde treater peace bytwene ſhewed frenche kyng tyme hym kepe warre kynge nauarre ſayd ynough kepe warre agaynſte engliſſhemen ſayenge howe better let ſome go owne rather greatter euyls ſhuld ryſe kynge nauarre ſhulde ſuffre englyſſhemen arryue paſſe fortreſſes cloux conſtantyne ſhuld therby greatly greue countre normandy whiche thynges ſayd ought greatly redoubted conſydered moche enduced kynge agreed peace went towne roan ther peace confyrmed kynge nauarr ther went archebyſſhop roan erle alenſon erle salebruche ſyr wylliam dormās ser robert lorry foūd kyng nauar uernon ther made great feaſtꝭ thā brought ye kyng nauarr roan frenche kyng ther agayne confyrmed aliaū ce confederacions ſworne put writyng vnder ſeale vnderſtode kyng nauar makyng peace ſhuld renoūce ꝓmyſſes loue ben bytwene hym kyng england returne agayne nauarr ſhulde defye kyng englād ſurete loue holden kept bitwene hym frēche kyng kyng nauarr went • yt frēche kyng fro roan paris agayne new feaſtꝭ ſolēpnities whan inough ſported thā leaue taken kynge nauer departed amyably fro frēche kyng left behynde two ſonnes kyng vncle wēt moūtpellyer ſo countie foi owne countre nauer nowe let v retourne buſyneſſe acqtayne ¶ howe ſir bertram cleſquy deꝑted spayne went tholous duke aniou receyued ioyouſly ca cc lxxvi ſhall knowe hath ben ſayd duke aniou ben france agreed yt aſſone returned lā guedoc ſhulde entre byforce guyen coude wyſe loue y• prince thenglyſſmen neuer dyde departyng frenche kyng ſent letter wt great meſſangers caſtell kyng henry deſyring hym ſende fraunce ſir bertram cleſquy alſo kyng duke aniou wrote ſir bertrā ſhulde fynd meanes come ſhortely fraunce theſe meſſangers dyd meſſage ye kynge spayne thought nat kepe ayenſt frenche kynges deſyre ſo wolde make non excuſe ſo ſir bertrā cleſquy made redy ſhortely coude toke leue kyng henry dyd ſomoche came tholou wher duke aniou ther aſſembled great nombre knight ſquyers men warr taryed nothynge comynge ſir bertram comyng duke greatly reioyſed ordayned de parte fro tholous entre price lande ſame ſeaſon come hāpton england duke lācaſtre iiii c men armes many archer ſhippes veſſels redy withall purueyance mynde ſayle bourdeaux ſo myght haue wynde duke lorde roſe ſir michell de la poule ſir robert rouxe ſir johan ſaynt lowe ſir wyllyam beauchampe ¶ howe monſac moūtpellyer yelded thē duke aniou duke berry lay ſiege cytie lymoges cap cc lxxvii duke aniou deꝑted fro cyte tholou great aray good order hi therle armynake lorde dalbret therle piergourt erle comynges vycont carmayne y• erle lyle vycont brune kyell vycont narbon vycont talar lorde de la barde lorde pyncornet ſir bertrā tande ſeneſhalles tholous carcaſſone beauchair dyuers ii ſpeares knightes ſquyers vi fote laūces paueſſes ſir bertram cleſquy chefe capitayne company ſo tooke way dagenoiſe way founde feldes mo cōpanyons ſeaſon ben quercy rydinge warde agen firſt fortereſſe came monſacke countre ſuche feare reaſon commynge duke iniou ſuche great nōbre dyuers townes fortereſſes trymbled feare nat wyll holde warre agaynſt ſo aſſoone come moyſac yelded became frenche wente thounyns ryuer garon ſo frenchman rode eaſe folowynge ryuer ſo came porte ſaynt mary incōtynent tourned frenche euery place frenchman put people made gariſons bothe towne caſtell thounyns yelded thē vp became french ther ſet newe capitayne xx ſpeares hym toke way moūtpellyer iguyllon brennyng diſtroyeng countre whan come good towne mountpellyer within ſore afrayed duke aniou ſo yelded thē ſelfe vp frenche kyng went ſtronge caſtell aguyllon four dayes within ſir gaultyer manny cōpany ſo yelded hym ſelfe caſtell duke aniou wherof bergerath great marueyle yelded thē ſelfe ſo ſoone capitayne within bergerath captall beufz ſir thomas phelton hundred ſpeares englyſſhe gaſcoyns lyke maner y• duke aniowe company entred prince lande countre agen tholouſen lyke wiſe duke berry ſame tyme company rode lymoſyn xii hundred ſpeares horſebacke thre thouſande fote conquerynge townes caſtels brennyng exilyng coū trey hym duke burbon erle alenſon sir guy bloyes ſir robert alenſon erle perche ſir john̄ darmynake ſir hugh dolphyn ſir john̄ uyllemore lorde beauieu lorde uyllers lorde senar ſir geffray mōtagu ſir loyes malleuall ſir rayman marnell ſir john̄ boloyne ſir godfray vncle vycont duzes lorde sully lorde talenton lorde cōfant y• lorde dappecher lorde dacon ſir john̄ damenue ymbault peſchyn dyuers good baron knightes ſquyers theſe men armes entred lymoſyn dyd ther great 〈…〉 uries ſo came layed ſiege lymoges within y• towne ther fewe englyſhmenꝭ whiche ſir hugh caurell left therin gariſon ſeneſhalll countre prince wale y• towne angoleme well enformed thoſe two great armyes aſwell duke aniou duke berry howe entred great ſtrength countre two ꝑties alſo ſhewed hym likelyhod wolde drawe towarde angoleme beſiege princeſſe within towne prince valyant man ymaginatyfe anſwered ſayd howe enemyes ſhulde nat fynde hym cloſed nother within towne yet caſtell ſaid howe wolde mete thē playne felde cauſed letter written ſente forthe true frendes ſubgettes poictou xaynton rochell rouergue quercy gore bygore agenoiſe deſyring commaundyng come hym haſt moche power men warre coude make mete hym towne cougnac ther hadde ſtablyſſhed aſſemble ſo anone departed fro good lady priceſſe wyfe hym richarde yonge ſonne meane ſeaſon prince made thus aſſemble frenchman rode forthe waſtyng diſtroyeng coūtre ſo came lynde good towne ſtandyng ryuer dordone leage fro bergerath capitayne therof ſir thomas batefoyle knight gaſcoyne within towne ſet ther defende ſo duke aniowe erle armynake lorde dalbret erle pyergourt vy count carmayn baron knyghtes came thyder ſo layed ſiege forte reſſe sayeng howe wolde neuer depart then tyll fortereſſe commaundement towne good ſtrong well furnyſſhed artillary captall beufz ſir thom̄s phelton ben ther nat paſt xv dayes ſo refreſſhed y• garyſon thought well within might kepe well y• fortreſſe yf lyſt conſydering ayde helpe might haue ſhortely fro bergerath nede requyred howbe people towne ſore enclyned become frenche great deſyre harken promyſſes duke aniou made vnto thē finally capitayn ſir thom̄s batefoyle fayne agre alſo certayne ſomme money ſhulde haue great ꝓfyte yerely duke aniowe ther vpon become good frenche ſo ordayned mornynge ſhulde let frenchman entre towne treaty couenāt nat ſo cloſe kepte knowen bergerath nyght towne ſhulde delyuered mornynge ſame tyme towne bergerath come erle cābridge two hundred ſpeares preſent whan reporte made thoſe tidynges captall beufz ſir thomas phelton hadde great marueyle therof ſayd wolde delyuere towne ſo mydnight departed fro bergerath rode towarde lynde brekyng day came thyder cauſed gate op▪ ned ſo rode towne tyll came gate frēchmen ſhulde entre whiche tyme entrynge ſir thomas batefole redy make way entre captall befz ſtept forthe ſwerde hande lighted fote nere gate ſayd ſir thomas batefole falſe traytour thou ſhalt dye firſt thou ſhalte neuer trayſon therwith ſtroke hym ſwerde ſuche wyſe fell downe deed erthe whan frenchman parceyued captall baner ſir thom̄s phelton knewe well fayled entent wherfore reculed togyder turned backes fledde away towne abode ſtyll englyſſhe gret parell haue ben robbed brent englyſſhmen men within ſlayne bycauſe conſented trayſon howe excuſed ſelfe ſayd howe dyde nothyng conſented nothynge feare prīcipally feare capitayne paſſed ouer theſe two lordes abode ſtyll ther long ſeaſon tyll duke aniou cōpany departed then toke another way ¶ nowe lette v ſpeke ſtate ordynaunce englande army ſir robert canoll made realme fraunce ¶ trewſe made bytwene englande scotlande ſir robert canoll brent exyled countre picardy uermandoiſe cap cc lxxviii ſir robert canoll cōpany parted englande great treaty bytwene englande scotlande whiche treaty ſo wyſely handled ſadde diſcrete counſayle bothe party ſo y• peace graūted bytwene bothe kynges coū treis liege people endure ix yere ſcottꝭ myght pleaſure arme thē ſerue take wage englyſſhe frenche pleaſur without brekyng peace wherby ſir robert canoll cōpany hundred ſpeares realme ſcot lande whan ſir robert canoll redy cōpany went douer ſo paſt forth calays ther arryued toke lande well receyued capitayne ſir nicholas stamborne whan ben well refreſſhed ther ſpace ſeayn dayes taken counſayle parte ſhulde drawe ſo mornynge deꝑted toke felde nōbre xv hundred ſpeares foure thouſande archer hym englande ſir thom̄s grantſon ſir alayne bourequeſelles ſir gylbert gyfford lorde saluatier ser johan bourchier ſir wylliam meſucyle ser geffray orſell dyuers knightes valyant men armes ſo firſt day wēt nere fiennes sir moreau fiēnes conſtable france ſame tyme owne caſtell fiennes great nombre knightꝭ ſquyers well purueyed aduyſed receyue y• englyſſhmen mornyng englyſſhmen came thyder thynkyng aſſayle caſtell anone ſawe howe coude take none aduauntage ſo paſſed forthe coūtie guyens entred countie faucōbrige brent ſo came cite turwyn dyde nat aſſayle ſo well prouyded thought ſhulde loſe payne ſo thanne toke way throught coūtre terrenoyſe entre artoiſe dayly rod four leages paſt nat bycauſe caryage men fote toke lodgynge euer noone lay great vyllagꝭ ſo laſt came cytie arras lodged towne mount ſaynt eloy 〈◊〉 arras ſo brente waſted countre ferr durſt ſtretche abrode frenche kyng ſame ſeaſon ſet gret garyſons cyties townes caſtels fortreſſes bridge paſſages defende agaynſt aſſautes whan ſir robert canoll company refreſſhed two dayes mount ſaynt eloy deꝑted went paſſed cytie arras sir wyllm̄ meſuell ſir geffray durſell marſhals englyſſhe hooſt thought go ſe arras nerer toke two hundred ſpeares foure hundred archer departed great batayle auaūsed thē ſelfe ſubbarbes towne ſo came barryers whiche foūde well furniſſhed croſ bowes men armes within towne ſir charles poicters lady artoiſe made ſemblant yſſue fight thenglyſſhmen whan engliſſhmen taryed barryers certayne ſpace ſawe non yſſued agaynſt drue agayne batayle departyng thought make knowledge ben ſet ſubbarbes fyre thentēt haue drawen towne men war mynde ſo ſo fyre dyd moch hurt domage ther brent great monaſtery freers prechers cloyſter ſo thenglyſſhmen paſſed forthe toke ye way bapalmes brennyng waſtyng coū tre ſo laſt came uermandoiſe cāe roy brent towne paſſed forthe went hem uermādois wherinto people withdrawen goodes ſo dyde lyke wiſe ſaynt quintyns peron ſo thengliſſhmen founde nothyng abrode ſaue ye grā ge full corne auguſt rode forth fayre eaſely two thre leagꝭ day whan came wher plentie vitayle taryed ther two thre dayes refreſſhe thē horſes ſo day came towne whiche chefe countre ther marſhals ſpake capitayne aſſurance ſayd howe ſay wyll ye gyue ſhall reſpyte countre ſaue fro brennyng robbyng ſo fell cōpoſicyon playne coū tre ſhulde gyue pay thē certayne ſōme florens ſo countre ſaued ſir robert canoll gate ſame voyage ſayde meanes dyuers tymes aboue ſomme hundred thouſande frankes wherof afterwarde ſhente accuſed kyng englande yt nat well done deuoyre yt iourney ye ſhall hyſtorie lande lorde couey abode peace ther nother man woman hurt value penny yf ſayd belonged lorde couey ſo laſt englyſſhmen came cyte noyon whiche well furnyſhed men warre ther englyſſhmen taryed aproched nere might aduyſed ſe maner aſſaut might preuayle nat ſawe towne well aparelled defence ſir robert canoll loged abbey dolkans people day came cyte raynged maner batayle ſe yf garyſon comontie towne wold yſſue fight nat wyll ſo ther ſcottyſh knyght dyde goodly feate armes departed fro company ſpeare hande mounted good horſe page behynde ſoo came barryers knyght called ſir johan aſſucton hardy man couragious whan barryers noyon lighted fote ſayd page holde kepe horſe departe nat hen ſo went barryers within ye barryers ther good knightes ſir johan roy ſir launcelat lourys x xii great marueyle ſayde knight wolde ſayd sir come hyder ſe ſe well ye wyll nat yſſue barryers therfore wyll entre wyll proue knyghthode agaynſt wyn ye therwith layed rounde hym hym thus alone fought agaynſt hour dyd hurt two thre thē ſo towne walles garettes ſtode ſtyll behelde great pleaſure regarde valyātneſſe dyde hurt whiche might haue done hadde lyſt haue ſhotte caſt ſtones hym alſo frenche knightes charged let hym alone togyder long fought laſt page came nere barryers ſpake langage ſayd sir cōe away tyme depart company departyng hen knight cd well gaue two thre ſtrokes ſo armed lept barryers lepte vpon horſe without hurt behynde page ſayd frenchman adue ſirs thanke ſorode forthe owne company whiche dede moche prayſed many folkes ¶ howe noyon toke engliſſhmen ſet fyre byſſhops bridge howe frenche kyng ſent ſir bertrā cleſquy cap cc lxxix sir robert canoll depted fro y• ſiege noyon people brent towne byſſhoppes bridge ryuer dyſe wheri ther many fayre houſes knightes ſquyers wt towne noyon great dyſpleaſure fyre ſo vuderſtove ſir robert cōpany departed lx ſperes thē went noyon cāe fyre founde ther ſtyllparte thē ſet fyre towne dyuers ther pylle robbe ſo mooſt parte ſlayne ther frenchman wonne mo xl good horſes reſcued dyuers priſoners ſaued fro brennyng many fayre houſes ſo returned agayne noyon mo xv priſoners ſo ſtrake heedes ¶ englyſſhmen rode forthe good order come larroyſe paſſe eaſe ryuer dyſe ryuer ewe dyde hurte countie soyſſons bycauſe parteyned lorde coucy trewe cooſted euer certayne lordes france vycont meaulx lorde chauny y• lorde raoll coucy lorde wyllyam mehung ſonne erle tankernell folkes wherby englyſſhmen durſt nat breke order euer kepte ſelfe cloſe togyder alſo frēchmen wolde nat medyll thē euery night lodged within ſtronge holdes good townes englyſſhmen abrode playne coū tre wher founde plentie vitayls newe wynes wherof made great large ſo thus rode countre brē nyng waſtynge laſt paſſed ryuer marne ſo entred champayne paſſed ryuer aube tourned march prouynce paſſed dyuers tymes ryuer saync drewe towarde cyte parys benſhewed thē howe frēche kyng made ther great aſſemble men warr whome erle ſaynt poule lorde clyſſone ſhuld chefe gouernours wherfore thought drawe thider wylling fight thē ſemyng thēngliſſhmen deſyred nothyng el batayle therfore frenche kynge wrotte ſir bertram cleſquy acquytayne duke aniou commaundyng deſyring ſight letter ſhulde drawe incontynent france ſhewyng wolde ſet warke place ſame ſeaſon pope urbane fyft came cyte amou ben foure yere togyder rome came thyder truſt make peace bitwene two kyngꝭ warr renewed agayne whiche ſore diſpleſant pope whoſe comyng aniou y• cardynals thoſe march greatly reioyſed thought fare better nowe let v ſpeke prince wale howe parceyuered warres ye haue herde recorded howe price wale made aſſemble congnac thentent ryde agaynſt duke aniou brent waſted coūtre ſo cōmaūdement thyder auaūſed baron knightes ſquyers poictou xaynton landes helde prince erle penbroke departed fro garyſon cāe prince ſame ſeaſon duke lā caſtre arryued burdeux wherof prince right ioyouſe ſo taryed nat longe ther deꝑted vnderſtode price wold encoūtre enemyes ſo dayes iourney fro congnac encountred erle penbroke lyke wiſe goyng prince ſo made great chere eche whan met ſo rode gyder cō gnac wher foūde prince princeſſe erle cābridge right glad comyng dayly came men warr thê poictou xaynton rochell bygore goute gaſcoyne marcheſſe nert adioynyng vnder obeyſance price frenche partie duke aniou erle armynake lorde dalbret erles vycontes knightes ſquyers conquered cyties caſtels townes fortreſſes comynge mo xl aproched within fyue leages burdeux waſted countrey bergerath lynde vnderſtode well howe price made aſſemble congnac alſo howe duke lancaſtre arryued wt great nōbre men warr ſpeares archer drue counſayle take aduyſe howe ſhuld perceyuer warr ſo newly ſent ſer bertram cleſquy frenche kyng came fro duke berry kepyng ſiege cytie lymoges ſuche wyſe conſtrayned within poynt yelde certayne meanes cōdicyons ſo counſayle duke aniou lordes hym ſir bertram cleſquy called reaſon ther many reaſōs alleged layd finally thingꝭ cōſydred counſayled duke aniou breke vp iourney tyme ſend people garyſons warr garyable ſayeng howe done ſufficyētly tyme alſo nedefull lordes gaſcone erle armynake therle piergourt lorde dalbret dyuers drawe owne coūtreis kepe defende make fronter warr knewe nat price entent ſayeng aſſembled toguyder ſo great army comon acorde departed eche fro duke aniou went cytie caours ſpredde abrode people coūtre put garyſons erle armynake lorde dalbre y• retourned countreis prouyded furniſſhe townes caſtels thynking ſurely haue warre made people redyneſſe kepe defende coū treis nede ¶ nowe let v ſpeke ſir bertram cleſquy departed fro duke aniou dyde ſomoche came cōpany cyte lymoges wher duke berrey duke burbone lordes fraunce ſiege ¶howe limoges yelded thē duke berrey howe ſame duke brake vp army cap c c lxxx whan ſyr bertram come agayne ſege frenchman greatly reioyſed comyng anone purſued treaty begon bytwene byſſhoppe lymoges cytie duke aniowe ſo finally byſſhoppe cytie tourned became frenche duke berrey duke burbone entred cytie ſir guy bloys lordes france great ioye toke faythe homage cytie ſo refreſſhed reſted thre dayes ſo determyned ther counſayle breke vp army tyme duke aniou done retourne owne coūtreis kepe defende townes fortereſſes bicauſe ſir robr̄t canoll ſtyll abrode felde fraunce alſo ſayd howe right well ſped wynnyng ſuche cytie lymoges counſayle aduyſe nat broken thus theſe lordes departed eche fro ſir bertram ab • de ſtyll party lymoſyn two hundred ſpeares kept caſtels y• lorde maleuall whiche tourned frenche whan duke berrey departed fro lymoges ordayned ſet y• ſame cytie requeſt byſſhop ſir johan wyllemur ſir hugh de la roche roger beauforde hūdred men armes went berrey duke burbon bonoyſe lordes farther march went home owne countreis nowe lette v ſpeke prince howe ſpedde ¶whan tidynges come prince cytie lymoges tourned frēche howe byſſhop goſſyp whome great truſt confydence chefe ayder yelde vp cyte become frenche whiche prince ſore diſpleaſed ſet leſſe force y• men churche hadde great truſt thā ſware father ſoule wherby neuer forſworne wolde gette agayne wolde make y• traytours derely abye falſneſſe whan mooſt ꝑte people come nombred xit hundred ſpeares knightes ſquyers thouſande archer thouſand men fote ſo departed fro towne cōgnac hym two bretherne duke lancaſtre erle cambridge ſir thomas phelton captall befz abode ſtyll bergerath kepe y• fronter agaynſt frēchmen companyons coūtre prince alſo ſir guyſſharde dangle ſir loyes harcourt lorde pōs lorde parteney lorde pynau lorde tanyboton ſir percyuall coloyne ſir godfray dargēton potenyns gaſcons lorde mountferant lorde camont lorde lōgueren ſir aymere tharſe lorde pomyers lorde muſydent lorde leſpare ſouldyche • eſtrabe lorde gerond dyuets engliſſ hmē ▪ ſir thomas percy lorde roſe lord wyllm̄ beauchāpe ſir mychell dela poule lorde stephan goſenton ſir richarde pontchardon ſir baudwyn franuyll ſir symon burle ſir dangouſe ſir john̄ deureur ſir wyllm̄ meſuyll dyuers nat name heynouſe ther ſir euſtace dābrety court companyons ſir perducas dalbret nandon bergerath thyder came le bourge de laſpare le bourge de bretuell eſpyot bernarde de wyſt dyuers theſe men warre went good ordynaunce toke feldes coūtte trymbled prince ſo dyſeaſed coude nat ryde ſo caryed horſe lytter toke way lymoſyn entent come lymoges laſt thyder came ſo lodged rounde cytie prince ſware wolde neuer departe then tyll hadde cytie pleaſure byſſhoppe within burgeſſes conſydered well howe greatly treſpaſſed prince wherof repented coulde nat remedy nat lordes mayſters owne cytie sir johan wyllemur ſir hugh de la roche roger beaufort capitayns within cytie cōforted greatly people ſayd sir nat afrayed ſtrong ynough reſyſt agaynſt price power aſſaute canne nat hurt greue v well furnyſſhed artyllary whan prince marſhalles well ymagined conſydered puyſſance ſtrength cytie knowledge nombre men warre within ſayd aſſaut coulde neuer wyn prince thought aſſaye way alwayes company great nombre myners ſo ſette awarke vndermyne knyghtes within parceyued well howe vndermyned began make dyke countermyne entent breke myne ¶howe ſir robert canoll entred realme france great nombre men armes came nere parys cap c c lxxxi sir robert canoll hath ben ſayd great nombre men armes entred realme france rode ſmall iourneys great expence thorowe realme y• poor people playne countre payed derely therfore englyſſhmen went cāe dyde great hurt ſhewed maner howe deſyred nothynge batayle whan paſſed coūtres artoiſe uermā doyſe byſſhopriche laon archebyſſhopriche raynes champayne tourned bry ſo came cytie parys lodged day two nightes whiche tyme frēche kyng might well ſe lodgynge ſaynt poule fyres ſmokes made gaſtenoyes ¶ ſame day conſtable france ſir moreau fyēnes within parys erle ſaynt poule therle tankeruyll erle salebruch vycount meaulx ſir raoll coucy feneſhall heynault ſir edwarde rauncy ſir anguerrant douden lorde caſtell julyan ſir johan uyan lorde de la ryuer dyuers knightes ſquyers valyant men fraunce none theym dyde yſſue day kynge wolde nat ſuffre thē lorde clyſſon one mooſt prīcypall counſayle beſt b • leued herde dyde put great doutes ſayd y• kyng sir ▪ ye haue nede enploy people agaynſt yonder ſort madde mē let thē go nat take herytage put realme ſmokes gate ſaynt james barryers erle ſaynt poule vycount roan ſir rafe coucy lorde canyne lorde creques ſir edwarde rauncy▪ ſir anguerant doudyn ſo tueſday mornyng engliſſhmen diſſoged ſette fyre vyllages wher lodged ſo fyre might playnly ſene parys ther knyght company made vowe day wolde ryde walles gate parys ſtryke barrier ſpeare y• furnyſſhyng vowe departed fro company ſpeare fyſt ſhelde necke armed peceſſe good horſe ſquyer another behynde baſſenet whā aproched nere parys toke dyde helme left ſquyer behynde hym daſſhed ſpurres horſe came galopynge barryers whiche opyn lordes wende wolde haue entred towne y• nat mynde whan hadde ſtryken barryers auowed turned reyne drue backe agayne departed knightes fraunce ſawe hym depte ſayd go way ye haue rightwell quyted ſelfe nat tell knyghtes name countre blaſure armes goules two fuſſes ſable aborder ſable howbeit ſubbar be aſore encountre paſſed pauement founde bocher bygge mā well ſene knight paſſe helde handes ſharpe heuy axe long poynt knight returned agayne toke heed bocher came ſyde gaue knight ſuche ſtroke bytwene necke ſhulders reuerſed forwarde heedlynge necke horſe yet recouered agayne bocher ſtrake agayne ſo axe entred body y• payne knight fell erthe horſe ranne away came ſquyer abode mayſter ſtretes ende ſo ſquyer toke horſe great marueyle becōe maiſter well ſene ryde barrier ſtryke therat glayue retourne agayne thanne rode lytell forthe thyderwarde anone ſawe mayſter lay vpon erthe bytwene foure men layeng ſtrokes wolde haue ſtryken ſtethy thā ſquyer ſo affrayed durſt go farther ſaw well coude nat helpe maiſter ther fore retourned faſt might ther ſayd knight ſlayne knightes y• gate cauſed buryed holy grounde ſquyer retourned hooſt ſhewed aduēture mayſter wherof ſorie diſpleaſed ſame night loged bytwene moūtle hery parys lytell ryuer lodged tymes ſir bertram cleſquy made great warre countie lymoges howe toke caſtell ſaynt yriell cap cc lxxxii ſame ſeaſon ſir robert canoll made thus vyage price wale two bretherne lay cyte lymoges sir bertram cleſquy cōpany whiche nombre two hundred ſpeares rode one ſyde countre lymoges lay nat felde neuer night feare englyſſhmen euery night lay fortereſſe ſuche tourned frenche parteyning ſir loyes maleuall ſir raymon marneyle howebeit euery day rode forthe dyde great payne conquere townes fortereſſes prince well aduertyſed toney ſir bertram made dayly cōplayntes came howe beit wyſe wolde breke vp ſiege ſir bertram cleſnuy entred vicoūte lymoges coū tre yelded dyde holde duke bretayne lorde johan mountford ther ſir bertram beganne make great warre name lady wyfe lorde charles bloyes whome ſame enherytaunce ſomtyme belonged made great warre none came agaynſt duke bretayne thought full lytell y• ſir▪ bertrā wolde haue made warr agaynſt hym ſo ſir bertram came towne ſaynt yriell wherin neuer gentylman defende towne wherfore ſo afrayed yelded vp y• obeyſaunce lady bretayne whoſe name ſir bertram made warr ſo ſaynt yriell breton made great gariſon wherby wan dyuers townes limoſyn nowe let v retourne prince wale ¶ howe price toke cyte lymoges howe four companyons dyd marueyls armes ca cc lxxxiii ſpace moneth prince wale cytie lymoges ther ther aſſaute ſcrimyſſhe dayly myned within knewe wel myned made countermyne agaynſt haue diſtroyed thēglyſſhe myners fayled myne whan y• princis myners ſawe coūtermyne againſt thē fayled ſayde prince sir whan ſoeuer ſhall pleaſe ſhall cauſe part wall fall dyke wherby ye ſhall entre cytie eaſe without daunger whiche wordes pleaſed greatly prince ſayd woll morowe tymes yeſhewe forthe execute warke myners ſet fyre myne ſo next mornyng prince habbe ordayned fell downe great pane wall fylled dyke wherof englyſſhmen gladde redy armed ſelde entre towne fote men myght well entre caſe ſo dyde ranne gate beate downe fortifyeng barryers defēce agaynſt thē downe ſo ſodaynly towne nat ware therof prince duke lancaſtre erle cambridge erle penbroke ſir guyſſharde dangle companyes entred cyte fote mē redy apelled yuell pyll robbe cytie ſle men woman chyldren ſo commaunded great pytie ſe men woman chyldren y• kneled downe knee price mercy ſo enflamed yre y•
