poictou holde iourney thouars y• day apoynted countre full men warre alſo gaſcons lorde archēbalt grayly vncle captall beufz deſyre ser thom̄is felton ſeneſhall burdeux cāe wt thre c ſperes ſame cōpany ther lordes dura corton muſydent roſſen lāgoren landuras ser peter corton ſir wyllm̄ fereton englyſſhemen theſe deꝑted fro burdeux came nyorth ther founde ſir water huet ſir john̄ ubrues ſir thom̄s percy johan creſuell dyuers ſo yt whan togyder xii c fightyng men ſir richarde pontchardon cāe xii c ſeaſon kynge englande ſonnes great army ſee coulde take lande rochell ther wynde fortune cōtrary thē caſe ſpace ix wekes ſo feeſt myhelmas aproched yt kyng coūſell ſawe well coude nat cōe tyme ynow kepe day reſcuyng thouars wher kyng ſore diſpleaſed ſo gaue lycēce people deꝑte wheder lyſt thus retourned great nauy england wynde wyll returnynge ther arryued burdeux ii c fayles marchauntes englande wyne whan nere mighelmas barones englande gaſcone cāe fro niorth go towarde thouars mete kyng england whan ſawe kynge came nat hadde great marueyle acquyte thēſelfe ſent certayne meſſangers tho war baron poictou ſuche ther meſſāgers ſayd right dereſirs ſent hyder fro y• lordes gaſcone englande vnder obeyſaunce kynge englande sir nyorthe twelfe hundred fightyng men redy apparelled ayde ſerue maners ſirs deſyre haue knowlege ſro whyder abſence kyng england chyldren ſhall ayde confort nat ſirs well cōtent company aduentur bodyes goodes barones poictou ſayd howe wolde take counſayle aduyſe caſ • ſirs thāke greatly barones gaſcone englade hath ſent hyder redy ſocoure v knightes poictou drewe togyder ſo firſt day greed nat lorde parteney one greatteſt company woldeth ſhulde kepe day receyue ſayd ayde repreſentynge kynge englande lordes cōtrary opinyon ſayeng howe ſealed ſworne howe kyng one chyldren nat perſonally ſayd day yelde vp obeyſance frēche kyng wherfore lorde partney went lodgyng nat well content howe afterwarde ſo entyſed y• agreed myndꝭ ſo ſent worde agayne ſayd meſſāgers thā ked good wylles howe kyng englande one chyldren muſt nedes ther acordyng treaty ſworne ſealed vnto wher gaſcoyns englyſſhmen nyorthe ſore diſpleaſed coude nat amende ſo myghelmas day came fro poy cters ther came thouars holde iourney ▪ duke berrey burgoyne burbone conſtable france lorde clyſſon dycount rohane dolphyn auuergne ſir loyes saurere lorde sully great lordes france ten thouſande ſpeares beſyde ſo thouars euyn daye ofſaynt mychaell ſtode ordynaunce batayle agaynſt nyght withdrue thē logynges mornynge y• two bretherne frenche kynges conſtable fraunce demaunded knightes poictou within thouars delyuer town acording promyſe othes halfe anſwered ſayd howe y• ſhortely wolde come poicters put themſelfe landes vnder obeyſaunce frenche kyng whiche anſwere ſufficyent lordes france ſo departed fro thouras duke gaue lyc 〈…〉 mooſt parte companyons lorde clyſſon departed gret nombre men warre apoynted conſtable ſo went mortayne ſee whiche englyſſhe capitayne therof ſquyer england called james clere hym threſcore cōpanyons whan lorde clyſſon come mortayne made feirſe aſſaute whiche hym ſelfe howe aſſaute wanne nothyng ſ • night drewe lodgyng capitayne within ſeynge ſelfe ſore oppreſſed ſent priuely lordz gaſcoyn englande beyng nyorth ſhewyng thē yt wolde com thyder night wolde receyue thē fortreſſe wherby might lightly paſſe lodgynges lorde clyſſon two hūdredmen ſo ſecretely theſe lordes departed fro nyorthe fyue hundred ſpeares rode nyght tyll came mortayne habbe great beſyre atrape lorde clyſſon howbeit ſpye departed thē fro nyorthe knewe entente ſo came haſtely lorde clyſſon foūde himſyttynge ſupper ſayd sir enemyes departed fro nyorthe nombre v hundred commynge thanne lorde clyſſon put table fro hym armed haſt moūted horſe company ſo departed ſodaynly left behynde great parte caryages rode ſo longe came poicters englyſſhmen ſayled entente retourned agayne nyorthe right ſore diſpleaſed anone departed fro nyorthe left garyſon ſir dangoſes creſuell ſir johan wet retourned englande went burdeur returnyng brent lorde partneys lā de thus poictou cōquered except theſe fortreſſes nyorth elyſeth mortymer▪ mortayne ▪ lyſignen caſtell accart la roche suryone gauſar toure larbre merris fortreſſes made dyuers yſſues aſſautes neighbour ſōtyme chaſyng ſomtyme rechaſed agayne ¶ howe ſir bertram cleſquy beſeged caſtell syreth englyſſhmen diſconfyted howe countrey poictou xaynton rochell clene delyuered thēglyſſhmens handes cap ccc vi duke bretayne peſably ī owne countre ſore diſpleaſed domage engliſhmen ſayd y• kynge englande puyſſaunce made hym nothynge kynge englande nat ben alwayes made warr hym lende ſyluer golde alſo doughter maryage duke wolde gladly countre ſhulde rather holde kyng englandes parte fraunce howe beit mooſt parte lordes knightes ſquyers bretayne hertes good frenche ſpecially lorde clyſſon de la uale vycount rohan chefe ruler bretayne theſe lordes ſayd duke sir aſſone parceyue ye take parte kyng englande agayne frenche kyng ſouerayne lorde wyll forſake leaue countrey bretayne howe duke coude nat hyde corage hert ſayd sir ye great wronge kynge englande ſpake great wordes certayne lordes bretayne french kyng drawen loue hertꝭ bretayne except ſir robert canoll deſyred thē ſawe defence made duke wolde gyue knowledge therof entent fynde remedy therfore duke parceyued well men hadde inſuſpect layed great wayt douted leeſt ſhulde ſende hym parys wherfore ſent kyng englā de ſhewyng caſe deſyring ſende hym men warr defende nede kynge englande ſent hym lorde neuyll foure hundred men armes many archer arryued ſaynt mathewes defyne poterne ther helde •• ne without doyng maner domage coūtre payed truely toke ſo wynter duke wolde neuer put fortreſſe y• whan knightes bretayne ſawe theſe englyſſhmen come countre ayde confort duke toke great dignacion cloſed fortreſſes ſhewed moche yuell wyll towardes duke thus matter abode great varyaunce wynter aſſone wynter paſt ſir bertram cleſquy conſtable france departed fro poicters xiiii hundred fyghtyng men ſo went layd ſege y• towne caſtell syreth hym breton knyghtes ſir alayne beaumont john̄ beaumanoyre arnolde limoſyn geffray ricoynan lanconet geffray konyell dyuers knightꝭ ſquyers ſo layed ſiege syreth cloſed ſelfe pale thentent nat troubled nyght often certayne aproched fortreſſe ſcrimyſſhed thē within defended ſelfe right valyantly fell ſiege enduryng ſir robert mycon ſir nicotyn ſcotte keꝑs fortreſſe ſent knowledge eſtate ſir johan ubrues ſir dangoſes capitayns nyorthe contynent ſent garyſon luſygnen dangoſey ſo aſſembled nyorthe departed nombre ſixe hundred ſeuyn ſpeares good men warr beſyde folowers ſo long rode came syreth four leages fro nyorthe whan come syreth reſted ſpace tyme apparell ſelfe bene better haue ſette lodgynges conſtable anone worde comyng howe araynged felde hobeit conſtable nat greatly afrayed made men armed drawe toguyder ſayde nowe fayre ſirs howe ſay haue wyll fight enemyes beleue ſurely muſt houe v fyght ſayd ſir thanke god ſhalbe welcome v conſtable aduyſed ſet buſſhment watche caſtell thought well wolde yſſue ſo ſet ther two hūdred entent thanne cauſed caſt downe mooſt parte pale hooſtꝭ thentent ſhulde nat lette hym company whan wolde yſſue ſo ordayned two batayls one gouerned ſir alayne beaumount ſir geffray carnuell commaūded none ſhulde paſſe baner without commaundement euery man ſhulde kepe lodgynge nowe lette v ſpeke ſir robert mycon ſir robert le ſcot aboue caſtell ſawe thengliſſhmen redy apparelled feldes ſayd lette v arme ſelfe yſſue ſhall ſo one paſſe throughe theſe breton aſſoone folkes knoweth fightynge thē wyll come great domage ſhall knowe iſſuyng ſo armed thē nombre lx yſſued horſebacke ſkrymyſſhe hooſt encountred buſſhement layd ſo ther ſore ſcrimyſſhe englyſſhmen ſo encloſed coude nother recule backe go forwarde ſo taken ſlayne ſo none eſcaped two capitayns taken ſeaſon englyſſhemen felde cōſtable ſtyll percloſe iſſued nat feared engliſſhmen ſome great enbuſſhement wode behynde englyſſhmen brought thyder certayne nombre poicteuyns breton robber pyllers nombre two hundred whome engliſſhmen ſent thē ſcrimyſhe frenche hoſt ſoone cāe conſtables batayle tourned thē ſelfe ſayd howe good frenche wolde conſtables parte pleaſed hym conſtable ſayd content haue ſette wynge one ſyde lerned maner dealynge englyſſhmen knewe howe maner buſſhmēt behynde ¶ whan conſtable fraunce vnderſtode toyouſe drewe people toguyder cauſed de bannerre auaunce forthe drewe wynge two bataylles went forthe fote caſtynge downe pale cryenge ourlady cleſquy whan englyſſhmen ſawe yſſue holde raynged ſelfe fote auaunſed forwarde great deſyre fyrſt metyng encoūtred cōſtables batayle fought ſo valiantly paſſed batayle brought many man erthe breton wyſely ordred two batayls beyng wyng ſo came freſſhe luſty baſſhed ſo among thenglyſſhmen wery yt ſore reculed backe howbeit lyke valyant men full courage fought ax ſwordes burdeaux wherwith gaue great ſtrokes ther good knyghtes bothe partes nobly aduentured ſelfe exaulte honour batayle well fought many proper dedes armes done takyng reſcuynge bene ſene many day playne felde without aduauntage euery man dyde beſt power many man ſore hurt caſt erthe great myſchefe howbeit finally thengliſſhmen dicōfyted ſo fewe ſcaped taken ſlayn ther ſlayne good ſquyers richard meſuyll wylliam dursell james ubille ſore hurte taken ſir john̄ ubrues aymery rochchoart dauyd hollegraue rycharde olyue john̄ creſuell dyuers englande poytou bataile syreth yere lorde god thre hūdred lxxii xxi day marche ¶ conſtable returned folkes lodgynges toke hede hurte men priſoners wherof great plenty afterwarde conſtable ſent ſpeke caſtell ſir alayne beaumounte ſhewed taken force ſhulde dye without mercy garyſon put thē conſtables mercy receyued grace ſuffred paſſe quyte ſaue conducte go burdeaux thus frenche men caſtell lande put vnder obeyſaūce y• frenche kyng thā breton great heate came niorth whiche good towne poictou y• ſeaſon euer ſuſteyned englyſſhmen kepte euer great garyſon ſoone niorth knewe cōſtable came warde went againſt preſented hym y• kayes towne ſo brought hym towne great ioye breton refreſſhed four dayes depted great aray xiiii hundred ſpeares ſo went fortereſſe luſiguen yelded vp compoſicion ſo gariſon within departed lyues ſaued moche coude cary owne ſo ſaue conducte conuey burdeux thus frēchmen caſtell ſeignory men therof became ſubgettes french kyng thā breton rode caſtell alart conſtable ſent lady wyfe ſir rycharde dangle within yelde vp caſtell ſhe deſyred haue aſſurance ye ſhe might go poicters ſpeke ye duke berry conſtable graūted deſyre cauſed cōueyed thyder one knyghtes whā ſhe came duke ſhe kneled downe duke toke vp demaū ded requeſt sir ꝙ ſhe required conſtable fraunce yt ſhuld put landes vnder obeyſaūce frenche kyng ſir ye knowe well y• lord huſbande lyeth yet priſoner spayne ſir lande gouernance woman ſmall defence ſir nat heritage huſbāde myne owne pleaſure peraduenture ſhulde thynge agaynſt pleaſure wolde thanke therfore ſo ſhulde blamed ſir apeaſe ſet lande peace ſhall cōpounde ſelfe myne ſhall make warr ſo ye wyll make warre v ſir whā huſbande come priſon beleue well wyll drawe englāde ſhall ſend hym worde cōpoſicion ſir ſure wyll ſende mynde ſhall anſwere duke anſwered ſayd dame agre well deſyre condicion none fortreſſes prouyde men warre vitayls artyllary otherwiſe preſent tyme ſo thus agreed lady retourned caſtell cauſed ſiege reyſed ſhe ſhewed letter fro duke berrey cōtayning ſame purpoſe deꝑted conſtable went mortymer lady wherof yelded herſelfe put landes vnder obeyſance frenche kynge alſo yelded vp caſtell dyenne whiche partayned thus poictou xainton rochell quyte delyuered fro englyſſhmen whan conſtable ſet garyſons good ſure kepyng euery place ſawe rebellyon thoſe march vnto ryuer gyronde returned fraunce alſo ſo dyde duke berrey burgoyn burbone mooſt parte baron fraūce ſuche ben theſe ſayd cōqueſtes kyng greatly feeſted retournynge iapes whan ſir bertram came parys kyng kyng coude nat honor moche thus cōſtable abode kyng parys ioye myrthe ¶ ſeige bercerell dethe kyng ſcottes peace bitwene frēch king kyng nauar howe duke bretayne fledde englande howe cōſtable fraūce conquered duchy cap ccc vii ſame ſeaſon lordes cliſſon lauall uangour tournemen rieux rochfort vicount rohane ſir charles dignen bannerette bretayne marſhall blarouille lordes hambe • ruille foūteuyll granuyll farnyll denneuall cleres banerettes normādy people great plenty bretayne normādy ſo went layde ſiege ſtronge caſtell bercerell greatly conſtrayned aſſautes within ther two capitayns englyſſhmen ſir johan aparte ſir johan cornwall certayne companyons yt valiantly defended theym ſelfe ſiege done many noble feate armes many iſſues many ſautes many ſcrymyſſhe lytell ther beſide ther ſege ſaint sauyour vicount ſir thomas trybles ſir johan de bourge ſir philippe pecharde thre bretherne maluriers ſeige layde thoſe two garyſons ouerran countre baſe normandy ſo thyng abrode fortereſſes alſo raunſomed toke priſoners byſſhopriche bayeux deureux kyng nauer conſen • yng therto conforted thē dyuers tymes bothe mē vitayle ſuche wer gariſons countie deureux nat acorded frenche kyng ſo garyſons chierbourg gouerell couch bretuell deureux diuers vnder obeyſanuce kyng nauerr greatly enpouered waſted coūtre normādy ſametyme ſo good meanes made bytwene ye two kynges ſpecially labour erle sale bruſes taken moche payne bytwene thē alſo byſſhop deureux dyde ſo moche brought thē acorde ſo two kynges mette togyder right amyable caſtell uernon ryuer sayne ſworne dyuers great lordes fraūce kepe peace loue vnite cōfederacyon togyder euer ſo ye kyng nauer went frenche kyng realme fraunce kynge dyde hym moche honour reuerence ther kyng nauer put landes normandy handes gouernynge frenche kyng leſt two ſonnes charles peter ye kyng vncle departed went backe agayne nauerre thus peace endured foue yeres howbeit ther fell agayne bytwene great diſcorde ye ſhall herafter hyſtorie ye wyll loke therfore howe beit thynke ther wyll none ende made therof preſent boke ¶ viii day may yere lorde thre c lxxiii paſſed lyfe towne edenborowe kyng dauyd scotlande buryed abbay dōfre •• lyn beſyde kyng robert de bruſe father dyed without ſonne doughter laufully begoten body ther kyng right ſucceſſyon nephue named robert ſeneſhall scotlande goodly knyght ſonne ¶ howe certayn ordeyned englande kepe countre howe erle saliſbury william neuyll phillyp courtnay dyuers men armes enterd ſee landed bretayne howe cōſtable fraūce went thyder duke bretayne went englande cap ccc viii ſame ſeſon ordeyned englande entent kepe coūtre erle saliſbury willyam neuyll ſir phylippe courtnay ſhuld take ſee certayne nombre men warr ſayd howe yuan wale comynge ſee ſixe thouſande men lande brenne countrey lordes englande hadde xl great ſhyppes beſyde barge two thouſande menne armes beſyde archer thus departed fro cornewayle toke ſee toke way towarde bretayne ſo came ſaynt malo iſle brent ye hauen towne ſeuen great ſpayniſſhe ſhyppes wherof countre maruayle ſayd howe thought ſurelye duke bretayne hadde cauſed ſo townes caſtelles cyties duke great ſuſpect kepte ſtrayter fortereſſes dyde ſecretneſſe duke mynde dyſcouered certayne knightes bretayne ſhewed dyuers wordes y• ſhulde ſpoken duke ſo moche fr • kyng ordeyned cōſtable make iourney bretayne cōmaūdyng hym take poſſeſſion townes cytes caſtels treſſes ſeaſe rebelles bothe goodꝭ bodyes conſtable deꝑted fro parys went angiers made ſomōs thyder came duke burbon erle alenſon erle perche therle porceau dolphyn auuergne vicountes meaulx dauſnay ſir rafe coucy robert ſaynt poule raf rauenall loys sanſere marſhall fraunce great nombre barony chyualry uermā doyes artoyes pycardy beſyde thē came thyder march aniou poitou tourayn patte erle saliſbury army beyng ſaint malo iſle knewe well frenche aſſemble ſawe well howe countrey bretayne agaynſt duke ſo depted fro then hysſhyppes ſayled ſo long came breſt whiche one ſtrongeſt caſtelles worlde whan duke bretayne knewe conſtables comynge durſte truſt lengar uennes dignan beyng good towne bretayn though • y• one incloſed ſhulde great ꝑll ſo went caſtell alroy whiche bitwene uēnes renes helde parte made ruler englyſſhe knight called ſir johan auguſtyne duke left wyfe deſiring kepe well knyght promiſed ſo duke rode ſaynt mathues fyne potern ye towne cloſed againſt hym then duke went kouke tokeſhyppynge thentent arryue englande thus conſtable fraunce entred bretayne ther came company lordes knightes bretayne ſuche ben ſiege bercerell left vp ſiege lordꝭ normandy whan conſtable come reynes within knew well come ceaſe handes frēche kyng duke landes kynge counſayle ſayd howe duke forfayted landes bycauſe ſuſtayned englyſſhmen enemy townes caſtelles alſo ſelfe tooke parte kyng englande agaynſt erowne frā ce whome helde duchy bretayne faythe homage wherfore reynes thought make warre peaſeably ceceyued conſtable knowledged hym lorde name frenche kyng whan conſtable poſſeſſyon reynes roode haſtely towne dignan whiche yelded vp vnder obeyſaunce frenche kyng conſtable went cyte uēnes alſo yelded vp went luzemont aſſayled taken force wtin ſlayne cōſtable wēt jugon whiche put thē ſelfe vnder obeyſance frenche kynge lyke wyſe dyde caſtell gouy ye foreſt roch • yen towne guigante ſaynt mathewe fyne poterne ſaynt malo iſle conſtable went quipercorentyn tourned alſo french campelly credo galande dyuers fortereſſes fyrſt conſtable ouerran breton bretouant bycauſe always enclyned tather duke johan mountfortes parte breton gallet ye haue herde whan duke went englande ſet ſir robert canoll gouernour ye duchy howbeit ther fewe lordꝭ obeyed neuertheles furniſſhed wel caſtell dyriuall gaue kepynge therof coſyn called ſir hughe broit ſir robert went breſt cōſtable wēt hanybout capitayne therin vuder duke ſquier england named thomelyn ubyche alſo therin knight ſent ſir robert canoll called ſir thomas priour fourſcore one aſſone frēchmen come thyder beganne aſſayle caſtell brought thyder fro dyuers place certayne engyns great gonne wherwith dyuers caſtelles fortereſſes ſpecially towne cāpelly taken wherof james roſſe ſquire englāde capitayne coude nat taken mercy fell hādes ſir olyuer cliſſon ſlewe glayue alſo ſlewe dyuers handꝭ pyte mercy englyſſhman fell daunger nowelet v retourn ſiege hanibout conſtable fraunce cauſed engins reared vp agaynſt towne caſtell went ſaut ſware yt woldeſuppe caſtell within defended ſelfe valyauntly cōſtable ſayd ſirs ye within certayne ſhall cōquere wyll ſuppe night within towne knowe trouthe yt caſt ſtonne quarell wherby leeſt cōpany hurt make myne auowe god ye ſhall leſe lyues whiche wordes abaſſhed ſo towne went houſes let englyſſhmen alone defēded themſelfe ryght valyauntly longe myght endure towne ſo great englyſſhmen coulde nat take hede euery place frenchemen entred towne engliſſhmen ſlayne except two capitayns taken bycauſe within towne obeyed conſtables commaūdement therfore cōmaunded none ſhuld ſo hardy maner domage ¶ whan conſtable fraūce thus conquered towne ſtronge caſtell hanybout taryed ther xv dayes went towne kouke ye meane tyme therle saliſbuty ſir wyllm̄ neuyll ſir bertram stapleton ſir wylliam luzy hadd newe refreſſhed fortereſſe breeſt bothe men armes archer artyllery vitayle tokeſhippyng thentent defende countre frēchmen ſtyll felde bretayne ye ſayd engliſſhmen wyſt nat whyder cōſtable wolde brawe whan ye cōſtable cāe towne kouke whiche hauen towne wan byforce aſſaut engliſſhmen ſlayne wihin except capitayne named ſir john̄ langay taken mercy towne ye frēchmen newe repayred drewe towne breſt wher lorde neuyll ſir robert canoll c men armes many archer ſo ye lordes fraūce bretayn beſeged towne vi fyghting men ſoone layd theſiege ſent ser olyuer chſſon name duke aniou certayne nōbre go lay ſege roche ſur yon thenglyſſhmen kept ſo lorde clyſſon beſieged towne rounde reared vp dyuers engyns whiche brought fro angiers poiters breton cāe thyder dyuers noble men gētylmen aniou poictou ſo aſſauted ſayd howe wolde nat deꝑte then tyll ye ſame tyme ye duke aniou often tymes refreſſhed thē lay theſege vitayle thyngꝭ ſtyll conſtable lay ſege breſt duke burbon erles alenſon piergourt dolphyn auuergne byuers lordes fraūce wanther lytell breſt one ſtrōgeſt caſtels worlde bicauſe ſir robert canoll capitayne within lordes fraunce determyned ſend ley ſiege caſtell duriuall ſo thyder went dyuers lordꝭ bretayne tourayn four hundred fightynge men ¶ howe frenchman laye • iege four ſundry place tone howe roche ſuryon yelded ſelfe became frenche howe englyſſhmen came breſt cap ccc ix thus lordes fraūce helde tone four ſeges one bercerell another breſt 〈◊〉 roch ſur yon iiii duriuall eche theſe made many great aſſaut within roche ſur fartheſt fro copany cōfort made compoſycion enemy wtout ſocoured within ſpace moneth ſhulde deꝑte put ye caſtell vnder obeyſance french kyng whiche day lorde clyſſon knyghtes cōpany cāe thyder whan reſcue cāe reyſe ſiege caſtell yelded vp thenglyſſhmen deꝑted vnder ſaue conduct lorde pons ſo went burdeur lorde clyſſon went then ſiege duryuall brought thē great engins alſo ſameſege cāe conſtable fraūce duke burbon therles alenſon perche great nōbre barony cheualry frāce thought dyde loſe tyme lyeng breſt howbeit left ſtyll ther two fortifyed thē ſelfe place kepe wayes y• non ſhulde entre iſſue breſt refreſſh fortreſſe whan ſir broes within duryuall ſawe thē ſelfe ſo ſore oppreſſed douted greatly takyng fortreſſe deuyſed treaty haue reſpyte two monethes ſo without reſcued duke bretayne ſome able kepe felde reyſe ſiege within ſayd ſpace 〈◊〉 yelde vp fortereſſe duke aniou conſtable men armes came fro ye duke bretayne cooſt frenchman within ſitte ſtyll reſt peace treaty put ſhewed duke aniowe agreed ſo duryuall durynge ſayd terme ſhulde nat take fortreſſe ayde help ſir broes delyuered certayne gētylmen knyghtꝭ ſquiers hoſtagꝭ y• behalfe ſo treaty cōpoſycion cōſtable rode naūtes cytie ſhyt faſt gate agaynſt bycauſe came ſuche great army ſo ſent hym knowe entēcyon conſtable anſwered ſayd howe ſent thyder ye french kyng lord take poſſeſſion name duchy bretayn ſir johan mountforte calleth hym ſelfe duke hath forfayted thā burgeſſes naūtes demaunded take counſayle anſwer whā long counſayled came forthe ſayde sir great meruayle v ye thus take herytage lorde duke frenche kyng commaunded v receyue hym duke lorde hym haue ſwerne fealtie homage hath ſworne v gouerne v ſubgettes thus haue taken hym knowe cauſe fraude ſuſpection ifye cóe towne vertue ſuche procuraryon ye haue agre ye ſhall entre condicyon hap duke bretayne lorde retourne countre wyll become frenche prelate barones gentylmen good townes breten knowlege lord thā quyte without domage nowe tyme alſo ye receyue rē te reuenues bretayn let ſtyll remayne handꝭ vntyll ſuche tyme haue tydinges y• whiche ſhalbe agreable v conſtable ſware thē fulfyll procurer frēch kyng caſe thus cōſtable entred rytie nauntes chiefe cytie bretayne company whan ſir robert canoll ſouerayne breeſt vnderſtode howe ſir hugh broes coſyn made compoſycion fortreſſe duryuall frenchman ſawe well howe coulde nat departe fro then ther go cō fort caſtell duriuall wtout ſo wolde make cōpoſycion lyke caſe began treat frēchmen breſt anſwered without cōſtable coude nothyng two knightes two ſquyers englande ſaue cōducte went conſtable beſyde naū te wher lay ryuer loyre great copany fraūce bretayne ſo treaty toke ſuche effect yt breſt reſpite xl dayes ſo wtin ſpace ſhulde beſo conforted men warte able fyght conſtable el yelde vp fortereſſe meane ſeaſon breſt abyde ſtyll ſame caſe thā without reuitaylyng enforſyng thyng fortreſſe meſſangers retourned agayne ſir robert canoll ſent ſufficyent men bothe knightes ſquiers conſtable hoſtage conſtable put priſon yt ben ſiege breſt departed conſtable gaue lycence frenche king ſent fortifye cyties townes caſtels fortreſſes picardy duke lancaſtre aryued calais great armye whan erle saliſbury ſee yt ſeaſon kept fronters bretayne normādy alſo kyng englande newly reconforted thouſande men armes two thouſande archer whan vnderſtode cō poſycion breſt ſayd goddes grace wolde fight frenchemen ſayled ſo longe arryued breſt toke lande cōpany breſt euery night went agayne ſhyppes euery daye raynged batell fight enemyes brewe thider conſtable gyuen lycence mooſt parte cōpany helde ſtyll two ſieges one bercerell duryuall thought full lytell erle saliſbury wolde haue come thyder ſo ſtrongly dyde departed fro march nauntes whan day delyueraunce breſt dyde aproche howe whā day came went nat thyder knowledge howe engliſſhmen ſuche ſtrengthe able fyght hym therfore thought warke great ſadde aduyſe ſo dyd taryed ſtyll remoued nat ther taryed vii dayes whan therle saliſbury beyng breeſt hadde taken place grounde auauntage ſawe conſtable fraunce breton came nat forwarde ſent thyder haraude whan came conſtable ſayd sir erle saliſbury lordes england ſend worde haraude armes tyme ye haue layd ſiege caſtell towne breſt ſir lordes maiſters vnderſtand howe certayne compoſycions treatyes made bitwene towne nat comforted daye lymytted whiche nat nowe long vnto ſhulde yeld vp towne caſtell wherfore ſir maye pleaſe knowe come breeſt kepe day defende fortreſſe therfore ſir deſyre drawe forwarde ye ſhalbe fought withall without dout ye wyll nat deſyre ſende agayne ſuche hoſtages ye haue entent conſtable ſayde haraulde ye bringe v good tidynges wherfore ye welcōe ye ſhall ſay mayſters howe haue greatter deſyre ſyght thē haue fight v beit nat place treaty made agreed vnto therfore ſaye lette theym drawe parte place without fayle ſhall ſought withall haraud retourned breſt dyde meſſage ſent hym agayne conſtable another meſſage whan came ſayd sir cōe agayne fro lordes maiſters whome haue ſhewed euery thynge ye cōmaunded ſay whan laſt ſir nowe ſay howe men ſee lately cōe then haue brought horſe ſir ſay haue nat ben acuſtomed go farre fote wherfore ſende worde ye wyll ſende thē horſes wyll come place ye wyll apoynt fyght kepe day fayre fared ꝙ conſtable nat mynde enemy ſomoche auantage ſend thē horſes ſhulbe reputed great outrage ſo mynded wolde deman̄de good hoſtages ſufficient anſwere v horſes agayne sir ꝙ haraud haue ſuche commaūdement anſwere mater howe beit ſir ſay ye wyll nat agre poynte ye haue lawfull cauſe retayne ſtyll hoſtages yehaue therfor ſir yeſend thē ye ye ſhulde cōſtable ſayd nat abuyſed ſo retourned haraude erle saliſbury company breſt whan vnderſtode ſhulde nat fought wall hoſtages delyucred ſore dyſpleaſed howe taryed ſtyll without remouyng tyll day expyred parceyued well conſtable cāe nat fight entred breſt newe reuitayled towne refreſſhed greatly fortreſſe ꝑte whan conſtable ſawe englyſſhmen cāe nat forwarde fyght hym deꝑted toke hoſtages ſayd priſoners ſaid englyſſhmen breſt hadde nat kept truely apoyntment reſcuyng breſt bycauſe erle saliſbury hadde newly refreſſhed vitayled y• fortreſſe ſo erle saliſbury deꝑted fro breſt entred agayne ſhippes kepe y• march fronters commytted alſo ſir robert canoll whan departed fro breſt went ſtreight owne fortereſſe duryuall aſſoone come caſtell ſhewed y• duke aniou cōſtable beyng nauntes ſuppoſed fortuned ſir robert canoll brake treatie apoyntment made renounſed ſend worde duke aniou conſtable wolde kepe ſuch apoyntmeut men made abſence without leaue ſayeng ſuche authorite ſo whan duke herde came ꝑſonally ſege duriuall ¶howe dyuers englyſſhmen ſlayne diſconfited lorde soubyſe ribamont howe garyſons soiſſons diſcōfyted englyſſhmen cap c c c x calais aryued duke lancaſtre y• duke bretayne mo thre thouſande men armes x thouſande archer englyſſhmen whiche voyage ben ordayning imagenynge thre yere theym erles warwyke stafforde suffolke lorde edwarde spcuſar one greatteſt barones englande conſtable tyme hooſt lordes wylloughby pole baſſet hubelles holenton ſir henry percy loys clyfforde wylliam beauchāpe chanoyne roberſart water hewet hughe carleton stephyn goſenton rychard pōt chardon dyuers knyghtes ſquyers england whōe nat name french kyng knewe right well paſſage theſe englyſſhmen prouyded ſufficyētly ſure kepyng townes cyties fortereſſes caſtelles picardy artoys uermandoyſe hadde ſet men warreꝭ breton burgonyons pycardes normayus dyuers ſoudyers empyre thus theſe englyſſhmen departed fro calais aparelled caryages wherof great plenty ſo rode forthe thre batayls aſwell ordred coude deuiſed firſt ye batayle wt marſhals wherof erles warwyke suffolke chefe two duke lancaſtre bretayne noble cōpany thyrde batayle led conſtable lorde spē ſer thre batayls marched forwarde kepyng themſelfe cloſe togyder alwayes harneſſe redy fight founde whome euery night lay togider made gode wache went neuer paſt thre leages day none went marſhals baners without cōmaūdement ſo paſſed motrell wherof lorde handboure capitayne made ther none aſſaut ſo paſt ſaynt omer turwyn currours brent lande therle ſaynt poule went nere arras two duke lodged abbey mount ſaynt eloy ther taryed two dayes departed coſted arras aſſayled nat knewe well ſhulde leſe labour ſo went bray ryuer ther two marſhals made great aſſaut gate within ther garyſon good knightes ſquyers picardy whome vicont mealx capitayne ſir rafe menac chanon roberſart day ſtrake downe glayue thre erthe gate ther ſore ſcrimyſſhe howbeit frēchmen kept ſo well fortereſſe loſt nothynge ſo englyſſhmen paſſed cooſtynge ryuer thynking paſſe ouer ham uermandois ſaynt quintynes thus went forthe thenglyſſhe hoſt wher duke lancaſtre chefe gouernour ordynaūce kyng england father lorde bouſyers heynalte cāe fraūce paſſed bridge ham towne deſyred effectuouſly yt wolde reteyned wt thē helpe ayde thē agaynſt thenglyſh men agreed ther taryed two dayes tyll englyſſhmen paſt toke way aboue entre vermā doys paſſe ryuer ſtrayter paſſage whan lorde bouſyers knewe thenglyſſhmen nygh paſt ouer howe yt drue towarde ſaynt quintynes rybamont wher lorde clyn whoſe doughter mariage lorde ther fayre lande herytage alſo hym ſelf ther fayre lande ye right wyfe knewe well caſtell rybamont vnpurueyed men warr toke leaue ham greatly thanked ſeruice done ſo departed ſuche nombre whiche great nōbre rode ſo long came ſaynt quintynes great parell countrey full englyſſhmen came ſuche danger ſoner entred engliſſhe currours chaſed hym gate lorde bouſyers founde towne ſir wylliam bourges capitayne vnder french kyng receyued ioyouſly deſyring hym byde helpe defende towne lorde bouſiers excuſed ſelfe ſayde howe hadde enterpriſed enter towne rybamont kepe towne fortreſſe bycauſe capitayne wherfore deſyred ſo ſore ſayd ſir wylliam hadde hym ſaynte quintynes xii croſ bowes ſo departed went nat farre paſt ſpyed company englyſſhmen toke another lowe way beſide thē knewe well countre ſame day rode great parell towardes rybamount rode encoūtred knight burgoyne called ſir johan bulle goynge towardes ſaynt quitynes whan one ſpoken lorde bouſyers retourned hym rybamount ſo xl ſpeares xx croſbowes thus aproched rybamont ſent one currours enforme towne comyng helpe ayde defende towne ye meane ſeaſon ſawe wher comyng company engliſſhmen nombre fourſcore frenchemen ſayd beholde yōder enemy comynge fro pyllage let v go daſſhed ſpurres horſe ſydes galopped forthe faſt might cryeng lady rybamont ſo came amonge englyſſhmen diſconfyted ſlewe mooſt parte theym happy myght eſcape whan frenchemen hadde thus ouerthrowen englyſſhmen went rybamont founde lorde chyne come thyder lytell xl ſpeares xxx croſbowes caſtell company lodgyngꝭ vnarmed herde watchman caſtell cryeng harneſſe ſirs mē armes aprocheth towne drewe togyder demaunded watchman nōbre like lyhode anſwered ſayd howe aboute nombre fourſcore men armes lorde bouſyers ſayd ſirs behoueth v go fyght ſhuld great blame v ſulfre thē goby ſo nere fortreſſe lord chin ſayd fayre ſonne ye ſay trouthe cauſe oure horſes cōe diſplay baner ſir john̄ bulle ſayd lordes ye ſhall nat go without counſayleis y• go wyſe lye parauenture currours whiche marſhalles englande conſtable hath ſent hyder cauſe vsto go fortreſſe iſſuyng parauentur may tourne folly lorde bouſiers ſayd ye wyll leue ſhall go fight 〈◊〉 brefely happe may befall wyll go fight theym ſo dyde helme lepte horſe ſo yſſued hym ſixſcore englyſſhmen fourſcore ser hugh caurelles company nat hymſelfe ſtyll duke lancaſtre howbeit ſixe knightes many ſquiers come thyder reuēge companye ouerthrowen ſoone frenchemen gate founde incontynent engliſſhmen couched ſpeares ranne among frenchman frenchman opyned let paſſe ſo dyd wherby roſe ſuche duſt one coude nat ſe knowe another frenchman cloſed ſelfe agayne toguyder cryed lady rybamont many man ouerthrowen bothe ꝑtes lorde chyn plummet leed hande wherwith brake baſſenetes ſuche attayned vnto bygge goodly knyght well formed membres laſt ſuche ſtroke helme nere fallen ſquyer nat kept hym vp whiche ſtroke greued hym longe lyued ther dyuers englyſſhmen gret marueyle y• ſaw penonſemblable armes without difference lorde coucy ſayd howe y• lorde coucy hath ſent men hyder agaynſt v ought frende ther harde batell howe finally englyſſhmen taken ſlayne fewe y• ſcaped lorde bouſiers priſoners two bretherne pennenort knight ſquyer ſir johan bulle two priſoners went rybamont foreby englyſſhe hooſt withoute ſcrimyſſhe alſo forbare brenne lande lorde coucy domage lombardy medlyd nothyng warr fraunce englyſſhmen went loged valeys vnder laon ther brueres creſcy dyd moche domage countre lonnoys howbeit tyme frenche kyng cauſed goodes playne countre fortereſſes townes caſtelles whiche ſo well prouyded engliſſmen coude haue none aduantage aproche aſſayle alſo englyſſhemen nat mynde enploy ſeaſon ther rather y• frenche kyng ſente downe power men haue fought frenche kyng alwayes commaunded wyſe gyue batayle wolde ſhulde euer purſued kept ſhorte euery night frenchman laye fortreſſes day purſued thenglyſſhe hoſt went euer cloſe toguyder happed beyonde soiſſous mornyng ſixſcore thenglyſſhe ſperes ran ouer countre came within dā ger buſſhment burgonyons frēchmen wherof ſir john̄ uyen john̄ bulle wyllyam bordes hugh porcien john̄ coucy vycont mealx lordes rauenall bone capitens dyuers thre c ſpeares alwayes coſtyng get auātage thēgliſhmen ſame night lyen felde made buſhment lytell wode soiſſons thenglyſſhmen cāe mornynge ſeke pyllage hoſt lodged behynde whan englyſſhmen paſt frenchman cāe buſſhment diſplayed baners penons whan thēgliſſhmen ſawe yt great company ſo nere reſted toke aduyſe ſent hooſt behynde thē whiche longe leage fro ſir gaultyer great capitayne nat farr then whan herde therof lept vpon horſe great haſte ſpeare fyſte without • •• enet vyſer ſo rode thyderwarde without aduyſe coūſayle men ſolowed faſt might ſo ī fray ſtryken necke ſo fell downe deed thēglyſſhmen fought valiantly finally ſlayne taken fewe eſcaped taken englyſſhe knightes priſoners ſir john̄ radwyn thomas faulque hughe bromewell thomas spenſer thomas ebreton nycholl gaſcoyne john̄ candley philyppe cambrey hughe harpe done lyonet dautryne ſquyers johan galarde thomas brudlay henry mamefort guy chuet wyllm̄ dautry john̄ menet antyquē wylliam gauſull john̄ fōbret tomelyn solerant wyllm̄ quiteuyn robert bouchell ro daudley rafe stanby thomas arthus tydingꝭ came englyſſhe hooſt howe company fightynge marſhals made haſt remoue hooſt parte coude nat ſo ſoone auaunce mater paſt done burgonyons frēchmen withdrawen withall priſoners ſo y• englyſſhmen wyſt nat ſeke thus fell encountre enformed whiche nere douchy beſyde soiſſons xx day february yere lorde thouſande thre c threſcore xiii ¶ theſe two iourneys rabymont douchy fell none aduenture duke lancaſtre realme fraūce mencyon ought made englyſſhemen paſſed many ſtrayte paſſage alway rode wiſely cloſe togyder frēche kynges counſayle ſayd kyng sir lette go finally nat attayne heritage ſhall wery ſelfe nought often tymes whan ſtorme tempeſt ryſeth countre laſt waſteth away ſelfe lykewiſe ſo ſhall ſene theſe englyſſhmen ¶ hoſtages layd duriuall beheeded howe ſir robert canolle beheeded agayne ſuche priſoners alſo duke lancaſtres iourney cap ccc xi le haue well herde howe ſir robert canoll come caſtell duryuall ye whiche helde owne herytage brake treaty yt made bytwene men duke aniou wherfore duke came thyder ſiege duke claymed owne enherita great company lordꝭ knightes bretayne poictou lowe march french kyng wolde cō ſtable ye lorde clyſſon yt ſhulde returne fārce ayde brother duke burgoyne purſue englyſſhe men heſent often caſtell duryuall obey let hym haue poſſeſſyon caſtell whan daye paſt caſtell ſhulde haue ben delyuerd yet lay ſtyll ſiege hadde great marueyle within thought knewe well ſir robert canoll entred caſtell newe refreſſhed theſe duke lordꝭ ſent haraude ſir robert canoll ſir hughe broes made treatie whan haraulde come fortereſſe ſayd sir lordes hath ſente hyder knowe cauſe ye nat acquyte hoſtages delyuer caſtell couenant ye ſir hugh haue ſworne ſir robert canoll ſayd haraude ſay vnto maiſters howe men coude make compoſycion without myne agrement returne ſhewe ſo haraude retourned recounted lordes ſir robert canoll ſaid ſo ſent hym agayne newe meſſage whan ſayd sir lordes yet ſendeth worde compoſycion y• ſhulde receyue fortereſſe perſon tyll day prefixed ſithe tyme day haue receyued ſir robert canoll fortreſſe ought nat haue done therfore ſir knowe trouther y• without ye yelde vp caſtell hoſtages ſhall beheeded sir robert anſwered god haralde manyſſhing maiſters wyll nat ſo leſe caſtell ſo y• duke cauſe men dye ſhall ſerue lyke caſe haue within bothe knightes ſquyers priſoners though myght haue hundred frankes wyll ſaue neuer one thē whan haraude departed hadde made reporte duke aniou called forthe hangman made brought forthe hoſtagꝭ two knightes aſquier cauſed heedes ſtryken nere caſtell ſo within might ſe knowe incontynent ſir robert canoll made borde put wyndowe hall brought thyder four priſoners thre knightes ſquyer whome might haue hadde great raūſome made four heedes ſtryken dyde caſt downe dyke bodyes one way heedes nother way brake vp ſiege maner men went fraūce namely duke aniou went parys ye kyng brother conſtable lorde clyſſon rode toward cyte troyes englyſſhmen march paſſed ye ryuer marne toke waye towarde anxere ſame tyme pope gregory xi ſent fraūce legacyon archbyſſhoppe rohan byſſhoppe carpentras treat peace yf might bytwene frenche kyng kynge englande theſe prelate moche laboure ryde bytwene frenche kynge bretherne duke lancaſtre alwayes englyſſhmen rode forthe thorough countreis foreſtes auuergne limoſyn ryuer loyre dordone lothe thenglyſſhmen nat eaſe iourney lykewiſe nat frenchman folowed coſted purſute ther dyed thre knightes heynault ſir fateres berlaumount bridoll montague begue uerlan alſo englyſſhe part dyed ſome solonge duke lancaſtre bretayne rode forwarde cam bergerath four leages fro burdeux alwayes frenchman purſued duke aniou cōſtable rode aboue towarde rouuergue roddes tholouſe come pyergourt ther two ſayd prelate reſted rode euer prechynge bytwene party layed many reaſons bring acorde party ſo harde wolde nat condiſcende peace without great aduātage ſo chriſtmas duke lancaſtre came burdeux ther bothe duke lay wynter lent folowynge ſome company departed whan iourney paſte retourned englande lorde baſſet company wherwith kyng nat content reproued hym bycauſe retourned nat duke ſonne anone feeſt eaſter yere lorde god thouſande thre hundred xiii duke aniou beynge pyergourt aſſembled great army hym conſtable fraunce ye moſt parte barones knyghtes bretayne poictou aniou tourayne alſo gaſcoyne ſir johan armynake lordes dalbret pyergourt erles comynges narbone vycountes carmayne uyllemure thalare erle dolphyn auuergne mooſt parte lordes auuergne limoſyn vycount myndone lordes de la barde pyergourt ſir robert de charde xv thouſande menne foote alſo great nombre geneways croſ bowes tooke way towardes highe gaſcoyne came ſaynt syluere wherof abbot lorde howe beit ſtronge towne yet abbot douted y• ſhulde loſe force therfore fell treaty ye duke aniou thought nother hym ſelfe lā de ſhulde abyde warre duke indygnacion sayeng town fortreſſe ſmall thynge regard townes caſtels hygh gaſcone whyder ſuppoſed ye duke goyng therfore deſyred hym leue reſt peace certayne compoſycion y• none men ſhulde make warre ſo non made alſo lyke maner herytours lordes gaſcoyne dyde duke accorded hym hadde hoſtages behalfe ſent kepte pyergourt hoole hooſt wherof duke anio chiefe drewe towardes mount marſen towne lourde highe gaſcone wherof ſir arnold de uyre capitayne frēchmen layd ſiege therto demaunded wolde yelde thē vp duke aniowe towne ſoone agreed therto knyght kept ſayde howe erle foiz delyuered hym place wherfore ſayde wolde delyuer none perſon whan conſtable herde cauſed euery man aſſaute caſtell ſuche wyſe wonne force capitayne ſlayne dyuers bo men woman towne ouerron robbed ſo left deꝑtyng left men therin frenchman entred lande caſtell bone ouerran thā paſſed lande caſtell neufe whiche aſſayled ſo went towarde byenre came entre lande lorde leſcute rode ſo forwarde came good towne good caſtell called sault held ye countie foiz landes arere fee gaſcoyne prince wale went spayne mynde haue made warr agaynſt ye countie foiz bycauſe wolde nat holde hym alſo ye duke aniou cōquered mooſt part acquitayne ſhewed hymſelfe lorde ther wolde haue poſſeſſyon layd ſiege towne sault gaſcoyne whiche nat eaſy wyn within capitayn ſir wyllim̄ pan whan erle foiz ſawe howe frenchman conquered landes arerefees reaſon ſhuld holde french kyng orels kyng englande ſent vicount caſtell bone lordes merſalte caſtell neufz leſcute abbot ſaynt syluere whanne come ſent ſaue cōduct go ſpeke duke aniowe lay ſtyll ſiege saulte duke accorded therto lordes went hooſt duke agreed landes ſhulde abyde reſpite peace tyll ye myddes auguſt tyme ther ſhulde apere ye towne mō ſac y• day certayne nombre men warre french kynges parte kyng englandes part party coude kepe felde wolde holde lā de peace euer whiche couenant parforme therle foiz lordes layd good hoſtages duke aniou went pyergourte hole army gaue lycence man departe ſeaſon ther exchange made certayne landꝭ priſoners ſpaygne whiche landes kynge spayne gyuen conſtable fraūce lorde manny ſuche ſeruyce done spayne cōſtable gaue lande ſaryen caſtell exchange erle pēbroke taken priſoner rochell ser olyuer māny gaue lande grece lordes ſir richarde dangle wyllim̄ nephue othes grātſone john̄ de gremeres tanyboton ſame ſeaſon began treatie bytwene duke aniou duke lancaſtre pyergort aſſurances towarde duke aniou duke lancaſtre helde himſelfe kynge regent thēglyſſhe march ſo ther reſpyte warre agreed bytwene ayders endure tyll laſt day auguſt yt theſe two duke ſhulde begynning septēbre march picardy duke aniou ſaynt omers duke lācaſtre calys truce thus taken duke lācaſtre duke breten therles warwyke suffolke stafforde lordes spenſer wyl loughby chanoyne roberſart henry percy lorde mauue lordꝭ knightes viii day july deꝑted fro burdeux returned englande whan capitayns bercerell ſir johan pert johan cornwall kept treſſe ſpace yere agaynſt frēchmen lay ſiege ſawe ſocoure ayde comyng warde vytayls began ſore myniſſhe toke aduyſe togyder de • myned make ſome compoſycion fell treaty lordes hambuye stonuyll blaynuyll franuyll lordes normandy lay ſiege right wery wolde gladly haue fallen ſome treaty howe beit firſt wolde knowe kyngꝭ mynde acorded right well therto duke bretayne nat perſonally bitwene tyme feeſt allſayntes next comyng ye towne bercerell ſuch wiſe able reyſe ſiege el within yelde vp compoſycion ther de lyuered hoſtages therle penbroke put raunſome ſixe thouſande frankes lomberdes bruges becāe dettours therfore promyſed payment therof aſſoone hole good poynt erle rode vnder conduct conſtable fraū ce ſo feuer ſickeneſſe toke hym ye way ſo horſe lytter brought cyte arras ſickeneſſe toke hym ſo ſore lay bedde final lye dyed ſo conſtable loſt money therle penbroke left behynde hym ſonne age two yere ſir richarde dāgle made finaūce ſhall ſhewe ye haue herde howe y• lorde roy priſoner englāde child doughter heyre frendes ſayd lorde roy fell treaty ſir olyuer manny knyght bretayne nephue ſir bertram cleſquy delyueraunce lorde roy meanes exchaunge one priſoners haue wyfe lorde roys doughter great lynage thā ſir olyuer māny ſent y• kyng englāde knowe knyght wolde gladlyeſt haue delyueced lorde roye kyng enclynod haue ſir rychard dangleꝭ ſo delyuered quyte eche lord mā ny wedded doughter lorde royes ſayde lorde roye maryed doughter lorde wille floren 〈◊〉 heynalt y• knyghtes ſir tanyboton ſir othes grantſon johan gruners put fynaūce meanes ſir olyuer manny paſſed eaſy courteſſe raūſome ¶ howe dyuers townes yelded vp french kyng gaſcon ſir hugh chaſtellon retourned fro priſon howe caſtell bercerell normādy yelded vp frē che cap ccc xii whan myddes auguſt began aproche iourney ſhulde hold monſac duke anioue came thyder great nōbre men warr ſo came lay monſac ſixe dayes thyder came body apere parte englyſſhmen thought reaſon treaty made bitwene duke aniou duke lancaſtre iourney ſhulde haue ouerpaſt duke aniou counſayle nat mynde duke ſent erle foiz vicount chatell boine lordes marſen chatell neufe leſcute abbot ſaynt syluere ſhuld holde couenaūt el duke ſayd wolde ſle hoſtagꝭ entent wolde entre landes ſuche puyſſaunce wolde compell cry mercy theſe lordes putte ſelfe landes vnder obeyſance frenche kyng monſac opened towne whiche fayre gariſon went preſented key duke aniou hym dyde fealtie homage ſo duke company entred taryed xviii dayes meane ſeaſon • oke counſayle parte ſhulde drawe ſoone myddes auguſt ſhulde paſt truce ſhulde expyred whan daye paſt duke aniou went ryoll whan layen ſiege thre dayes ye ryoll put themſelfe vnder obeyſaunce frenche kyng went langon whiche alſo yelded vp ſaynt marquayre condoſe baſylle towre prudēce mauleon towre drowe nombre xl townes caſtels tourned ſelfe frenche ſame viage laſt tourned frenche dauberoth euery place ye duke layd newe gariſons whan ordayned euery thyng accordyng pleaſure retourned fraunce conſtable lykewiſe kyng ſent ſo gaue lycence mooſt parte company departe lordes cliſſon beaumauoyre dauangourt ray ryon vycontes rohan lauall came ye ſiege bercerell holde iourney ye day prefixed ſayd howe duke bretayn ſir robert canoll lorde spenſer comynge thyder reyſe ſiege ye haue herd ſir hugh chaſtellon maſter croſbowes taken abbeuile ſir nycholas louuayn caryed england coude come raūſome bycauſe axed ſo moche fynaūce howe marchaunt flaunders auaunſed hymſelfe dyde ſomoche ſubtelly gate hym englande maner howe ouer long tolde therfore paſſe breuely whan come gayne fraunce kyng reſtored agayne office maiſter ye croſbowes ſent abuyle kepe fronters two hundred ſpea • e countre aboute obeyed ſir johan bertheouyllers capitayn boloyn ſir henry iſles capitayne dept ſuche garyſons tyrwinnyn ſaynt dmers lykos fiennes mount roye lorde comynges capitayne arde ſir johan ubrues aſſembled arde viii hundred ſpeares erly mornyng departed ran towarde boloyne ſe coulde fynde aduēture ſame day capiten boloyne lx ſpeares iſſued rode towarde calais lykewiſe fynde ſome aduenture returnynge encountred ſorde compynges company ryden warde boloyne capitayne boloyne ſaued hym ſelfe moche payne loſt xiiii ſpeares chaſe lorde comynges retourned agayne ſame mornynge maiſter croſbowes made muſters hym great nombre arthoys uermādoyes aboute ſo yt nombre thre hūdred ſpeares ſame tyme erle ſaynt powle newly come picardy fro lande lorayne ſame day rydynge lady boloyne pilgrymage herde way howe maiſter croſbowes wolde likewiſe tyde thyder ſo met rode forthe togyder came arde taryed ther certayne ſpace ye felde knewe nothyng thēglyſſhmen brode felde engliſſhmen knewe nothyng thē whan frenchman ben certayne tyme arde ſawe man iſſue returned abbey lyques ſoone departed fro arde engliſſhman iſſued priuely rode ſo longe priuy wayes knewe countre laſt mette lorde comynges returnyng warde arde tolde hym howe frenchemen ben arde departed tyme frenchman paſt tornehen certifyed thengliſſhmen tydynge abrode capitayne arde tourned coſted one ſyde layd buſſhment thre hūdred ſpeares lytle wood beſyde liques wherof ſir hugh chaſtellon chefe capitayn ordayned yt yong erle ſaynt poule great nombre knightes ſquiers ſhulde tyde forthe nat far then along great hedge lorde comynges ſir ubreues company reſtyng thē lighted fote good order ſir johan harlſton went forthe xx ſpeares breke frenche buſſhement determyned fly ſuffre frēchmen chaſe ſo rode forthe feldes yonge erle ſaynte poule brode ꝑte hundred ſpeares ſayd company let v auance forthe yōder enemyes baſſhed ſpurres horſes ran faſt might ſir john̄ harlſton turned cauſed chaſe along hedge thēglyſſhmen redy rainged archer thē aſſoone frenchman came englyſſhmen receyued ſpeares ax archer began ſhote ouerthrewe men armes beate downe horſes done many feate armes fynally frenchemen encloſed ouerthrowen yong erle ſaynt poule takenne priſoner ſquyer duchy guerles taken lorde pouns clarry ſir william melle charles chaſtellon lionet daraynes gauues uaiſnell henry iſles johan brother chaſtellayn beauuoyſe dyuers knightes ſquiers contynent diſconfyture lorde chaſtellon banner thre hūdred ſpeares came ſame hedge ende whan ſawe diſconfyture company drewe company toguyder departed without ſtrokes gyuen thenglyſſhmen haynowes led priſoners towne arde ſame night lorde comynges bought therle ſaynt poule ſquier taken hym priſoner anon went englande preſented kyng thanked hym therfore hadde therby great profyte ſame ſeaſon come fraunce duke aniou conſtable fraunce alſo arche byſſhoppe rohan biſſhoppe crapent ben long kyng parys ſo paſſed forthe go ſaynte dmers kepe daye apoyntement duke lancaſtre alſo come calys lord bocnyer hym wente bruges anone duke aniowe came ſaynt dmers great array ſent hym coſyn ſir guy bloys came thyder haynalt lay frontres fraunce flā ders towarde arde croyes aboute ba • llule flaunders caſſell ther conſtable fraunce lordes clyſſon lauall ſir dlyuer manny mo vi hundred ſpeares kepe countre let ſhulde come erle flaūders great truſt alſo wolde neuer come brugꝭ nothyng entreatours coude v ye haue herd howe bercerell beſieged ſpace yere howe made compoſicion yelde vp fortres without reſkewed feaſt ſayntes whan day began aproche ye french kyng ſente thyder great nombre men warre knightes bretayne normandy excepte ſuche conſtable ther merſhals fraūce ſir lewes sāxere ſir mouton blanuylle erle harecourt ſir james uien admyrall fraunce doulpoyu auuergne ſir johan bulle dyuerss lordes theſe helde iourney day bercerell none came thyder apere ſo forte reſſe yelded vp euery man departed wolde ſo ſir john̄ apert men cornewall tooke ſee retourned englande lordes fraūce toke poſſeſſyon fortereſſe bercerell newe repayred refreſſhed men artyllary puruyances anone cōmaūdment french king theſe men warre went layd ſiege ſaynt saluyour vicount cōſtantyne whiche parteyned ſir johan chandos dethe ye kyng englande gaue ſir alayn boucqueſell thā englande hadde lefte capitayne ſquier called charenton ſir thomas cornet johan de bourge thre bretherne maulurier ſixſcore men warr ſo ſaynt sauiour beſieged ſee ſir johan uien admyrall fraūce lande lordꝭ bretayne normandy ther great hooſt dreſſed vp engyns agaynſt towne whicheſore traueyled within fortereſſe nowe let v ſpeke lordꝭ 〈◊〉 bruges entreat peace frēche parte duke anion burgoyne erle salebruch byſſhoppe amiens chiefe bayeux engliſſhe parte ye duke lācaſtre erle saliſbury byſſhop lōdon laſt thentent none yuell trouble ſhulde cōe theſe lordes none men rode dayly bytwene party therfore agreed truce endure fyrſt day may next march calais ryuer landes ſtyll warre ſent bretayne lorde clyſſon lorde de lauall companyes kepe fronters ¶ howe duke bretayne arryued bretayne tooke dyuers caſtels fortereſſes force trewce made bytwene french kyng kyng englande alyes cap ccc xiii whyle theſe lordes entreatyng peace brugꝭ duke bretayn englande ye haue herde ſawe well howe countre great trybulacion nighe countre turned agaynſt hym counteſſe wyfe caſtell alroye ſelfe ye kyng englāde right hertely loued hym ſayd fayreſon knowe well howe loue ye haue put balance landes put ſeignory fayre herytage ye certayne ſhall right well recouer agayne woll make peace frēchmen without ye cōprſſed therin haue agayne herytage duke hūbly thāked hym ſo y• ſame ſeaſon duke bretayne aſſembled toguyder hāpton thre archer payed wage ordynance kyng englande halfe yere thē two men armes yt iorney went therles cā bridge marche lorde spenſer ſir thom̄s holāde nicholas camoire edwarde twyford richarde pontchardon johan • eſſelle thomas grantſon hugh haſtyngꝭ lordꝭ māue pole diuers knightes ſquiers duke bretayne company arryued ſaynt mathewes tyne potern bretayne ſo toke lande contynent aſſayled ye caſtell without towne caſtell nat greatly fortifyed nother men artillery ſo engylſſhmen toke force ſlewe within whan within towne ſaynte mathewes knewe therof opened gate receyued duke lord thengliſſhmen went towne polle de lyon whiche ſtronge well cloſed made great aſſaute archer beyng dyke ſhot ſo holy togyder fewe none durſt ſhewe ſelfe defence ſo towne wonne ouerron exyled went brue de uaulx well fortifyed men armes purueyaunces lordes clyſſon beaumanoyre vycount rohan dyuers lordes bretayne lytell fore refreſſhed fortreſſe euery thing neded ſo duke engliſſhmen layd ſiege therto whan ſaynt sauyour vicoūt vnderſtode howe duke bretayn theſe lordes englande arryued bretayne truſted wolde come thyder reyſe ſiege whiche greatly deſyred greatly cō ſtreyned engyns dyde caſt day nyght ſo wyſt nat kepe thēſelfe danger toke aduyſe entreat frēchmen haue truſe endure eſter yere lorde thre hundred lxxv whiche vi wekes ſo within tyme ſhulde fought withall orreyſed fro ſege el yelde vp fortereſſe lyues goodꝭ ſaued truce taken lay ſtyll ſiege made warre eche duryng ſeaſon vicont rohan lordꝭ cliſſon beaumanoyre laye fronter agaynſt duke bretayne thē gliſſhmen lay ſege ſaynt bru de uaulx herde reported howe ſir john̄ deureux nere campelly made great warre countre newly repayred fortifyed lytell fortreſſe wherin made garyſon called nouell fort ſo cāpelly coulde nat iſſue towne without trouble ſo ſent worde therof lorde clyſſon lamballe company departed then left men behynde kepe towne rode ſo longe came newe forters layd ſeige therto whiche tidynges came duke bretayn ſiege ſaynt brue de uaulx ye duke made myne bene makyng ye ſpace xv dayes ſame tyme loſte myne labour whan duke lordes hooſt knewe ſayd thynges conſydered thought loſte tyme abyde lenger wherfore ſayd better go ayde ſir john̄ deureux may fynde felde hath layde ſiege hym truſt ſhall haue fayre iourney diſloged rode towarde newe fortereſſe whiche lordes bretayne made aſſayled ſuch wyſe fote wall feared nothynge caſte downe thē well paueſſhed alſo within lytell ſtuffe caſt downe therwith haſt came one thē ſayd ſirs get hen yonder cometh duke bretayne englyſſhmen nat paſt two leages hen trūpet ſowned retrayte drewe abacke toke horſes ſo departed went campelly whiche nat far then cloſed gate lyfte vp brydges tyme duke bretayne come thyder barones englande company paſt ye newe fortreſſe hadde ſpoken ſir johan deureux thāked comyng el ben ſoone taken ſo duke layde ſiege towne campelly ſet forthe archer brigātes well paueſſed made great aſſaut englyſſhemen fayned nat dyd within ther dyuers hurte bothe partes euery day aſſaute elles ſkrymyſſhe within ſawe well howe coulde nat long endur ſawe ſocours comyng alſo ſawe well yt coulde nat yſſue departe fortreſſe ſo cloſed euery ſyde alſo knewe well taken byforce ſhulde haue mercy ſpecially lorde clyſſon thenglyſſhmen hated hym ſo ſore thā lordes bretayn within began entreat duke yelde ſelfe vp vpon courtes raunſome duke wolde haue ſymply ſo moche payne laſt gat areſpyte viii dayes duryng ſame reſpyte fell well within fortereſſe two knyghtes england one ſir nicholas carſuell ſir water durſwyke ſent duke bretayne fro duke lancaſtre cōmaundyng vertue treatie peace made brugꝭ bitwene kyng england ye frenche kyng wherof brought charter ſealed trewce without delay ſight leaue make warre incontynent truce reed publyſſhed hooſt alſo ſhewed within cāpelly wherof right ioyfull ſay lorde cliſſon vicont rohan lorde beaumanoyre ye trewce came well thus brake vp ſiege cāpelly ye duke bretayn gaue leaue departe except ſuche dayly houſe ſo went alroy wyfe erles cā bridge marche ſir thomas holande erle irelande lorde spenſer englyſſhmen retourned agayne englande whan duke bretayn ordred beſyneſſe great leaſer refreſſhed towne caſtell breeſt alroy retourned agayne englande wyfe hym ſame day trewce made bruges endur hole yere bytwene kynges englande fraunce alies duke burgoyne one parte duke lancaſtre parte ſware come thyder agayn feeſt alſayntꝭ eche parte ſhulde holde enioye euery thyng poſſeſſion ſaid terme englyſſhmen thought ſaynt sauiour vicount ſhulde ſaued reaſon treatie frenchman ſayd fyrſt couynant ſhulde paſſe laſt ordynance whan day aproched ofſaynt sauyoure ſhulde yelde vp el reſcued frendes french kyng ſent thyder great nombre men warre vi thouſande ſpeares knightes ſquiers beſyde people none came thyder reyſe ſiege whā day expyred ther yelded vp frenchlordes full ſore agaynſt wylles yt fortereſſe well ſittyng englyſſhmen capitayne ſir thomas tynet johan de bourc thre bretherne malurier engliſſhmen went carentyn ſo toke ſhyppynge retourned englande conſtable fraunce newe refreſſhed fortereſſe ſaynt saluyour vicount ſette breton knight capitayne therin vnderſtode ſo frenche kynge gyuen ſeignorie iorney lorde coucy made auſtrych deth prince wale howe coulde founde maner treatie peace bitwene two kyngꝭ alſo dethe kynge englande edwarde thyrde cap ccc xiiii ſame ſeaſon come fraūce lord coucy ben longe lūbardy erle uertue ſonne ſir galea makyng warre againſt ſir barnabo alies bycauſe pope gregory xi holy colledge rome lorde coucy ſucceſſion mother ſuſter duke auſtryche laſt diſſeaſed wherby ought enheryter duchy duke deed without iſſue waye maryage auſtrich gyuen duchy lande another farther lynage lorde coucy wherof lorde coucy hadde often tymes complayned emperour lorde charles behayne thēperour knewe well yt lorde coucy right therto howe might nat eaſe conſtrayne thē auſtryche ſtrong countre many good men warre lorde coucy made warre conforte aunt ſuſter duke lytell auayled whan thus cōe fraunce kyng made great chere aduyſed ſawe well howe fraunce many men warre ſatte ydell wherfore thought coude nat better ocupyed helpe right durynge trewce bytwene fraunce england lorde couey deſy •• kyng let haue breton ſuch ouer ronne realme make warre hym auſtryche kyng wolde gladly companyons hys realme accorded deſyre kynge lende gaue nat tell wheder lx thouſāde frankes departe among ſayd companyons rode forthe warde auſtryche ye feeſt ofſaynt michell dyd moche yuell wayes w • alſo ther dyuers baron knyghtes ſquiers fraūce arthoys uermandoys haynaulte 〈…〉 rdy vicountes meaul • daunoy ſir ra • e co •• • arone roy peter bare dyuers deſyring 〈◊〉 bodyes get honour whan feaſt alſayntes began aproche thā came agayn bruges entreate peace fro frenche kynge duke burgoyn erle sal • bruce byſſhoppe • n duke •• lay 〈◊〉 atſaynt omers • ro kynge englande thyder came duke lancaſtre duke bretayne erle sal • ſbury y• byſſhop london towne bruges well garnyſſhed dyuers aſtates ſpecially duke burgoyn kept noble aſtate duke lan • aſtre ther ser robert namur kept good company longe duke flaunders ther ambaſſadours archebyſſhop rohan byſſhoppe carpētras went ſtyll laboured bytwene bothe • tie layd forthe many good reaſons none came effecte theſe lordes farre ſondre treaty frenche kynge demaunded haue agayne 〈◊〉 hundred thouſande frankes whiche payed redempcion kyng john̄ haue cala • rayſed beaten downe whiche kyng englande wolde neuer conſent ſo y• trewce contynued feeſt ſaynt johan baptyſt next yere lorde thouſande thre hundred lxxvi ſo theſe lordes • aryed ſtyll bruges wynter ſomer returned euery part owne coūtreis except duke bretayne taryed ſtyll flaunders erle loys coſyn made gode cher ¶ ſame ſeaſon trynite ſonday paſt worlde •• oure chi • alry englande edwarde prince wale • tayne kynges pala • weſtmynſter beſyde london ſo enbawmed put leed kept tyll feaſt ſaynt michaell next entred greatter ſolē • ytie whan parliament ſhulde ther kyng charles fraunce bycauſe lynage dyd obſequy reuerently holy chapell paleys parys many prelate noble realme fraūce ſo truce prolōged firſt day aprill next let v ſomwhat ſpeke lorde coucy almayns whan auſtriche almayns vnderſtode lorde coucy cōe ſuch ſtrength make warre cauſed brent diſtroyed thre dayes • ourney countre along ryuer went mountayns place inhabytable ſo whā lorde cou • wende haue founde vytayle hooſt coude get none wherby ſuffred wynter moche trouble dyſeaſe wyſt nat whyder go forage gette vitayle • horſes ſo ſome dyed hūger colde ſickneſſe therfore whan ſpringyng tyme began returned agayne fraunce went dyuers place refreſſhe ſelfe frenche kyng ſent mooſt parte cō panyons bretayne baſe normandy • yde reſt thought well ſhulde haue ſōwhat ſhort tyme retournyng lorde cou • fraunce began good frenche bicauſe • ounde kyng ſo amyable condiſcende deſyre alſo counſayle ſayd ne •• nat voide heritage vnder ſhadowe kyng englandes warr ſayd frenche name blode armes extraction ſent wyfe englande kept ſtyll eldeſt doughter left yonger ſtyll englande wher ſhe brought vp noriſſhed▪ y• frenche kyng ſent lorde coucy bruges ther entreate peace • great lordes nat onely duke bretayne ſtyll coſyn therle flaunders buſyed ſelfe lytle treatie peace feeſt ſaynt mychaell whan obſequy prince done fyniſſhed kyng englande made knowen 〈◊〉 ▪ duke lācaſtre erle cambridge lorde thom̄s yongeſt baron erles prelatꝭ knightes englande howe yonge richarde ſhulde kyng diſceaſe ſo cauſed ſwere ſolemly maynteyne chriſtmas day kyng made hym ſytte table aboue owne chyldren great eſtate repreſentyng ſhulde ky ••• alter diſceaſe ſent bruges kyng englandes parte john̄ lorde cobham byſſhoppe herforde mayre london frenche partie thyder came erle salebruche lorde chaſtellon maiſter phylbert leſ 〈…〉 two byſſhoppes embaſſadr • alwayes went bytwene party treatynge peace ſpake mariage bytwene yong prince englande lady • doughter frenche kyng ſo departed aſwell fraūce englande ſo made report bothe kynges lent ſecrete treatie 〈◊〉 bytwene two kyngesat moutrell ſee ſo ſent kynge englande calais ſir rycharde dangle rycharde stan ge •• ray cha •• er▪ fro frenche kyng ſent lorde cou • riuyer ſir nycholas braque nycholas braſier along ſeaſon treated ſayd mariage frenchman offered enfourmed dyuers thyng • wolde haue agayne otherthynges ſuche named el nothyng theſe entreatours went made report lordꝭ ſo trewce agayne relonged fyrſt day maye ſo came agayne calais erle saliſbury y• byſſhop ſaynt dauyd chaūcellour englande byſſhoppe herforde frenche kynge muttrell lorde coucy ſir wylliam dormans chaūcellour fraūce durſt neuer truſt mete toguy • er place bytwene mutterell cal ••• bytwene mutterell boleyn fronters thyng two byſſhoppes embaſſadours coude orſhewe thus theſe entreatours abode aſtate tyll 〈◊〉 expyred whan warr open ſir hughe caurell ſent kepar calais whan pope gregoriebeynge 〈…〉 • non vnderſtod peace coude • wene fraūce england right ſorouſull ordred buſyneſſe ſhortly went rome whan duke breten • e • yere erle flaūders coſyn ſawe ye warr open toke leaue therle wēt grauelyng thyder came therle saliſbury ſir rycharde dangle ſo went calais ther taryed ſpace moneth ſo went englande came shene 〈◊〉 foure leages fro london long temmes ſyde kynge englande laye ſore ſy • ke paſt worlde 〈◊〉 gyll ofſaynt john̄ baptyſt y• yere lorde thouſande thre hundred lxxvii great ſorowe made englande incontynent paſſages realme ſtoppedde none ſhulde yſſue realme wolde nat dethe kyng ſhuld ſo ſoone knowen fraunce tyll haddeſet realme ſome ordre ſame tyme ther came englande erle saliſbury ſir rycharde dangle body kyng edwarde thirde great proceſſyons • ynges lamentacyons ſonnes behynde hym noble prelate englande brought long cytie london open viſage weſtmynſter buried beſyde quene wyfe anon yong kyng richard crowned palays weſtmynſter great ſolem • ytie ſtode duke lā •• llre bretayne xi yere age moneth july whiche day made four erles nyne knightes firſt lorde nycholas vncle made • rle • olengy lorde percy erle northumberlande ſir thomas dangle erle huntyngdon lorde mombray erle notyngham yonge kyng putte vnto rule gentyll knyght ſir rycharde dangle accorde lande inſtru • ted noble vertues realme englande gouerned duke lancaſtre ſoone frenche kynge knewe dethe kynge edwarde ſayd howe • yght • obly valiantly hadde reyg • ed well ought putte newly remem • raunce amonge nombre worthyes aſſembled great nombre noble prelatꝭ realme dyd obſ • quy ye holy chapell palys paris anone dyed ye eldeſt doughter frenche kyng enſured haue maryed wylliam heynault eldeſt ſonne duke aubert ¶ howe frēche kyng ſent great nauy ſee howe dyuers townes brent englande howe duke burgoyne tooke dyuers caſtels calys cap ccc xv meane ſeaſone whyle ſayd trewce endured frenche kyng ꝓuyded greatly ſhyppes andgaleys kynge spayne ſent admyrall ſir ferraunt sauſe ſir johan de uien admyrall fraunce whan tre wee expired went brent towne rye four dayes dethe kyng edwarde vigill ſaynt peter july ſlewe men woman founde theſe tidynges came london therles cambridge bouligney went douer great nombre men warre erle saliſbury lorde montagu went march towarde hāpton french army toke laude ile ubyq̄ brent therm dyuers wnes lamēd dartmouth plomouthe pleſume dyuers whan brente pylled towne ubique went agayne ye ſee coſted forewarde came porte called poc redy erle saliſbury lorde montague defended paſſage howebeit brente parte towne poc toke ſee agayne coſted towardes hāpton wolde dayly haue taken lande englande englyſſhmen company erle saliſbury rode ſo dayly alonge ſee coſt kept euer fro takyng lande ye frenchman came hāpton redy ſir johan arūdell great nombre men warre archer defended towne elles ben taken frenchman departed went towarde douer toke lande day 〈◊〉 lytle abbay called lians ther many men countre aſſembled hadde made priour place ſir thomas cheyny johan fuſelle chefe capitayns ſet ſelfe good array defende paſſage ſo frēchmen ſmall aduauntage coſte moche people coulde take lande fynally force good fightyng toke lande ther ſore ſcrimyſſhe howe beit englyſſhmen dryuen backe putte flyght two hundred ſlayne two knightes priour taken priſoners frenche men entred agayne ſhippes lay ſtyll night ancre abbey frenche men knewe firſt dethe kynge edwarde englande priſonners coronacyon kyng richarde great parte ordre made englande rulynge realme ſir johan uyenne cauſed barke departe ſent therin knight aryued harflewe knight rode parys founde kynge ſhewed hym certayne tidynges deth kyng edwarde whiche ſayeng kynge gaue credence frenchman ſpanyardes departed ſayled forthe wynde wyll came ſame tyde threof clocke douer ſir edmonde erle cambridge ſir thomas brother erle buckynghame redy hundred thouſande baners diſplayed abydinge frenchman ſixſcore ſhippes galyes frenchemen came foreby porte taryed nat paſſed toke depe ſee ſee began ebbe howe beit englyſſhmen taryed ſtyll day nextnight frenche men nexte tyde came hauen calays entred ye haue herde ſir johan captall beufz taken priſoner soubiſe kept towre tēple parys kyng england prince whyle lyued wolde gladly haue hym delyuered ther alſo moche entreatie made coūſell bruges ther offred exchange yong erle ſaynt poule thre four knyghtes frenche kyng coūſayle wolde nat cōſent therto howbeit french kyng made ſhewed priour hym kepyng y• wolde ſwere neuer beare armes agaynſt ye crowne fraunce wolde condiſcende delyuerance captall anſwered wold neuer make othe dye priſon ſo abode priſon ſure kepynge v yere lytell ioye toke priſonment lytell pacyence ſo long laſt dyed priſon french kyng cauſed hym entered ryght ſolemply therat dyuers barownes knightes prelate fraūce thus feblyſſed thengliſſh capitaynes y• ſame yere dyed alſo lorde spenſar great baron englande good knight hym wyfe doughter ſir bartylmewe brunes abode ſonne four doughters anone dethe ſayde captall frenche quene delyuered fayre doughter named mary whiche byrthe quene toke ſuche ſickneſſe ye ſhe dyed quene full noble vtues doughter gentyll duke burbone lorde peter dyed batayle poycters obſequy done abbay ſaynte denyſe ſhe buryed great ſolempnyte wherat ther nighe ye noble prelate fraunce namely marcheſſe parys ſeaſon ſir hughe caurell capitayne calais ſir john̄ harlſton capitayn guynes lorde gomegines capitayne arde made many iourneys picardy euery weke thre four often tymes ran ſaynt omers arkes moton fyēnes therabout boloyne ſomtyme tyrwyn ſpecially garyſon arde dyde moche hurt countre wherof complayntes came oftentymes herynge frenche kyng whervpon toke coūſayle knowe might beſt reſtrayn ſhewed hym howe ye garyſon arde nat ſo ſtronge might eaſely begoten kyng ſayd haue wyll ſpare coſt within lytell ſpace made ſomōs men warre ſecretely man wyſt whider wolde ſende chefe duke burgoyne brother xv hundred ſpeares well furnyſſhed ſodenly cāe baſtyde arde beſieged rounde duke burgoyne erle guynes marſhall blanuyle lordes clyſſon lauall rougemont ryuer bregyde frannyll danuyll dautoyng raueuall angeſt ſir james burbone ſeneſhall heynalte dyuers knightes barones engyns caſt nyght day ſtones two hundred weight aſſayled right feirſly lorde gomegynes lorde fortereſſe whan ſawe hym ſelfe encloſed ſo many noble men warre promyſed wonne aſſaut thoſe hym ſhulde dye alſo nat well prouyded artillary longe endure ſo procurement lorde raneuall coſyn germayn entred treaty yelde vp garyſon lyues goodꝭ ſaued treaty long makyng howe beit laſt fortereſſe gyuen vp ſuche wolde departed brought calais ſir gawen bayllule ſir wylliam bourdes made capitayne ard • kepar long tyme vicount meaulx thirdly capitayne ther lord sampy ſame day arde delyuered duke went layd ſiege caſtell arduyche wherin capitayns thre bretherne mauluryer duke lay thre dayes made dyuers aſſautes laſt within yelded vp caſtell brought calys marſhall frā ce duke went beſieged uauclinen whiche alſo yelded vp dyde whan duke newe refreſſhed theſe place vitayls men gaue lycence euery man departe ſo wēt himſelfe fraunce kynge lordes breton went bretayne tidynges brought duke bretayne aryued breſt great army lordes burgoyne place retourned euery man owne ¶ howe warre began agayn bytwene frēche kyng kyng nauerre howe kynge nauer loſt coūtie deureux except chierbourge whiche beſeged frenchman iorney duke lancaſtre made bretayne cap ccc xvi haue herde y• peace made uernon bytwene frenche kyng kyng nauar howe kynge nauar left two ſonnes vncle frenche kyng ther great ſuſpect layde ſquyer beyng frenche kynges court attendyng two ſonnes kyng nauarr ſquyer called james rue alſo clerke great maiſter kyng nauars coūſayle great gouernour countie deuxeux called maiſter peter tartre iuged dethe ſo cruelly executed parys ther ſhewed people howe mynde haue enpoyſoned frenche kynge kyng reared vp great army men warr made cōſtable chefe leader lorde de la ryuer dyuers baron knightes ſo went normādy fortreſſes caſtels kyng nauarre whiche fayre noble well garnyſſhed ſo layd ſiege fortereſſe called ponteau de mere dyuers gōnes engyns ablemētes ſaut whet troubled ſore fortereſſe within howbeit dyde defende ſelfe valiantly ther dyuers ſautes ſcrimyſſhes longe ſpace durynge ſiege caſtell ſore bruſed wtin ſore oppreſſed deſyred oftentymes conſtable gyue vp fortereſſe elles yf taken force promyſed thē ſhulde dye cuſtomably ſuche cōſtables promyſe naueroyſe ſawe vitayls began myniſſhe knewe well howe kyng nauer farr fro ſo yelded vp fortreſſe cōueyed chierbourge goodꝭ thē fortreſſe raſed beaten downe erthe whiche coſt moche makynge therof alſo walles pōteau de mere beaten downe frenchman went beſieged fortreſſe mortayne lay great ſeaſon within ſaw maner ayde confort comyng fro kynge nauarr alſo fortereſſes nat able make reſyſtence agaynſt frenchman ſo gaue vp dyd ſame ſeaſon cōſtable brought frenche kynges obeyſaunce townes caſtelles fortreſſes countie deureur fortereſſes beaten downe erthe townes vncloſed thentent ſhulde neuer ryſe warre vnto realme fraunce meanes caſtell towne y• kyng nauer ſhulde haue countie deureux alſo frē che kynge made gabelles ſubſydies rynne aſwell parte realme fraunce alſo ſame tyme kyng spaygne made baſtarde brother entre nauarr great nombre men warre began wynne countre aſſayled townes fortreſſes ſo yt kyng nauerr coude make reſyſtence agaynſt ſent worde therof yonge kyng richarde englande deſyring ayde agaynſt frenche kynge countie deureux ſelfe abyde ſtyll nauar kepe fortreſſes ther agaynſt kyng spaygne ſo kyng richarde aduyſe counſayle ſent ſir robert • roux nombre men armes archer ſee toke lande chierbourc thyder came thoſe ben put fortreſſes countie deureux frenche conſtable whan ther togyder great nombre choſen men ſo prouyded well fortreſſe beleued beſeged whan conſtable lorde de la ryuer cōpany coūtie deureux ſo nothyng left aparant kyng nauer vncloſed vnder obeyſance french king thā cāe chierbourc ſtrong nobly foūded firſt julyus ceſar whan cōquered englande port ſee frenchman layed ſiege rounde except ſee ſyde ſo determyned nat departe then tyll sir robert de roux cōpany within made many iſſues day night ther ther day nyght ſcrimyſſhe frenchman coude ſeke dede armes founde ynowe euer anſwere thē many ſlayne taken aſwell one parte durynge ſiege whiche laſted remynaunt ſommer thanne ſir olyuere cleſquy made day buſſhement ſo began ſcrimiſſhe frenche men driuen backe buſſhment ſir olyuer cleſquy cāe enbuſſhment ranne feirlly thenglyſſhmen naueroyes ther harde encoūtre bothe party many man borne y• erthe ſlayne hurte taken reſcued fynally ſir olyuer cleſquy taken priſoner aſquier nauer called john̄ coq ſo put chierbourge ſo ſcrymyſſhe ended domage y• frenchman engliſſhmen ſir olyuer ſent englande abode priſoner long ſpace london put raunſome thus great coſt charge frenchemen abode ſtyll great parte y• wynter lytell conqueſt ſo ſawe well loſt tyme lyeng ther thought well chierbourc inprignable alwayes might newe refreſſhed vitayls men ſee wherfore frenchemen diſlodged layde counter garyſons agaynſt chierbource mountbourge pount done charentyn ſaynt lou ſaynt saluiour vicount euery man badde leaue deꝑte y• yere lorde thouſande thre hundred lxxviii ye haue well harde howe duke bretayne departed bretayn hym wyfe englande ſo abode ſuche laude englande whiche called countie richemont laboured ſore yong kyng richarde coū ſayle haue helpe ayde recouer lande agayne whiche tourned frenche coude nat herde ſame ſeaſon duke lancaſtre enfourmed wolde go bretayne great armye dyuers fortereſſes caſtels wolde yelde vp ſpecially ſaynt malo iſle fayre fortreſſe hauen ſee duke lancaſtre reyſed vp army went hampton ſo toke ſee great nombre lordes knightꝭ men warre archer ſo ſayled forthe tyll came ſaynt malos toke lande diſcharged purueyance ſo layd ſiege aboute towne ſaynt malo within y• towne nothyng afrayd well prouyded vitayls men warr croſ bowes valiantly defended thē ſelfe ſo duke lay longe ſpace whan conſtable fraunce lorde cliſſon knewe therof made great ſommons men warre cāe towarde ſaynt malos reyſe ſiege man wolde haue thought dyuers tymes y• batayle ſhulde haue bytwene party englyſſhmen often tymes ordred themſelfe redy gyue batayle conſtable lorde clyſſon wolde neuer aproche ſo nere y• batayle myght bytwene thē ſo whan engliſſhmen ben ther great ſpace ſawe well towne hadde wyll yelde vp duke lancaſtre counſayle diſloge ſeyng loſt tyme lyeng ſo toke agayne ſee returned englande gaue leaue euery man departe ¶ howe caſtell alroy bretayne yelded vp frenche frenche garyſon layd mountbourge agaynſt garyſon chierbourc cap ccc xvii tyme caſtel alroy poſſeſſion duke bretayn lay ſtyll englande frenche kynge ſent dyuers lordes fraunce bretayne great nombre ley ſiege caſtell alroy alroy knewe ſocour comyng thē fro parte wherfore fell treatie ſo y• nat ſocoured duke bretayne kyng england certayn day lymytted yelde vp place whiche treaty agreed day came frenchman kept iourney none pered nother fro duke bretayne fro kyng englande caſtell gyuen vp put vnder obeyſaūce frēche kyng caſtels good townes bretayne ſo deꝑted fro alroy ſuche • duke bretayne ¶ yere lorde thouſande thre hū dred lxxviii anone eaſter kyng charles fraunce ſawe well howe chierbourc made ſore warre countie conſtantyne ordeyned ſir wyll •• bordes valiant knight good capitayne keper ſouerayne capityne conſtantyne fortreſſes ther chierbourc ſo ſayd ſir wyllim̄ fayre company men armes croſ bowes genowayes wente laye mountbourge made counter garyſon agaynſt chierbourc deſired nothyng ſo moche fight englyſſhmen chierbourc cō ſydering howe hym floure men armes garyſons ſame ſeaſon ſent capitayne chierbourc engliſſhe knight called ſir john̄ harlſton whome haue often ſpoken ben long ſpace capitayne guyens toke ſhippyng hāmpton iii hūdred men armes many archer ſo arryued chierbourc ſir othes grantſon engliſſhmen ther ſir johan aubourge ſir john̄ orſell dyuers knyghtes ſquyers aſſoone arryued diſcharged horſes baggage taryed ther certayne dayes made redy ryde abrode coūtre make warr alſo ſir wylliam brodes frenche partie imagyned nyght day howe myght domage englyſſhmen ſame ſeaſon theſe two knightes layd many buſſhementis eche aueyled nothyng nat fortune mete ſomtyme ſome companyes met togyder rode ſekyng aduentures mette often tymes ouerthrewe eche ſomtyme frenchman wanne ſomtyme loſt long rode forthe layd wayte eche mornyng ſir wylliam bordes garyſon montbourge thought ryde forthe towarde chierbourc fyght ſir johan harlſtone yf myght encounter hym drawe felde ſo rode forth withall company puyſſaūce aſwell men armes croſbowes mē fote parte ſir john̄ harlſton knewe nothyng frenchman wer abrode alſo great deſire ryde forthe ſame mornyng ſo ſowned trumpettes cauſed cō pany armed aſwell horſebacke fote ſo went feldes ordayned ſhulde byde fortereſſe ſo rode forthe great array ordayned ſir orſell capitayne fotemen ordeyned currours likewiſe ſo done ſir wylliam bordes ſo long bothe party rode forthe laſt currours cā • ſo nere toguyder eche thē aduyſed well ſo eche retourned owne hooſt reported certayntie enemyes theſe two capitaynes right ioyouſe founde longe ſought whan theſe two capitayne herde reporte courrours drue companyes togyder diſplayed baners ſtanderdꝭ aproched eche ſoone nere togyder within ſhotte bowe frēchmen lighted lykewiſe dyde englyſſhemen archer croſ bowes began ſhote men armes aproched ſpeares handes rainged well cloſed gyder aſſembled togyder ꝑtes began foyne ſpeares ſtryke ax ſwexdes ſore harde bataile well fought men armes proued well valyātiſe prowes sir wylliam bordes armed peſes axe hande ſtrikyng right ſyde lyft whome ſoeuer gaue full ſtroke went erthe ther dyd ſuche dedes armes owne body • hat ought prayſed foreuer ſyde ſir johan harlſtone capitayne chierbourc fought valiantly axe hād fote amonge formaſt ynough matched hard parte many valyant dede done day many man ſlayne hurte ſir johan harlſton borne downe erthe great aduēture lyfe force armes reſcued batayle endured long ſpace well fought well contynued bothe ꝑties ther none great aduauntage dyuers ſlayne hurte bothe party fynally englyſſhmen fought ſo long ſo good hertes obtayned place frenchman diſconfyted ſlayne taken fewe noble men ſayed ſo ſore fought withall power departe thinkyng outher dye el vāqueſſhe enemyes taken ser wylliam bordes ſquyer heynault called wylliam de beaulyau man armes long lyen among englyſſhmen garyſon calais whome ſayde ſir wylliam yelded ſelfe right ſoroufull iourney nat ben ther thengliſſhmen brought frenchman great myſchefe many taken priſoners thende ye batayle great pytie thē deed whan thenglyſſhmen diſpoyled deed men ſir john̄ harlſton cōpany departed fro place leyde priſoners ſpoyle ſo went agayne chierbourc ye may well knowe engliſſhmen made
