ſo ſtyll tyll fayre day ſayeng eche ſhall ſe whan day flemynges wyll come ſtrēgth aſſayle v whan come let v crye cryes one voyce euery man owne crye orels lordꝭ thogh ſo lordes nat ſuche cryes ſhall abaſſhe lette v ſtryke among good courage wyll god gyue v grace diſconfyte yuell armed haue good ſpeares well heeded good ſwerdes habergyns beare ſhall nat defende thus good conforte abode night y• conſtable ſyde ryuer towarde lyſle great feare hert thē wyſſhed hym ſelfe puiſſaūce within ye towne comynes marſhals burgoyn flaunders ſayd conforte hym sir nothynge abaſſhed paſſed ouer choſed men warre valyaunt great wyſdome wyll nothyng good order diſcrecyon sir wyll nat fight day night nere aprochynge ſir ye haue abādoned paſſage paſſe wyll morowe aſſoone day ſhall oure beſte paſſe bridge haue prouyded daye woode tymbre ſhall nede truſt ſhall ſoone ouer reconforte haue nede yonder vnhappy people ſhall nat endure agaynſt v thus cōſtable recōforted ſayeng ſuche valyant ꝑſons cō pany ¶ howe frenche men paſſed ryuer lyſe diſconfyted flemyngꝭ ſlewe many thē wan paſſage comynes cap cccc xv peter de boyſe knewe well theſe mē armes maryſſe nere ioyning comynes thought ſelfe ſuretie bycauſe knewe natte thēde ſhulde ſawe well y• cōpany ſixe ſeuyn thouſande men ſayd thē sir yonder men armes haue paſſed ryuer nat made ſtele haue laſte day traueyled nyght ſtamped myre thinke nowe brekyng vp newe mornyng beſt ſet men ynoughe cloſe thèm rounde beate one ther none wyll medyll v let v make noyſe tyll tyme come feate otherſyde french knightes maryſſes nat farre fro enemyes nat eaſe ſtode ſo myre ſōe ancles ſome mydde legge howe greate pleaſure deſyre cōquere paſſage honour made forget payne traueyle yf bene somer wynter ben pleaſure theym erthe colde wete nightes long ſome tyme rayned heedes whiche ran downe baſſenettes ſtode euer redy fight loked euer whan̄e ſhulde aſſayled remembraunce wherof made forgette paynes lorde ſaynt pye aquyted ſelfe right nobly formaſt euer went priuely ſpye ſe harken dealyng enemyes whan retourned ſhewed companye howe noyſe amonge sayeng paraduenture bycauſe wyll redy purpoſe thus wente ſpye enemyes dyde tyll laſt breakyng day flemynges plumpe without maner noyſe came ſoftely towarde maryſe whanne lorde ſaynt pye watchyng ſawe certaynly comyng cam company ſayd sir let v ſette enemyes comynge hande come fayre ſoftely without noyſe wenyng ſette v beware therfore nowe lette v ſhewe ourſelfe lyke men warre incōtynent ſhall haue batayle thoſe wordes euery man apparelled hymſelfe redy ſet ſelfe good order coude deuyſed ſo whan aproched made cryes apoynted receyued flemmynges ſpeare poyntes ſuche wyſe ye mayle cootes coulde holde two thre folde clothe wolde haue doone conſtable fraunce herde well crye noyſe ſayd sir ſurely company fightynge god ayde canne nat tyme thus frenche men receyued flemynges ye good ſpeare heedes burdeaux whiche went throughe habergyns ſhulders bellyes heedes ſuche wyſe flemyngꝭ gaue backe frenche men wanne grounde peter de boyſe formaſt front hurt ſpeare ſhulder alſo heed bene deed without remedy men nat ſaued hym xxx gret varlettes whome apoynted wayte euer owne perſon ſo toke hym armes bare preaſe myre ſo great euery man waded mydde leg men armes bene vſed great feates armes beate downe flemynges ſlewe without mercy cryed ſaynt pye lauall sanxere rieux anghien cryes flē myngꝭ began abaſſhed diſcomfyted began recule backe fall one vpon nother frenche men entred among thyckeſt ſpared ſlee thē ben dogges ſurely good cauſe ſo ye flemynges achyued priſe ouer bene ſerued ſame ſauce ¶ whan flemynges ſawe howe aſſayled ſo valyauntly men armes conquered cauſey bridge determyned ſet fyre owne towne two cauſes one thentent cauſe frenchman recule backe ſecondly cauſe owne company alſo recule backe towne deuyſed ſo dyd put fyre dyuers howſes towne thynkynge therby haue abaſſhed enemyes whiche auayled nothynge frenchman valyauntly dyd ſo purſewed ſtyll betyng ſleyng ſlemynges forſoke towne entred feldes drewe togyder ſent ye countrey ſtyrre reyſe vp people uertaygne propringne uergues rolers meſiers warneſton townes cauſe come comynes belle began braule wherby myght well knowen ther beſyneſſe hande ſo ſome drewe noyſe ſome went ſaue themſelfe goodes ipre courtrey woman child forſoke houſes left beſtes corne mouables behynde ſome went towarde comy ne ayde company fyghting ye meane ſeaſon whyle theſe frēchmen paſſed ryuer liſe lytell barkes hande enemyes conſtable great bande vowarde dyd myght paſſe ye bridge great preaſe bycauſe conſtable hadde abandoned paſſage euery man ſo wolde aduenture euery man preaſed forthe lette paſſe theſe lordes paſſed ſame day ye bridge moch parell fayne lay paueſſes targes ioyſtes bridg paſſe ouer ſame nyght cauſed brought two lode nayles greatly dyd helpe amende y• bridge ſo within ſhort tyme bridge made agayne good ſtronge ſo company paſſed ouer ſame tuiſday mornynge ſo fought paſſage therle flaunders vnderſtode howe fought paſſage comynes ſent thyder ſixe thouſande men fote ayd company came done ye bridge newe made conſtable ſent bridge warneſton make bridge agayn caryage myght eaſly paſſe ouer ¶ howe french kynge paſſed ryuer lyſe howe philyppe dartuell made ordynaunce reſyſt kyng puiſſance cap cccc xvi tidynges came tuiſdaye kynge abbey marquetes vncles howe ye paſſage comynes conquered vowarde paſſed ouer wherof greatly reioyſed thā ordeyned kyng ſhulde paſſe ſo harde maſſe lordes alſo dranke lept horſes ſo toke way comynes voward delyuered towne clene fro flemynges ſlayne ſtretes feldes four thouſande beſyde thoſe kylled ye chaſe mylles church hyden ſelfe feare ſone breton ouer lept horſes entred chaſe fynde flemynges ouer ryn countrey whiche fat ryche lorde ryeux lorde de lauall lorde maleſtroyt vycount bellyer lorde comborte company rode ſo long came uerayne agreat towne whiche anon taken brent within put dethe ther breton great pillage profite lykewiſe ſo ſpredde brode countrey founde houſes full clothe fethers cloth golde ſyluer flemynges truſt ſtrength comynes nat voyded goodes countrey breton entred fyrſt countre dyd ſet thyng clothe ryches ye golde ſyluer founde ſuche came toke left thyng behynde fyſſhe came net ye may well knowe tydinges wyll anon ſpredde abrode ſame tuiſday worde cāe philyp dartuell lay ſiege andewarpe howe frenchman paſſed ryuer lyſe barkes ye monday howe conquered paſſage comynes howe ther ſixe thouſande menne ſlayne thought peter de boyſe alſo ſlayne theſe tidynges philypp̄ greatly abaſſhed began greatly marueyle demaūded lorde harſels beſt anſwered ſayd go gaūt aſſemble togyder men ye gette towne come hyder agayn ſo youre puyſſaunce drawe towarde courtrey whan kyng vnderſtandeth ye come ſo ſtronglye wyll aduyſed come moche farther countrey alſo truſt ſhall ſhortlye tidynges fro oure company englande may ſo kynge englande vncles wyll paſſe ſee great puyſſaunce ſōe thē whiche ſhall come well paſſe v marueyle greatly quod philyppe dartwell englyſſhe men tary ſo long seyng knowe frenche men entred countre wotte nat mean therby ſpecially marueyle owne men nat fro thē howe ſoeuer wyll go gaunt fetche ye rerebande ſo ſhall come agayne fight frē che kyng whatſoeuer come therof enformed howe kynge hath twentie thouſande men armes whiche mounteth lx thouſande men warre ſhall bringe many agaynſt hym batayle yf pleaſe god grace yt may diſcōfyte hym wt good ryght haue ſhalbe mooſt honoured lorde worlde diſcōfyted great fortune hath fallen gretter lorde thus philyppe dartuell lorde harſels toguyder deuyſinge ther came certayne perſons ſuche bene batayle comynes verifyed ye haue herde than̄e philyppe dartuell ſayd peter du boyſe deed lyue anſwered ſayd sir nat deed ſore hurt batayle gone bruges ſo therwith philyp lepte horſe xxx men hym toke way gaūt went lytell way ſe certayne men yt deed garyſon andwarpe iſſued ſame night make ſcrye hooſt ſo ther xii ſlayne ſtode behelde ſawe haraude comyng gaunt warde belongyng kyng englande called irelande comyng haraude philyppe right ioyefull bycauſe came englande demaūded hym tidynges sir quod haraude fyue yor men knight englande called ſir wyllyam fermeton come gaunt acorde kynge englande vncles generally conſent realme englande haue brought letter enformed whiche letter comyth regent flaunders whan ye knowe letter conteyne great alyances ye ſhall haue englande men one retourned ye ſhall knowe •• oforte ye ſhall haue thē well quod philyppe ye •• otente moche deuyſing feare wyll late go way hooſt lodgynge ſo brought lorde harſels philyppe rode forthe gaunt ryght penſyfe ſuche wyſe man coude haue worde hym nowe let v ſpeke frenche kynge let v ſhewe howe parceyuered whan harde howe ye paſſage comynes bridge newe made departed fro abbey marquette ſo rode forth towardꝭ comynes good order euery man degre kyng came ſame tuyſday comynes vncles lodged towne vowarde dyſlodged went lodged mount ipre ſo people caryage paſſed comynes warneſtone wedniſday kynge came lodged ſame mount ipre ſāe wedniſday rerewarde paſſed ye bridge comynes wherin two thouſande men armes two thouſande croſbowes erle ewe erle bloyſe erle ſaynt powle erle harcourt lorde chatelon lorde ſere gouernours thē whan night yt lordes thoght haue reſted thē traueyle fell ſodenly larum ſkrye ſo lordes thought ſurely haue batayle thought flemynges ipre caſſell bergues bene gadred togyder come gyue batayle theſe lordes armed agayne ſet baſſe nettes ſet forthe baners penons ordred men euery man vnder owne enſygnes thus ſtoode nygh nyght myre myde legge theſe lordes endured moche payne erle bloyſe nat bene acuſtomed ſuffre ſuch cold ſuch longe nyghtes nouēbre ſuffred honour went ſurely haue bene fought incontynent nothing ſkrye aroſe certayne varlettes amonge ſelfe howe theſe lordes endured payne bare well myght ¶ howe towne ipre dyuers put ſelfe vnder obeyſance french kyng ordre kynges hooſt cap cccc xvii thurſday mornyng rerewarde diſlodged fro comynes drue company mount ipre kyng lordes toke counſayle beſt whether ſhulde go ipre courtrey bruges meane ſeaſon french forangers ran ouer countrey founde catayle thynges maruayle conſydre one ouer paſſage comynes lacked thynge whan ipre ſawe kynge puyſſaunce ſo nere paſſage comynes conquered nat well aſſured ſelfe ſo drewe togyder coūſayle rych notable men towne wolde euer ſhulde haue ſent crye kyng mercy ſende hym keyes towne capitayne gaunt ſet ther philyp dartuell wold wyſe ſhulde yelde ſayng ſirs towne ſtronge inough well prouyded may byde ſiege longe ynogh nedebe meane tyme philyppe dartuell regent wyll gather puyſſance come fyght ye kyng rayſe ſiege thinke nat contrary anſwered ſayd nat ſurety thynke nat lye philyppe dartuells power withſtand kyng helpe englyſſhmen whiche nothyng lykely therfore thynke beſt yelde v french kyng none moche roſe wordes bytwene thē roſe agaynſt capitayne ſlewe called peter uanelayre whan ipre hadde done dede cauſed two freres go kynge vncles deſyring kyng wolde take amyable treaty ipre kynge aduyce counſayle gaue ſaue conduct xii ipre abbote come go ſaue knowe wolde deſyre ye frers returned ipre ſo xii choſen towne abbote go kyng ye mount ipre whan came kyng kneled downe offred hym become alwayes vnder obeyſance without meane reſeruacion kyng conſent counſayle yt thought reduce countrey faire meanes myght receyued offre cōdicyon ipre ſhulde pay kynge xl thouſande frankes towardes charge comynge thyder whiche ipre made refuſe ryght ioyfull therof thus ipre taken mercy deſyred kyng vncles come towne refreſſh wherof ſayd towne wolde ryght gladde kyng agreed therto conſyde ryng howe fro then myght go flaunders whiche parte wolde thus ipre returned towne people therof right ioyfull whan knewe receyued mercy ſo anon xl thouſande frankꝭ gadered among payed kynge entred ipre tyme kynge lay ſtyll mount ipre came tydynges howe yt paryſiens rebelled determyned ſayde amonge ſelfe haue beaten downe caſtell beautye ſtandyng wode uyncenes alſo caſtell lowre ſtrong howſes parys thentent yt ſhulde nat greued one amonge thought haue ſaid well ſpake right yuell apered ſayd sir let v nat thus iyll ſuch ſeaſon knowe howe kynge lorde dothe iourney flaūders gaunt come entent truſt ſhall wyll good tyme let v nat begyn thyng afterwarde repent v ſayde called nycholas flemynge ſo wordes paryſiens ſeaſed outrage helde ſelfe ſtyll parys prouided thynges harnes abylmentꝭ richely though bene great lordes harneſſed men cape pe lyke men armes mo thā xxx thouſand many malles dayly cauſed harnes made ſolde euery man wold bye beholde ſe myſchiefe ſhulde haue fallen kyng noble chiualry hym bene diſcomfyted flaūders may well thought noblenes ſhulde haue ben deed loſt fraunce well peraduenture place rebellyon called jaquery neuer ſo great horible likely haue bene lykewiſe reynes chalons champayne ryuer marewe villayns rebelled thretened gentleman ladyes chyldren ſuche abydinge behynde kynge alſo orleance bloys rohan normandy beau uoyſen dyuell entred heeddes haue ſlayne nobleman god nat purueyed remedy ye shall af • hyſtorie nowe let v retourne flaunders whan caſſell bergues bourbourcke grauelyns furnes dunkyrke propringe tourront uaylant meſſyne vnder ſtode howe ipre become frenche yelded vp towne vnder obeyſance frenche kyng gracyouſly receyued theym mercy greatly reioyſed recomforted thus whan̄e well ymagyned theſe ſayd townes toke capitayns bounde faſt thentent ſhulde nat ſkape ſo brought theym mount ipre pleaſe kyng cryed hym mercy knee ſayng noble kyng put bodyes goodes townes vnder youre obeyſance ſir ſhewe playnly ye ryght lorde haue brought chyefe capitayns philyppe dartuell ſette rule v agaynſt wylles obey ſir pleaſure thē ſhall lyke beſt ſir haue ruled v pleaſure kynge counſayled take mercy ſo amonge ſhulde gyue kyng lx thouſande frankes towarde charge therby catayls thynges abrode feldes ſhuld ſaued nat brent diſtroyed whiche cōpoſicion ryght gladde thanked kynge counſayle ſo ſkaped capitayns bene ſette philyp dartuell ſayd townes beheeded mounte ipre theſe apoyntmentes treaty erle flaunders nat made preuy noue nat cal led counſayle somewhat anoyed hym voyage men lay euer wynge bycauſe flemynges ordeyned cōmaunded kynges name payne dethe yt man hooſt ſhulde ſpeke flemyſſhe ¶ howe frenche kynge departed fro moūt ipre howe philyppe dartuell flemynges apareled ſelfe fyght cap cccc xviii whan frenche kyng hooſt vowarde rerewarde lyen mount ipre longe hadde pleaſed men ſolde moche marchādiſe ſuche ſtuffe abrode countrey lyſle doway tourney ſolde franke worthe foure ſome breton yt thought wyn than̄e charged wagans horſes ſtuffe cloth lynen wollen golde ſyluer plate veſſell dyd ſende ſauegarde ouer ryuer lyſe ſome fraunce ſeruauntes kynge went ipre lodged towne many myght refreſſhed fyue ſixe dayes bruges well enfourmed howe ye kyng ipre howe countre grauelynge yelded hym ſo wyſt nat outher yelde nat howbeit dyd tyme mooſt prīcypall cauſe moued thē nat yelde bycauſe hadde agreat nombre men towne philyppe dartuell ſiege andwarpe ye nombre ſeuen thouſande alſo towne gaunt lying hoſtage mooſt notableſt marchauntes bruges entent peter de boyſe ſhulde ſurer rule alſo peter de boyſe peter de myrt monge ſhewyng ſayeng thē thus fayre ſirs good men bruges diſmay nat though kynge come ipre ye knowe well howe auncyently puyſſance ſent kyng philyppe courtrey auncetours diſcomfytted ſlayne lyke wiſe ſo ſhall ſlayn diſconfyted philyppe dartuell hathe great puyſſance wyll nat leaue mater thus wyll fyght kyng may well right fortune fauorabell gaunt ſo nowe may diſcomfyte kyng nat one ſhall ſkape repaſſe agayne ryuer lyſe ſo thus hour countrey wonne agayne ſoo thus ye towne ſhall reputed good true mayntayninge fraunches grace philyp dartuell v gaunt theſe wordes ſuche lyke ſhewed dayly peter de boyſe peter de myrt refrayned bruges fall treatie french kyng meane ſeaſon burgeſſes gaunt bene englāde aryued calayes thē ſir willym̄ fermeton englyſſhe knyght ſent countre flaunders kyng englande conclude flemynges peace taken bytwene thē coun trey capitayne calys ſir johan deluerays ſayd ſirs ye welcome preſent tyme ye may paſſe farther frenche kyng ipre countrey bytwene tourned hym ſhortly ye ſhall tydinges ſayde philyp dartuell aſſembleth power fyght kyng ſhall knowen ſhall haue better flemynges diſcomfyted ye haue nothyng flaunders kyng leſe ye felde thus men gaunt ſir willyam fermeton taryed ſtyll calays ¶ nowe lette v ſpeke philyppe dartuell howe parceyuered hadde great deſyre fyght kynge well ſhewed came gaūt ordeyned euery man able beare armes towne kept ſhulde folowe hym euery man obeyed made beleue grace god ſhuld discōfyte french men ſhuld ſtyll lordes gaunt dyuers countreys ſo hadde hym towne ten thouſande men harnes arerebande ſo came courtrey ſent bruges audyn ardanbourc sluſe four meſtyers chatelayne grātmont teremonde aloys ſo rayſed among th • xxx thouſade ſo lodged one nyght andewarpe next day departed went courtrey hadde company fifty thouſande men harnes tjoynges came kynge lordes fraunce philyppe dartuell puyſſance aproched faſt towarde ſaid ye company threſcore thouſande men vowarde departed fro jore reregarde hooſt whyle lordes thus feldes endured moch payne hart wynter begynnig december rayned nygh euery day lordes fayne lye euery nyght hygh wayes euery houre loked batayle dayly ſaid hooſt howe enemyes cō meth morowe ſayde forager went dayly forthe foragyng kynge lodged myddes felde monge men philyppe dartwell cōpany taryed ſo long came lordes fraunce ſore dyſpleaſed wether ſoo ſore wolde fayne mater bene determyned kyng floure chiualry fraūce philyp dartuell ye flemynges proude whan ſo hardy fight ye kyng leyen ſtyll ye ſiege andwarde fortefyed ſelfe reaſon rayne foule wether fell frenchman wolde neuer haue gone haue fought coulde nat lightly haue fought great payne parell philyppe glorifyed ſo fayre fortune victory bruges ſemed thynge coude go agaynſt hym hoped well lorde worlde ymaginacyon doughted nothyng french kyng puyſſance wolde nat haue done dyd ye ſhall ¶ maruayle came flemynges nyght howe ordeyned batayle one company cap cccc xix wedniſday night ye batayle next day philyp dartuell puyſſance came lodged fayre grounde right ſtrōge bytwene dike lytell groue woode ſtrong hedge ſo yt lightly man coulde come well bytwene hyll roſebeque ye kyng lay ſame night philyppe dartuell made ſupper lodgyng capitayns right plenteous prouiſyon ynoughe folowynge ſupper ſayd faire ſirs ye ſe well armes hope well morowe ſhall haue ſome beſynes kyng hathe great deſyre fynde v fyght lodged roſebeque nowe require kepe faythe trouthe nat abaſſhed thyng ye ſe vpholdynge ryght lette v frely fyght mayntayn iuriſdictyons flaūders admonyſt people well deuoyre ordre ſo well wiſely good order array may haue victory iourney morowe ye grace god ſhall fynde lorde dare fyght agaynſt v felde ſhall honoure v though comfort engliſſhmen company ſhulde haue renome nat alſo ſay company ſaue parſone alyue ſo therby ſhall lyue reſt kynge floure fraunce none leſt hynde wherfore cōmaunde payne deth man take priſoner without kynge hymſelfe wolde ſaued chylde 〈…〉 e ought pardoned knoweth nat yet dothe led ſhall bring hym gaūt lerne ſpeke flemyſſhe duke erls parſones ſlee comons fraunce wyll nat dyſpleaſed ſurety wolde none ſhuld returne agayne fraunce truſt ſhall ſuch philyppe ſupper acorded opinyon ſo anſwered one voice ſayd sir ye ſay well thus ſhalbe done toke leaue retourned lodginges companyes ſhewe ye haue harde thus paſſed nyght hooſt philyppe dartuell midnyght enfourmed fell hooſt maruaylous thynge neuer harde none lyke maner thus whan̄e flemynges reſt lodginges howbeit knewe well enemyes hyll nat paſt leage fro enfourmed philyp dartuell brought damoſell gaunt philyppe lay ſlept couch beſyde lytell fyre cole pauilyon ſayd damoſell ye houre mydnight iſſued pauilyon loke ye ayre ſe tyme night likly hode ſhe could nat ſlepe ſhe loked towarde roſebeque ſhe ſawe ſkye dyuers fume fyre flyeng fyres frenchman made vnder hedge buſſhes damoſell harkened ſhe thought ſhe harde great brute bytwene hooſt french hooſt ſhe thought ſhe harde frenche cryes cryeng moūtioy ſaynt denyce cryes ſhe thought mount dorre bytwene roſebeque thyng ſhe ſore afrayed ſo entred pauylyon ſodenly awaked philyp ſayd sir ryſe vp ſhortly arme haue harde great noyſe mount dorre leue frenchman comyng aſſayle thoſe wordꝭ roſe caſt gowne toke axe hande yſſued pauylion ſe damoſell ſhewed hym herde ſame hym ſelfe ſemed hym great tournement onthe ſayd hyll incōtynent entred pauilyon cauſed trumpet blowen ſoone trumpet blowen euery man aroſe armed watche ſent incōtynent philypp̄ dartuell knowe •• uſe ſtyrred vp hoſt ſeyng cauſe ſhewyng howe ſent enemyes hooſt ſtyrring quod philyppe wherof roſe noyſe mount dorre sir ꝙ herde ſame noyſe ſent thyder knowe went hath made report y• whan came herde ſawe nothyng ſir bycauſe founde nothynge made noyſe therof ſtyrring vp hooſt ſhulde haue ſtyrred without cauſe ought haue ben blamed labour whan watche ſhewed philyppe theſe wordes apeaſed hym ſelfe hooſt howbeit marueyle mynde myght ſayde fendes hell played tourneyed batayle ſhulde next daye ioye great pray likely haue ther euer ſodayne afray philyppe dartuell flemyngꝭ dout betrayenge ſo good leyſar armed thē made great fyres eate meate dranke wherof ſufficient hour day philyppe ſayd sir good drewe felde order peple entent thoughe frenche men come v breakyng day may redy receyue thē accorded ſayeng ſo iſſued lodgynges came hethe without woode great large dyke newly made behynde full buſſhes genepar ſmall buſſhes ordered batayle one company report cōſtables nombre l thouſande choſen men dyde ſette lytell lyues alſo threſcore archer englyſſhmen ſtolen away fro calys thynkyng haue profyte philyppe dartuell thus euery thyng ordred cariage woman varlettes philyppe dartuell page hym good courſer worthe great lorde fyue hundred florens hym nat hym entent flye away ſteale fro company gretter therby ſhewe eſtate moūt hym nede folowe chaſe frenchman towne gaūt nyne thouſande men well armed kept euer owne perſon truſte baners formaſt front aloyes grantmōt next courtrey bruges danne scluſe franke armed mooſt partie malles chapeauſe ſtele hocquetons gantlettes ſteele baleyne eche bearynge ſtake typped yron theſe townes differēce armes lyuereis knowe one company fro another cote yelowe blue ſome blacke bandes reed cootes ſome bordered whyte blewe cote ſome plā ted grene blewe sōeloſenged whyte blacke ſome quartred whyte reed ſome blewe one quarter reed ſome reed cutte vpon whyte baners accordyng craftes great holmeſſes hāgynge gyrdels thus taryed day light whiche nere aprochyng nowe ſhall ſhewe order frenchman ¶ howe conſtable admyrall fraunce baſtarde langres wente ſe flmynges howe fortifyed ſelfe cap cccc xx frenche kynge lordꝭ hym knewe right well howe flemynges aproched nere ſawe well ther remedy batayle ther mocion made tretie peace wedniſdaye crye made towne ipre yt maner peple men warre ſhulde drawe ye felde kynge oughte euery man obeyed kynges cōmaundement reaſon drue felde except ſuche bar lettꝭ cōmaūded kepe mayſters horſes howbeit bowarde many horſes ye aduēturers dyſcouer feldes thus wedniſday frenche men kept feldes nere vnto roſebeque night kyng made ſupper four vncles • cōſtable fraūce lorde coucy great lordes ſtraūgers brabant heynalte hollande zelande almayne lorayne sauoy come thyder ſerue kyng wherof thanken greatlye ſame nyght erle flaūders kept wache hym ſixe hundred ſpeares xii hūdred men perſons warre ſupper whan theſe lordes departed conſtable abode ſtyll ſpeke kyng vncles ordayned kynges counſayle cō ſtable fraunce ſir olyuer clyſſon ſhulde leaue office next day bycauſe thought yt ſhulde haue batayle lorde coucy ſhulde occupy offyce • yme ſir olyuer kynges perſon ſo whan wolde haue taken leaue kyng kynge ſayd hym ryght ſwetely amiably sir cōſtable wolde ye rendre vp offyce handes night morowe day haue ordayned another occupy rome wyll ye abyde perſone theſe wordes conſtable great marueyle anſwered ſayde right dere ſir knowe well nat haue ſo great honour ayde kepe youre perſone ſir ſhulde right diſpleſaunt company theym vowarde haue nat company paraduenture maye leſe therby wynne sir ſay nat bycauſe ſhulde thynke ſelfe ſo valyant lacke ſhulde nat well ſir ſauyng correctyon coūſayle ſay theſe fyftene dayes paſt haue done none thynge purſewed myne offyce honoure people ſir haue ſhewed euery man ſhulde ſir fight morowe ſe nat amonge wyll abaſſhed wher ſhall receyue blame ſome wyll ſaye haue deuyſed many thynges flye way fro firſt ſtrokes sir requyre grace breke nat hath ben firſt ordayned enſure ye ſhall haue profyt therby kynge ſuche hym wyſt nat ſay laſt kyng right ſagely ſaid conſtable knowe well ye haue cauſes right well acquyted ſelfe ſhall kyng father deed loued truſted aboue great truſt affyaunce therfore wolde haue aboute beſyneſſe ryght dere ſir quod conſtable ye ſo well acompanyed ſo valyant ſo noble men ſo ordred delyberacion wyſe counſayle nothynge amended wherfore ſir ye youre counſayle ought content therfore requyre goddes behalfe ſuffre alone myne offyce truſte morowe ye ſhall haue ſo good fortune iourney frendes ſhal gladde ennemyes diſpleaſed whiche wordes kynge gaue none aunſwere great ſpace laſt ſayd conſtable name god ſaynt denyce exercyſe offyce pleaſure wyll ſpeke therof ye ſe farther matter ſuche moued firſt matter morowe maſſe ſir quod conſtable right good wyll ſo toke leaue kyng retourned logyng thurſdaye mornynge euery man apparelled thēſelfe redy armed ſaue heedes knewe well lykelyhodde ſhulde haue batayle ſame day frenche kyng herde maſſe tymes mornyng great lordes great deuocyon prayeng god ſende thē honoure daye ſame mornynge aroſe great myſt ſo one coulde nat ſe acre brede hym wherof lordes ryght ſore diſpleaſed coude nat amende maſſe kynge conſtable great lordes wente counſayle determyne ſhulde ther ordayned ſir olyuer clyſſon cōſtable fraunce ſir mathue uyenne admyrall fraūce ſir wylliam poicters baſtarde langres theſe thre ſhulde go vyſette demeanour flemyngꝭ nere ther might come agayne make report kynge vncles trouthe euery thynge meane tyme lorde de labreth ſir hughe chatelone ſhulde order ba • aylles thus theſe thre departed fro kyng moūted good horſes rode ſtreyght thought fynde enemyes ſame mornyng ye great myſt flemynges roſe drewe toguyder ſame ſtronge place fortifyed ſo ſtode toguyder one batayle tyll eyght clocke coude nothyng frenchman great pride capitaynes ſayd eche thus ſtandyng ſtyll fete take colde nat go forthe great courage ſythe haue ſo great wyll fight oure enemyes tary nothynge frēch men wyll neuer ſeke v lette v go leeſt mount dorrel take aduauntage hyll theſe wordes ſo multiplyed agreed auaunce forthe take ye hyll bytwene frēchmen ſo eſcape fro dyke went lytell wode behynde toke playne feldes came wode forſaid thre knyghtes aduyſed great • eyſar ſo rode coſtyng batayle within bowe ſhot whan paſſed lyft ſyde rode agayne ryght ſyde ſo well aduyſed hole batell flemynges ſawe right well brake none aray 〈◊〉 dartuell ſayd ſoftely capitayns 〈◊◊〉 dreſſe v make v redy batayle 〈◊〉 enemyes nere v se right well y• thre knightes haue paſſed •• paſſed v haue well auiewed oure batayle • h • ſie th • drewe one batayle wente hyll philyppe ſayd loude ſirs whan come batayle lette v thynke oure enemyes howe diſconfyted batayle bruges reaſon helde oure ſelfe cloſe toguyder let v beware opyn nat euery man beare weapen ryght hym enterlaſe ſtaues ouer armes one within another wherby ſhall nat entre vpon v lette v go good paſe leyſar nother tourne lyfte hande right ſhote gonne atones ſhote oure croſ bowes ſhall abaſſhe enemyes whan philyppe dartuell thus ordred men ſette batayle arraye ſhewed theym ſhulde made wynge part men ſuche beſt truſted page courſer whōe ſayd go thy waye horſe behynde yonder buſſhe whan thou ſeyſt frenchman flye bring horſe crye crye men wyll gyue roume entent may folowe y• chaſe formaſt y• page dyde commaunded ſet beſyde hym wynge xl archer englyſſhmen whome wage ¶ nowe beholde philyp ordred hym ſelfe well nat thynke ſo dyde many ſuche expert bataylles dyde nat well wyſely one thynge whan̄e depatrted mornynge ſtronge place thought frenche men wolde neuer haue ſought theym haue fought thē coulde nat haue done without great domage lyke foles thought ſhewe ſelfe valyaunt lytell fearyng enemyes ſo ſerued therafter ¶ maner batayle roſebeque howe flemyngꝭ 〈…〉 yted coūſayle thre •• •• knightes • ewed b • hauyng cap iiii c xx • theſe thre foreſayd knyghtes retourned kyng bataylles ye redy good • ey • ought ther many noble wyſe men well experte armes bothe vowa • de reregarde kynges batayle knew right well ought done ther •• good ch •• alry worlde thus euery man gaue theſe thre knyghtes way cōe kyng lorde clyſſon ſpake firſt en • lynynge body kynge doyng hatte ſayde sir mery yonder people • ure varlettes ſhall beate conſtable quod kynge god graunt let v go forwarde name god ſaynt denyce than̄e ſuche knyghtes apoynted attende kynges body ſette good order kynge made many newe knightes ſo dyde euery lorde owne batayle dyuers baners newe reyſed vp ordayned wha • e ſhulde • oyne fyght kynges batayle • riflambe fraūce ſhulde fore fronte uo warde ſhulde paſſe ſyde wynge one ſyde kynge rerewarde paſſe lytell ſyde kynge thre batayls might atoues cloſe ••• mynges batayle came cloſe toguyder one batayle arereward ſhewed apoyntmēt erle ewe erle bloyſe erle ſaynt poule erle • arcourte lorde chatyllone lorde sere chiefe warde erle bloyſe made barone yonge lorde haurell ſir thomas dyſtre ▪ ſir james • ameth baſtarde made ••• ght • made ſame day reporte haraudes foure hundred thre ſcore ſ • uyn knightes ſo thre knight • departed fro kyng went vowarde rome 〈◊〉 • riflambe diſplayed ſi • • e • e • • yllers dyde beare ſome ſay haue founde written neuer ſene diſplayed agaynſt chriſtēmen tha • voyage great queſtyon made whyder ſhulde diſplayed ornatte howe dyuers reaſons conſydered finally determyned diſplayed cauſe flemynges helde opynion contrarie pope clement therfore frenchemen called theym urbanyſtes wherfore ſayde hery •• kes oute true beleue chyefe cauſe borne diſplayed flaunders ori •• ambe precyous baner ſent firſt fro heuyn great myſterie whiche euer great comfort ſawe ſame daye ſhewed ſome vertue mornyng great thicke myſt one coude ſcanteſe another ſoone diſplayed lyfte vp hyghe myſt brake away ſkye clere tyme yere lordes frā ce greatlye reioyſed whan ſawe ſonne ſhine ſo clere might ſe greatly dyde reconfort great beautie regarde baners ſtremars waue wynde behelde well great batayle flemmynges euer ſtyll aproched faſt ioyned toguyder ſtaues vpright ſemed lytle groue wode ſo many ¶ howe flemynges diſcō fyted batayle roſebeque cap iiii c xxii iwas enfourmed lorde deſtenort ſhewed howe ſawe ſo dyde dyuers whan oriflambe diſplayed myſt gone away came doue made dyuers flyghtes ouer kynges batayle lytell fought ſhe ſat downe one kynges baners whiche euery manne toke good token ſo thus aproched flemynges began ſhote gōnes arowes fethered ſteele thus batayle began whiche right ſharpe feirſe firſt encoūtryng ye flemyngꝭ ſet proudly thruſtyng wt ſpeares ſhulders lyke wylde • re helde themſelfe ſo cloſe toguyder coulde nat opyned ther ſhot gonne fyrſt thruſt ſlayne french parte lorde del •• rwyn baneret morlette harwyn james dorre ſo therwith kynges batayle reculed vowarde ye arerewarde paſſed forth encloſed flemynges helde theym ſtrayte ſhall ſhewe howe theſe two wynges men armes ferſly aſſawted ſtronge ſpeares well heeded heedꝭ fyne ſtele wherwith perſed flemynges cote mayle ye harde bone ſo flemynges glad eſche ſtrokes thus theſe men armes kept flemynges ſo ſhort coude nat well helpe ſelfe put downe armes gyue ſtrokes many loſt ſtrength brethe fell one vpon • ſo dyed lacke breth ſtrikyng ſtroke ther philyppe dartuell wounded beaten downe amonge men gaunt whan page horſe ſawe diſcōfyture mayſter departed lefte mayſter coulde nat helpe hym ſo rode courtray towardes gaunt thus theſe batayls aſſembled gyder • lemynges batayle incloſed bothe ſydes ſo coulde paſſe way ye kynges batayle came forth agayne whiche lytell drawen backe men armes beate downe flemynges euery ſyd • ſome good ax ſtele wher brake ſonder baſſenetes ſome malles leade wherwith gaue ſuche ſtrokes beat downe erthe fore flemynges beaten downe page redy cut throtes great knyues ſo ſlewe pytie though bene dogges ſtrokes baſſenetes ſo great yt man coulde ſpeke noyſe harde reported yt though armorer bareys bruſels hadde bene workynge toguyder coulde nat haue made ſo great noyſe ſome aduaūced ſo ſore preaſe ſ • ayn ouercome lacke brethe ſir loys gouſalles gētle knight berrey ſir fleton renyell dyuers whiche great domage ſo great batayle flemynges coulde nat ouercome without great loſſe yong knightes ſquiers wyll lightly auaunce ſelfe get honour preaſe ſo great beſyneſſe ſo parylous whan thicke preaſe coude nat releue ſelfe troden vnder fote dethe ſo meanes dyuers frēchmen ſlayne great nombre • lemyngꝭ ſlayne hepes one vpon nother whan̄e behynde ſawe diſcomfyture company abaſſhed caſt downe paueſſes armures tourned fled away towarde courtrey place mynde nothynge ſaue ſelfe ye breton frenchman chaſed thē dyke groues buſſhes euer foughte ſlewe downe ryght many fledde bytwene courtrey batayle go gaunt batayle moūt dorre bytwene courtrey roſebeque yere lorde god thouſande thre hundred sourſcore two thurſday next aduēt nouember xxvii day french kyng charles beyng xiiii yere age ¶ howe body philyp dartuell brought kynge ſo hā ged vp howe towne curtray brent cap c c c c xxiii thus ye haue herde flemynges diſconfyted mount dorre pride abated philyppe dartuell ſlayne gaunt parteners ſlayne hym felde nombre nyne thouſande acordynge report herauldes chaſe xxv thouſande ſlayne batayle endured nat paſt halfe hour diſconfyted diſcōfyture whiche right honourable chriſtendome nobleneſſe theſe ſayd villaynes atchyued entente neuer ſo great crueltie haue ben ſene worlde comonties dyuers countreis rebelled haue diſtroyed nobleneſſe thynke parys wolde ſaye whan knewe diſconfyture thynke nothynge ioyfull therof thus whan batayle atchyued laſte left chaſe trūpettes ſowned retrait ſo euery man drewe lodgynge vowarde lodged forwarde flemynges lyen nyght toke eaſe well refreſſhed newe purueyaunce came fro ipre ſo y• night made great fyres ſuche paueſſes ſtaues flemynges broughte felde whan kyng lod gynge pyght vp pauilyon crymaſyn ſendall right noble riche kynges vncles 〈…〉 ed hym dyuers lordes fraunce came thyder ſe hym reaſon requyred kynge ſayde hym sir philyppe dartuell lyue dedde wolde fayne ſe hym anſwered howe wolde payne ſhulde ſe hym thanne made crye throughe hooſt ſoeuer coude fynde philyppe dartuell ſhulde haue hundred frankes laboure many went among deed bodyes nyghe diſpoyled clothes laſte ther ſuche ſerche made founde knowen varlette ſerued hym longe tyme knewe hym well dyuers token drawen brought kynges pauylyon kyng behelde hym longe ſpace ſo dyde thother lordes turned retourned ſe hurtes woundes coude ſe wounde wherby ſhuld dye iudged fell lytell dyke great meny gauntoyſe hym wherby preſſed dethe ſo whā well regarded hym laſt taken fro then hāged vpon tre ende philyp dartuell sir danyell helwyn within andewarpe knyghtes ſquyers whiche kepte garyſon right honourably wedniſdaye batayle bycauſe knewe well kyng flaū ders ſhulde haue batayle flemynges late nyght cauſed foure fagottes ſette fyre caſte highe towne tokenynge thē lay ſege howe ſiege ſhulde reyſed thurſdaye tidynges came lorde harſelles howe company diſcōfyted philyp dartuell ſlayne ſoone thes tidynges knowen diſlodged toke way gaunt left behynde mooſt parte prouyſion warpe knewe nothynge therof tyll next mornynge whan knewe therof iſſued oute brought great pyllage founde hydden ſāe thurſday nyght tidynges came bruges diſconfyture batayle wherof greatly abaſſhed ſayde lo may nowe ſe owne diſtructyon breton come hyder entre towne ſhall pylled ſlayn wyll haue v mercy burgeſſes wyues toke beſt iowelles rich put ſhyppes ſaue ſende water hollande zelande caſe four dayes ſo left diſſhe cuppe ſyluer bruges put ſhyppes dout breton whan peter de boyſe laye ſore wounded hurtes toke paſſage comynes underſtode diſconfyture company howe philyppe dartuell deed ſlayne howe people bruges ſo abaſſhed ſuretie hym ſelfe ſo determyned departe go gaunte thought gaunt wolde alſo ſore abaſſhed ſo made lytter dreſſed hym coude nat ryde ye may knowe well whan theſe tidynges came gaunte loſſe men dethe philyp dartuell ſo ſore diſconforted frenchman come thyder daye batayle next day ye ſaturday euer peter de boyſe came thyder wolde haue ſuffred haue entred ye towne reſyſtence haue done lyſte frenche men toke hede therto thought right well lordes therof pleaſure ſeynge philyppe dartuell deed thought ſurely people gaunte wolde haue yelded kynges mercy howbeit dyde nat ſo alone made greatter warre euer dyd ye ſhall herafter hyſtorie friday kyng diſloged fro roſbeque bycauſe eyre deed bodyes counſayled go courtray refreſſhe hym haſe dyuers knightes ſquyers ſuche knewe countrey lepte horſes galowped ſtreyght courtray entred towne made defence agaynſt burgeſſes wyues men woman chyldren entred cellar church flye fro ye doth ſo pytie ſe suche entred firſt courtray great profyte pyllage ſo entred frenche men breton euery man toke vp lodgynge came kynge entred firſte day decembre newe perſecucyon made towne flemynges ſuche hydden founde ſlayne ther man taken mercy frenche men towne hated eche mortal lye bycauſe batayle one fought courtray ſir robert arthors great parte •• oure fraūce ſlayne ſhewed kynge howe y• courtray churche oure lady chapell wherin fyue hundred gylte ſpurres parteyninge olde tyme lordes knyghtes fraunce ſuche bene ſlayne ſayde batayle courtray whiche yere oure lorde god thouſande thre hundred two courtray one yere made therof great triumphe ſolempnyte wherfore kyng ſayd ſhulde derely bought ſo departynge ſette towne fyre entent ſhulde knowen euer howe frenche kynge bene anone kynge thus come courtray came thyder fyftie ſpeares fro garyſon warpe ſir danyell helwyn ſe kynge made thē ryght good chere ſo dyde lordes whanne bene day retourned warpe company ¶ howe bruges yelde ſelfe vnder obeyſāce french king howe gaunt reconforted peter de boyſe cap cccc xxiiii breton voward ſhewed well demeanoure hadde great deſyre go bruges pylle robbe towne erle flaū ders loued ryght well towne bruges wolde nat wyll towne ſhulde clene diſtroyed alſo enformed howe bruges diſconforted greatly abaſſhed pytie theym ſayde ſonne duke burgoyne sir bruges wolde come aſke mercy goddeſſake lette nat refuſed towne ouer ronne theſe breton ſhall neuer recouered agayne loſt euer duke agreed well therto thus whyle kyng lay courtrey bruges lyued great feare wyſt nat outher avoyde towne el abyde aduenture ſo laſt determyned ſende two freres kyng courtrey obtayne ſaueconduct twelfe beſt towne cōe ſpeke kynge counſayle theſe two freres came curtrey ſpake kyng counſayle erle flaunders molefyed mater moche might kyng graunted theſe twelfe burgeſſes ſaueconduct go come ſpeke hym thus theſe freres retourned bruges ſo twelfe burgeſſes departed went courtrey kynge vncles kneled downe knee hym ſayd sir requyre yor grace take accepte v owne men towne pleaſure ſir goddeſſake haue pytie v let nat towne diſtroyed loſte ſir yf diſtroyed many good men vtterly vn done euer ſir haue ben contrarie oure naturall lorde puiſſaunce philyppe dartuell gaū toyſe hadde nat bene towne bruges hadde benefull trewe lorde kynge entended well wordes meanes erle flaunders preſent kneledde downe kynge deſyredde haue mercy theym ſhewed theym apeaſe breton menne warre lyenge feldes bytwene courounte bruges muſte behoue theym paye ſome certayne ſome money ſo comunyng mater demaunded pay two hūdred thouſande frankes laſt determyned yt ſhulde pay ſixe ſcore thouſande frankꝭ thre ſcore thouſāde hande reſydue candelmas next ſo therby lyue reſt peace clerly become liegmen french kyng owe hym faythe homage obeyſaunce thus good towne bruges abode peace nat robed pylled wherwith y• breton ryght ſore diſpleaſed thought haue great profyte therby ſo ſome ſayd whan ſawe peace made lykely haue warre warre flaunders thyng profytable v haue lytle aduauntage therby let v returne coūtrey let v go haynalt duke aubert hath gouernynge came nat ayde helpe coſyn therle flaūders hath diſſymuled hym wherfore good go vyſet hym hathe good countrey fat ſhall • ynd none wyll let v way ſo let v recouer domagꝭ wage yuell payed one accorde nombre xii hundred ſpeares breton burgonyons ſauoſyns countreis ieopardy good countre heynalt knowledge therof came gentyll erle b • oyes one great lordes among one chiefe gouernours arere garde one kynges counſayle anone whan knewe ye breton burgonyons deſyred nothyng pyllage howe • aſſhed good countre heynalte fynde remedy therfore aduaunced forthe ſayd howe nat thyng conſented vnto good countre heynalt ſhulde ouer ronne ſo called hym coſyns erle marche erle ſaynt poule lorde coucy lorde dangeen dyuers hauyng landes • n coūtie heynault heſhewed howe wyſe ought conſent good countre heynalt ſhulde ouer ronne fro whens dyſcended haue therin fayre herytage alſo ſayd ſirs ye knowe well countre heynalt hath done maner treſpaſſe warre bytwene erle flaunders countre alwayes heynalt bare faute hath ſerued kyng voyage well truely barones knyghtes therof alſo kyng came flaūders knightes ſquyers heynalt ſerued truely erle flaunders ſo ſome cloſed beſeged tere monde andwarpe aduentured bothe body goodes moche erle bloys dyde went fro one another gat ſuche frendes mater broken ſo abode ſtyll peace alſo ſame erle dyd another thyng ther flaūders knyght called lorde eſquymyn loue kynſman called ſir danyell buſe throughe owne faute ſlayne towne ualencennes ſo reuenge quarell ſayde lorde ſayde wolde make warr harry towne ualencennes goten ſuche frendes toguyder yuell drewe nombre • yue hundred ſpeares redy go heynalt harry towne ualēcennes affirmyng howe good quarell ſo whan erle bloyes enformed therof defended ſayd knightꝭ ſhulde nat ſo hardy entre heynalt countrey coſyn duke aubert dyde ſhulde derely bought moche dyde gentyll erle bloys ſtopped ſayde knightes enterpriſe mater put clerely handes lorde coucy ſo thus towne peace suche ſeruice dyde erle bloys army heynalt ualencennes wherby gatte greatloue ſpecially towne ualencennes ſeaſon lordes men warr lay ſtyll courtray knewe nat kynge wolde whyder wolde go gaunte ornat frenchman beleued whan bruges yelded vp gaunte wolde ſo lykewiſe seyng loſt capitayne receyued great domage loſſe men batayle roſebeque trouth • one gaunt mynde ſo haue done thre dayes wyſt nat outher departe leaue towne el ſende kayes therof kynge yelde▪ mercy ſo abaſſhed wyſt nat lorde harſels wyſt nat howe reconforte theym whan peter de boyſe entred towne founde gate wyde opyn without kepyng defence wherof great marueyle demaunded ment kept better towne ſuche come ſe hym anſwered ſayd ſir ſhulde ye knowe well haue loſt oure good capitayne men towne beſyde ſtraūgers nombre nyne thouſande domage toucheth v ſo nyghe haue recouery folyſſhe people quod peter de boyſe ye abaſſhed wot nat well warr yet nat ende towne gaunt neuer ſo renomed ſhalbe yet herafter philyp dartuell deed owne outrage cloſe vp gate entende defence ye nede nat feare kynge wyll come hyder wynter tyme meane tyme newe ſeaſon cōe ſhall newe releued men holande zelande guerles brabant place ſhall haue men ynowe money frā coys atreman englande ſhall retourne ſhall capitayns warre neuer ſo ſore ſhall make better nowe alone thā whan helpe flaūders nowe better expert therfore lette v entende nowe prouyde warre ſhall thā euer dyde thus ſuche wordes peter de boyſe reconforted thē ſore abaſſhed returnyng gaunt nat bene yelded themſelfe ſymply frenche kynge lo thus ye may ſe counſayle confort ther one man tyme nede whan gaunt ſawe fyue ſixe dayes paſſed man cāe towardes towne lykelyhod ſiege greatly reconforted prouder euer ¶ howe treatie alyaunce bytwene englyſſhe men flemynges broken howe french kyng deꝑted flaūders cap cccc xxv ye haue herde howe ſir willyam fermeton calys ſent thyder kyng englande counſayle brought letter hym haue bene ſealed good townes flaunders makynge men • yon great alyaunces taken bytwene thenglyſſhmen flemynges calais hym ſtyll fraunces atreman ſixe burgeſſes gaunt whan tidynges came diſcōfyture roſebeque ſore abaſſhed engliſſhe knight ſawe well entre farther flaunders ſawe well treatie broken toke letter vnſealed retourne englande agayne aſſoone might ſo ſhewed mater howe fallen wherof gentylmen countre nat greatly diſpleaſed ſayd alſo ſay yet comons flaunders wonne vyctorie noble men fraunce ben ſlayne pride comons euery countre wolde haue ben ſo great noble men ſhulde haue repented whiche well ſene lytell englande wherfore loſſe flemynges lytell thought taken whan flaunders ſuche ben englande fraū ce atreman knewe theſe tidyngꝭ right greuous thē ſo departed water arryued mydelborowe zelande ſuche gaunt retourned gaūt euery man home owne townes fraū ce atreman company beyng cali departed went gaunt nat long frenche kyng flaūders enfour •• ed retourned zelande ſame ſeaſon frenche kyng lay courtrey dyuers coūſayls knowe howe ſhulde parceyuer warre whether ſhulde go ley ſiege gaunt nat kyng well wyllyng haue gone thy • er lykewiſe ſo breton burgonyōs lordes cōſydred howe moneth decembre ye deed tyme wynter dayly rayned wherfore thought good hoſtyng tyll ſomer ſeaſon alſo ſawe well howe horſes feble reaſon ye colde ſeaſon ryuers great large gaūt wherfore thought loſt tyme ley ſege alſo lordes wery ſore traueyled ſo long lyeng feldes colde tyme tayny thynges conſydred determyned kynge ſhulde go tourney refreſſhe kepe chriſtmas farr countreis auuergne dolphyn sauoy burgoyne ſhulde returne home owne countreis fayre eaſely breton normayns frenchman ſhulde abyde ſtyll conſtable attende kyng thought ſhulde haue ſome buſyneſſe pariſyēs newly forged great nōbre malles wherfore thought ſet another rule order amonge thē whan kynge ſhulde departe fro courtrey counſayle forgate nat gylt ſpurres founde churche courtray whiche olde tyme parteyned noble men fraūce ſomtyme ſlayne erle robert arthoyſe batayle curtrey kyng ordayned departyng towne ſhulde ſet fyre diſtroyed whan knowledge therof came erle flaunders thought haue founde ſome remedy therfore ſo came ye kyng kneled downe requyred hym none yuell towne curtrey kyng anſwered howe ſurely wolde nat requeſt ſo therle durſt ſpeke mater ſo departed went logyng fyre began duke burgoyne cauſed horaloge taken downe ye mooſt fayreſt goodlyeſt coude founde ſyde ſee whiche horaloge taken downe peces layed chares bell alſo caryed diyon burgoyne ſette vp ſowneth xxiiii houres ye day night departyng kyng fro courtrey towne clene diſtroyed brent knyghtes ſquyers men warre toke ſome men woman chyldren raunſome ſo kyng rode came turney lodged abbey ſaīt martyne towne dyde great reuerence kynge reaſon requyred ye towne arayed whyte thre barres grene one ſyde cytie deuyded lodge lordꝭ kyng lay ſaynt martyns company one quarter towne duke berry lodged byſſhoppes lodginge duke burgoyne crowne duke burbone golden heed cōſtable ſaynt james heed ther cry made kingꝭ name payne dethe man hurt people cytie manne take thyng without pay truely therfore none entre countie heynaulte hurte domage theſe thynges well kept holden lordes refreſſhed thē well ye farr countreis departed retourned homewarde ſome lyſle ſome doway ſome ualencē ne erle bloyſe toke leaue kynge vncles companyon therle ewe ſo returned herytage heynalte lay day nyght ualencēnes wher well refreſſhed achyued entierly loue good people towne ſeruyce yt dyde countre whan breton burgonyons ſauoy ſyns wolde haue ouerron countre whiche let meanes alſo ſir tyrrie diſquemyne helde ualencennes great feate whiche mater putte erles handes lorde couces ſo therby peace erle departed fro ualencennes went lē decheries ther taryed ſeaſon lady mary wyfe lewes ſofie ſomer went bloyſe coū teſſe wife ſonne taryed ſtyll heynalt mooſt parte lay beaumont ¶ howe frenche kyng cāe parys howe cauſed putte downe cheyns harnes towne howe pariſyēs raunſomed pleaſure cap cccc xxvi lykewiſe erle marche ſir james burbone brother deꝑted fro tourney went refreſſhe scluſe heynault owne herytages sir guy de lauall breton went cheure heynault wher parte enherytaūce ſir robert namure lordꝭ therof y• lorde coucy went mortayn ryuer leſcalt refreſſhed hym cōpany moſt parte hym ſelfe kyng turney erle ſaynt poule cōmiſſyon chaſtyce urbanyſtes wherof ther many towne ſo foūde many euer founde thē churche lady el taken put priſon ſore raūſomed meanes erle ſaynt poule gathered toguyder ſhorte ſeaſon ſeuyn thouſande frankes none ſcaped hym payed founde good ſuretie paye whyle kyng lay tourney gaunt ſaueconduct go cōe entreate peace treaty harde proude thoughe vyctorie batayle roſebeque ſayd wolde gladly put thē ſelfe vnder obeyſaunce frenche kyng holde hym haue reſort court parys ſayd wolde neuer haue take lorde erle loyes ſayde coude neuer loue hym bycauſe great domages receyued hym meanes euer ye kyng counſayle coude coude neuer tourne fro opinyon wolde neuer make anſwere butſayde thoughe lyued two thre yere payne trouble daunger yet truſted laſte recouer bringe vp towne agayne great proſperyte welthe ſhewed might departe whan lyſt ſo deꝑted fro tourney retourned gaunt ſo mater hanged ſtyll warre frenche kyng lordꝭ toke great payne cauſe countie flaunders good clementyns obey pope clement good townes church ſo ſore anexed bounde opinyon pope urbane coude nat turned therle flaunders hym ſelfe ye ſame opinyon ſo anſwered coūſayle therle take aduyce anſwere detmynatly feeſt eſter ſo thus matter hanged kynge kept chriſtmas turney whan kyng deꝑted ordayned lorde guyſtell capitayn bruges lorde ſaynt pye ipre great lorde guyſtell regarde flaunders ſir john̄ jumont capitayne courtrey ſent two c ſperes breton garyſon andeburge andwarpe ſent ſir wyllm̄ langhien c ſpeares hym garyſon thus garyſons flaūders purueyed kepe garyſon warr wynter none otherwiſe tyll next ſomer theſe thynges thus ordred kynge departed fro tourney went arras vncles hym erle flaunders company kyng taryed arras cytie great aduenture haue ben ouer ron robbed breton great wage owyng alſo endured great traueyle voyage nat well content kyng great payne refrayne fro doyng yuell cōſtable marſhals fraunce apeſed promyſyng howe ſhulde clerely payed wage whan came parys ſo thus kynge deꝑted went peron erle flaunders toke leaue kyng went lyle ſo long kyng iurneyed paſſed peron noyon cōpayne ſo came ſaynt lyſe reſted men warre lodged ye vyllages bytwene ſaīt lyſe meaulx bry ryuer marne ſaynt denyce ſo ye countre full men warre ſo kyng departed fro ſaynt lyſe went towarde paris ſent officer prepare hym lodgynge caſtell loure alſo thre vncles ſent ſeruauntes prepare lodgynges lykewiſe ſo dyd lordꝭ done cautell wyle kyng theſe lordes nat determyned entre ſo ſodenly parys douted parys dyde proue countenance order paris wolde make kyngꝭ entre thought wold make aſſay fore ſeruaūtes went commaunded ſay man demaūded thē kyng comyng wolde ther incōtynent whiche pariſyens aduyſed among ſelfe armed ſhewe kyng entre puyſſance men warr able make ſerue kyng whan pleaſed ben better haue ſytten ſtyll houſes ſhewe made cōuerted great ſeruytude ye ſhall ther ſayd dyde good taken yuell wher kyng ſhulde haue lodged lour made lodgynge prepared bourgell voyce ran thorough parys kyng nere hāde entre parys mo xx thouſande pariſyens armed yſſued feldes ordred themſelfe fayre batayle bytwene ſaynt lader parys towarde mount martyr croſbowes paueſſes malles redy apparelled thoughe ſhulde haue fought incōtynent batayle kyng borgell lordes thider broght tidynges demeanoure parys lordes ſayde ye may ſe pride theſe rybauldes wherfore nowe ſhewe eſtate yf wolde haue ſerued kynge ſame poynt nowe whan kynge went flaunders than̄e done well hadde mynde ſo rather prayed god yt ſhulde neuer retourne agayne whiche wordes dyuers ther helped well forwarde thentent greue pariſyens ſayeng kyng 〈◊〉 counſayled ſhall nat aduenture hym ſelfe • come among ſuche people cometh agaynſt hym army arrayed batayle ſhulde rather haue cōe humbly proceſſyon haue rong belle parys thankynge god vyctorie kyng flaunders thus lordes abaſſhed howe ſhulde mē tayne ſelfe finally apoynted conſtable fraunce lorde dalbret lorde coucy ſir guy tremoyle ſir johan uyen ſhulde go ſpeke thē demaunde cauſe iſſued parys ſo great nōbre armed order batayle agaynſt kyng whiche thynge neuer ſene fraunce vpon aunſwere lordes ſayde kynge ſhulde take aduyſe wyſe ynoughe order great mater gretter theſe ſaid lordes departed fro kyng without harneſſe ſuretie buſyneſſe toke thē thre foure herauldes ſende ſomwhat pariſyens ſayd sir go ye yonder people parys demaūde ſaue conduct v go cōe tyll haue ſpoken fro kyng theſe heraudes departed rode great pace cāe theſe people whan pariſiens ſawe comyng thought full lytell hadde come haue ſpoken thought rydden parys dyde heraudes cote armures whan aproched nere pariſyens ſayd high mayſters wher ruler whiche capitayns become ſende fro lordes ſome parys parceyued well theſe wordꝭ nat done well caſt downe heedes ſayde mayſters one accorde kynges commaundement ye lordes therfore ſirs ſaye goddes name ye wyll v sir quod heraudes lordes ſente v hyder named knowe nat ye thynke entende requyre may peaſably without parell come ſpeke retourne agayne kyng ſhewe hym anſwere ye make otherwyſe dare nat come oure faythes ſirs quod ought ſay ſuche wordes v gētylneſſe thynke ye mocke v surely ſirs quod heraudes ſpeke good certentie quod pariſyens go way ſay may come pleaſure v without daunger parell ſhall haue hurt none v redy fulfyll commaundementes herauldes retourned lordes ſhewed ye haue herde thā four lordes rode company came pariſyens whome founde good array order batayle mo xx thouſande malles lordes paſſed behelde theym well within ſelfe prayſed moche maner alſo paſſed euer pariſyēs enclyned ſelfe thē whan theſe lordes myddes amonge reſted ſtode ſtyll conſtable ſpake highe ſayde ye people parys hath moued iſſue cytie order batayle ſemeth ye wyll fyght agaynſt kynge ſouerayne lorde whoſe ſubgettes ye ſhulde sir quod ſaue youre grace neuer wyll thynge agaynſt kynge ſir yſſued non cauſe ſhewe kyng puyſſance pariſyens kyng yonge neuer yet ſawe without ſe nat knowe may ſerued nede sir quod cōſtable ye ſpeke well ſaye vnto fro kynge tyme wyll ſe maner ye haue done ſuffyſeth therfore counſayle retourne agayne peaſeably parys euery man owne lodgynge youre harneſſe ye entende kynge ſhall come hyder sir quod ſhall right good wyll fulfyll youre commaundement ſo therwith retourned parys euery man owne houſe vnarme hym ſayde four lordes retourned kyng ſhewed vnto hym wordes ye haue herde determyned kyng vncles lordes certayne men armes ſhulde entre parys great bande • yde without cyte roūde gyue feare pariſyens lorde coucy marſhall ſā xere ordayned aſſoone kynge entred parys ſhulde take downe leaues gate four princypals cytie towarde ſaynt denyce ſaynt gate myght ſtande open day night maner men warr̄ entre pleaſur thentent mayſter parys nede alſo take downe cheneſſe euery ſtrete ryde pleaſure ordayned ſo done ſo kyng entred parys lodged loure vncles thother lordes dyuers logynges thus gate taken gouge layd downe ye grounde cheneſſe euery ſtrete taken downe brought palayes pariſyens great dout feared ſhulde ouer ron ſo none durſt loke ſtrete open dore wyndowe thus thre dayes great parell feare receyue greatter domage dyd coſt many great fynance raū ſome called chambre counſayle one another ſuche lordꝭ wolde haue ſo raūſomed ſome ſixe thouſande frankes ſome thre ſome one ther leuyed parys kynges profyte vncles myniſters ſōme foure hundred frankes ther nothyng demaūded poore people great mayſters ſuche might bear right happy might eſcape payeng raūſome euery man ſelf fayne bring harneſſe ſackes y• caſtell beautie wiſe called caſtell uycēnes cloſed great towre mals alſo thus pariſyēs delt • gyue enſā ple good townes frāce ther reyſed vp ſubſydꝭ gabels aydꝭ fouages douzimes trezimes ſuche thyngꝭ alſo playne coūtre cleneryfled ¶ howe dyuers notable men paris beheeded mayſter johan marettes parys dyuers townes fraunce warr̄ gaūtoiſe newe begon agayne cap cccc xxvii alſo diuers taken put priſon many drowned apeaſe remynant crye made cyte none payne dethe ſhuld hurt pariſyen ro 〈…〉 take thynge houſe without payeng therfore cry apeaſed greatly cyte howe day dyuers perſones ledde caſtell iudged dye defaulꝭ ſtyrring vp comons howbeit great marueyle made mayſter johan marettes reputed renoumed ſage notable man ſaid wrong iudged dye alwayes bene man great wyſedome good counſayle one mooſt autētyke men court parlyamēt ſerued kyng philyppe kyng johan kynge charles neuer founde defaute howe iudged beheeded xii company caryed charet place execuſion ſpake ſayd hath iudged dye let come forthe ſhewe cauſe thus preached people went execuſyon people great pyte durſt ſpeke worde brought markette place halle firſt beheeded ſuche brought thyder hym one called nicholas flamant draper ther offred ſaue lyfe threſcore thouſande frankes wolde nat taken dyed whan came mayſter johan marettes ſayde hym mayſter johan crye mercy ye king forgyue myſdedes tourned hym ſayde haue ſerued kyng phylyppe great graunt father kynge johan kynge charles father well truelye theſe thre neuer layed thynge charge kyng y• nowe wolde haue done bene full age mānes knowledge beleue iudgyng nothyng culpable haue nothyng crye hym mercy crye god mercy none requyre hym humbly forgyue miſdedꝭ ſo toke leaue people ſo many wept hym maner dyed mayſter johan marettes lykewiſe towne rohan mayſter towne ther dyuers putte dethe raunſomed alſo reynes chaalons troyes sence orlyaunce theſe townes taxed great ſommes florens bycauſe begynninge diſobeyed kyng ther gadered realme fraunce ſuche ſōme florens marueyle ſpeke therof went profyte ye duke berrey duke burgoyne yong kynge gouernaunce ſaye trouthe conſtable fraunce marſhalles great parte paye men armes ſerued kynge vyage flaunders erle bloys erle marche erle ewe therle ſaynt poule erle harcourt erle dolphyn auuergne lorde coucy gret baron fraunce aſſigned payed ſuche tare ſhulde payed countreis ſuche ſeruyce done kyng flaunders pay company theſe aſſignacyons canne nat tell howe lordes payed incontynent newe taylles ceaſſed countreis kynge ſo kynges taxe ſhulde payed executed lordes dueties putte abacke ye haue herde howe whan̄e kyng deꝑted fro courtrey towne gaunte abode ſtyll warre capitayns gaunte tyme peter de boyſe peter de myrt fraunces atreman ſo renewed towne newe ſoudyers came fro dyuerscountreis nothynge abaſſhed make warre freſſhe quycke euer capitaynes gaunt vnderſtode ther certayne breton burgonyōs towne dardenbourge determyned go thyder loke ſo fraunces atreman deꝑted fro gaunt thre thouſande men ſo came dardēbourge ther made great ſcrimyſſhe finally gauntoyſe wan towne ye coſt many lyues two hundred men ſlayne towne robbed pylled mooſt parte therof brent ſo retourned gaunt boty conqueſt receyued great ioye anon went cytie dabes teremonde iuſte warpe pylled robbed countrey ¶ alyaunce purchaſed bytwene thenglyſſhmen flemynges bulles pope urbayne ſent englande dyſtroy clemētyns ca iiii c xxviii erle flaunders lay lile vnderſtode howe gauntoyſe auaunſed ſelfe ryde ouer ron countre diſtroy might ryght ſore diſpleaſed thought nat wytte puyſſaunce ſo ſythe philyppe dartuell deed howbeit counſayle ſayd sir ye knowe well ye haue alwayes herd ſay howe gauntoyſe right ſubtyll people whiche haue well ſhewed wyll ſhewe alſo agayne haue ben englande retourned agayne ſpecially fraunces atreman companion philyppe dartuell faytes long lyueth ye ſhall haue warre thē alſo ſir knowe well hath made great alyaūce kynge englande towne gaunt hath certayne penſyon englande ſecretely johan saplemon pure englyſſhe dwelleth vnder towne bruges hathe done ſpace xxiiii yere verify true raſe ueyrte loyes de uos johan ser colacke gaunt clerke procureth byſſhoppe gauut theſe ſtyll behynde englande performe alyaūce ſir ye ſhall trewer tidyngꝭ tell myddes may paſt erle flaunders beleued well theſe ſayenges trewe ſo dede began ymagin agaynſt john̄ saplemon thenglyſſhmen dwellynge bruges cauſed ſomoned certayne day aſſigned erle lyſle ſo erles ſeruauntes came ſomoned johan saplemon dyuers riche englyſſhmē ware ther commaundynge fyftene day erle caſtell lyſle whan englyſſhmen herde therof ſore abaſſhed toke counſayle toguyder hauyng great marueyle erle ſhulde ſende thynges conſydred douted gretlye knewe well erle fierſe fell haſt ſayd amonge themſelfe kepeth natte body kepeth nothyng dout leſt erle enfourmed ſore agaynſt v fraunces atreman hath penſyon kyng englande whan englande hym two burgeſſes towne bruges parauenture haue made ſome enformacyon agaynſt v therle nowe parte purpoſe reſted englyſſhemen durſt nat abyde erles iudgement go lyle day lymyted departed fro bruges wente scluſe dyde ſo moche founde ſhyppe redy aparelled ſo bought money ſo departed ſayled tyll arryued london whan therle flaunders enfourmed mater ſawe englyſſhmen apered nat theyr day ſore diſpleaſed ſende incontynēt bruges cauſed ceaſed euer coude founde parteyninge englyſſhmen herytages gyuen ſolde johan saplemon clene banyſſhed flaunders hundred yere one day cōpanyons ſuch taken put priſone ſome dyed ſome recouered agayne euer loſt comune prouerbe whiche true howe enuy neuer byeth ſay bycauſe englyſſhmen right en uyouſe ye welthe alwayes hath ben ſo kyng englande vncles noble englande right ſore diſpleaſed welthe honour fallen frenche kynge noble fraunce bataile roſebeque knightes englandeſpake ſayd eche ah ſaynt mary howe frenchman nowe moūted pride ouerthro wyng ſort rude villayns wolde god philyp dartuell men ii ſpeares ſixe archer ther nat ſcaped one frenchman outher ſlayne taken god wyll glorie ſhall nat long endure thē nowe haue fayre aduaūtage entre flaūders countre nowe cōquered french kyng truſt conquere agayne kynge englande ſheweth well tyme erle flaū ders greatly ſubget frenche kyng wyll pleaſe hym poyntꝭ whan marchantes dwellyng bruges haue dwelt ther beyonde xxx yere nowe banyſſhed chaſed flaūders tyme hath ſene durſt nat haue done nowe dare none otherwyſe feare frenchemen truſt ſhall nat abyde longe poynt langage among thenglyſſhmen realme englāde therfore ſuppoſed ye done enuy ſeaſon wrote hym ſelfe pope urbane ſixt came ſee fro rome gēnes well receyued reuerently genoways kept reſydens ye knowe well howe england obeyſāt hym aſwell churche ye people bycauſe ye french king clementyne fraunce urbane whome englyſſhemen dyuers countreis beleued beyng gennes aduyſed howe might anoy french kyng ſo thought ſende englande ſocoure ſhall ſhewe maner ſent bulles archebyſſhoppes byſſhoppes englande makyng mencyon aſſoyled payne ſynne ſuche wolde ayde diſtroy clementyns knewe well howe clement aduerſarye done lykewiſe realme fraunce dothe dayly called vrbanyſtꝭ faythe beleue dogges ſo urbane ſawe well clementynes wolde condēpne diſtroy hym might ſawe well coude nat greue frenchman englyſſhmen firſt ſawe well muſt fynde meanes gather toguyder great ryches knewe well noble englande abſolucyons wolde nat ryde forthe warre without money menne warre lyue nat pardon ſet nat moche therby artycle dethe 〈1 page duplicate〉 〈1 page duplicate〉 than̄e determyned beſyde theſe bulles ſende englande prelate ſhulde ordayne full dyſme church noble men men warre therof payed wage without greuynge parte kynges treaſur comontie realme whiche thynge pope thought baron knightes england gladly wolde herken vnto cauſed writen engroſſed bulles well kynge vncles prelate englande playne abſolucyon payne ▪ ſynne beſyde graunted ye kyng vncles playne dyſme taken leuyed throughe englande ſo ſir henry spenſar byſſhoppe norwyche ſhulde chiefe capitayne ye men warr bycauſe goodes came fro churche therfore pope wolde yt one churche ſhulde chefe gouernoure entent church comons realme ſhulde better beleue mater beſyde yt bycauſe knewe realme spaygne contrarie opinyon ſom alyed ye frēche kyng aduyſed parte ſame golde ſyluer ſhulde gadered realme englande duke lancaſtre reputed hym ſelfe kyng caſtell right wyfe lykewiſe ſhulde make another army caſtell alſo yf duke lancaſtre take hym ſayd viage pope ſaid wolde graunt kynge portyngale made newe warre kyng johan caſtell kyng fraunces deed playne dyſme throughe portingale thus pope urbane ordeyned buſyneſſe ſent xxx bulles englande whiche receyued great ioye prelate iuryſdictions began preche voiage maner croſey wherby people englande light lye beleued gaue therto great faythe beleued verilye coulde nat go paradyſe yf dyed yere without gaue ſō pure almes towarde warre lōdon dyoſes gathered tonne full golde ſyluer accordynge pope bulles mooſt gaue mooſt pardon obteyned whoſoeuer dyed ſeaſon gaue goodes theſe ꝑdones clene aſſoyled payne ſynne accordynge tenour bulles happy dyed ſeaſone haue ſo noble abſolucyon thus gathered money wynter lent ſeaſon pardon dyſmes ſayd drewe ſomme xxv hundred thouſande frankes ¶ howe byſſhop norwiche englyſſhe men yſſued englande ron make warre agaynſt helde pope clement cap cccc xxix whan kynge englande vncles coū ſayle vnderſtode money gadered right ioyouſe ſayd howe money ynoughe make warre agaynſt two realmes ſaye agaynſt fraunce spayne go spayne name pope prelate englande duke lancaſtre ordayned byſſhoppe london called thomas brother therle deuonſhyre chefe capitayn two ſpeares four thouſande archer haue halfe money thus gadered ordayned ſhuld nat ſo ſoone departe englande ye byſſhop norwiche bycauſe army ſhulde aryue calys ſo entre fraunce wyſt nat ſhulde fall therby whider frenche kyng wolde reyſe puyſſāce fyght thē nat alſo ther another poynt contrary duke lancaſtre yet great ioye vyage generally comontie englande enclyned byſſhop norwiche go duke lācaſtre long ſeaſon ye duke nat grace ye people alſo thought realme fraunce nerer iourney spayne alſo ſome ſayd yt duke lācaſtre couytouſnes theſyluer golde gadered churche pardon wherof ſhulde haue parte dyde enclyne rather therto profyte deuocyon ſaid howe biſſhop norwiche repreſented pope hym inſtytuted wherby greatteſt part englande gaue hym great faythe kyng alſo ſo ordayned wage churche go byſſhoppe henry spenſar dyuers good knightes ſquyers englande gaſcoyne lorde beaumont ſir hugh caurell ſir thomas tryuet ſir wyllm̄ helmon ſir johan ferres ſir hugh spenſar coſyn byſſhoppe ſonne brother ſir wyllyam fermeton ſir mathewe reedman capytayne berwike theſe englande gaſcoyns lorde newcaſtell ſir john̄ brother raymon marſen guyllonette de pauxe garyot uyghier johan de cachytan dyuers counted fyue hundred ſpeares fyftene hundred men great nō bre preeſtes bycauſe mater touched churche moued pope theſe men warr prouyded themſelfe mater paſſage delyuered douer sandwyche eſter ſo paſſed ouer lytell lytell lyſt voiage maner croyſey thus paſſed ſee byſſhoppe capitayns fully redy byſſhop ſir hugh caurell ſir thomas tryuet ſir wyllm̄ helmon kynge counſayle ſware ſolempnely kynges preſens bringe truely ende voyage fight againſt man countrey belde pope urbayne fight make warre agaynſt opinyon clemēt thus ſware y• kyng aduyſe counſayle ſayd ſir byſſhoppe ye whan ye come calais wyll ye ſoiourne fronter y• ſpace moneth terme▪ ſhall refreſſhe newe men warr armes archer ſhall ſende good marſhall valyant man ſir wyllyam beauchampe haue ſende hym marche scotland wher kepeth fronter agaynſt ſcottes trewſe bytwene scottes v falleth nowe ſaint johans tyde retourne ye ſhall haue hym youre cōpany without fayle therfore wolde ye ſhulde tarye hym ſhall ryght neceſſarie bothe wyſedome good counſayle byſſhoppe company promyſed kynge ſo thus departed fro kynge toke ſee douer arryued calayes xxiii day aprill yere lorde god thouſand thre hundred fourſcore thre ſame ſeaſon capitayne calais ſir johan deluarnes receyued byſſhoppe company great ioye ſo landed lytell lytell horſes baggage ſo lodged calays baſtylles made dayly ſo taryed tyll fourthe day may abidyng marſhall ſir wylliam beauchampe came nat tyme whan byſſhoppe norwiche yonge couragious deſyrous armes neuer bare armure lumbardy brother thus calays ſawe capitayne ſo many men armes ſayde one day company sir ſoiourne hereſo long tary ſir wyllyam beauchāpe cometh nat kyng vncles trowe thynke lytell v let v ſome dedes armes ſythe ordayned ſo lette v enploy money churche truely whyle lyue let v conquere ſomewhat enemyes well ſayd ſir quod thoſe herde ſpeke let v warne oure company wyll ryde forthe within thre dayes let v take aduyſe whiche way ſhall drawe nat iſſue gate entre landes oure enemyes frenche aboute euery parte good go towardes flaunders boloyne flaunders lande conqueſt conquered puyſſaunce frenche kyng nat beſtowe tyme honourably thynges conſydred conquere agayne alſo erle flaunders hath done late great diſpyte men countre without tytell reaſon hath banyſſhed chaſed thē bruges flaūders paſſeth nat two yere ſythe wolde haue ben lothe haue done ſo nowe fayne obey pleaſure frēche kyng wherfore quod byſſhop may beleued firſt iourney y• ſhall make ſhalbe flaū ders sir quod ſir thomas tryuet ſir wylliam helmone ye ſhall well beleued lette v ryde partie within thre dayes lande enemy counſayle agreed gaue war nynge eche ¶ howe englyſſhe men toke towne mynſter grauelynge howe erle flaunders ſent ſpeke thē cap cccc xxx agremēt nat ſir hugh caurell gone ſe coſin capitayne guynes called ſir johan droithton ſo day retourned agayne nexte day byſſhoppe ſent hym caſtell knightes ſayd byſſhoppe howe wolde haue aduyſe ſir hughe caurell dyde thynge bycauſe mooſt ſene vſed warre byſſhop ſayd hym ye haue herde commaunded hym ſay aduyſe ſir hughe anſwered hym ſayde ſir ye knowe well condycion departed englande enterpriſe toucheth thynge warre bytwene kynges▪ onely agaynſt clemētyns ſoudyers pope urbane hath clene aſſoyled v ſynne payne oure power diſtroy clementyns go flaunders thoughe countrey hath bene conquered frenche kyng duke burgoyne yet ſhulde amyſſe vnderſtande erle flaunders flemynges good urbanyſtes alſo ſir haue nat men ynowe entre flaunders redy vſed warre great nombre people haue done nothyng el lyned warre thre foure yere alſo ſtronge countrey entre alſo flē mynges haue done v treſpaſſe ſir yf ſhall ryde lette v ryde fraunce enemyes two maners kyng lordes warr nowe opyn alſo frenchman good clementyns cōtrarie beleue agaynſt pope alſo ſir ſhulde abyde marſhall ſir wyllm̄ beauchāpe ſhulde haſtely come v good nō bre men laſt worde kynge ſayd wolde ſende hym v ſir counſayle ſhall nedes ryde let v drawe towardes ayre mouſtrell ther none thynke yet wyll cōe agaynſt v alwayes men wyll come v oute flaūders hath loſt haue wyll gladde go v hope wynne ſome agayne beare yuell wyll hertes frenchman hath ſlayne warres father bretherne kynſmen frēdes sir hughe coude ſcant ſpeke theſe wordes byſſhop toke mater hote haſty ſayde ſir hughe ye haue ſo well lerned ryde fraunce ye nat ryde none place nat better ryde profyte thanne entre fronter flaūders ſee coſt towne bourbourge duneſſhe meſport bergues caſſell ipre proprigne theſe ſayd countreis enformed burgeſſes gaunt neuer warre greued let v go thyder refreſſhe v abyde marſhall wyll come howe weſe nat yet lytell aparence comynge whan ſir hughe caurell ſawe byſſhop dyde take hym vp ſo ſhortely conſydred well howe chyefe capitayne great man great lygnage helde peace ſawe well alſo howe opynyon ſhulde nat ſuſteyned nother ser thomas tryuet ſir wylliam helmon departed ſayd sir ye ryde forthe ſir hughe caurell ſhall ryde ye ſhal nat go way y• dare well go ſame beleue well quod y• byſſhoppe ye haue good wyll ryde forthe therfore make redy wyll ryde morowe purpoſe agreed rydinge forthe publyſſhed throughe towne mornynge trumpettes ſowned euery man departed feldes tooke way grauelyng nombre aboute thre thouſand men armed ſo came porte grauelynge theſee lowe ſo paſſed forthe aſſayled mynſter y• towne fortifyed towne cloſed pale whiche coude nat long endure alſo men towne ſee men ther ben gentylmen wolde haue helde lē gar dyde alſo coūtre nat ware therof feared nothyng thēglyſſhmen thus thēglyſſhmen cōquered y• towne grauelyng entred drue y• mynſter wherinto people y• towne drawen putte therin goodes truſt ſtrēgth place wyues chyldren made rounde great dyke ſo englyſſhmen coude nat haue eaſe ther two dayes wanne yet finally wan ſlewe kept defence reſydue dyde lyſte thus lordes mayſters grauelynge lodged toguyder towne founde ther plentie prouiſyon countrey beganne afrayed dyde put goodꝭ fortreſſes ſende wyues chyldren bergues bourbourcke ſaynt omers erle flaunders lay lyſle whan̄e vnderſtode theſe tidynges howe englyſſhe men made hym warre taken grauelynge beganne dout franke bruges called counſayle hym ſayde haue great marueyle englyſſhe men ronne lande demaunded neuer nothynge thus without defyaunce entre lande counſayle anſwered hym ſayde sir thyng well marueyle ſuppoſed repute therle flaūders frenche bycauſe frenche kyng hath ſo rydden coūtre yelded hym quod therle beſt done sir quod good ye ſende ſir johan uillayns ſir john̄ moulyn preſente alſo haue penſyon kynge englande englande ſpeke kyng fro ſhewe ſagely buſyneſſe demaūde dothe make warr thynke whan hereth youre meſſangers ſpeke wyll nat content theym thus warreth agaynſt countre call backe great blame yea quod erle meane tyme whyle go englande nowe grauelynge wyll go farther great domage franke ſir quod let thē firſt go thē grauelynge deſyre ſaue conducte go calayes ſo englande knowe demaunde thynke theſe two knyghtes ſo well aduyſed wyll handell ſo wyſely ſhall ſette countrey reſt peace content thus ꝙ erle theſe two knightes enfourmed erle counſayle ſhulde ſay byſſhop norwych ſhewe charge haue go englande ſhewe mater kyng vncles meane ſeaſon theſe knyghtes prepared go grauelynge ſpeke byſſhop norwyche countre aroſe burbourcke bergues caſſell propringe furnes newport townes came dōkyrke abode towne sayeng howe wolde ſhortely iſſue defende fronters fight englyſſhmen theſe men flaunders capitayne called ſir johan sporequyn gouernoure landes lady bare lande lyeth marcheſſe ipre ſir johan sporequyn knewe nothynge erle flaunders wolde ſende englande haſe flaunders newly come hym xxx ſpeares ſhewed hym howe erle lyſle maryage bytwene ſuſter thē lorde delbaryn theſe two knightes dyde moche coulde ſtyrre countrey ryſe ſo nōbre twelfe thouſande pykes paueſſes cootes ſteele hoctons ſhapeauſe baſſenettes maner lande y• lady barres bytwene grauelynge donkyrke enfourmed thre leages y• way ſtode towne mardyke great vyllage ſee ſyde vncloſed thyder came ſome englyſſhmen ſcrimyſſhed ſo thus came grauelynge ſir johan uyllayne ſir johan de moulyne erle flaunders ſaueconduct attayned fro byſſhoppe came fro burbourcke came byſſhoppe norwiche made theym ſemblaunt ryght good chere hym dyner y• ſame day lordes hoſt knewe well erles knightes ſhulde come hym ſame tyme mynde wolde ſhulde fynde toguyder theſe two knightes beganne ſpeke ſayd sir ſende hyder fro erle flaunders lorde lorde quod byſſhoppe anſwered agayne ſayde fro erle none lorde flaūders good lorde quod byſſhoppe take lorde flaunders frenche kynge el duke burgoyne enemy puyſſance late haue conquered countre sir quod knightes ſauyng diſpleaſure lande tourney clerelye rendred agayne put handꝭ gouernyng erle flaunders hath ſent v deſyring two haue penſyon kynge englande may haue ſauecōduct go englāde ſpeke kynge knowe cauſe without defyaunce maketh warre agaynſt erle countre flaūders sir ꝙ byſſhop ſhall take aduyce anſwere morowe thus went logynge left englyſſhmen counſayle ſo day toke counſayle togyder concluded ye ſhall ¶ aunſwere byſſhoppe norwyche made knightꝭ flaunders aſſemble caſſell countrey made agaynſt thenglyſſhmen cap cccc xxxi thynges conſydred regarded ſayde wolde graunt ſafecōduct thē go englande farre coude retourne agayne coūtre wolde ſore ſtyrred greatly fortifyed alſo therle ſhulde tyme ſende worde therof frenche kyng duke burgoyne wherby might come ſuche nōbre people againſt ſhulde nat able reſyſt thē fight determynacyon reſted demaunded amonge thē anſwere ſhulde make knightes flaunders next day ſir hugh caurell cōmaūded ſpeke gyue aduyce ſayde thus byſſhoppe sir ye chefe capitayne ſir ye may ſaye howe ye lande ducheſſe bare clementyne howe urbane ye make warre body el offre thē lande church abbey wyll become good urbanyſtes ryde bring throughe countre ye wyll cauſe yor company paſſe countre peſably paye ſhall take touchyng gyue ſaueconduct go englande ye wyll nat graūt therto wiſe ye may ſay youre warre toucheth thyng warre englande fraunce ſoudyers pope urbane sir thynke anſwere ſhulde ſuffyce euery man agreed well ſpecially y• byſſhoppe mynde nothynge ſayd fight warre countrey thus mater abode night y• mornyng maſſe two ſayd knightes erles deſyringe haue anſwere cāe byſſhoppes lodgynge abode tyll came go maſſe ſo ſtept forthe hym made thē good chere ſemblant deuyſed lytell matter delay tyme tyll knightꝭ come hym whan aſſembled toguyder byſſhop ſayd sir ye tary aunſwere ye ſhall haue requeſt ye make erle flaunders ſay vnto ye may retourne agayne whan ye lyſt erle mayſter el go calais ieoꝑdy englande ſauecōduct ye get none nat kyng englāde haue nat ſo farr authorite ſo company ſoudyers pope urbane wage hym take money ſerue truely nowe y• lande ducheſſe bare clementyne yf people opynion wyll make warre wyll go v take parte ſhall haue part pardon abſolucyons urbayne oure pope voiage hath aſſoyled v clene frome payne frome ſynne thoſe wyll ayde diſtroy clemētyns whan knightes herde theſe wordes ſir johan uillayns ſayd sir touchynge pope thynke ye haue nat herde cōtrary lorde therle flaunders hath ben alwayes good urbanyſt wherfore ſir ye yuell make warr hym coūtre thynke kyng englande yo • lorde hath nat charged ſo ſo noble wolde haue made hym warre firſt wolde haue defyed thoſe wordes byſſhoppe began angry ſaid well ſirs go erle ſaye vnto hym getteth nothyng el v ye wyll ſende englande knowe kynges pleaſure ye lyſt way calys ſhall nat 〈…〉 sse whan theſe knyghtes ſawe coulde nat attaygne purpoſe none otherwiſe departed returned lodgynge dyned dyuer departed went ſame night ſaynt omers ſame day knyghtes deꝑted came tidynges byſſhoppe y• donkyrke theraboute xii thouſande men harneſſe baſtarde flaunders company chefe capitayne dyuers knightes ſquiers ſomoche ſhewed thurſdaye ſcrimyſſhed companye ſlayne hundred lo quod byſſhoppe ye may ſe wheder erle medyll mater nat dothe entreateth peace ſwerde hande let v ryde forthe moro go donkyrke ſe people gadered euery man agreed therto ſame day cāe byſſhoppe two knightes one fro calys othe▪ fro guyſnes xxx ſpeares threſcore archer knyghtes called ſir nicholas clyncon ſir john̄ dracton capitayne guyſnes nexte mornynge made redy ryde forthe ſo drewe felde mo vi hundred ſpeares ſixtene hundred archer ſo rode towarde mardyke dō kyrke byſſhop made borne armes churche baner ſaynt peter felde goules two keyes ſyluer lyke ſoudyers pope urbane penon bare owne armes ſyluer azure quarterly fret golde azur bende goules ſyluer bycauſe yongeſt y• spē ſars bare border goules difference alſo ſir hugh spēſar nephue penon baner penon lorde beaumont ſir hughe caurell ſir thom̄s tryuet ſir wylliam helmon penon without baner ſir wylliam dractone ſir johan brother ſir mathue reedman ſir john̄ ferres ſir wyllyam fermeton ſir johan new caſtell gaſcone thus theſe men armes rode towardes mardyke refreſſhed dranke ſo paſſed forthe toke waye donkyrke flemmynges aſſembled aduertyſed englyſſhmen wolde come way redy aparelled fight determyned among ſelfe drawe felde redy good aray fight nede requyred thought abyde towne cloſed therin ſhulde nothyng profytable ordayned ſo done euery man armed hym ſelfe towne iſſued felde ſette ſelfe good array lytell hyll without towne nōbre xii mo ſo therwith came
