ther done great honoure eche enforſed ſelfe honoure eche duches margarete burgoyn duches margaret heynault helde ſore treaty ſaynge y• ſonne ſhulde mary margarete burgoyne ſhe wolde alſo doughter ſhuld mary john̄ burgoyne ſo make croſſe maryag • wherby ſhulde y• coniunction loue ſo two chyldren burgoyne ſhulde maryed one howſe duke burgoyne thought ynough mary doughter excuſed johan ſonne ſaynge howe h • yonge age maryed duk • burgoyne ymaginacion mary jo 〈…〉 ſonne katheryne fraunce ſuſter 〈…〉 nephewe french kyng thus 〈…〉 poynt treaty lyke haue fayled duches bauiers ſayd howe ſhulde made maryage chyldren maryed alwayes ſhe helde purpoſe ther coude man breke therof duches brabant hadde great payne go fro one bringe treaty toguyder moche ſhe dyd alegynge ſhe wynge ſo good reaſons ſpecially duke duches burgoyn finally went concluded y• ſonne doughter duke burgoyne ſhulde maryed ſonne doughter duke aubert bauiers y• let mater fyue dayes mater duke burgoyns coūſayle feared vnderſtod duke aubert nat bene trewe poſſeſſion heynalt poſſibylite therof lyued erle willyam haynault brother lay ſore ſycke oueſnoy whiche erle myght recouer ouerlyue duke aubert brother ſo dyd thought clerely feared greatly bretherne ſhulde haue gouernynge haynault chyldren duke aubert put clene dought made delay maryage ſpace fyue dayes tyll laſt clerely knowen duke aubert hadde mo bretherne erle haynault ſo coulde nat put herytage fro duke aubertes chyldren whan̄e theſe thynges knowen than̄e lenger delay theſe maryages ſworne couenaunted willym̄ haynalt ſhulde haue maryage margaret burgoyne johan burgoyne haue wyfe margarete haynault theſe ſhulde retourne cambray • parforme ſolempniſacion theſe maryages vtas eſter next • ere lorde thouſande thre hundred four • ore fyue ¶ h • frenche kynge lordes fraūce heynalt made • rouiſyon cābray •• neſſage duke lancaſtre 〈…〉 erle haynalt 〈…〉 yages chyldren haynalt 〈…〉 burgoyne • p cccc l thus euery man departed fro cambray duke burgoyne returned fraunce king duches wyfe returned arras duke aubert duches wyfe retourned towne oueſnoy haynalt lady brabant countrey warkmen ſette awarke make redy lodgynges cytie cambray men ſent thyder make prouiſyon ſo great ſo coſtly marueyle conſydre feaſt cryed publyſſhed abrode holden cambray weke vtas eaſter whan frenche kyng enfourmed beſynes ſayd wolde maryages coſyns ſo ſēt cābray ſtewardes howſe make prouiſyon acordyng byſſhopes palays taken vp duke burgoyne prouyſion made howbeit fayne delyuer vp y• kyng carpenter maſons ſet warke palays make aſtate royall whiche warke yet apereth feaſt nat remembraūce man harde two hundred yere ſo great feaſt ſolempnyte aꝑelled lordes make thē freſſhe gorgious exalte eſtates ſpared money fallen fro clowdes euery man helped tidynges theſe mariages came englande duke lancaſtre alwayes hoped willyam haynalt ſhulde haue wyfe doughter leeſt borne ſo hande ▪ right penſyue ſore troubled thoſe newes whan̄e well ymagined knowe trouthe therof ſent certayne perſons howſe gaūt ſpeke wi • h duke auberte whan̄e theſe meſſangers came gaunt foūde ſir john̄ bourchier alderman gaunt peter du boyſe fraunſes atreman made right good chere ſo ther taryed two dayes fro thence went mon heynalt ſo queſnoy came duke duches child receyued goodly honour duke lancaſtre made good chere lykewiſe ſo dyd lorde gouuighen mayſter byenge wolles englande ſpake firſt hadde de lyuered letter credence recōmaunded duke lancaſtre duke auberte coſyn ſpake thynges charged amonge thynges demaunded duke auberte enfourmed entent perceyuer maryage y• chyldren duke burgoyne thoſe wordes duke lytell chaunged colour ſayd ye ſir truely faythe wherfore demaunde sir 〈◊〉 demaunde bycauſe duke lancaſtre hathe alwayes hoped vntyll tyme lady philyp doughter ſhuld haue lorde willyam ſonne than̄e duke ſayd cōpanyon ſay coſyn y• whan ſoeuer mary chyldren ſhall nat marueyle diſmayed therat▪ hath take care maryenge child whether wyll mary nat whan whome anſwere y• thengliſſhmen duke aubert thus toke theie leaue departed went ſame nyght ualencennes next day gaunt tell thynke retourned englande whan eaſter came acounted thouſande thre hundred fourſcore fyue yeres lorde frēche king duke burgoyne duke burbon duke aubert duches wyfe duches brabant duches burgoyne ſir willyam ſir john̄ namure came cambray kynge went y• palys lodgynge euery man drewe lodgynges ye may well beleue knowe frenche kyng many noble prince great ladyes great noble chiualry king entred monday none lordꝭ ladyes met without towne ſo conueyed trompettes great plenty mynſtrels ſo brought palys ſame monday preſence great lordes renewed couenauntes maryages willm̄ dorſet ſhulde haue countye oſtrenant lady margaret wyfe endowed lande acque brabant y• duke burgoyn gaue doughter hundred thouſande frankes thus made porcyons tuyſday hour maſſe wedded cathedrale churche lady cambray great ſolempnyte byſſhoppe cambray dyd obſeruaunce called johan borne brucels dyner ther ſhewed moche noblenes kyng cauſed two lordes two ladyes newly maryed ſyt table lordꝭ ſerued ſate dyner conſtable fraunce marſhall fraūce ſir guy de la tremoyle ſir willyma de namure ſerued ſo dyd dyuers great lordes fraūce fyue hūdred yere nat ſene ſuche ſolempnite cambray dyner knyghtes ſquiers armed iuſt ſo iuſted markette place xl knightes one ſyde yonge kyng charles iuſted knight heynalt called ſir nycholas eſpinot theſe iuſtes nobly contynued yonge knyght haynalt price called ſir johan deſternne beſyde beawmont haynalt knyght iuſted greatly pleaſure lordes ladyes priſe gyrdell ſet precyous ſtones gyuen hym y• duches burgoyne owne waſt admyrall fraunce ſir guy de la tremoyle dyd preſēt thus great reuell contynued weke y• friday dyner kyng toke leaue lordes ladyes ſo departed fro cambray alſo duke ducheſſes deꝑted duches burgoyn brought margaret haynalt doughter arras y• lady haynalt brought y• lady margarete burgoyne queſnoy thus paſſed forthe beſynes ¶ howe duke berrey enſured doughter ſon̄e therle bloyſe howe therle matche duke burbon made ſomons entre lymoſin cap cccc li ſāe ſeaſon trety maryage bytwene loys bloys ſon therle guy • oy • y• lady mary dought 〈◊◊〉 johan berry ſo th 〈…〉 rle bloys well acōpanyed lordes ad 〈…〉 brought doughter bergues 〈◊〉 duke duches redy 〈…〉 de tyght nobly receyued 〈◊〉 company 〈…〉 rmed aſſurance maryage 〈…〉 〈…〉 chebyſſhop bergues enſured 〈…〉 der preſēce many lordes lad 〈…〉 howbeit natte wedded 〈…〉 ey bothe yonge ther great feeſt reuelyng daunſyng ſo laſt therle counteſſe retourned countre ſonne lady abode ſtyll duches mother barrey fayre caſtell beſyde bergues called mehune ryuer yure ſame ſeaſon duke berry went auuergne lāguedocke ſo auignon ſe pope clement ordayned duke burbone therle marche two thouſande men armes ſhulde go lymoſyn delyuer countre fro englyſſhmen theues robbed pylled coūtre poictou xaynton certayne fortreſſes whiche dyde moche domage coūtre wherof complayntes came heryng duke berrey▪ mynde remedy deſyred duke burbone coſyn wyſe whan come limoſyn xaynton ſhulde cōquere garyſon bertuell fortereſſe dyde mooſt hurt countre duke burbone promyſed hym ſo hadde made ſomons molins burbonoyſe firſt daye june ſo thyder drewe tyme maner men warre duke burbone hym gentyll ſquyer called johan bone laūce mayſter capitayne men warre certaynly ſquyer well worthy haue ſuche charge erle marche ſhulde cōpany duke burbone made ſomons cytie toures ſame ſeaſon came scluſe flaunders ſuche men warre apoynted paſſe ſee scotlande ſir johan uyen admyrall fraunce ſhulde haue hym thouſande ſpeares knightes ſquiers beleue well great deſyre go ſo moche ſome nat deſyred aduaunſed ſelfe go voyage admyrall ſhyppyng redy apparelled scluſe caryed harneſſe xii hundred men armes taken harneſſe caſtell beauty beſyde parys harneſſe parteyning pariſyens whiche cauſed bring ſayd caſtell tyme rebellion admyrals company great nombre good men warr entenſyon delyuer ſayd harneſſe knyghtes men scotlande bycauſe ſir geffray de charney enformed kynges counſayle howe men scotlande eaſely harneſſed ſhall name vnto parte thē fraunce wente scotlande ſame ſeaſon▪ firſt ſir johan uyen admyrall fraunce erle graunt pre lordes uerdnay ſaynt crouſe mountbury ſir geffray charney ſir wyllyam uyen ſir jaques uyen lorde deſpaigny ſir gerard burbone lorde hetz ſir floromonde quiſſy lorde marny ſir ualerant rayneuall lorde beauſaige lorde uaynbrayne lorde rynoll baron dury lorde coucy ſir percyuall daneuall y• lorde ferrers lorde fountaygnes ſir braquet braquemont lorde graunt court lorde landon breton ſir guy la ꝑſon ſir wyllm̄ de couroux ſir johan de hangyers ſir henry de uyncelyn coſyn y• great maiſter pruce diuers good knightꝭ whiche nat name ſo nōbre thouſande ſpeares knightes ſquyers beſyde croſ bowes varlettꝭ gode wynde fayre ſeaſon y• ſee wether fayre moneth may tyme y• truſe bytwene englāde fraūce expyred bitwene gaū toyſe flemynges lykewiſe ſemed euery parte deſyred warre knyghtes ſquiers deſyred greatly go voyage scotlande thought ayde ſcottꝭ haue fayre iourney agaynſt enemyes englāde thenglyſſhmen enfourmed comynge loked theym euery day thus endeth firſt volume ſir johan froiſſart cronycles englāde fraunce spayne portyngale scotlande bretayne flaūders place adioynyng tranſlated frenche maternall englyſſhe tonge johan bourchier knight lorde berners cōmaundement mooſt highe redouted ſoueraygne lorde kyng henry viii kynge englande fraunce hygh defender chriſten faithe c imprinted london fleteſtrete richarde pynſon printer kynges noble grace ended xxviii day january yere lorde xxiii cum priuilegio rege indulto blazon coat arm
